This time, it seems that Lucas' cinematic vision hasn't been outpaced by the power of his computers. I also very much liked the visuals in the scenes on the water planet (can't think of the name). They impressed me a great deal.

Author: luigi8888
Review_Title: Solid Sequel Proves Episode One Wasn't Good, But Necessary
Review: It seems nowadays that nobody who even considers themselves even the smallest of Star Wars fans can resist bashing Episode One. Lucas has lost his touch, too much talking, no action, Jar Jar is a pain. Well, Episode II has proved all naysayers wrong (mostly).

Author: robertaveryuk
Review_Title: Arrogance is the downfall of the Jedi...and a director!
Review: Let me start by saying that "Attack" is far, far better than "Phantom":  and is well worth seeing on the big screen.

Author: Chris Dillhole
Review_Title: Am I alone on this one?
Review: Personally this film, in complete honesty, bored the fun-lovin' crap out of me.

Author: mevans2574
Review_Title: A true epic living up to the Star Wars name
Review: As hard as it is to impress today's sophisticated, seen-it-all before audience, Attack of the Clones does just that. While critics will be quick to point out awkward dialog and an unrealistic romance, no one can deny the numerous elements that make this is one of the finest motion pictures of all time: incredible special effects, epic scale battles, hundreds of lightsaber-thrashing jedi, amazing sound effects, intense emotional performances from Hayden Christensen, Natalie Portman's skin-tight outfit, Yoda kicking serious fanny, hacked off limbs, etc. Not to mention composer John Williams' finest work he has ever done. Thanks George for giving the fans what they wanted.

Author: jxander1
Review: I have grown up on Star Wars, and usually look forward to each new installment with unrealistic excitement.  This time around I was really just hoping for an entertaining ride.  AOTC is undoubtedly much more than this. I must say that I absolutely loved it!  The acting is a bit flat the directing is a little off, and it is absolutely about as much fun as you can have in a theater.  Just what should be expected of Star Wars movies.  Lucas shows no limitations in imagination, and aims to please, not only the average viewer but especially the fan of the saga . . . something he miserably failed to do with E1.  The medichlorian count is up in this one!

Author: Flwreden
Review: I think it was the worst movie of 2002. I want my money back. I think that it was over hyped and that the script was BAD. I feel that I was cheated out of 2 hours and 25 min..

Author: mmayer20
Review_Title: Maybe I Need To See It Again...
Review: Um, it was ok.  For some reason, the Anakin/Padme romance didn't click for me.  And let's face it, that's what this movie really turns on.  And if you don't buy that, the rest is hard to swallow.  What in the world does she see in him?  She: a young but experienced Senator, and ruler of a planet.  He: an immature, mixed-up, narcissistic, teenage Jedi wannabe.  He almost made me long for the kid in the first movie!  It isn't until after he slaughters the sand people camp that she pledges her love.  No wonder Leia likes scoundrels...she gets it from Mom!  And the scene where Anakin's mother dies...I almost laughed it was so cliched.  It's a good thing it wasn't a wide shot, or I'd half-expected her feet to fly up at the moment of truth (a la Shemp of the 3 Stooges).

Author: gurustump
Review_Title: Oh, that I might have been involved in the script meetings...
Review: Like many movie viewers, I saw the original Star Wars as a child. So great was its effect on me, I don't remember it so much as a movie as something that happened to me as a kid. As such, my feelings about the recent prequel trilogy are prone to be colored by my having placed the first trilogy on a rather inaccessible pedestal.

Author: blindsourse
Review_Title: Just another Star Wars clone? No!
Review: Let me start off by saying, do NOT listen to the wind bags that are bent to ruin this movie. It was great. I can't see why anyone could not like this movie. There is action and Natalie Portman for the guys; Hayden Christensen and love for the girls; Star Wars itself for the kids; Nostalgia for the fans; and a great plot for the intellectuals. Theoretically, this is the perfect movie. Go see it in the theaters and help fight the battle between Spiderman.

Author: 6RO7
Review_Title: This is the Star Wars I wanted to see 3 years ago!
Review: Attack of the Clones was one heck of a movie.  I'd put it up there with the likes of "Empire" and "A New Hope."  I went into the movie theater with very, very low expectations.  Folks, this movie plays out just like "Empire," and thats a good thing.  The love story isn't as flawed as everybody says, it's kind of like Han & Leia's fling in "Empire," but ends in a different fashion.

Author: mafioso
Review_Title: The saga is showing its age
Review: Star Wars Episode II:  Attack of the Clones, in my opinion, flatlined in its first thirty minutes.  George Lucas has failed miserably in capturing the charm, wit, fun and excitement of the previous Star Wars films, especially the original trilogy.  The acting was generally wooden throughout and the Skywalker/Amidala romance has to the sappiest most pathetic romance I have ever seen.  If anything it is the non-humans that did the best acting - *SPOILER* I did enjoy the interaction between C3P0 and R2D2 near the end of movie, and Yoda's (again not a human) fight and "use of the force" with a light sabre was also entertaining, the films only redeeming features.

Author: jimpludthura
Review: ***SPOILERS***

Author: BgDog18
Review: SPOILERS ALERT

Author: FELIXTHECAT2
Review: First off, let me say how frustrated I have become from reading the mainstream and many of the other reviews.  They have been harping how Lucas writes corny or flat out bad dialogue.  Or how AOTC is nothing but cheap eye candy. (eye candy maybe, cheap no)  All I'm trying to say is that all of his films have that corny dialogue, its entertaining, it is a signature of being a Star Wars movie and it's something we love about it.  As for people nit picking the CG, well all I can say is that is absolutely absurd.

Author: deeyell101
Review: If you are a Star Wars fan (like me), you will love this movie. If you aren't you will love it anyway, but on a different level. George Lucas has given just about everyone a light-sabre, and there are some terrific battles, far better then anything in the other Star Wars movies. You see an entire army of Jedis, running forward and smashing aside laser blasts with their light sabres, and then crashing into an army of droids, which is truly satisfying, and the young Anakin Skywalker and Obi-Wan fighting back to back, which is a bit ironic really, considering what will happen in the later movies. Anyway, the battles are brilliant, and Yoda gives everyone a big surprise by turning up and showing us all just why he is the Jedi master. Unfortunately, the acting was pretty rubbish: Natalie Portman, who plays Amidala was completely flat, and Anakin Skywalker just couldn't pull off the bits when he wasn't angry. Samuel L Jackson was a bit of a disappointment too; he is an excellent actor, but was held back by the script. However, Ewan Mcgregor was excellent as Obi-Wan, and acted the part really well. No worries though, as the acting was never Star Wars' strong point, and the battles truly make up for it. There were also lots of references to the later movies: Anakin has his arm chopped off, we are shown how the Bounty Hunter Boba Fett came to be, and there is a brilliant line, when Obi-Wan says to Anakin, "I have a feeling you will be the death of me." So anyway, if you have not seen this movie, go and see it, as it is pretty damn good. Well done George Lucas, I can't wait for the next one!

Author: fragalle
Review_Title: George Lucas has been forgiven of all sins for Episode I.
Review: To quote one of my favorite video game squirrels: "Oh my giddy aunt...." In my opinion, Episode II had it a little easier than Episode I did. Wheras Episode I was having to live up to the untouchable classic 3, Episode II merely had to rise above the fetid steaming pile that was Episode I.  But by no means is this an inferior movie.  EVERY SINGLE ASPECT is bettered by Episode II.  Acting, Special Effects, Plot....the list is long.  But one of the biggest differences in this movie (in my opinion) is that this movie seems a little more..."human" if you will.  No stiff acting, or impassive emotions- this is a movie ABOUT emotions.  The classic Star Wars humor also makes a much deserved inclusion as well.  George Lucas has been forgiven. Also, on a side note:  Rumor has it that Samuel L Jackson has BMF engraved on his lightsaber.  After seeing this movie, I think most will agree with me when I say: Yoda should have the BMF engraved on his lightsaber.  Never before have I witnessed a scene in a movie with a bigger mix of emotions- fond nostalgia, absurd hilarity, and complete reverence for the arse-kicking skills of Master Yoda.  Go see it.

Author: carolann213
Review: I remember refusing to see Star Wars when it was first released because it was so hyped up.  Fortunately I came to my senses and my brother persuaded me to go see it.  I adored it! and can remember going to bed that night and singing the theme tune whilst jumping over all the furniture in my room. Read the books to the second and third and saw the films on tv.  Both quite good, but for me didn't nearly approach the excitement I felt watching the first.

Author: lionspride
Review_Title: Send in the Clones--don't bother, there here.
Review: Well, at last the Clones have attacked...(we first heard about the Clone Wars way back...or ahead...in the first Star Wars movie--which George now calls Episode IV- A New Hope).  So was it worth the wait? (I know you've been dying to hear.)

Author: sdk_pimp79
Review: Wonderful and Awesome, are mere words to describe Attack of The Clones. Lucas did a great job of putting us on the edge of our seats and an equally good job of keeping us in suspense. The growth of young Anikin was explained very well, and his gradual love affair with Padime fit in nicely, among the growing conflict between good and evil. Meeting several new characters and seeing some old favorites in actual battle was terrific. This installment of Star Wars definitely sits well with the original trilogy.

Author: djsahin
Review: I'm not a big fan of Star Wars Series but I've seen all the episodes. For me, Episode II is much better than Episode I. The battle with Yoda is mazing! In one word, this movie is greatest!!! Thank you George...

Author: mtrupe
Review: Thank God Jar Jar appearances were minimal.  If you hated Phantom menace you MAY like this.  If you liked Phantom Menace you will love this one.  The dialog is cheesy at times, but it has been cheesy in every single Star Wars movie... Thats just part of Star Wars.  Lucas has done an excellent job of appealing to little kids and older geeks with this one...

Author: Asra Nolan
Review: The movie was much better than the first and reminds me more of the original series and fortunatly thats the only drawback to a great movie that I sat there (my second time :) and counted all the almost direct quotes and "forshadows" of the original trilogy some were good foreshadows some would be plagerised (if it were not his films to start) but I will not tell you my count you will have to see it to find out yourself :

Author: opium_nick
Review_Title: Terrible love scenes + awesome action = great popcorn flick
Review: Oh my god, IT WAS ACTUALLY REALLY GOOD!

Author: Purple_Possum
Review_Title: I'm a very impressed little movie-goer...
Review: I saw AotC at eleven o' clock this morning, the very first showing at my local cinema. Bad points first: Most of the dialogue is DIRE, absolutely cringeworthy, and I'm still not too sure about Hayden as Anakin.

Author: pezgandhi
Review: As the NY Times said: "...the event will have all the spontaneity and surprise of an election day in the old Soviet Union."

Author: dagger32
Review: I just got done seeing the second installment of the greatest 5 movies the planet has ever seen and this installment secures that status even more. the movie is a bit long but is more than made up for with a good story and great special effects.  The action depicted buy the Jedi Masters and their apprentices, i.e. Anakin Skywalker, are spectacular.  Yoda kicks major a!@ against Count Dooku!!!  Mace Windu show what the force can do in dire circumstances and theri are plenty of great Jedi to try to save the galaxy from the Dark Side.  Definitely a must see!!! I plan on going again to take in everything that the long movie has to include in this awesome series. Thank you George Lucas!!!!

Author: rvtjm5
Review: Nice movie! Good acting,plot was "thick" enough,romance scenes weren't too drab & dreary(like most "love" scenes in movies try to be).Substainable action sequences through most of the movie.Some of the scenes stretched a little much for no apparent reason,but to be honest with you,by the end of the movie you really don't care!Enjoy this one,we don't get this quality of movie very often.

Author: jonmiller820
Review: my rating is 4.0 / 10. new star wars stinks. 2 is better than 1 at the expense of interesting character development. 3 is not cool. they're stupid. I could care less about these movies. have you heard about the new clone wars cg show? me neither. the laser is off target. I have a funny feeling about this movie. don't spend your money on this movie. digital effects have made the acting and reactions completely stale and worse than imaginable. they are phoning it in. these movies are difficult to watch. I don't believe these are the same people we saw the first trilogy. its shameful that he thought this was acceptable. the collectors editions will transform it further into decomposed trash with extra seepage. I am reminded of Point of No Return.

Author: Helto1
Review: I went into the movie today, knowing a couple of things.  That Yoda was finally given a chance to show off his skills, that the C.G.I. would be incredible, and the story had a main focus on the relationship between Anakin and Padme.  What I didn't know, is how horrible the dialogue was, how UTTERLY pitiful Hayden Christensen was, and that eye candy alone, is no longer good enough to make a movie enjoyable.  I was completely and totally disgusted with this movie.  I can say I actually enjoyed Episode 1 more, simply for the fight scene with Darth Maul.  I will admit, C-3PO was very funny, and Count Dooku was a very good villain, but I simply cannot endorse a movie, where I feel absolutely nothing for any of the characters.  I hope Mr. Hayden Christensen turns out better than this, and that George Lucas returns from whatever planet he's residing on, because it's sure not Earth. All I can say is, see it if you must, but I seem to have lost all faith in the Force!

Author: pakallman
Review_Title: I'm sorry, call me a blasphemer, but Empire has to move over...
Review: Many people, including myself, have argued the best Star Wars movie is a title belonging to The Empire Strikes Back.  Obviously, its a great, but honestly, I've never been so happy with any other movie as I am RIGHT NOW with Episode II: Attack of the Clones.  This movie is unbelievable, and blew me away.  I am a huge Star Wars fan, and this movie has the caliber of greatness that Star Wars movies deserve.  This movie, in my opinion, is not only the best Star Wars movie ever, but I truly believe that it is the best movie ever made.  Undoubtedly, this movie has made up for the mistake that was Episode I: The Phantom Menace, and has reset Star Wars to the top of the movie series ladder of greatness, a comfy spot it was made for.  George Lucas is a genius and if I was polytheistic I would believe he was a god. He really has out done himself this time.  I plan to see it again at least another 3 times.

Author: psegrin
Review: Star Wars Episode II: Attack of the Clones was perhaps the best Star Wars film out of the whole series. George Lucas surly shows off his true talents in this film. The idea to film this movie completly digitally was sheer genius. It is a shame that Star Wars Episode I: Tha Phantom Menace wasn't shot in digital. Episode II had perhaps the best action sequences I have ever seen in a movie. The lightsabre battles were sheerly amazing. Despite all the machines that do not exist the machines and crafts all looks pretty damn real.

Author: mjk9564
Review: This is a great story. It really brought the Star Wars series all together. Yoda fighting wasn't as long as I thought it should be, but the special effects that it took to create that short seen are amazing. As usual George Lucas didn't spare any expense or detail. Some say they didn't like the dialogue, that it was drawn out, well to them I say "That you're not a true Star Wars fan."  Getting to see Anakin start to turn into Darth Vador, and harness the force (dark/good) was a great highlight too.

Author: daniel_diesing
Review_Title: This movie was one of the most entertaining experiences of my life.
Review: Wow! what a great movie. the effects were beyond all belief, the fighting was phenomenal, and the story line worked perfectly. I was entertained to the point of wanting to immediately watch it again which has never happened to me. In my opinion this is the best movie of the past 3 years.

Author: shyjones2
Review: EP2 is not the best nor is it the worse.  The heavy CGI and special effects did more to let down than to amaze.  The movie is TOO BIG when compared to the other episodes. Big in terms of "stuff" and "creatures"  and "sheer numbers" and anything else you can think of. Its a wee-bit too much for even a Star Wars movie.  EP5 was big, EP1 was big but restrained.  During that last hour throw down, I felt like I was watching someone play a video game. All the actors were great!  Christensen was a perfect pick to play Anakin. The scene with him talking about how he's good at fixing things is the BEST scene in the whole movie, possibly the series.  Besides the issues listed above and below, I loved it and can't wait to see it another x number of times.  Star Wars fans will understand, others won't. ***SPOILERS************** Since when could R2D2...   What was up with the girl in the bar wearing the red skin-tite see thru mesh pants wearing no panties, with the juicy rear?? (Droooool) First Star Wars with a PG13 rating, you know something ain't quite right.

Author: imercado
Review: Fool me once, shame on you.  Fool me twice, shame on me!

Author: acehit
Review_Title: gud movie, but not as good as phantom menace
Review: Before watching this movie at the theatres, i had expected it to be a moderately gud movie.  At first sight the 'cover art' remained illustrative to keep consistent with the previous movies, which i thought was best despite the age we are in with modern photography. The film started out well, but i began to have doubts as the movie progressed for numerous reasons.  I thought the acting of Anakin Skywalker by Hayden Christensen was poor, and the performace of Obi-Wan Kenobi by Ewan McGregor wasnt as consistent as it was in the Phantom Menace.  Especially in the emotional scenes, Anakins acting suffers a great deal due to lack of facial expressions and carisma.  Even when his mum dies, you can tell the fake mourning blatently. The love scenes between Anakin and Padme didnt contain any depth, again due to Anakins poor acting (Natalie Portman as Padme was passable, but again not as gud as in Phantom menace).  Obi-Wan was a much stronger character in the phantom menace, and he looses much of his acting quality due to keeping a still face for most of the movie.  I thought the young Anakin in the phantom menace was a much better actor than the older one in Attack of the clones because of convincing acting.  I thought another downfall of the movie was the dialogue, and corny jokes.  A better dialogue delivery i think was in the older versions of star wars. The soundtrack however was good, as it captured the essence of the movie which was based on love more than anything else. One thing i didnt like in the phantom menace, was the 'over-doing' of special effects, which i think was solved in this episode.  it was moderate and kept realistic, although the jedi masters gliding in the air was abit daft.  Overall a good movie, but not as gud as the phantom menace.

Author: bfrantz
Review: Star Wars. The name is practically a mandatory addition to modern man's vocabulary. After the huge breakthroughs the original Trilogy made in sci-fi movies, fans have been screaming for more. It wasn't until Episode I came out that their appetite has been whetted. And while it was a worthy addition to the Star Wars saga, there were a lot of people who were disgruntled with the less-than-great acting on the part of Anakin, and the ok-at-first-but-quickly-becoming-annoying Jar Jar Binks. It undeniably didn't do for movies today what the original Star Wars did back in 1977. Personally, however, I enjoyed the movie and wasn't too disappointed. Well, Episode II has come out and it is clear to me that George Lucas has learned from some of his mistakes in Phantom Menace and turned out an amazing and very entertaining movie that should please both die-hard Star Wars fans and the casual movie-goer. While it certainly has a different feel than did the originals, since hardly a frame goes by that isn't 95% computer generated, it is still Star Wars and a movie that is not to be missed.

Author: AWitte9144
Review_Title: Not the best of all but very close
Review: Finally and after a long drought Episode 2 made it`s appearance. I must admit that I`am a huge Star Wars fan. I grew up with it and fell in love with the Story and the way it appeared and was made. It was a milestone something like the first man on the moon. How could you not fell in love with a movie like this when you`re about 12 years old ? But now back to the point and Episode 2. I remember all those critics who tell you it consists of a poor story, bad or average actors at best and ok at least some good special effects. Hey guys, be honest, the isn`t much worse than TITANIC who`s still the top movie to be beaten. Hayden and Natalie are as good actors as Leo and Kate who are often called to be great actors !? And has anyone seen some kinda special effects anywhere else ? Especially this Episode offers you a lot. Besides a romance and lovestory it`ll give you more answers and how young Skywalker turn into Darth Vader. You`ll see some lightsaber duels that remind me of the 3 Musketeers. A chase through the skyscrapers of Coruscant. and Samuel L. Jackson is awsome again although he just has one of those smaller roles and even if most is computer generated it catches you and really puts you in another world. So for everyone who like to be taken into a world of dreams and execptional images this is a movie you gotta have to watch.

Author: McGowan_M
Review_Title: Fantastic sci-fi, magnificent specials effects and a plot that works.
Review: As one of the world's GREAT Science-Fiction fans, I've always felt a little disappointed at the fact that I couldn't see what everybody else apparently saw in the 'Star Wars' movies.

Author: anotone
Review_Title: This is a spoiler of AOTC.
Review: This is a spoiler. Star Wars Episode II AOTC was very disappointing. The best part of the movie was when Yoda went ape turds on Count Chocula at the end. The plot and trying to figure out who is who is so confusing it's ridiculous- the empire, the republic, the senate, the trade federation, the commerce guild, the separatists, the clones, the drones, the schmones. In the first trilogy, there was just the empire and the rebellion- simple and clear cut. Lucas does a poor job of developing the main characters- you have no vested emotional interest in Amidala or Anakin. Why should we care about them? Why is the title Attack of the Clones? Weren't the clones fighting with the Jedi and for the good guys? Is Senator Palpatine Darth Sidious? Is he the Emperor?Who is Chancellor Valorem and what do these guys have to do with anything? Which side is fighting for and with whom? Plus, Lucas assumes that every creature in the universe has a humanoid form with a head, torso, two arms and two legs. There is no scientific basis to support or assume that. Jar Jar Binks makes me want to retch. Does the republic become the empire? What about the separatists and the trade federation? What the frig is going on?

Author: samizdat7
Review: Yes it is better than The Phantom Menace, but is that really such an achievement?  For my money, the best thing about Episode II (by far) is Natalie Portman.  She has great presence, is incredibly beautiful and successfully portrays the dignity and youth of her character.

Author: alan-198
Review_Title: open your mind, feel the force
Review: They say that familiarity breeds contempt, well it certainly seems to cultivate arrogance, in between the thunderous fun i have experienced with the two latest editions to the Star Wars saga, (yes both of them),i've become aware of a truly cynical backlash against these films, a form of dyed in the wool fan, or casual viewer of the original trilogy, with a limited ,narrow view of exactly what constitutes a star wars film. Of course everyone is entitled to an opinion on any given subject, but the scorn being poured upon these films now seems a little disproportionate when one considers the neverending pants that flaunts itself each year, in the summer season. The most common complaint, the script. Re-watch the original trilogy, with your back to the screen, listen to the dialogue, not how it is read, but the actual words, then likewise for the new films, i think you will find an even match. The manner in which dialogue is performed is different in TPM,AOTC, because the characters are more formal, they would not talk in the colloquial fashion that the characters of Luke or Han did, although to be fair Lucas has tried to insert the odd glib line in AOTC. Watto is one of the few characters in the recent films who does talk in such a manner, cynical, sarcastic, and i do recall at the time of TPM release he was wideley recognised as the most "star wars" ,like character. The plot is too complex, well yes, there is more plot to these episodes , than simply goodies v baddies, as the originals were, the first three films were off and running from Star Wars opening scroll, the villains were in place, consequently the new films have to establish the empire, they have to show Anakin and Padme falling in love, and again given the social stature, and age of these people it would ring hollow if they flirted in the knowing ,nudge-nudge manner Han and Leia did, we knew he was going to show this, and here it is and yet some of us appear incensed by it.The computer animation looks false, to be fair sometimes it does, so lets return to jerky stop motion, which ultimately also looked false, look at Robocop2, (one of the last times i can recall stop motion in a big release), it still looked unconvincing, funny the year after that was Terminator 2 ,when CGI really kicked in. Please dont get me wrong Phil Tippett is a genius. Another complaint , in AOTC the droid factory sequence does not progress the narrative, again a fair comment , and strangely enough applicable to the chasm swing in Star Wars, or the trash compacter sequence, or the speeder bike chase in Jedi, if memory serves all very popular bits, ah but you would say they were character moments,(spoiler alert) i.e a moment of insite into who the character is ,or will be, so excepting that, it was shear coincidence the image of Anakins arm pinned beneath the robotic plating, echoed what we soon find out happens to said arm, hmmm?.Natalie Portmans swift recovery, after falling from a moving spaceship, at the films climax, again a fair observation, totally unlike somebody falling from a speeder bike moving at 80mph+, eh? Lucas is just making these films to sell toys, interesting that people, whom i'm sure laid their head on a Empire Strikes Back pillow case back in the mists of the 80's, have become such staunch socialists today. Yes i agree there are flaws in the new films, but take a second, and look back clearly at the originals, the problems were there too, just not as visible to a 5-12 year old, feel the new films, dont scrutinize them, because old or new, they never stood up to that.

Author: andrewm-6
Review_Title: An hour of ideas in two hours with some ham-fisted romance.
Review: Lucas comments that he is "a visual film maker, not a literary film maker" in the additional material that comes with the DVD, and this movie is graphic proof of this statement. Visually, you can't fault it - but the literary side of the movie is simply non-existent. After watching the movie, in spite of the beautiful visuals, I was strangely unsatisfied - left feeling like I'd eaten fairy floss.

Author: johnhood
Review: After the relative disappointment of the first prequel, much rides on this second instalment in Lucas? six-part magnum opus. Does it deliver and can it equal 'Empire Strikes Back' in the dramatic stakes?

Author: adino-the-eznite
Review_Title: The most underrated Star Wars movie
Review: This movie gets a lot of flack and has been called by many (including a certain man whose name rhymes with bebert) the worst movie in the Star Wars saga. I, however, would disagree whole heartedly with that accusation. I would almost put Episode II on par with Episode III for best of the prequels. It's not nearly as good as the classic originals, but it's still got enough plot and character development to keep the audience interested. It definitely did what Episode I failed to do in terms of plot and character development. First off, let me get some of the common complaints about this movie out of the way right away. A lot of people complain about the amount of romance in this movie. Yeah, yeah, I know, George Lucas is not a very good romance director, at all. But the romance that's in this film is here for a reason. George wanted to show the developing relationship between Anakin and Padme in a way that would make the events of the next film even more tragic. So, in a sense this is the most romantic of the Star Wars movies and the romance is actually more necessary here than it was in The Empire Strikes Back. I think the reason why so many fans were offended by this kind of romance is because it was something that hadn't been done in a Star Wars film before. But is that a bad thing? Is it so wrong for George Lucas to expand his universe a bit by trying new things? Not everything has to be the same as the originals. Now, all that being said, the romance aspect wasn't perfect. A few moments are almost cringe-worthy, but it also had some moments that were really affective and I really did feel attached to these two people by the time they get married at the end of the film. The next thing that people complain about is Hayden Christianson's acting. People, it's a Star Wars movie. The last thing I'm looking at is the acting when I watch these movies. Remember how horrible and whiny Mark Hammill was in the original ("But I wanted to go to Tosche Station to pick up some power converters! Waaaaaah!") Yeah, I bet you forgot about that because you paying attention to the story and characters too much to notice. Sure there are better choices to play Anakin and I'm not saying that Hayden is the best choice for Anakin, but he's certainly not the worst. In reality, no one's a good actor in Star Wars. Even good actors aren't good actors in Star Wars. In fact Hayden's a decent actor in most of his other work, it's just that this is Star Wars and the focus is not on the acting. Anyways, with those things out of the way, I will say that Episode II's plot isn't perfect. Sometimes it just gets a bit too, well, boring. But the fact remains that George really stepped up the character development on this one just like he did in Episode V and it really shows through. People and things are starting to shift in a big way here and there's enough mystery to keep audiences interested to want to see a third movie where they basically already know what's going to happen. Going back and making movies about something that already happened is a huge undertaking for anyone and I feel that story-wise this one got it right the most due to major continuity flaws in the third movie and the lack of progression in the first. There's also enough eye candy here to keep the casual film-goer interested, such as a lightsaber battle with Yoda and an epic clone war battle at the end of the movie. When Obi-Wan briefly mentioned the clone wars at the beginning of Episode IV no one imagined it was going to be this cool. Seeing that battle is reason alone to see this movie. Ultimately though, Episode II is a Star Wars movie for Star Wars fans and I think that's why a lot of casual viewers couldn't appreciate it. It's not perfect, but it's far from being bad.

Author: miki2003_43
Review: I expected Star Wars to be action packed. All I got was a sappy love story between to very lousy actors. There aren't enough scenes where the Jedis decapitate robots. The scene where they were fighting in the arena was disappointing. Seriously.

Author: nathan-254
Review_Title: How brainless do you have to be to enjoy this?
Review: In some ways this might be the best of the prequel sequence. Not to say it's in any way good, but it does sit happily with most of the nondescript Hollywood tripe that presumably all those reviewers giving it good reviews on this site thrive on.

Author: gypsyhansolothepolishpavlova
Review: In the year 1977 , George Lucas wrote and created a film he expected to be hated and criticized and over all made fun of. That movie was Star Wars. And , as you know , everyone loved that movie. So in 1980 he wanted to create a sequel that lived up to of the first one , and he tried but he was once again worried that people would hate it. That movie was The Empire Strikes Back , which is considerded to be one of ( if not , THE ) greatest sequels of all time. So in 1999 , George Lucas tried to create a new trilogy , aprequel trilogy. Only this time , he thought everyone would love his new movie. That movie was the Phantom Menace. And now , just like how the Empire Strikes Back was better than the first one , Attack of the Clones is worse than the first one.

Author: anaconda972000
Review: After episode 1, this was a vast improvement. I came away from the theater impressed. I didn't necessarily think the acting was good or the dialog or even the story, but for some reason it was much more fun than The Phantom Menace and that's how I'm rating it. Everyone talks about how the new ones aren't as good, but go back and watch the originals. They're not exactly perfect. There's plenty of cheesy crap and bad acting in the originals, but they were enjoyable and I think this one is as well.

Author: Chidiock
Review_Title: Weak characters, but a visual feast
Review: Wonderful visuals.  I'm going to have to see this movie three times to have a chance to pick up the details.  Dialogue ranges from mediocre to bad--but who goes to Star Wars expecting to hear the banter worthy of the Algonquin Hotel?  The heart of a Star Wars movie is visuals and action, and this movie delivers the goods.

Author: JFenin
Review_Title: Better than Episode I - but far from Episode IV
Review: It wasn't hard to top Episode I but again I was disappointed of what George Lucas made out of this saga.

Author: Yuca
Review: Forget what the critics are saying, this movie delivers the goods. No, it won't win the Oscars for Best Pic, Director, Screenplay or Actor, but we all know that. The action sequences are terrific, the sets are incredible and the overall feel of the movie is right on with the Star Wars universe. Job well done for Lucas and Co. Bring on Episode III!!!!

Author: Geoff-32
Review: This flick pretty much speaks for itself.  Yeah, it was overloaded with mind numbing digital effects--hell, the whole movie is pretty much a mind numbing digital effect--but who cares, it was Star Wars all the way.  To be honest, the entire movie could have sucked, but the single, two minute scene with the "Matrix" style Yoda butt-whoopin' made the entire movie, nay, the entire series of films completely worth it.  Not bad for a character who used to be a glorified sock puppet with someone's hand crammed in his rear.  Luckily, the entire movie didn't suck to say the least, and George Lucas, in my opinion, has made up for the travesty that was "The Phantom Menace" from which the only good things we got were Ewan McGregor as Obi-Wan and Natalie Portman as Queen...uh, no--Senator...um...oh, you know, that absolutely hot girl who got her form-fitting white outfit all torn up at the end of Episode II.  The award goes to Natalie Portman for having the most stunning non-digital effects in the movie, rivaling the tongue-waggling classic "Princess Leia enslaved in a bikini" scene.

Author: Krud-2
Review_Title: An improvement over Episode I... but then, so are most beer commercials.
Review: *the spoilers below pertain to the movie's ending. You have been warned.* (It's actually been a while since I've seen this movie, but I neglected to vote or comment on it at the time. Since I'll be doing so for Episode III, I figured I might as well do this one first as a point of reference.) I will admit up front that I am often a fickle, difficult-to-please movie viewer. I am more than happy to nitpick a film to death, no matter how good it actually is. (In fact, my nitpicking a movie is no reflection on how I felt about it, as even my favorite movies are full of things to critique.) Having said that, I will say that I am not going to nitpick this movie. At least, not here. I've done it elsewhere online, and there's nothing I can say here that hasn't been repeated ad nauseum by others before me.

Author: DbNatura
Review_Title: Yoda and Obi-Wan Kick Some Serious Butt
Review: I was blown away by this movie.  I realize that the professional critics have had a field day with this one as they have with all the previous episodes.  I'll briefly give my response to their comments.

Author: smcinrny
Review_Title: First the franchise lost its soul, now it has lost its way.
Review: This film is Dawson's Creek in Space, with special effects sequences thrown in for no particularly coherent reason.

Author: jamesglu
Review_Title: Did I see a different movie??
Review: Judging by the last set of comments I saw, and the high ranking this movie got from other viewers, I am starting to think that I saw a different movie from the rest of you.  The only thing good I think to say about this movie is that if you have an incurable illness you should see it because it will make what little time you have left on earth seem to go by much more slowly.

Author: davetrou
Review_Title: Great cinematography, awful acting and dialogue
Review: SW2 has some of the best cinematography and visual effects I've seen.  But the great visuals were overshadowed by terrible dialogue and even worse acting.  At the performance I attended, the love scenes (which are sooooo cheesy) brought on roars of laughter from the audience.  Not exactly what George Lucas intended.

Author: Musca domestica
Review_Title: Better then RotJ and TPM, not as good as ANH or ESB
Review: -Spoilers ahead!-

Author: ichthus
Review_Title: If only the humans were animated!
Review: Awesome FX! The humans were stiff and the dialog was flat.  How many hairdos can Padme have in how many scenes?  Even the over actor (Samuel Jackson) was stiff.

Author: Aslan-6
Review_Title: When is the last time you cheered?
Review: I will now relay my thoughts on this movie at the risk of sounding like a broken record. (Spoilers ahead)

Author: badknees
Review: ...the movie wasn't bad. Christensen had been so hyped, and he was AWFUL!!! Made of wood. Of course, his dialogue left much to be desired, but even so, he is simply a whiny mama's boy. Portman wasn't a whole lot better; Obi was terrific. More Obi, less Anakin, please.

Author: brn2brd
Review_Title: The Best Summer Blockbuster in Years!!`
Review: Ok, I'll keep this short. I thought movie was incredible. It's lightyears beyond Phantom Menace and it's everything a summer blockbuster should be. I did not walk out of this one feeling cheated or empty. Instead, I simply felt like I'd had an awesome evening at the movies.

Author: dicedano
Review: After reading many reviews of AOTC and their harsh criticisms of the dialogue and plot, I have a question: How many Star Wars fans, on the news that prequels would be made, thought "Yes, I can't wait to hear some of that great dialogue once again"?  Hell no, you wanted great special effects, a journey into new and exciting worlds, and to find out how Anakin succumbed to the dark side.  I enjoyed AOTC thoroughly, and although it is a bit esoteric and may alienate non-fans, Star Wars lovers will find that this is what the hoped for in Episode I.

Author: beef-9
Review_Title: What a great fit in the saga!
Review: I have been hearing people complaining about how uninspired this film is emotionally. I believe this is for good reason. We have seen how ships in Phantom Menace had beautiful lines and style, but as we move through time towards A New Hope it becomes utilitarian and functional. This has been explained as a move from an age of the Republic's beauty and art into an age of Trade Federation cold capitalism and ultimately into an age of Imperial totalitarianism. I believe a similar thing is happening with personality styles. We have a republic that is sick and dying and being torn apart, and much of it is based on the fact that the politicians are mostly bureaucrats and passionless, and that a Jedi's guiding principle is restraining emotions. Since these are the people who are getting the wool pulled over their eyes by charismatic separatists like Dooku and Sidious, you can see why they are destined to fail. Like many civilizations in decline, they are apathetic and listless, and they are bound to be boring in comparison to their descendants Han Solo, Leia, Luke Skywalker in the coming rebellion who have a reason to light a fire in their eyes and hearts. They are like the revolutionaries that fought for freedom in America. They are the Jeffersons and Reveres of Star Wars. Comparing a Naboo Senator and a pack of cool headed Jedis to the gang on the Millenium Falcon is unreasonable. It is like comparing George W. Bush to George Washington. It all depends on whether you are trying to defend freedom from a position of power, or fighting for it from a far off empire's "Most Wanted" list. Remember, England promised the death penalty for anyone who signed the Declaration of Independence. America is an old republic now, I see no passion in leadership here either. To sum it up. If Han, Leia, and Luke were running the Republic, I doubt they would have been all that interesting either. Eddie Keever

Author: ArchArnie
Review: Lucas has grown since Episode I. Did you like IV, V and VI but had a minor grudge against Episode I because it was too childish (Jar-Jar etc. ?) Fear no more! Episode II is much better than I. Meet C3PO, R2D2 and Bobba Fett for the first time!

Author: fear-4
Review: I am a very big Star Wars fan.  Like millions of people, I have grown up with these movies and have cherished the first three (or rather, the middle three, I suppose) since I first saw Star Wars (I cannot in good conscience call it "Star Wars Episode IV - A New Hope" -- how arrogant can one mediocre director be) in the theatres (70mm was a wonderful thing).  I was excited, but ultimately disappointed by Phantom Menace, but still thought it was passably entertaining.  I still have all my Star Wars action figures tucked away somewhere in the C3PO carrying case, and I have many fond memories of the hours I would while away having the Star wars figures battle the evil Lego-man regime (the Legos were the bad guys because they could be decapitated and dismembered much easier and with less damage than the Star Wars dudes.)

Author: A Triump
Review: I will have to admit I was skeptical going into my viewing of Episode II, after the disappointment of Episode I. However, I was pleasantly surpirsised by the film. In many respects, Lucas has returned to those elements which made his prior films a success. As you would expect, there are familiar faces, as well as new characters, and an explosive action finale. While no one may be surprised at the superior effects, it is actually the story of the inner struggle of Annakin, a momentous task to handle, that the film captures well. Performances are not as stale in this film, and it is a great improvement. This is a film Lucas can take some pride in. 7/10

Author: Opie-6
Review: Don't worry, it's good, very good indeed. Not great, but definitley worthy of Star Wars fame.

Author: jewinda
Review: First off, let me say that I didn't mind the original three films.  I even tolerated Phantom Menace.  But Attack of the Clones was an over-rated, morally pretentious, poorly acted, nauseating pile of rubbish.   Hayden Christensen should never be allowed on a movie screen again.

Author: kanton
Review_Title: Heroes you do not care about
Review: I am a declared Star Wars fan and it is very sad for me to see how George Lucas transformed an epic movie into a video game. In the original series there were a group of people that you cared about and some that you feared or hated. In this one, the main focus of the film seems to be on the digital achievements of Industrial Light and Magic. No character development, no memorable dialogues.

Author: kaywang
Review_Title: the special effects is sucked me in
Review: It was more fantastic than EP1,the special effects is sucked me in.the fight scenes in EP2 are awesome,especially the fight scene between yoda and dooka,dont miss it...however,i didnt really like the love scenes,too affected.waiting for EP3.

Author: thegame
Review: When the trailers for Attack of the Clones first started show up on hte internet, tv and movie theaters i was truly blown away.  Images of the new film had me psyched and ready to be thrilled in theaters.  My most common words about the trailers were, "if the movie is half as good as these trailers make it look, it will be the first time i ever have a favorite star wars movie." The movie delivered juut that.  Filled with a wide variety of action, adventure, romance and humor i found Attack of the Clones to be the best star wars movie to date.  I have been a fan since I was eight years old. Star Wars has always been viewed as one story by me, however i felt Attack of the Clones is that one chapter of a story that really sticks out and stays with you forever. Some people will say the dialog was corny, sappy or just bad however I felt the dialog was perfect for the movie.  Lucas was able to bring the worlds in this movie alive with the dialog and locations.  The movie brings you much deeper into the star wars story, with some huge twists and surprises (espcially one that involves a little green man and his lightsaber, :]). The acting in the movie was great for the most part I felt.  Hayden lets you see both sides of Anakin in this installment, as he slowy sinks more and more towards the dark side. Overall i rate this film a 10 out of 10, terrific acting, story, special effect, music, and action make this my favorite star wars film of them all.

Author: wardf-08015
Review: Attack of the clones is a huge improvement over the phantom menace but that unfortunately doesn't mean that it's the greatest film on the Star Wars universe and it still suffers from a lot of flaws.

Author: coyote521
Review_Title: Who put the dark in the dark side?
Review: When William Holden, in "Sunset Boulevard", said "it's sometimes fun to see how really bad bad dialogue can be", he may have been reading the script for "Attack Of The Clones".

Author: obo-3
Review_Title: Clone is right - of other movies...
Review: Others have pointed out the sub-Shakespearean plot and the timber acting so I will not repeat those criticisms. My biggest complaint was that there wasn't one scene in the movie I hadn't seen before - in another movie. I thought it'd be fun to make a list:

Author: laryan
Review: Everything that was wrong with Episode 1 is either gone or cut back severely.  Everything that is good about Episodes 4, 5, and 6, with the exception of Han Solo (Harrison Ford), is here.  It was worth standing in line for two hours among people half my age, to see on the premiere.

Author: Arwen Undomiel
Review: This one has to be one of my favorite Star Wars movies and I think it made up Phantom Menace.  The Yoda fight scene was awesome, and sure the love scenes were really corny, but it was funny.  This one has to be one of my favorite Star Wars movies and I think it made up Phantom Menace.  And it's, and the feeling you get from the fans(Countdowns, dead silence when you see the LucasFilmLtd Logo then suddenly cheers of held back excitement when they see STAR WARS and hear the theme) rubs off on you and makes it that much better.

Author: mario24
Review: For all the hype, this one was pretty bad.  Not so much the acting, just the timing of where he put things in set the movie off. People in the theater were laughing during the so-called romantic parts and at the climax.  I'd wait for DVD before forking out money to see this in theaters, unless your totally in love with Star Wars.  Its not even that impressive without a digital projector.  Hope the third one turns out better.

Author: I_have_a_brain_cloud
Review_Title: Gushing in spite of myself. SPOILERS!
Review: About a month prior to the opening of AOC, a local theater ran ALL of the prior Star Wars movies over the space of a weekend.  This put me in a state of happy expectation for Attack of the Clones, although I had an opportunity to be reminded of how disappointing TPM was.  On first viewing I found AOC to be visually overwhelming and complex to the point of incoherence.  I've seen it a few more times since and I keep enjoying it more.  Lucas has not succeeded at recreating the pristine splendor of what is now called "Episode I"; the beauty and simplicity of that movie has been supplanted by overly-complex yet banal plotting, and and stupifyingly ornate costumes, creatures and special effects.  I find it irritating that George Lucas (or his creative droids) keep needing to perform damage control in order to maintain that the entire series was written before Episode IV was produced. This is so blatantly a fiction-- wish George would just own up to it. Maybe he had a basic plot in mind, but the continuity problems are just so manifest that it is impossible that he had it completed back then.  In fact, I've read that Lucas changes the plot continually, and substantially, in the midst of filming and post-production.   Who cares when it was written?

Author: waylayer
Review: Weak dialogue, weak acting, and plotholes the size of Wyoming hurt this film tremendously. While the final half hour is riveting, the first 90 are painful to behold. Particularly groanful are any and all scenes between Padme and Anakin...they are directed as if in a high school play, and because of this their "romance" seems forced and contrived. Kenobi's half of the story came off much better, since McGregor was actually instilling some fun qualities into his character. Perhaps the biggest flaw the film has is having characters with whom the audience may invest emotion in. It may be true that Anakin will become Darth Vader, but it is still the film's obligation to present him as sympathetic and someone whom the audience should care about. Here the film failed. Though Christensen's wooden performance did not help the cause either. 5/10

Author: agharwaen
Review_Title: I'm Big Fan of SW but...
Review: Well, it was really... disappointing! But let's not compare with LOTR please? It's two completely different stories...

Author: JoeFreezy
Review_Title: Fun-Filled & Action-Packed, But Lacking That Star Wars Magic
Review: Why are the critics bashing this movie?  If critics, like Chicago's Roger Ebert for example, can give good reviews to a movie based on its `popcorn value,' why can't they do the same for `Clones.'  This was arguably the most entertaining and the most fun of the Star Wars movies.  All moviegoers, fans or not, will enjoy this movie.  (Yoda alone is worth the price of admission.)  But the praise ends here.

Author: mattmansour-3
Review: Two and bit hours of bombs, blasts, light sabers, lasers and flying.

Author: avb-5
Review_Title: final fantasy is even more realistic!!!
Review: What a game, if they had only given me a joystick. but no, so I had to see this low action drama with tears in my eyes. If they only had a white rabbit and a duck to do the one-liners, it would be better off. Another one bytes the dust.

Author: ashleytate
Review: The first hour and a half of this movie literally sucked the life out of me.

Author: anthonyo-2
Review_Title: Really good, what we desperately wanted from Episode I
Review: The word on the street was that Episode II was a vast improvement on The Phantom Menace, and they were right.  The only real complaint I heard was that the developing romance between Anakin & Padme slowed things down. Now that I've seen it, I can say it is visually stunning, fast paced and in the end thoroughly entertaining.

Author: slyspicoli
Review: Dialogue -- Unexplainably bad.  I honestly felt nauseous.

Author: grefly73
Review: One can expect the very best in special effects when it comes to a George Lucas.  That being said, I cannot forgive him for the atrocity of some dialogue.  There are points where it is almost embarrassing.  Hayden is a good-looking kid, but not a good actor.  He's better than Jake (Epi I), but not good.  The movie really lacked the biting one-liners or give-and-take that was so well crafted in the original series.  But since I am a hard-core fan, I can look past the trifles of acting and enjoy the spectacle.  (And for those who disliked Jar Jar so much, this movie can give you a justification for it, with a snicker and grin.)  Samuel L. is just too cool as a Jedi, Yoda looks much more like the original that many of use grew up with, and Natalie is a pleasure to watch.  The new worlds and new critters were interesting.  I agree that the linear battle sequence (as opposed to Epi I's three fights at once) was much better.  There were tense moments, and moments to cheer.  The action towards the end will tend to make up for the shortcomings in the beginning.  In fact, it almost felt like Lucas was filming a war movie.  So George, I guess you are forgiven after all.  7 out of 10.

Author: MyDixieNormous
Review: First, Lucas had nothing to prove with this film.  Episode I was as fine as any of the original three and better in some ways.  Second, he owes us (The viewers) nothing.  He is doing this for our entertainment not to line his pocket books.  The man has been a billionaire for years.  Now for all of you who claim to be Star Wars "fans" but are disappointed by this film all I can say is that I'm disgusted by you.  Episode II is not disappointing at all. The dialogue is not trite, contrived, tired and predictable, or any other words you don't know the meaning to but saw other people using them so you decided to use them yourselves.  It lives up to the original three very nicely and tells you exactly what happened to make sweet Anakin Skywalker turn into the person we all love to hate, Darth Vader.  As for the acting. Do you remember how horrible the acting was the first time around?  Yet everyone loves those films and doesn't seem to be bothered by the fact that none of them could act.  So why the beef now?  And I don't recall Lucas ever saying that he was a first rate director.  His strong point is story telling and at that he is better than anyone, past or present.  Which brings us to plot.  The plot of this film is to protect the Senator from being killed and find out who is trying to kill her.  Wow, that's so horrible.  Star Wars' plot was to try and rescue the princess and in doing so get the Death Star plans to Obi-Wan.  I can argue that that is a sub par plot.  My point is, they are both great movies with great plots and both deserve to be thought of as so.  If you don't like them you don't have to I'm not telling you to. But don't claim to be a huge Star Wars fan and then strike these two latest films off as lacking.  I can not express how happy I am with this latest installment and how I wish Episode III was coming out next week.  If you don't understand that then maybe you should go and see Spider-Man.  As for me I'm going to go see Episode II again and remember why after 25 years George Lucas is still the most sought after film maker of our generation.

Author: kazan316
Review: Boy was this movie ridiculous. Better than Phantom Menace but still pathetic. The special effects were astonishing and the were so many possibilities involved with the plot. But Lucas has to make this one of the worst Star Wars films. This movie was silly, and for those of you who don't believe me, go see the movie again, and you'll see everyone laughing at the most serious scenes.The Yoda scene was a laugh, but not the serious battle the light sabre scenes should be. And a good part of the movie is a romance. I couldn't sworn I was watching a high-tech Romeo and Juliet film, if my ticket hadn't said otherwise. You should see this, but just to say that you've seen it. Bring on Episode 3.

Author: travvller
Review_Title: Top 250? You've got to be kidding
Review: The fact that this film is currently listed as one of the top 250 films of all time here strains the long term credibility of the IMDB web site. Can't blame the site, of course, it's just a whole lot of hype out there and it's clouding people's judgements.

Author: kmona87
Review: I saw this film the day it came out and...I was fairly entertained. What am I thinking, I was more than fairly entertained. This is so much better than Phantom Menace, and it answered so many questions I had. I thought it was awsome how they introduced the Storm Troopers, we got to see Luke's aunt Beru and unlce Owen in their youth, and most importantly (I don't even know if I am worthy of saying this) we got to see Yoda fighting with a lightsaber. That was the best fight I have ever seen in my life (and im not limiting that to just Star Wars fights). Needless to say the audience sat there dumbfounded. How could that the little green guy who seemingly can barely walk, jump around doing flips and cartwheels as he attempts to defeat Count Dooku. Simply incredible. People have compared this movie to The Empire Strikes Back. I thought the only thing that AOTC lacked that would beat out ESB is it didn't have a "Luke, I am your father" scene. But then again, ESP had Yoda sporting his cain, while ATOC had his taking charge with his green lightsaber. Episode II lives up to its hype. I rate this movie 4.5/5 stars.

Author: sweetcheeks_31
Review: well...this movie is a definite improvement over episode 1. The characters have some history to work from and there is not a lot of Jar Jar. Well actually he causes the rise of the empire but that's beside the point. C-3p0 and r2 again bring back humor, which I missed since the original trilogy. Attack of the clones in my opinion has a lot to do with the original trilogy than episode 1 because we meet Luke's aunt and uncle, the clone troopers will eventually become storm troopers and WE FINALLY SEE THE ORIGINS OF THE DEATH STAR...which for me was a spine tingling moment.... the death star will probably play a role in episode 3. One last thing.... yoda...yoda yoda yoda.... I just didn't see it coming...yoda with a light saber...the highlight of the star wars saga...

Author: yojimbo2006
Review: Coming out of the theatre after this film I felt I needed to sit down and get a bit of fresh air to clear my head! There's just so much action and so many visual effects (especially in the second half) it was almost impossible to take it all in - definitely a must-see-twice movie. The strongest aspect of the film for me is the plot which starts with a bang when Padme's ship is destroyed and never lets up. Some say the first half is boring but I disagree; it sets up the characters and plot very well - if the whole film was like the second half I think I would have fainted trying to keep up!

Author: Happy_Scrappy
Review_Title: Jaw-dropping, story-dense, unrelenting, powerful. It's Back!
Review: Star Wars has been many things over the past 25 years: action, romance, mystery, and even hoakey. But until now it has never been story-dense. Say what you will about the ridiculousness of the title, Attack of the Clones is nothing short of awesome. Even if you have never seen a Star Wars film in your life (and I would sincerely find that hard to believe) you owe it to yourself to see this movie. So you didn't see Phantom Menace. So what? It wasn't a complete masterpiece (the podrace and the last thirty minutes do a lot to save it, though). This is. From the opening moments on the landing platform to the last 45 minutes (which is truly one of the most intense things ever put to the screen), you are barely given a chance to breathe, much less try to make sense of the actual story. I've seen it twice before opening weekend is over and I'm still going to have to see it at least twice more, not to mention buying it on DVD the day it comes out, before I'll be sure that I know everything that was going on in the movie. Also, as though you need another reason to see the movie: Yoda has himself a little action scene that y'all might enjoy (Yoda with a lightsaber--Hell Yea!!!). Bottom line, go see it. Don't ask questions, just go see it.

Author: Ldyandrea
Review_Title: Overall entertaining, but someone needs to take away George's CGI toys....
Review: I won't give any plot spoilers here, but just my general impressions after seeing the film at 12:01 last night.  High points were definately the music (although I didn't recall any new themes being introduced, rather variations on old), the costuming (Natalie looks spectacular in everything), the creatures (although one needed to be attacked with some lemon and drawn butter rather than a blaster *grin*), and the ships (the first big one being very reminiscent of the prop plane in Casablanca).  The droids were very entertaining, and Yoda kicked his little green butt into overdrive for some seriously Jackie Chan-type action! Who knew?  However, while overall the plot and storyline started coming together, I felt that similar to Episode I the dialogue and acting really have taken a backseat to the special effects. While I can't deny that they are indeed beautiful, I have two specific issues with them.  First that they are indeed so perfect as to not have the somewhat gritty reality quality that the first films had.  They feel more like a video game or a cartoon at times than a film.  Secondly, that there are so many separate elements included on the screen in some scenes that it becomes overwhelming and scatters the focus of the scene itself.  Also, in re-watching the first films, I was struck at how much edgier both the dialogue and the characters were then.  While many of us could recite and quote the great lines from the first three films, the lines from Episodes I and II seem to be forced and in some cases are simply recycled poorly. Amidala could have been edgier with better lines, and a more intense, less "American Pie" teenage boy to play against.  The audience laughed in places that it obviously wasn't intended, and it was unfortunately due to the hormonal rather than anguished/love-struck performance that should have been.  Ewan was good, but again needed to be more edgy and less wishy-washy....the interaction between Obi-Wan and Anakin fell flat for me, particularly since it was supposed to be taking place after they'd been together for 10 years.  10 years training as a Jedi would certainly have ingrained far more maturity and tact in Anakin even if he would have still had the ego of a 20 year old.  They would have been more like partners of mutual respect, rather than the relationship seen.....one that could have been undermined in a far more effective subtle fashion than occurred.  It was actually this relationship that was the key to the entire plot of this film.....Anakin's desire for respect and praise of his abilities, to be thought of as an equal while being egged on by the Senator who played to his ego.  Unfortunately, it simply didn't succeed.  I know some will think it blasphemous to say so, but it seems to me that while George Lucas has continued to develop his skills as a director of special effects, his skills of directing actors and his writing seem to have atrophied a bit over the years.  I was reminded of the adage that simply because you *can* do something (i.e. with technology) doesn't mean that you *should*.  Less is more, and using effects as enhancement and backdrop rather than making them the overwhelming star would have instead made this a film at least equal to the original three.  I feel that Lucas is truly visionary, has blazed the trail for the present movie industry, and will bring them finally into the age of digital projection that has so long been overdue.  However, in regards to this film, I think that perhaps to have done this as a collaborative effort with another strong director (such as the "Raiders" series with Spielberg) would have achieved a far more effective end result.

Author: emenslaw
Review: The acting was wooden, the plot rambled, and the special effects simply distracting. Natalie Portman can act -- her performance in The Professional was Oscar caliber. But under Lucas she is mechanical. The future Darth Vader suddenly goes to look for his mother in the middle of the film -- a segment that has absolutely nothing to do with the plot. Apparently he is motivated by a dream. But he hasn't bothered to look her up in years.  Must be the Dark Force clouding his vision. The same force that has dulled Lucas' artistic ability.

Author: tjpatterson98
Review: This is the best Star wars yet. It manages to do what the Phantom Menace couldn't do. That is combine the story of how the events of the first Trilogy came to be with plenty of action. This was especially true in showing all the Jedi in action, especially Yoda. In fact it was worth the price of admission, just to see Yoda in action.

Author: CRidgeNorway
Review: Episode 4-6 was great! Episode 1 was just about as bad a job as one could do with such an awaited movie. So what about episode 2?

Author: nvincent
Review_Title: Star Wars franchise sinking fast in a sea of digital effects and uninventiveness
Review: Remember the good old days when Star Wars actually had real models and real actors?

Author: jnrohde
Review: After "The Phantom Menace" which was a slight disappointment and without a doubt the weakest of the now five movies, George Lucas has crafted possibly one of the best Star Wars movies second only to "The Empire Strikes Back".

Author: wizard5233
Review: This Star Wars movie was truly a great one.  It is one of the best Star Wars movie of the entire trilogy. (warning! possible spoilers!) For those who are really Star Wars fans this movie will establish many plots and it will tell you all about Anakin Skywalker and his turn to the dark side.  Also is a romance in it in which you know is Padme.  The love dialogue is kinda corny, but hey it was a long, long time ago, perhaps they invented this kinda dialogue.  The action sequences are just truly amazing.  There will be plenty of lasers, explosions, lightsabers, and force power action for Star Wars fans and new fans.  The first hour is slow but the real strength comes in the second hour, where the battle sequences are amazing.  The special effects are really great.  This was a very enjoyable movie for me, watch it, it is really a great movie!

Author: Petep623
Review_Title: Better than EPI but not much.
Review: I think what sets this movie apart from EPI is the acting. It's a little better. I thought the acting on behalf of Ewan McGregor was better than in EPI. He seems to take on the role that Alec Guinness left us in Star Wars.

Author: spewey
Review_Title: Not quite as good as Empire, but not far off
Review: I'm a huge Star Wars fan so I pretty much knew I would like Attack of the Clones going in. And I did enjoy it. It's not a flawless movie, and there is always room for improvement, but my complaints are minor.

Author: theevilmoo
Review_Title: A fantastic but very flawed film.
Review: Attack of the Clones gets better and better as you watch.  There is a thread of suspense throughout most of the entire movie that is strengthened expertly.  Hayden Christensen does a great job of portraying a very scary and troubled Anakin.  While the movie is much darker than Episode I, there is a more playful and unrestrained feel to it (though, it is still not near the Han Solo days).  C3P0 and Yoda steal the show.

Author: Doak22
Review_Title: Not just Lucas, but Star Wars, too, is back.
Review: This is the most entertaining out of all the Star Wars movies.  Lucas brings back the franchise where it belongs with loads of nostalgic hype and links to the originals.  This may be a simply effective tool to reign the box office, but I think I stand with most Star Wars geeks in saying that those subtle and obvious foreshadowing points, etc. effectively brought huge grins on each person's face.  On top of this, the visuals in the film are simply unparalleled.  While Phantom Menace (which still is not a Star Wars movie in my book) had good stuff, the art was not so effectively implemented with the new visual technology as in this film.  Every new amazing shot of a spaceship, and you think they will not be able to top it, and then the next one leaves you hyperventilating because the visuals are that awesome.  The computer-generated character models are especially good--Jar-Jar looks even better than he did in Phantom, etc.

Author: Draupnir
Review: There are some things to like about this film, but many others that regrettably do not work. Among the good is the developing plot (I know many would disagree, but let me explain), SOME of the actors, and, of course, the special effects.

Author: mvz-1
Review_Title: Clearly the weakest of the 5 star wars movies
Review: This movie suffered from the lack of a plot. The acting was wooden and amateurish. While the special effects were good, it does not make a good movie. As a star wars junkie I would have seen this in any case and will see the 6th version when it comes out, but if this were number one, there wouldn't have been any sequel.

Author: asdf-12
Review: I think the plot of this movie is actually pretty good.  I wish they'd found a better way to make Anakin go dark than having his mother die, but after Episode I (in which nothing happened) I had pretty low expectations plot-wise ... it was nice to see a little intrigue & mystery, and I like the fact that Sidious seems to be playing both sides in this war.

Author: wayne55
Review_Title: Once you get past some cheesy lines, this movie is FUN!
Review: Overall, a much improved effort over Episode I.  Although I did not totally bash Episode I, it did have its major flaws.  This new installment is not without its problems as well.  A few (ok more than a few) poorly written lines must be overlooked in order to enjoy this film.  If you go in with the "I'm going to hate this" attitude, you'll hate it.  I give this a SOLID 8 for the entertainment factor.  Yoda with a Light Saber Rocks.

Author: Brock256
Review_Title: Vastly underrated by most critics, blends well with the feel of the originals
Review: (extremely minor spoiler warning, proceed if you don't mind learning things you could get as easily from the official site)

Author: redscorpion9
Review_Title: makes you wanna see episode 3 (very small spoiler)
Review: i saw the this movie on may 16 in dubai. firstly i was amazed that dubai (which is a city in the UAE) got the movie soo quickly. usually it takes 3-4 weeks or more for a movie to come out her. i thought the movie was excellent. the graphics and visual effects were very good. the acting could have been better and that is one of the negative points from the film. anakin had too many corny lines. but overall okay acting. the story line was good, however i think if lucas got rid of the love sequence it would have made the film better. i mean star wars is an action and adventure film, adding i love story just makes it look boring, plus the love lines were corny. i felt the end was the best part of the movie. it had yoda fighting with darth doku, that part was probably the best part of the movie. lucas made an excellent decision of making yoda fight. they really showed yoda's speed and accuracy. when the film finishes it really makes you want to see part 3 because it doesnt tell you what happens. it doesnt really give you an ending. you know whats going to happen but how you dont know. i feel that lucas can do a very good job for part 3 and im really looking forward to seeing that movie. sadly its going to come out in 3 years time.

Author: mac_21_94589
Review_Title: Simply the Best in the Saga!
Review: As a devoted Star Wars fan, 'Attack of the Clones' I would say is not only the best installment in the prequel triology so far, but THE BEST STAR WARS MOVIE CREATED!

Author: sPiCe4Ce5
Review: There was a lot of action in the movie and some humor, not like everyone says that there is too many Anakin and Padmé scenes they are just exaggerating. Don't criticize and find the mistakes go see it because you like it and to have fun, that's what you should see it for...George Lucas intended it to be fun,original, and full of imagination. Don't become the next Ebert and Roper.

Author: benmet420
Review: Star Wars Episode 2: Attack of the Clones was just what any Star Wars fan can want in a movie.  From start to the BEST ENDING EVER Star Wars Episode 2 is a must see.  It blows Episode 1 out of the water, George Lucas definatley worked a lot harder, and more true to the Star Wars series in this great movie.

Author: dreamscape03
Review_Title: Frenetic CGI battles and disjointed storytelling
Review: I watched The Phantom Menace with impossibly high expectations only to be let down worse than I ever anticipated. It was with renewed hope that I walked in to the theatre to watch the B-movie titled, Attack of the Clones. A little over 2 hours later I walked out dazed and confused. I had little idea what had just happened other than a mass of quick cuts and needlessly busy battle scenes.

Author: unbloodyfied
Review: Five years ago I was a proud to say that I was a Star Wars fan. Now I have to put an asterisk next to that statement, as the predictable story and bad acting have drug the series down to the level of the cheesy sci-fi serials that have supposedly inspired it, yet still lacking the campy fun.

Author: guox0032
Review: This movie has to be the biggest disappointment this summer.  I couldn't help to think that The new Star Wars will never be as good as the original, not matter how good the special effect gets.  First of all the dialog is horrible, the love story should have been a big part of the movie, but it is not convincing at all.  The movie is full of poorly constructed logic.  For example, why the hell the bounty hunter trying to use some poison bugs to kill the senator, when he can actually put some bugs into her room without any trouble, why not just shoot her right there.  Also the special effect didn't get very good untill the second half,  the sky chase part of the movie is not original, merely a shamelessly copy of Fifth Element which was made 6 years earlier, and still looked a lot better than this movie.  The only good thing I can say about this movie is the special effect at the end, yes it is very good.  But for some reason, I am not that impressed.  I think I expected Star War to be this good.  I found BladeII and Spider Man to be better movie this year.

Author: LytseJehannes
Review: Went to see this movie, not sure what to expect. Reviews were quite ambivalent; some liked it, some didn't. No better way to judge than seeing it for yourself. The movie starts out pretty good, with the attempted assassination of Senator Amidala (the former Queen). Unfortunately the rest of the first half of the movie tends to fall into cliche's. It looks like Mr. Lucas just grabbed all the classic scenes from love stories, and put them in a row. It's just an overkill. Come on, nobody is waiting to hear Amidala say 'Every minute I spend without you, a piece of me is dying.' Besides that the focus is drawn away from the real story. And this is what the movie is about, and what makes up for the lousy first half. With the precognition of Episode I, and the other Star Wars movies, one can see the underlying plot develop. Hints to future events are hidden everywhere. Besides obvious hints to other Star Wars movies, there also seem to be plenty of references to other SF movies (search for Star Trek, Stargate, AI, LOTR). The action scenes in the movie are quite good, and as pointed out in other reviews: Yoda rocks.

Author: soumyeah
Review_Title: its true- this is the phantom menace's empire strikes back.
Review: if a bit overloaded with cgi at times the digital orgy eventually gives way to a compelling plot and subplot. this time it is more like we are watching dominoes collapse than a stale chess match. yoda. the fetts. anakin minus the night cries. natalie porter. 3rd kind cloning encounters. gladiator. braveheart. lucas must be brimming. all in all a great movie.

Author: srb67
Review_Title: Up there with the originals - and Yoda fights!
Review: Brilliant, excellent, as good as all the original 3 movies.  Having been a huge fan of Star Wars since my childhood I was a little disappointed by Phantom Menace.  Not so Attack of Clones, it had everything - The humor, the action, the special effects, the dramatic plot, the immense sets with thousands of extras, etc. Star Wars fans, go see it as soon as possible.

Author: mm74md
Review_Title: Ignore The Critics - Go Watch And Enjoy
Review: It was exciting from start to finish.  Being in my late 20's I grew up with the original trilogy.  This movie made me feel like a kid again.  I'm going to get me some AOTC action figures!

Author: Kw1373
Review: I would classify myself an enthusiast when it comes to Star Wars.  I read 2 reviews on IMDB before seeing it.  The 2 reviews said this was much better than Phantom Menace (PM).  I quite enjoyed PM and gave it 7/10 (therefore still a disappointment when it comes to legend that is Star Wars).  The prospect of seeing something better got me very excited.

Author: voidfox-25393
Review: Let's be real.

Author: harvey_osullivan
Review: Well this is better than the Phantom Menace, but then again anything would be better than that.

Author: Mulee
Review_Title: Finally there is balance on the force!
Review: YES! Star Wars is BACK!

Author: ntam
Review: Special effects, background, action scene, music are all 10/10. But story, acting, dialogue are disappointing, giving me hard time to live through the non-action part. The two young actors tried hard but they just could not bring out the emotion level.
