Perhaps because I am not a true StarWars fan, I just don't feel the movie entertaining, except the last half hour. 6.5/10

Author: MotownMan
Review: Okay, so there are lot of nuts out there who think George Lucas is God and this new Star Wars trilogy is, quite literally, the second coming.  Putting that aside, Attack of the Clones is a truly entertaining movie that has all of the elements of a great sci-fi flick. More than that, it is a great Star Wars movie, definitely better than Phantom Menace, and I thought more enjoyable than Return of the Jedi.  From the battle scenes to a look at both the dark and romantic sides of Anakin Skywalker, this movie seems to fulfill all expectations.  When the movie ended, I was ready for it to continue on to Episode 3!  Arghhhh, 3 more years!!!

Author: Omega101
Review_Title: Exciting and dull at the same time
Review: I'll be brief, the movie is a hit and a miss.  The actions sequences are some of the best action I've ever seen on film, but the dialogue is frightfully dull.  The love scenes in particular could have been so much more, and perhaps the development could have been given to a more experienced writer.

Author: Tom-5673
Review: There are so many comments already on this film that I wouldn't normally bother myself, and I'm sure someone else has put it better, but I felt I had to throw my opinion in on such a heatedly argued topic. I loved this film!  After the Phantom Menace, I really didn't have high expectations for this film, so I was just blown away.  If you've seen it you'll know what I mean when I say the red and blue lit shots in the climatic finale are too cool, even more powerful than the duel in the Empire Strikes Back.  Obviously, people watch films for different reasons. Judging by the other comments, a lot of people have different reasons to me, but if you want a couple of hours of escapism, to be transported to a magical other place that could only ever exist on a cinema screen, you'll love it too.

Author: matthewjschelle
Review: George Lucas had devoted a large chunk of his life to the biggest ever family epic ever filmed. In turn, he has made enough money to live without ever having to really THINK about money. But this Episode of the Star Wars saga has a different tone to it then all the others. In the original trilogy, Lucas handed over the directorial reigns because of the difficulty he didnt not wish to repeat when Star Wars was made. With this prequel trilogy, the first film was seen as part galant attempt to prepare the balances for the characters to come but as some critics would easily let you know, to 'cash in' on the box office star wars madness. But Attack Of The Clones, despite the slightly silly nature of the title, delivers in less the money making sense, and more in the character driven sense. Each character in this movie has two sides. Padme Amidala is both leader and fragile lady, Anakin is both destined for greatness and confusion and obviously Palpatine is not all he seems. It was a shame the character of Count Dooku did not appear in the first film to add some consistency, but never the less, Lee is at his best, firmly set in stone once again. As an admirer of the works of Alec Guiness, I incredibly enjoyed Ewan McGregor portrayal of the young mentor of Anakin. With this saga, we watch Obi-Wan turn from learner, to young (and weakened) teacher, to hero, to wise old sage and then immortal (of sorts). It is easy to see how Lucas will turn Obi Wan in too the great character portrayed by Guiness in Episode IV. With Luke, he tries not to make the same mistakes twice. Its a shame the third movie will have to cover so much ground (the Jedi Purge, Windu's death, the hiding of the twins) and mostly likely have a time jump in the middle. And although Lucas has already filmed the ending of this prequel series in Tunisia, one can only hope that this set of films can stand by themselves, not as a prologue to the events of Luke's life, but as a moral message, which shows a somewhat innocent fall into corruption, so that his son can redeem him. Epic stuff.

Author: Chutzpah-1
Review_Title: Really good fun sci-fi movie with priceless entertainment value.
Review: Absolutely thrilling Episode of Star Wars, a few good funny jokes and amazing action sequences.  There's great lightsaber duels.  I think that people who are complaining about the acting and dialogue are missing the point entirely as Star Wars has never been about plot or dialogue.

Author: scantan
Review_Title: Some nice ideas, but very badly executed.
Review: Attack of the Clones starts out as all Star Wars movies should, in full on action mode. The first twenty minutes of the movie are a thrill ride that has you thinking, great, Lucas has recaptured what he did so well in the first three movies. Then, the engine of the movie sputters and dies in a slow monotonous drone of politics and romance. The movie drags for the next hour and a half until the end, at which stage I had given up hope.

Author: fstinz_23
Review: This movie far exceeded my expectations. Hayden Christensen is perfect as the tormented Anakin. Yoda was the coolest, everybody cheered when he lit up that lightsaber. Ewen Mcgregor was great and Natalie Portman is just beautiful and exciting to watch.The comedy was strictly left to C-3P0 and R2-D2 like it should be and not to that other thing(can you believe he is a senator now.) The battle scenes were thrilling and of course the final lightsaber duels were great. If you didn't like this movie then you should get a life and stop complaining. No movie that Lucas makes today will compare to the original trilogy, ever. So just accept it for what it is today and stop complaining, because critics and fans will always find something wrong. Enjoy the movie and don't analyze it, its just fantasy anyway.

Author: Khs0988
Review_Title: I didn't like it at first, but now i like it
Review: There was no problem with the story. To be honest, the silly lines that people say didn't bother me that much. People say Hayden's acting is the worst, but not to me I think he expressed Anakin well, an impulsive teenager.

Author: Paul_from_Enumclaw
Review_Title: Can anyone save Lucas from himself?
Review: I gave this episode 5 stars, only because it was "Star Wars" and because it looked pretty cool.

Author: jwtrout
Review_Title: It's Great! See it for yourself!
Review: I saw "Star Wars: Episode II--Attack of the Clones" just a few hours ago and it was great!  It fits in well with the other "Star Wars" movies, which is as it should be.  The action scenes are exciting, the jokes are funny and the romantic scenes are nice.  It is about time we had a good romance in a "Star Wars" movie.  Yes, Han and Leia fell in love in "ESB" and "ROTJ" but we don't get the details of it like we do here. Yes, I will admit that "Episode II" could have been better in some ways, but it is GOOD ENOUGH and that is all that mattered to me.  Hurrah for "Star Wars!"

Author: dgslater
Review: The entire Star Wars saga is a fantastical and brilliantly imaginative concept, but, ironically, in the hands of its creator, the story is done a great injustice.  Unlike Episodes IV,V and VI, which benefited from both simplicity (Lucas couldn't go overboard in A New Hope) and outside influence (different directors amongst other input in V & VI), Episode II is beleaguered by Lucas's autocratic control of his creation. Plainly, Lucas is a bad storyteller. In Episode II, all the elements that made the first three films classics are there: the strong, and interconnecting themes of good and evil, the inventiveness  and most definitely the effects.  However, the merits of these elements are largely lost in Lucas's inability to use the power of images and the techniques of film to tell his tale.  He insults the audience by relying on unnecessary exposition, worsened by elementary dialogue, to carry his plot points, rather than letting a telling glance or a shadowy sneer do the work for him (e.g. Ankin/Amidala scene by fire or before they enter the coliseum, etc.).  This compounded with flat direction and poor editing, create an unbalanced film lacking in emotion. Unfortunately, when you get down to brass tacks, there are some outstanding scenes and imagery in this film that if reworked could have yielded a much more effective product.  I love Star Wars, and will probably give this film more credit than it deserves, as it helps close another chapter of a story that I feel so connected with, but I can't help but think that if this weren't part of the "Saga" I'd be p***ed I spent my 10 bucks to go see it.

Author: Laura_VanDerbooben
Review_Title: Go see it because its Star Wars (you'll need SOMETHING to talk about at work on Monday)
Review: Although the movie wasn't that bad....it wasn't that good either.  Like the empire strikes back, this movie was basicly a little filler until the next movie.  Although Yoda with a lightsaber is worth any price you pay to see the movie!!! GO YODA!!!!

Author: soccerguy578
Review_Title: How I know that this movie was awful...
Review: You know when you go into a movie expecting it to be bad? 9 out of 10 times, it's not as bad as you think. You end up surprised, because you've set your expectations so low that the movie is able to surprise you.

Author: soccerguy578
Review_Title: Unfortunately, this movie can't be unmade...
Review: It's Star Wars, so you have to go see it.

Author: eggman-1
Review: The Best Star Wars Ever! I want to see it again.  The special effects were incredible.  The fight scenes were intense, the story is a lot darker and there is a lot less Jar Jar.  The only down side is they recopied a lot of stuff from The Empire Strikes Back, but it was still incredible.  I gave it a 10!

Author: rogerspy-1
Review_Title: The Force Will Be With Us...ALWAYS!
Review: When I first say the trailer for Star Wars Episode II, I said to myself "I can't believe this will be a Funny Girl meets Independence Day". Although I loved each of these films I hated the idea of turning Star Wars into a romance with a little bit of action. But this trailer is by far one of the bests I've ever seen. It shows nothing on it. It doesn't let us know what the movie is about, it doesn't let us know anything about the characters...anything. Not like the trailer of AMERICAN PIE II where you can see the whole movie in 1minute and 35 seconds. With this I mean that the movie was a total surprise for me. Not only i loved it but it was also very emotional for me...watching Amidala hugging Anakin...and the music swells, and...I think this movie was made with "The" Star Wars magic, unlike EPISODE I, which was quite boring and quite intensive...4 wars at the same time...give the Force a break. With Episode II, Star Wars rise again, with great classic touches from the original episodes, to great new adventures and a great script in my opinion. I can't deny however how sad it was, for me at least. I think the best performance on the movie is Supreme Chancellor Palpatine, played by Ian McDiarmid. What I liked the most about the film is the scenes, moments, places and language that made me remind of the old movies. It was the greatest Dejá vu moment i have ever had in the silver screen. It was indeed an amazing movie. Now I know, the force will be with us...ALWAYS!

Author: MKS0420
Review: This was probably the worst SWs I've seen yet; the romantic angle was all wrong and made the movie seem forever and I personally fell asleep until my friend woke me up as Yoda was fighting, now that was the best part of the movie I mean LOL, Lucas made that scene one of the most memorable parts of SW ever.

Author: lololwut
Review: I expected so much more from this movie, and this is what I get...a confusing plot. The biggest question here is:"Who is Jedi Master Sifodius (is that how you spell his name?)?????" It seems he created the whole plot of this movie. And so the Death Star was invented by Count Dooku? And this still doesn't explain the history of Darth Maul.

Author: pepelipep
Review: If it wasn't for the fact that this is a Star Wars film, this would have been one of the worse films I've seen in the cinema (the worse one is "The book that wrote itself").

Author: bunkerforever
Review_Title: Maybe the best of the series.
Review: After seeing it twice I can honestly say that "Attack of the Clones" might be the best Star Wars film to date.  It's at the very least just as good as Empire Strikes Back which up to now was hands down my favorite Star Wars film.

Author: rob_terminatorbestfilmin80s
Review_Title: This is the best starwars film ever? Not!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Review: This is the best starwars film ever? Not!!!!!!!!!!!!

Author: rob_terminatorbestfilmin80s
Review_Title: This is the best starwars film ever?Not!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Review: This is the best starwars film ever? Not!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Author: immortalist
Review_Title: Episode II: A First For STAR WARS in Many Ways.
Review: Episode II has shown us "Battling Jedi". Sounds like stuff we've seen before, huh? NOT LIKE THIS! For the 1st time hundreds of Jedi fight enemy droids, It's not your normal 1 on 1 Jedi encounter, It's something we have NEVER seen. The Battles don't stop there, Yoda Gets into it with Dooku using an intimidating fighting style for the 1st time. Obi Wan & Anakin also have their share of action with Dooku in which Skywalker uses two sabers for the 1st time. The story is Very well told, and Hayden portrays Anikin much like Luke: impatient. Anakin's start of falling to the dark side is evident when he kills a group of Sand People. This is the Jedi epoch & it shows their greatness as a whole. This Film Brings A Grander scope to STAR WARS & it's History.

Author: ChrisHenry
Review: Star wars is back to it's best with Episode 2, there is more action including loads more lightsabre fights (even Yoda has one, and boy does he kick ass for an ancient midget)and it starts right away rather than us having to sit through hours of political nonsense like in Episode 1.  More interesting things go on in the plot with more new characters where we find much more about them.  The whole thing is just pure unadultarated fun where we're reminded why we love these films because of their classic sub-genre of The Good Vs The Evil.  Hats off to you Mr Lucas!

Author: louise_is_goldilockz
Review_Title: not as good as the others
Review: it is an ok film, some of the action sequences are amazing, its the dialogue that isnt up to much, Obi wan comes across as very patronising towards anakin who in turn has a few awkward lines to Padme. apart from the action sequences Hayden Christensen manages to show Anakins journey towards the dark side very well, the part where his mother dies was excellently done, it is definately worth seeing, but not as good as the other episodes

Author: dkeeley
Review: Episode I was hyped so much it took people a little while to come back down to earth and realise it disappointed them.  Fortunately George Lucas either learned from his mistakes or had some grand plan from the start because almost everything that was wrong with Episode I (plot, direction, subtext, characters) is addressed here.

Author: skye wingfield
Review_Title: "The Force is strong with this one."
Review: Well, I've seen it twice now and even though I didn't enjoy it as much the second time it is a far better film than the extremely disappointing Phantom Menace and bodes well for Episode III.

Author: scott_murray1
Review: First off, let me just say this.  To all those high and mighty 'critics' out there who deconstruct every aspect of George Lucas' work - why??????  This film is George Lucas' creation, his world, his characters, his story, and if you don't like it because it is stunningly produced, entertaining, fun and appealing to all ages, go and watch Monsoon Wedding or Memento.  Stop expecting a mythical film series whose creator said was aimed at (wait for this) 12 year olds, to twist your brain around like a sponge with its dark-hued complexities and have dialogue that is hard for young people to understand. Hail George Lucas!

Author: nbstryker
Review: Fantastic sound, awesome character development.  I feel as though this is the movie that will tie both trilogies together.

Author: bios303
Review: Here's my concise review of Star Wars II: Attack of the Clones --

Author: scratch76
Review: well still no classic starwars movie, but much better than ep 1. characters looked nice (almost all of em aged well) and special effects were cool.

Author: kevinpicton
Review: Welcome back Uncle George.

Author: magoodfellow
Review: I was just six years old when the first "Star Wars" came out.  Didn't really understand the whole concept of sequels and such and "Episode IV: A New Hope" totally confused me at the time.

Author: xmullet
Review: (*SMALL* SPOILERS)

Author: rangermanlv
Review_Title: The Greatest Space Saga in the Universe Continues......
Review: This movie is absolutely awesome. The special effects are excellent and the continuation of the story seems much deeper and meaningful this time around. Seeing the developing life of Anikin kept me rivited for the whole movie. I loved it. :)

Author: TDI
Review: Star Wars: Episode II- Attack of the Clones gets the Star Wars franchise back on track after the lackluster Episode I. Gone are the horrid kiddy jokes and Jar-Jar (well for the most part) and back is the engrossing Star Wars saga.

Author: Yooda2004
Review_Title: Not as bad as Episode I but still...
Review: Ok, I saw it.

Author: Count_Dooku
Review_Title: Good to middling film until Yoda comes in
Review: This movie was a fairly typical Star Wars effort. I thought Phantom Menace had several things wrong with: 1 Jar-Jar Binks, i know lots of people like him, but i dont. 2 That guy who played Anakin, wanted to kill him and his whining voice 3 Fairly 1 dimensional acting by really good actors This movie might seem dodgy beacuse of its fairly random title, but is a vast improvement on the last one, as a result of eliminating all the poor qualities listed above. If you are sitting, watching this movie, and thinking about leaving, just hang around until the Yoda/Count Dooku lightsabre battle: its worth the wait. Until next time, HAPPY VIEWING :-) Count Dooku

Author: SideShowBob
Review: The first 45 minutes of this film were horrendous, but then it started to improve.  Yet I still left the theatre feeling disappointed.  I know it has been almost 30 years since the original films were made, and that he has to appeal both to die hard star wars fans and also a whole new audience, but I think he failed on both parts.  The dialogue was dire, the casting of Annakin Skywalker was all wrong (How can anyone believe that this 'pretty boy' could ever become Darth Vader'?) and the love story seemed overdone (running through the fields etc).  In some cases more is less.  Special effects are OK if used to enhance a film.  Lucas uses them to try to distract the audience to how weak this film really is.

Author: CyberFireFox
Review_Title: The Force is Back in the house
Review: Well I am a person of few words so i keep this short and to the point ok folks.  If you seen all the Star Wars movies to-date and was put off with the disappointment but never the less good Star Wars Episode I but not excellent. Then go see episode II because fear not this film live up to original Star Wars movies and is so so much superior than episode I but on the other hand if you never watch star wars before (if this is true where have you been for last 3 ½ decades hey) then I would still say go see this film as by it own right it is an excellent movie for all to watch. This movie has little better for every weather you are an action, sci-fi, Drama and Romance etc kind of person this film has it and mixes them perfectly into the movie. So go pictures get a ticket, gets the pop corn site down with a friend, girlfriend or boyfriend and watch an excellent movie.

Author: mblount540
Review_Title: A formula movie, but it is a billion dollar formula.
Review: George Lucas has used the last quarter century to perfect the formula for the most successful franchise in film history. All the elements are present in just the right amounts to give a good two and a half hour diversion that lives up to past "Star Wars" installments. The performances are competent and adequate for the genre, but the villain turn delivered by eighty year old Christopher Lee was showy and over the top and very fun to watch. The music by old pro John Williams was familiar and contributed to the sense of sitting down with an old friend and covering familiar territory. In total a good movie, not a great movie; but one that delivers everything promised.

Author: welsh_freak
Review_Title: Good, but not the best Star Wars ever
Review: OK, so it's smashed the box office, even next to Spiderman. That's got to be worth something, right? Well, Star Wars films have always smashed the box office. Most of you (like me) probably only went to see it to find out why Anakin becomes Darth Vader. But, yet another episode went by without fully answering this.

Author: arkiver-1
Review: I'll say up front that I hated Episode I.  And after that fiasco, have come to the conclusion that I really don't care for what Lucas has done with the Special Editions either.  That being said, I think Episode II couldn't help but be better than Ep. I.  And it is.  But once again, this movie suffers from Lucas' weaknesses as a director and a writer.  The plot is still overly convoluted, filled with horrible dialogue and contrived situations.  The characters are wooden and for the most part unlikeable.  I thought all of actors did a decent job with bad parts and bad directing, but none of it made me care.

Author: JaMiE_56
Review: i really was never into the STARWARS movies becuz they never really interested me but this movie really shocked me....i wasnt originally going to see this movie, i bought tickets to see SPIDERMAN with my friend but saw our other 2 friends going to STARWARS. they wanted us to go see that so we went in. boy am i glad i went becuz i really enjoyed this movie....much more then i had expected. i highly recommend this movie. its a great adventure......

Author: Chickenhawk2002
Review: After The Farcical Menace, I approached this film with some trepidation, but it is Star Wars for god' sake!

Author: bfreeman_1
Review_Title: A good edit would make this a great film.
Review: I'm not Trekkie, not a Star Wars groupie, so some might not like the truth. "Clones" is a good movie. Out of the box, it moves and moves fast. Yet there is something that slows down this long movie..love scenes. We all now know that Lucas has to join many parts to equal the whole and bring us closer to episode IV, but it comes at the cost of slowing down "Clones" to pace that had many squirming in their seats. Long shots of waterfalls, the future Darth Vader in a field of flowers..come on. The positive side, there is plenty of action, a chance, thanks for newer technology (from that of 1978) of seeing Yoda battle and lead and some pretty neat battle scenes. George, you've got one more chance with III. Or do you want to tell us all about the other secret "Star Wars" project????

Author: Qtip007
Review_Title: Everything I wanted it to be and more....
Review: ...This movie not only lived up to my expectations but also exceeded them. I did not enjoy TPM all that much, but it did have one good fight scene towards the end (duel of the fates). This movie had the fight scenes sprinkled out throughout the film like it should have, and the last forty minutes just had me at the edge of my freakin seat. I will not ruin it for anyone... ...but I have to say that when Yoda steps from out of the corner and stares down dooku... ...I HAD THE BEST FREAKIN STAR WARS EXPERIENCE OF MY ENTIRE LIFE!!!

Author: scottymcgeester
Review_Title: I watched this movie on Halloween with my friends because it's a true "Horror Film"
Review: Really, it is.

Author: HalifaxMovie
Review_Title: Better then EP1, but still just mediocre
Review: At least Jar-Jar is only in it for like 5 minutes.  Alright movie, better then EP1, but still bland.  Some neat little bits that show how some things came about in EP4.  I think EP3 will be the best of the first trilogy.  At least its improving as it goes along!

Author: tiago-anadutra
Review: The main problem is that the world and some aliens don't look real, actually that's the problem with this new trilogy, things need to seam old, dusty and broken to be believable, that's why the old trilogy has a big character, we almost got absorbed by that world. The story of attack of the clone doesn't take us on a ride like the other star wars, some parts of the movie are dull not all is bad in this movie, some of the action is really entertaining, like obi-wan versus Jango Fett, plus we finally get to see Yoda fight. The score is perfect like it has always been, that's the one thing that keeps a high level in all six movies of star wars.

Author: romeo1216
Review: I was fortunate enough to be one of the first people outside the movie world to see this movie (Love special connections) and absolutely loved the movie! Spectacular jobs done by all the actors.  Natalie Portman was incredible, and because I don't want to give anything away, I'm just gonna say YODA ROCKS THE HOUSE!!  Star wars fan or not, I think anyone can enjoy this movie. I know I did.

Author: adamtheking
Review: SPOILERS ok this is not the best of the 5 so far but its a good film the 1st half hour is a bit borring but it does get better in this film it sees the birth of the clones in other words the storm tropers that was  in a new hope empiore strikes back and of corse return of the jedi it this film also sees anakin slowly getting towards the dark side he also falls in love for padama ammildla who is now a senete and of corse a jedi is not allowed to love the best part of the film has to be when master yoda take on dooko. dooko who is played by the legend chris lee all in all this is a good film good acting by everyone i think.

Author: cantthinkofanid
Review_Title: For a cartoon, not that bad. for a star wars movie...
Review: Does George Lucas really think that CG looks real? for most of the movie it looks like Ice Age, or Shrek (which are great movies),  but i think George wanted the audience to believe that what we were watching is real. if that's true, this was a failed experiment in CG. unless Lucas comes out and says that Ewan McGregor was really CG, i will continue to refuse that CG looks real. oh yeah, the dialog was trite, the story was awful, and Hayden Needs to stop whining if we're expected to believe that he's going to become the badest mother F#cker in the galaxy.

Author: p_dimako
Review_Title: Even worse than The Phantom Menace
Review: There are films that make Star Wars seem insignificant these days. The old trio are by far the best and the true classic, however the new films lack the imagination, fun and adventure. Yoda is made out to look like a flea jumping everywhere and Ewan McGregor's acting is absolutely attrocious. What makes matters worse is the sloppy romance between Padme and Anakin. This film is catered towards selling the toys, toothbrushes and shampoo kits rather and audience satisfaction. Highly dissapointing and very unreal visual effects.

Author: Magistrafamiliae
Review_Title: Should have been a silent film
Review: This is the worst movie I have ever sat all the way through. Had I not had been playing chaperone/chauffeur for the girls basketball team...I would have walked out of the theater. Gorgeous scenes, neat effects- and the most inane screenplay ever penned. Even a good actor like Ewan Mcgregor can't pull lines like, "This is why I hate flying", out of the cinematic toilet. I found myself thinking "Oh PLEASE don't say...", and the insipid line which had crossed my mind would be the next words spoken. It just was very distressing to know what was coming next, and that it was going to be bad. I think the visuals alone could have told the story. And it sure would have made it more tolerable if everyone could have kept their mouths shut. 1/2 out of 4

Author: Dark_gollum713
Review: Attack of the Clones... Wow what can I say about it. it is a complete waste of time. There are far too many special effects, some of them looking very fake on the final film(for example the final battle in the film some of the aliens the Jedi fight look like something out of a Saturday morning cartoon. This movie had a good story, but horrible and I repeat horrible dialog in it. I am a huge fan of the Star Wars films in general and I will be the first person to admit that all of the movies have some cheesy dialog, but none of the dialog in the old trilogy or the other 2 films in the prequel trilogy are as awkward or boring to watch as in Attack of the Clones. The dialog in the romantic scenes between Padme and Anakin should definitely been edited by someone other then George Lucas. This movie had promise but certain scenes such as the Yoda and Dooku fight are just ridiculous. Yoda suddenly running and jumping around out of nowhere was just stupid, especially after he had to use a cane in the movie and a half before it. The acting is also unbelievable, except for Ewan Mcgregor who acted as best as he could given the lines. Overall I gave the movie a 4/10. Unless you're in the mood for some cool fight sequences and are ready to bear the horrible dialog and acting avoid this movie.

Author: tarantura
Review_Title: My six year old sister's FAVORITE Star Wars episode
Review: Star Wars episode 2: Attack of the Clones is an awesome movie which continues 10 years after episode 1: Phantom Menace and a few years before episode 3: Revenge of the Sith. If you like Star Wars, then you'll love episode 2! There are great action scenes , forbidden love scenes , mystery , and a great storyline. I would recommend this movie to anyone who is a Star Wars fan and who has already seen episodes 4 , 5 , 6 ,& 1 in that order. This movie is great for kids(I'm 13) and adults of all ages but not very young children under the age of 4 (they might get scared). Even my 6 year old sister likes it, especially the ending. I gave this movie a 10 because it is well put together and it me laugh during certain scenes.

Author: mu97x
Review: Not good enough ..... but not very bad.. this episode like episode 1 boring and cold.

Author: dirkb
Review: Watched it this weekend on a rental, and boy am I glad that we didn't waste our theater dollars on this one. What acting school did the petulant punk that plays Anakin go to? If they were trying to make us dislike the Anakin character, then they are doing a fine job. Natalie Portman, oh what a mistake you have made attaching yourself to this series, it will set your career back. Ewan McGregor was good as Obi-Wan and Samuel L. was okay, although I kept expecting him to exclaim "But is this a righteous light-saber?". The effects were good, as well as the transfer and sound track. The plot was thin and several scenes were lifted from previous films. Not enough of Natalie in the bare-midriff outfit. I kept hoping that Jar Jar would be put out of our misery by catching an errant shot. What would this film have been like if James Cameron had directed it? The franchise continues its downhill slide.

Author: Tommy-20
Review_Title: Average Start, terrible middle and an incredible ending
Review: The movie starts with some nice racing scenes, not too bad but nothing you haven't seen before in "Blade Runner" or "The fifth Element". Then it seems to fall into a bottomless pit of boringness for about an hour!!! I don't know what George Lucas had in mind, when he blew the whole romance thing to a whole hour. Obviously it had to be in the movie because it belongs to the plot, but 10 minutes would have been more than enough! I read somewhere that the audience was laughing in some cinemas when they saw that "Heidi"-like love affair on Naboo. When I saw it, nobody was laughing! At first everybody seemed to wait patiently for the action to start up again, then the "BORING"-chants started and finally a lot of the people started to leave the cinema. Only those who couldn't believe George Lucas could make such a crap and who were still waiting for a good ending were rewarded with an incredible and furious final battle.

Author: sirakusai
Review: Take out Hayden Christensen from the movie and It becomes 10.

Author: harman-6
Review_Title: Finally! This movie had all that I missed in episode one.
Review: After seeing episode one I had pretty low expectations on this second episode, but after a bit slow introduction of the 'new' characters the movie really takes off and Gorge Lukas takes you for the ride of your life! The last part of the move is really breathtaking, the battle scenes has nothing more to wish for.

Author: falcon291
Review: It is hard to write a movie you know how will it be going, and how will end. The future has seen before, now past must be created. To judge the movie, so it is better to look at the details. The movie is good, better than the first one of the new series. Digital effect which is the driven force of the details are brighter than any recent movies, and past movies are far away to be taken into account as you can see. So I have given it a 9, if I don't know how the whole story will end, I will most possibly give it a 10.

Author: Iolair
Review: Watching this film is like being back at the start again. From the cheezy one-liners to the incredible battle sequences, this film just smacks of quality.

Author: Spirit-10
Review: Well,the wait is over.I've finally seen Attack Of The Clones.Did I expect anything? No,not after the flop of The Phantom Menace.But this time both dramatisation and visual effects are superior to the previous episode.The storyline is good and no one can badmouth about visual effects.Besides there are very good actors like Samuel L Jackson and Christopher Lee.Natalie Portman was good too.Thankfully,she didn't have to wear those horrific costumes for the most of the part.And Jar Jar's having a smaller part is a very good thing.Bad sides? Well, not much actually.I didn't like Ewan McGregor.I thought he was so reluctant playing this role.As for the dialogues,everyone knows that this movie is not about dialogues or drama.Forget about the critics, just have your popcorn and enjoy the movie!

Author: Dve
Review_Title: Star Wars Act II followed by....3 year Intermission. Please stay in your seats
Review: While many of us would like to forget about The Phantom Menace, there are some, such as yours truly, who feels it to be a neccesary evil, a small scene situated in a massive play.  Attack of the Clones thankfully stays away from its predecessor's sophomoric formula (namely Jar-Jar) and focuses on a more tightly knit story.  While it is in no way Citizen Kane, Attack of the Clones does harken back to the roots of the old trilogy.  Some can compare it to The Empire Strikes Back, however I am sure Episode III will be the darkest of them all.  This film does have it share of cheesy romance, poor acting and even poorer dialogue.  But just think about it.  Who sees a Star Wars film for that anyway.  Give me a cool chase, lots of blaster fire and whole lotta lightsaber dueling and you got yourself one happy camper. If Episode III plays out the way it should, when we all look back in the end people will come to realize that the prequels did their job and did it well

Author: geezer-4
Review: Attack of the Clones is an excellent movie, and is far superior to Phantom Menace (which is still a good movie). It is more fun than Episode 1, has a faster pace, has a more interesting plot, and less Jar-Jar. This is a visually stunning film (it didn't hurt to see it in a digital theater). The action scenes are fantastic, and it was nice to see Mace Windu and Yoda receive more screen time; the audience cheered every time they were onscreen at the end of the movie. Hints of dark things to come kept popping up throughout the film, which added to the fun. The film has its flaws. It is a little slower at the beginning of the movie, and the dialogue IS a bit flat or corny at times, but that is something one hears in all of the Star Wars movies. I will have to watch the film again, but after the initial viewing I feel that this film ranks up there with the original trilogy, and I can't wait to see it again.

Author: halo80
Review: Getting back to basics with a 21st century flavour never tasted better. Attack of the Clones rises far above The Phantom Menace.  Why?  A great script, good characters, lots of action and that all powerful force in many Star Wars movies: a sense of wonder.  This is truly what Star Wars is all about.

Author: JR-79
Review_Title: One of the Best SW Films
Review: Go see it.  There are plenty of people that will say it's a flop simply because that's what they want to say.  However this movie is really good. Plenty of action.

Author: reenie8
Review_Title: Slightly Flawed but still a Force to be reckoned with!
Review: I won't go into plot details here. I have only 2 problems with Episode II. While I think Hayden Christensen does a great job, his character was written with a bit too much petulance for me. If his personality was a little more Hans Solo and a little bit less Luke, I could have seen Padme falling for him.

Author: ackbaar
Review_Title: Freedom of speech should be banned!! (In the case of "Star Wars", don't get me wrong)
Review: I think when it comes to any of the "Star Wars" episodes, anyone who doesn't consider himself to be "Star Wars" fan, shouldn't be given the freedom of expression because they will eventually analyze it as a regular movie just like any of the other ones that come out every week. Listen people, star wars in "not" a movie. What it is is, in itself, a legendary universe which requires its fans to revolve around all of its aspects including the movies, the books, the comic books etc... For example I am a "huge" film buff who just graduated from four years of studying film theory but when people ask me what my favorite movies are, I never include star wars on that list because I look at it as a different hobby and not just a string of movies and so do the rest of the star wars fans. So if you look at attack of the clones as a single movie you go see on your free time as a non- star wars fan, of course you won't like it, and nobody said you should like it so shut the f--- up!!!!

Author: EduGator
Review_Title: Thousands of computer-generated foes don't scare me?
Review: We went, we saw, we ho-hummed. The visuals are terrific. They've always been that way. The story is two dimensional. The acting (or is it the directing) is one dimensional. Portman is gorgeous but has a greater ability than this film shows (see The Professional which she made when she was about 14.)Hayden Christensen is plastic. To utilize his good looks, I'd stick him in a boy band. Yoda does a better job, and he's digital.

Author: mattye
Review_Title: More like Attack of the Crap!
Review: The visuals were stunning as usual, but the incredibly weak dialogue puts Episode II at the bottom of my summer movie list.  What a HORRIBLE SCRIPT!!! I saw it just after Midnight on Thursday with a New York audience. Several people moaned and groaned through the awful dialogue, including me.  The next installment should be written by someone with talent.  Don't waste your money on this movie - wait until it airs on broadcast tv.

Author: NerfHerder44
Review: Attack of the Clones is a great movie. Yes, it is easy to "attack" some of the sub par acting and shoddy dialog, but people should not expect a Shakespearian drama, that is not what the purpose of these films is. It's supposed to be about entertainment. AOTC is terrific in that it draws up part of the story of a transformation of a good character to evil, while also telling the story of how a republic crumbles. The CG effects are terrific as is the spectacular battle on Geonosis. I hate to say it, but I think I may have liked it more than any of the other Episodes. Just AWESOME! Star Wars lovers, if you haven't already, go see this film!

Author: ArizonaGeek
Review: This will go down in history as one of the best films. Certainly as one of the better in the Star Wars films. This is a MUST SEE!! I dont want to give away too much since we have 4 days left before it opens, but I will say that if you hated Jar-Jar in the first one you will REALLY hate him in this one. Stunning performances all around and the effects are even better!

Author: max-172
Review_Title: Puts you back into the universe.
Review: Great filmmaking.Ewan really owns the part and the music by John Williams is terrific. Its nice to be so reconnected to the Star Wars Universe and this film is truly a saving grace. I am very hopeful that the next film will be something very special.It is after all the ending in Georges dyslexic yet dynamic universe.

Author: TerraFed
Review_Title: Better than TPM and Jedi, almost as good as Empire
Review: This movie succeeds in every way that The Phantom Menance failed.  The story is more cohesive and compelling and the performances are uniformly better (Samuel L. Jackson especially redeems himself after his terrible cameo in episode 1).

Author: jlawc
Review_Title: Gets better the more you watch it!
Review: I have seen this movie twice already and I have to say it gets better each time. I was very disappointed with Episode 1 so my expectations were low for Episode 2.

Author: arttext
Review_Title: How Anakin is becoming Darth Vader
Review: The yet to come Darth Vader is growing inside Anakin Skywalker SPOILERS This one is more of the same. Of course great effects etc. But they can be seen on any screen in your neighborhood movie theatre. The only thing that is really interesting, after episode 1 we all wondered how nice little Anakin could eventually have become Darth Vader, the father of Luke Skywalker (know your history) is his character development. This Anakin is in his late puberty and  acts like all pubers do. He is an impatient "know it all" and thinks he is unrightfully denied the Jedi final exam (yet). Besides all that, his love for (former) queen now senator Amadilla stays unanswered, even more, after one burning kiss he is repeatedly turned down. So he gets frustrated and annoyed. So far not much more then a normal teen phase we all have gone through or will. Then Lucas introduces, out of the blue, the captured and dying mother of Anakin. In a dream it came to him and he's going to rescue her, alas with no success at all. "I miss you so much" he says after her death. Which is quite unlikely since he hasn't seen her for about ten years or so. But Lucas must have been in great need of an explanation why Anakin eventually turned over to the dark side and into Darth Vader, besides Anakins' teen angst. And there it is: Hatred! As we learned from earlier episodes, hate is what draws a Jedi Knight to the dark side. Mothers die and loves are turned down but it didn't turn me to the Dark side. So may be in Episode III it'll all become crystal clear. But I'm afraid George Lucas will have a hell of a job to make that final turn acceptable. And the rest of the story, well the usual stuff, political plots, traitors in high places and massive attacks near the end. Why do I still go to these Star War movies? Well, I can't help myself, as so many of you. See you around in two years!

Author: Dalif
Review_Title: No mistakes this time. Pure pleasure
Review: As a die hard fan of Star Wars, I was one of the, I guess, few who really liked Ep. 1 (yes I even liked Jar Jar (although not as much)). And not just because I am a die hard fan. I liked it because of a lot of things. But the general opinion was that it wasn't really that great. So I was really nervous about Ep. 2 because I knew that if it also weren't really great enough, the public opinion about SW would decrease drastically.

Author: htodd
Review: OK, so it wasn't as bad as Episode I, but what is? I can't believe all the things that sucked. The color. The dialogue. The pacing. The confused story. The non-acting.

Author: Macca-14
Review_Title: Attack of the Clones Drones on and on
Review: I expected great things from this movie.  Episode I had been slated and George Lucas has had three years to put the Star Wars express back on the rails.

Author: Arator
Review: This movie was soo bad. Anakin is such a bad actor that it is really unbelievable how such a guy made it into the cast for SW. And the dialogs....AAAAHHHHH!!! Who wrote these dialogs. George please stop it. And the lovestory in this movie. If I wanna see a lovestory I watch Pretty woman and I hate it, but I don't want this crap in a Star Wars movie. Everyone in the cinema laughed when Anakin and Amidala are sitting together and discussing how impossible a future together would be. And sad but true the directing of this movie was bad. I love you George and your movies, but this time the directing was bad. So many mistakes. The most stupid scene is when Amidala is lying in the sand after she fell out of the ship and she makes noises of pain and this clonewarrior is asking if she's allright and suddenly she stops with her pain yammering and stands up and says " Yes". Tarraaaa!!!! Aarrgghh!! Sorry but this is not Star Wars anymore :-(

Author: edskee
Review_Title: Pretty decent, better than I expected
Review: I read a bunch of reviews from critics and users here on imdb.com, and thought the movie was gonna stink. Well... it was much better than I thought it'd be. Yes, 70% of the dialogue sucked and could have been better written by... well... almost anyone. A lot of the acting was wooden and "I dont care just give me my paycheck." Some of the CGI was REALLY bad and fake looking. ALL the romance scenes were either cliche, cheezy, or just plain... oh man... just BAD. Lucas should stay far far away from romance.

Author: MasterYoda
Review: AOTC is a GREAT movie. In fact, the more I watch it the better it gets. The FX are breathtaking, the acting is contextually solid, and the story is a thrill ride that solidly binds together four other episodes and advances the entire saga. I am a Star Wars fan. I loved it since it originally came out in 1977. The critics didn't like it then either. Urg! Now many do...!?

Author: brixtonfan
Review: This is just a very average sci-fi film that gets too much publicity.  It gets hyped up to no end but the film really isn't very good.  The only reason this film gets rated so high is because of the fanatics that this series has.  I don't understand it at all.  Oh well, I think I'll go watch a good sci-fi movie like Alien.

Author: itsruf
Review: I really wanted to like it, but I just couldn't. The story was OK, but the directing was bad.

Author: logan6400
Review_Title: Possibly the best Star Wars film.
Review: I watched this movie at 6 in the morning, GMT (10 where I live) and it was amazing. I'm not going to spoil the story, but I just want to say that I loved this movie. I didn't hate the Phantom Menace (I enjoyed watching Darth Maul and the lightsabre fights) but it was not as good as the first two Star Wars movies. But Attack of the Clones is amazing.

Author: cofbaron
Review_Title: Not as bad as Phantom, but not as good as Empire...
Review: ...Empire being my favorite of the original trilogy, and remaining my favorite. There has been talk of AotC being the "Empire" of the first trilogy, but this simply isn't true. I'm not going to spoil anything when I say that the dialogue is wooden, the acting stiff, the romance unbelievable, and the jokes are often moronic and inappropriate. All this weighs heavily upon the viewer for the majority of the first two hours of the movie.

Author: BenAnakin
Review: If Count Dooku is a Jedi who is sick of the corruption in the Senate, then I'm pretty sick of the mindless corruption of this once great series. Now we have Star Wars Episode II - ATTACK OF THE CARTOONS.

Author: turboman
Review_Title: Now Lucas knows why The Beatles never attempted a comeback.
Review: I'm so sorry.

Author: mendax66
Review_Title: Don't forget your gas mask--it's a stinker
Review: "The Phantom Menace" was not a very good movie but it has grown on me in the last couple years.  "Attack of the Clones", however, is so bad it is ridiculous.  I did not go to the theater to see a comedy but the lines between Padme and Anakin we so awful that people in the theater were laughing out loud.  Fortunately, I had a bag of popcorn to barf in just in case.

Author: nayadonis
Review: unbelievable, such cynical people. i don't listen to critics, i've been to film school myself and film students are snobs, critics are just hybrid snobs. I realize it's a generalization, but it's an accurate one. just remember that those who can- do, those who can't- just gripe... Critics are often completely inept of a creative drop of blood in their body, and yet they so freely critique the creative work of others. They're failed screenplay writers in alot of cases, and failed film makers in other cases. Yet, we listen to them? why?- Would we ask a high school drop-out to take the bar exam? Think about it, was anyone honestly blown away by A Beautiful Mind? - The critics' pick for this year's best picture; a decent movie, but unoriginal and stupid. Russell Crow would have done a pretty good job- if his character had turrets, because his nervous impulses weren't indicative of schizophrenia (which was what his character really suffered from). Film is art, which infers creativity and yet one of the most creative films that we will likely see this year is slammed, why? A man with money and influence tries to do something to advance his profession into the 21st century so they're not using ancient methods of filming. His methods would allow for longer lasting and better quality film. Yet, he is condemned for this, why? Film is entertainment 1st and foremost, and George Lucas has made movie-going into an event again with the Star Wars series. Yet, he is trashed for this as well, why? Is it jealousy? Are those who "can't do" jealous of the one who so obviously can? Perhaps that's too simple an answer. Don't make the movie going experience into something it's not, there's no need for such pretension. No one should let critics b.s. them into believing that a grainy film which is long and boring is worth the 10 bucks over Episode 2, which is built for the soul purpose of entertaining. In the end all that critics are doing is giving opinions and opinions are subjective. I am sure many films are better examples than Star Wars of aesthetically perfect movies, but it doesn't matter because movie making is about one thing, the audience. Not the reviews. Critics are not the final word on movies as much as they might like to believe they are, the box office has proven this fact time and again. I've seen Episode 2 and it was a truly amazing experience, the electricity in the room was like a rock concert, the effects were wild and fast, the story was good and I walked out with a smile on my face and a heart beating fast. That's MY opinion. It's fun to go to the movies again, let's keep it that way.

Author: -Cinemaster-
Review: In a word, this second of the Star Wars prequels is 'awful'. If you're one of the fans who felt severely let down by The Phantom Menace, then this installment of the Star Wars saga isn't likely to ease your pain.

Author: nefarious888
Review: Like many of you who are Star Wars fans, I was eagerly anticipating Episode II and had hoped that it would be as good, if not better, than Episode I.  The trailers looked awesome and the story line sounded great. Romance, action, suspense, thrills, lightsabers, Sam Jackson kickin' major butt!  What's not to like about it.  Well, I'll tell you.  The action was plentiful, but contrived since it all looked animated.  In fact, most of the movie was animated and it really gave the film a fake look.  Even the best CGI in the world couldn't make this film look realistic.  The romance seemed kind of silly and forced.  This is a minor flaw because if those two love birds didn't get together, then the whole Star Wars thing wouldn't exist anyway.  But, maybe George should have noticed how badly Hayden handled the romantic subplot and could have found somebody better.  I will say Mr. Christensen could look pretty pissed off when he wanted to and I believed he could be the future Darth.  I guess if he had better dialogue to work with, then the romance would have clicked.  The suspense in the film diminished pretty close to the beginning of the film after I realized there really wasn't anyone I cared about in this movie.  The thrilling parts of the movie were not really thrilling because I could not believe anything that anyone did.  Why do Jedi's stop jumping high and flying in the later episodes? Oh, yeah, no CGI.  The lightsaber battles in this film were simply a disapointment.  Yeah, I know about Yoda and that was funny to watch, but much of the lightsaber battles in the film were camera closeups of the actors face's and I don't want to see actor's faces in a lightsaber battle, I want to see the fight.  Darth Maul and Obi-Wan in Ep. I had a pretty good battle with stunts and acrobatics which this movie just lacked.  Sam Jackson seemed wasted in this film as he was in Ep. I.  At least he looked like he was having a good time, because I know I wasn't.

Author: zeno303
Review_Title: Empty & Boring Love Story with Great SFX
Review: The Love Story subplot is badly written, poorly acted, too long, tedious and boring.  It seems that Lucas can no longer cast, write for, or direct young actors,. The very talented Ms. Portman is only marginally effective in Clones, IMO, through no fault of her own.  There is only so much a young actor can do with such extended wooden dialogue and aimless direction. Hayden Christensen, OTH, transcends the merely mediocre material to be truly awful in his own right.  It's like the stiff child actor who played little Anakan in Phantom has grown up to be an equally untalented teen actor.  None of the strength, power, charisma, dark humor, or nacent malevolence of the future Darth Vadar come through in any way. Instead, we get shallow teen idol mouthing and grimacing his way through the part, reminicent of the days when studios used to cast teen rock stars in movies without regard for their acting ability --if any. I did not believe Mr. Christensen's Anakan for one second. Instead of Darth Vadar trapped inside a teen, I am seeing a spoiled 10 year old trapped in the body of an awkward 18 year old. Believe it or not, there are numerous young male actors who can really act & help give some life to such a flat script. Lucas either no longer knows young talent when he sees it, or does not care as long as they "look the part."  Mark Hamill comes across like a trained Shakespearean actor compared to Hayden Christensen. Worse, these two "lovers" are on screen declaiming there love (and filling in back story trivia) for extended periods of time, causing virtually everyone in the theater to start twitching and moving tiredly in their seats  -- including the young girls that such chick material must have been aimed at. Lucas has too much control of this material for his own good. Much of this tedious pap could and should have been edited out without harming the story at all.  (Remember how short and sweet the love interest was kept in the first Trilogy?  What happened to that restraint?)  Dare I say it, Lucas is starting to remind me of Kevin Costner, who can't bring himself to cut anything either after he has shot it. OTH, the action scenes, costumes, and digital sets are remarkable and well worth the price of admission, and (other than Christopher Lee's always memorable turns) are just about the only real reason to see this flick, unless you are into memorizing the latest Star Wars trivia,

Author: kjg-2
Review: That really was something else. I went into the cinema with low expectations after the Phantom Menace  but I was over the moon with Episode 2.

Author: raging bull
Review_Title: This is not only the best Star Wars movie but also one of the best sci-fi films to have been made
Review: George Lucas has made a breathtaking film that will easily rank as one of the better Star Wars movies. I watched in awe at the beautiful images in Attack of the Clones. And Yoda's fight scene??? It was simply amazing. I do not have enough praise for this. . It leaves you wanting more. A definite 10/10

Author: gungan666
Review: Lucas has redeemed himself big after a somewhat dissapointing but still enjoyable episode 1.  This movie totally brings back the original spirit that made the original holy trilogy so great. There are many great scenes of action but the absolute best scene is where Anakin is chasing after Jango Fett's assassin.  This sequence blew me away and i loved it.  Get ready for some really cool Yoda fighitng and buckle in for this kickin ride!!!!!!

Author: srok82
Review: Well here we are again with another good, no I'll rephrase that, the best Star Wars film made yet. This film has it all but I have to admit there were a couple of minor flaws but I won't hold that against this film. This new chapter is far better than The Phantom Menace and in fact comparing clones to the first episode they are 2 completely different styled movies. Ewan McGregor and the rest of the cast lead a victory especially a certain Jedi Master to triumph over evil. I highly recommend this film to all ages unless you get traumatized after seeing aliens with more than one pair of arms then go see it.

Author: riatsila2
Review_Title: Great action stiff acting but Yoda saves the day!
Review: Inevitably comparisons will be made with Phantom Menace and I'm no exception!.Far better in scale and special effects than Menace,SWII is a welcome back to (sort of) good form for Lucas but he has really got to get a grip with the actors - or should I say wooden tops!

Author: bazclack
Review_Title: One of the all time greats.
Review: Having received an invite to a press screening, I am happy to report that the Star Wars saga is back on track. After the wobbly Phantom Menace, I can say hand on heart that Attack of the Clone is a good film. No, its great. The effects are amazing to say the least. Its has a story, you bond with the characters and its very well made. Towards the end of the film you begin to remember the first time you ever saw a Star Wars film, and it takes you back to then. The actors were, I'm sure, aware that they had to put 110% into the film and they do. Phantom was a big let down but, George, your forgiven. To qoute Austin Powers a couple of years ago, If you see one film this summer, make sure its Star Wars - Attack of the Clones.

Author: edge16
Review: the cold, inhuman feel of the phantom menace is finaly gone. for the last few years i thought about how lame starwars had become and how sad it was to see these movies fall short of the original trilogy.

Author: lapointe64
Review: This is it!  Star Wars with just the right mixture of darkness.  It's great. Fantastic.  Blade Runner on speed!

Author: cloud540
Review: I may not own a lightsaber, and I surely don't read the books, but this movie was the best I've ever seen.  This has an excellent mixture of romance, comedy, action, and mystery.  This has to be one of the best movies of all time.  It ROCKED!!!  I'll tell you that I experienced a true star wars experience when I saw the midnight show on 5/16.  There was a countdown, people laughed at all of the jokes, people cheered on the jedi. It was a true experience.  Critics who rate this film low have some problems with movies, and don't deserve the title "critic".   This great film gives all people a reason to watch.  If you don't see this movie, your missing out on something great.  Those who rate it low, well, they should be hit in the head with a light saber or something!

Author: Ronin1272
Review_Title: Another sad attempt by the burnt out Mr. Lucas...
Review: ...after seeing this, I will say it once again...

Author: fishymoto
Review_Title: May the Farce be with you
Review: I have enjoyed all of the Star Wars movies, but this one leaves much to be desired.  I was concerned when I heard Lucas say that he was not concerned with what the critics said about this movie, he was going to make his movie. I only wished he was concerned about the plot. It was too predictable and jumped all over the place.  I was waiting for the movie to end.  Too many special effects, not enough plot.  I only hope Lucas will remember that next movie.

Author: mikedlt
Review: Star Wars first captivated my soul back in 1977, when I was young Anakin's age of 9; you can imagine a young boy's anticipation of each and every sequel...I felt that same anticipation ever since I first heard of George Lucas' plan to release the trilogy of pre-quels to my all time favorite Star Wars films. While I did enjoy Episode I and watched it over and over again, my enjoyment came not necessarily from the film itself, but more from what it represented: a filling in of the gaps of what is Star Wars the saga. I must admit, some elements of Episode I were a disappointment (J.Binks & A.Skywalker), but overall I did appreciate the film. I hoped and prayed that the next film would redeem some of Episode I's weaknesses and after just having viewed the film for the first time on opening day at 12:01 am, I can say to you that I can't wait to add this film to my collection so that I may watch it over and over as well. In just over 12 hours, I will be viewing this film again and I can't wait! Natalie (Amidala), a stunning beauty, and Hayden (Anakin), a gorgeous young man, were perfectly cast in their roles; they definitely fit the look needed for episodes IV, V, and VI, and their acting is wonderful. I accept the gaps in the development of their relationship as necessary in order to keep the film under 2.5 hours; besides, anyone that has ever been in love can easily fill in all the details. My favorite part of this film has got to be seeing youthful, strong, properly trained Jedis in action! I was blown away by their skill and the wonderful cinematography. Now, I wait in anticipation of the final installment of the Star Wars Prequel Trilogy...And for that I thank you, George Lucas--for making me feel 9 once again!

Author: john-863
Review: As much as I hate to say it, this movie is terrible. Yes there are lots of whiz-bang effects, rich worlds, etc. etc. But in the beginning you must have a plot, and acting to make a movie. Towards the second half of the movie the acting improves a little, but in the first half it is very wooden. Ms. Portman in particular seems very amateurish (as a fan, it is difficult to be so candid). Her acting is much better in some of the deleted scenes, and her costumes more eye-catching.

Author: sspackma
Review: This movie is truly a dissapointment.  Some of the worst acting I've seen in a long time.  Lucas obviously wasn't looking to see if his characters were feeling the force.  Most of the scenes in the first half of the film look like the actors are reading their lines.  The actor who plays Anakin is terrible, and Portman looks like she's saying a line for the umteenth time. The action gets going in the last 45 or so minutes, but go to the concession stand for the first half, nothing really important really happens anyway.

Author: jlkramer-2
Review_Title: Lucas rediscovers his youth and heart
Review: Watching Star Wars- Episode II: Attack of the Clones, I felt as if George Lucas had gone through every single piece of hate mail he had recieved from Phantom Menace and made every effort to satisfy his disappointed fans in the next installment of his saga. Does he succeed? Without question, yes. The most frequently mentioned disappointments of Phantom Menace are as follows: Jar Jar Binks (need I say more about him?), wooden acting, wooden characters, confusing plots, the overall lack of adventure, and simply the fact that it didn't seem like a Star Wars film. I can only begin my critique of Attack of the Clones by saying it is a film that corrects the mistakes made in its predecessor. Jar Jar Binks is brilliantly written into this film. Lucas knows we hate Jar Jar. So he makes the characters feel the same way about him (i.e. Amidala shutting him up). Lucas also places Jar Jar at the heart of something terrible to come, which gives us reason to hate his stupidity even more. (But at least this time, it's a deliberate move by Lucas.) Now...many critics have destroyed and mamed this second episode. I, along with generally everyone I know who has seen the film, have no idea where these criticisms originate and why. What we know is that contrary to popular critics belief, the acting is not nearly as wooden as we've been made to believe it would be. Ewan McGregor has finally settled into the role of Obi-Wan Kenobi, as he conveys a true personality that is slowly and brilliantly molding into the likes of Alec Guiness. Also, Portman, although not incredibly versatile and outstandish in this film, does an adequate job as Senator Amidala. But the man of the hour (or should I say, 2 hours and 22 minutes) is Hayden Christensen. He shows a wide range of emotion as Anakin, and he grips us right from the beginning as the unstable Jedi who's fate we already know. We loathe his cockiness, we buy his romantic seduction, and we are simply in heart-pounding awe of his turn to anger. (Let's just be frank, that evil look of his is the coolest freaking thing on the screen.) Let me end with this. The adventure is back. THIS is the Star Wars we've been waiting for. Here is a film with a sense of comedy that we didn't see in Phantom Menace at all whatsoever. (R2-D2 and C-3PO have a wonderfully comedic and heartwarmingly developing relationship and Obi-Wan and others share clever one liners). Here is a film with a sense of drama and romantic conflict (Anakin is being torn between his love for Padme and his loveless committment to the Jedi order. He is truly feeling the angst we expected him to from Obi-Wan "holding him back".) Here is a film with a real sense of danger and loss. Here is a film that rivals with the first 3 installments of the Star Wars saga. I won't even go into the special effects and action sequences. We all know they're amazing and breath-taking. What I must say overall is that we finally have back that feeling of adventure we had from the original SW films. And throughout the film, we have incriments of ingenious musical score that bring us back to the soaring dark horns that give an overture to the reign of the Galactic Empire in the first three films. Episode II does more than just correct its prior installment's mistakes. It goes much further. Out of a possible 10, I grade this film a 9. (Phantom Menace was a 5, Empire was a 10.) I urge you...do not go dwell on the skepticism of critics. Go in with an opened mind, and low and behold, you may likely enjoy yourself.

Author: Flatline-10
Review_Title: If you did not like Episode 1, you won't like this.
Review: I'm tremednously disappointed. The chrome wrapped spaceships, all the grassy locations, the high contrast scenes made SW2 a fairy tale. I was saying "Oh my god, am i watching a Backstreet Boys like guy on screen making a very weak love story?"

Author: TJ-91
Review_Title: The train is not only back on track, its speeding at 1000mph.
Review: The wait is over.  When "Phantom Menace" ended, I was happy.  Happy because even though it wasn't exactly what I was hoping for, there was a lot of good in it. And happy because I knew the best was yet to come...but not for  3 long years.  For three years we have waited and today that wait is finally over: We have been absolved with Attack of the Clones. (Mr. Lucas, I never doubted you for a second ;) "Clones" is a lightspeed paced dash through the galaxy; it takes us through what should seem like a lifetime in just over two hours.  Compared to the geriatric pace of "Phantom Menace", this movie barely stops to breathe.  The characters are lovable in entirely new ways and the FX are awe-inspiring.  The dialogue can be clunky, and at times, downright silly, but there are still parts to be cherished.  I now view Star Wars in an entirely new light...it is all finally starting to make sense. "Clones" and "Menace" are not like the originals...they are not meant to be. These are not new versions of Episodes IV-VI...they are a continuation of them.  They are a completion of THE story, and when it becomes possible to understand them as equal parts in saga not and not as a bunch of suped-up sequels, nothing, not even Jar Jar Binks, can prevent you from being impressed.

Author: garsy
Review: Attack of the Clones is an excellent addition to the Star Wars saga. The film sets a much more darker, moody atmosphere reminiscent of Empire'. The film's special effects are mind blowing and my only criticism would be that at some points in the film there is so much happening on the screen you just don't have time to take it all in. I suppose that what video and DVD are for. Hayden Christiansen's portrayal of the older more unruly Anakin is very convincing. You feel different emotions for the character as the film progresses. Don't get me wrong I don't think he will get an Oscar nomination, but his older version of Anakin is what it should be. The rest of the characters pick up their parts from Phantom' and develop as the story progresses. The main flaw in Phantom' was the lack of story. This film does not fall into that trap and gives the viewer lots to think about. More references to the original trilogy are made throughout the film and this helps you once again fell as if you are back in the Star Wars universe. One nice touch are the scenes set in the homestead of Owen and Beru. Shots and camera angles are exactly the same as the original film. Once you get to the battle at the end of the film you will have forgiven George Lucas for Jar Jar and the menace that was Phantom' and see the true nature of a Star Wars film. If you haven't seen this movie yet go and enjoy the experience. It will definitely make you feel young again.

Author: RN-1
Review: It wasn't as boring as the last.  It was very beautiful, lots of pretty pictures and cgi that didn't actually ruin the film (shock!).  But amongst all these good things were a weak (and obvious) plot, terrible direction, and possible the most implausible love story this side of Spaceballs.

Author: slashx
Review_Title: An excellent followup to episode 1 and introduction to episode 3!
Review: The second episode brilliantly starts to piece together the beloved episodes 4, 5 and 6.  The special effects no longer seem native in this film - everything fits and doesn't seem to distract as it may have in Episode 1. Jar Jar Binks made a respectable reappearance that is sure to give the character more respect than in Episode 1.

Author: nayanbhula
Review: I was definitely worried after reading countless bad articles in the paper and on the web, but I tell you...it's a all a lie.  Star Wars II is amazing, incredible, awesome.  "Spider-Man" is a faint memory beside this film. "Phantom Menace" was let's face it, a little bit of a letdown -- I did enjoy the film, but it had a great many faults.  This film is fantastic...people complain about the dialogue and the acting.  Portman is excellent as always, and Christensen is remarkable in possibly one of the most difficult roles ever!  I mean, it's been built up since the release of the Star Wars IV! There's dumbed down, teenage lovey-dovey talk, but what they hell are they suppose to say -- yes, he's a jedi and she's a senator, but they're still teenagers, who just fell in love. Lucas' direction is a lot more confident, and he leaves the comic relief to people like Obi-One and C3PO & R2 -- definitely a smarter choice then Jar-Jar.  Jar-Jar was bad, but if Lucas had cut some scenes from "Phantom" -- the backlash would not have been as bad. SO...go see the movie.  It's still on one of the most amazing plots and stories you'll ever see.  The intricacies are astounding...and yes the special effects are incredible. Bottom LIne, tell the critics to shove it and go watch it; you will not be disappointed!

Author: extracoconut
Review_Title: Decent film, but Lucas can't write or direct!
Review: Enjoyed the film immensely - well almost.

Author: gmurthy2004
Review: I figured that this movie would be bad, but I saw it anyway because its Star Wars.  I should have waited for it to come out on rental.  This movie was bad, almost as bad as Episode 1.  Its obvious that Lucas made this new trilogy for money alone.  This movie does not come close to living up to the original trilogy.  My advice, blow this movie off and see the year's greatest film, Spiderman, again.

Author: Obi-Doug
Review_Title: Lucas creates a stunning Episode II
Review: Absolutely amazing... I saw Spider-Man and was impressed. I saw Attack of the Clones and I was floored! The scope and range of this film was nearly overwhelming. The story-line was captivating and exciting. The fight scenes were excellently done (Yoda's fight scene left me in absolute awe). The climax of the movie left me on the edge of my seat, and I have never literally done that before in a movie theater. Great job George!

Author: phoeniusphreak
Review_Title: Truly Amazing on so many different levels (EVEN AFTER 5 TIMES of Watching..hehehehe)
Review: This film is absolutely brilliant. Whether you like Star wars or not....it doesn't matter. This film is undeniably great, not just visually but acting wise. As a Brit Ewan McGregor is fantastic, he holds the screen well and how Liam Neeson did in The Phantom Menace he pulls off being the wise Jedi very well. Obi-Wan is essential to the plot as we all should know what is going to happen but Lucas keeps us guessing how it happens. Ewan McGregor especially as he seems so strong but has this degree of humanity that when watching, the viewer can really relate to. Episode IV to VI were so brilliant because of Han Solo keeping the comic element there....were episode 1 failed is to re-create a character of comedy....they tried with Jar Jar Binks and it did work to a degree but Han Solo was really arrogant and that made him appealing..as his comic relief was essential for the whole series. In Attack of the Clones (AOTC) Hayden Christensen amazes me as his acting ability is fantastic not only does he portray Anakin as strong and arrogant but his facial expressions are fantastic and change the whole tone of the movie.....he really shows that inside Anakin is a boy who just needs to get out so he can be a man. Christensen shows this brilliant and comes across very evil at times and really keeps the viewer enthralled as he allows everyone to see how he is slowly becoming seduced by the dark side. Anakin and Obi-Wan make this film amazing to watch and u can really relate to everything that goes on. Christopher Lee in a role much like his role in Lord of The Rings is a very good bad guy and is very arrogant. He really does give Obi-wan a nemesis.....Anakin is not only battling with his feelings with the Dark Side but with Padmé...on paper a love story doesn't really fit at all into the story because Star wars seems like a guy thing...just loads of action....but how wrong we could be. Lucas doesn't over do it....but emphasises on the natural feeling between the two...and Christensen really does show how versatile he is, as an actor....the chemistry between him and Portman make the film very interesting....and like I said before abt the need for relief from an all action plot...it is a nice diversion. If you see this film you have to see it for Yoda....as Yoda is absolutely brilliant at the end....tt final scene towards the end will be remembered form years to come...as 25 years of waiting to see what Yoda can actually do is finally seen. In conclusion to this epic adventure.....Lucas stays close to the story and fuses together the fundamental key characteristics of what made Star Wars, Star Wars....he substitutes Anakins arrogance for Han Solo's comic relief....but tt alone is not enough....so he uses the diversion of a love story to ease the whole action. At the same time he runs sub-plots into the film...introducing new ideas and although the eventual ending is already known....u never quite noe where the film is going to go next. This is what George Lucas has done amazingly....Im not a person who goes to see films over and over again...but films I truly respect and love for what they do critically should be watched and watched over and over again. Star Wars and LOTR come under tt category.....but AOTC has met the hype of the two new films together....it is a joy to watch...its only friday and I have seen it 5 times.....its not sad....if you see it...you can see no matter how perceptive u r to wot is going on, on screen u always pick up on sub-plots.....and Lucas has wrote this script like a book because its so unpredictable....Jango's character should return as tt is one of the minor details tt u can only pick up on if u see this film again and again...I suggest to any1 who has seen it, to see it again even if they do not like it....give urself a chance to see how great this film is...and how it works on the five levels a film should, Sociological, philosophical, Religious, psychological and suspense...the fact AOTC is such a big budget picture and it can do this is truly amazing......if u see one film this summer see this film. Get down to the nearest theatre that shows it digitally...becasue if you see it digitally...u will just simply look in ore...of the amazing effects....in the end....ull get your money's worth even if you don't like Star Wars...its a brilliant romance...its not a Pearl Harbour romance...it has depth to it....watch it twice...because if you dunt....it will plague ur mind.

Author: Cbrizen
Review_Title: The best movie in the Star Wars series?
Review: Episode I sucked.  We all know that, I mean come on the dialogue was cheesy, Anakin should have been played by Haley Joel Osment, and of course Jar Jar Binks ruined the movie.  Episode I is one of the reasons many people are straying away from Episode II. But if you are one of those people, forget that Episode I ever existed

Author: Great Cthulhu
Review_Title: Doesn't engage you like the originals.
Review: Thank you, George Lucas - for giving me the opportunity to use the word "humdrum" in everyday conversation.

Author: hualuengpong
Review: Ok, at least this movie is better then Episode 1. At least the special effects are pretty well done and the scenery looks very futuristic. There was one 'Star War' that I can think of right now and that was where Jango Fett and his Slave I start blowing up asteroids, which looked very cool in my opinion. That is about all I can think of that is any good with this movie.

Author: Lewmor1110
Review: Okay...so it's not "The Empire Strikes Back," arguably the best Star Wars movie. I will say that it's way better than Episode I - The Phantom Menace.

Author: bass_addicted_xxl
Review: Definitely better than the first episode! No more of that annoying Jah Jah stuff (thank God)!

Author: scootaboy
Review: Lucas once said during production of the original trilogy, "Special Effects alone do not make a good movie" - or something to that effect. Clearly he has a short memory. This was the most over-bloated piece of garbage I have very seen. As a movie fan old enough to have seen the original trilogy on release I was appalled.

Author: jasonhoneycutt
