Review: Sorry, but it really was boring and I really wanted to like it... a lot.  I know that comment will anger many "Jedi's" who waited for days for tickets but let's look at it objectively.  It opened shaky but picked up.  I thought, "Great!  Finally, it's back!!"  But then the brakes were applied and it came to a screeching halt in after the first plot point.  It picked back up toward the end (after and hour and a half) but then I was thinking, "Why are we fighting...?  Some politics or something?  Eh, who cares... it's fun again."  Without giving anything away, the end fights were amazing and that totally salvaged the film for me.  The set-up of the Storm Troopers was great... originally good guys!?  Wow.  And the last scene, again without giving anything away, is a redeeming one for Star Wars fans because it finally starts getting into familiar territory with the 'ultimate weapon'.

Author: museyshian
Review: I enjoyed Ep 1. but Ep II left me completely cold and disinterested. The CG visuals are superb - better than any previous Star Wars. Quite possibly better than any other film ever made, in fact. This makes Final Fantasy look like a hand-drawn flickbook.

Author: aj1976
Review_Title: You have got to be kidding me
Review: Alas, poor Star Wars...I knew it well....

Author: johnnysure
Review: ***hopefully doesn't spoil anything***

Author: jsregner5a
Review_Title: 4 out of 10 - Still 1 chance left to get it right **Spoilers**
Review: I am not a hardcore Star Wars fan.  I cannot recite the lines from the original trilogy.  However, I am a fan of the original 3 movies.  I saw The Phantom Menace for the first time only a few months ago and I had to turn it off after the first hour and take a break.  That is how boring I found it to be.

Author: baggins39
Review_Title: A shadow of its former self
Review: I was there at the beginning and stayed until the admirable entry-point to the trio of prequels that would, we were assured, re-map the splendid beginnings of George's magnificent odyssey and usher in a whole new generation of fans who had only ever experienced the magic on VHS/BETA. No, I didn't much care for Star Wars "Re-dux" a couple of years ago at the cinema with the added bits for good measure. I mean, if it ain't broke, why unnecessarily lengthen and dissipate the narrative structural integrity with a plethora of CGI jiggery-pokery? For me, the original IS most definitely the best. Having said that, I was suitably impressed by "The Phantom Menace", a film which was chock-a-block with the aforementioned effects but which managed to develop the early incarnations of our heroes/villains suitably whilst effortlessly introducing some new faces and even throwing in some stunning set pieces (that remarkable pod-race sequence, for example) before slapping us across our drooping jaws with an intricate and splendidly edited three-way battle extravaganza at the finale. And of course...the critics disliked it as I believe did a sizeable majority of incredibly hard to please individuals. Poor ol' George must've really been scratching his head over that one. "What in God's name did I do wrong?", he might have said. "I set the whole shebang in perfect motion or so I thought. Sure, the effects got most of the headlines but scrape away the CGI and I also had a solid script, some thoughtful, low-key and otherwise performances from some splendid actors, some breath-taking locales, unparalleled action sequences in the traditional Star Wars stylee and the Mother and Father of all light-sabre battles with a particularly loathsome Sith Lord who prior to a late narrative tinker, I had pencilled in to last until the beginning of Episode III. I mean, what more do you people want!?!!" screams Curious George. O.K. folks, it appears that what George has done is pull his hair out in trying to bend and mould a once fresh-faced and truly original movie-franchise (if that's not a contradiction in terms), into a shameless hussy of a free-for-all in which everyone gets a bit of what they fancy. To hell with the original vision, here's Star Wars by the numbers with a dreadful, wise-cracking new version of once stolidly po-faced Obi-wan, a slew of cartoon-like chases and near-misses and improbable escapes. Throw in a ludicrous, "Gladiator"-style melee with terrible creature design and a newly transformed Senator Amidala into some kind of neolithic Wonder Woman and you're really only scraping the surface of what's gone very badly wrong. I'll admit that the story-line is reasonably well adhered-to in most places and the double bluff by the fantastic Count Dooku (take a bow, Sir Christopher) will leave most people guessing till the end, but by the half way stage, no amount of shots of the supremely cool, but criminally underused Jango Fett can sway one back to full consciousness after more than an hour of a tepid romantic tale not at all suffused by a rousing finale which instead is just a large mess of flashing lights and a painfully obvious, heavily unlife-like series of skirmishes which leaves a rather unsatisfied taste in the mouth as the strains of John Williams build to the end titles. "What did I just watch?", I heard someone say, "Was that Star Wars?" piped another. "My bleedin' eyes hurt", moans a third. All I can add to the growing list of unsatisfied customer-speak, is why reduce one of the most famous and well-written characters to the lowly bowels of bad stand-up with shamelessly ill-judged and un-funny puns. Poor ol' Anthony Daniels must be secretly crying into his cocoa. R.I.P C-3PO. I remember when real humour and many an uproarious punchline was exacted from your uppity, cantankerous and uniquely blinkered view of the universe and not from a junior script-writer's lazy scribblings on a matchbox on the subway to one of George's crisis meetings. Ah, what the hell, bar Lee, Jango Fett and a half-way decent performance by that Danish bloke wot played Annakin, "Attack of the Clones" was little short of a complete disaster. Please, George, I beg you, recant, shut yourself away in a little room with some pencils and a notepad and start re-writing the third and mercifully, final instalment. Don't listen to no-one, my amply-jowlled friend, and throw your work out there into the big, wide world letting those would-be directors and screenwriters amongst us peck at the pieces and take it or leave it. After all, you don't need the money at this stage, right. Right? And to think, your good buddy Mr. S. actually went and said that AOTC was better than "A New Hope".....the man's loosin' his cool. Fur reel, Dog. (Either that, or he felt you needed some serious consoling).

Author: StockholmJacob
Review: Entering the cinema my expectations for Episode II were extremely low, as opposed to three years earlier with 'The Phantom Menace'. Perhaps this is the reason I enjoyed this movie so much more, but then again, perhaps not...

Author: darth-han
Review: The smile first appeared on my face when the Star Wars theme music blasted out at the very beginning.  I was still smiling 2 days later when i was about to see it for the third time.  All i can say is that it is most excellent.

Author: homerjfry
Review: I saw Episode 2 today, and i must say that i was truly impressed with this effort. After seeing Episode 1, i was greatly disappointed in the plot, and the casting (Jake Loyd was probably the worst Star Wars casting ever, well maybe next to N'Sync) and the amount of crappy religious elements in it. There were many scenes that could have been edited out of it such as the underwater part where they are being chased by that fish. The emaculate conception crap was laugh out loud funny in its lameness as well. I think that Lucas has listened to all the complaints from fans and tried to address them, and for the most part he suceeded. Jar-Jar actually serves a purpose in this film, and Hayden Christianson is very strong as Anakin Skywaker. He plays the role with anger, and saddness, pulling the viewer in to his struggle. Sure he is whiney, but he is also playing like a 17 year old kid so that is fine by me. He has a look about him that seems to scream evil, and he is very good in this role. Ewen McGregor is strong as well as Obi Wan. He really adds a lot to the role. His performance was very good, and he seemed to have that auora of Obi Wan greatness around him. Natalie Prtman was weak as Padame' as her performance was kind of bland and cookie cutter. Although she was the most beautiful i have ever seen her. She was gorgeous. This movie really set up the future of the Star Wars universe such as introducing the storm troopers instead of the droids. The Droids in the first movie really bugged me, as i wanted to see Strom Troopers. I was happy to see them introduced, but was shocked at their role in the movie. There were some complaints such as the Jedi were made to look like weaklings. I will not reveal how, but you will see when you watch the movie. Most of them are just pushovers. I think they tried to hard to make humour with C3PO and R2D2 and a lot of the time it didn't work. It ended up being rather lame. The fight that Yoda had was cool in the beginning, but the more i thought about it, the more laughable it was. I was chuckling when i was watching it because it was pretty outrageous. My final complaint being that Obi Wan was kind of shown to be a loser, as Anakin was correcting him and making him look stupid, and he was getting beaten up a lot, but i guess it is ok because Anakin is suppossed to be the bad ass of the universe.

Author: rangermanr
Review: This is (no kidding) one of the worst movies I have ever seen.  There are no redeeming qualities to it whatsoever.  You'd be hard pressed to find acting any worse than it gets here, from just about everybody.  Lucas has fallen in love with C.G.I. and it looks atrocious on the screen.  I'd take the effects of the first three over these new ones in a heartbeat.  George Lucas has obviously gone crazy and is tarnishing his reputation and the Star Wars franchise, which is arguably the most influential film of all time.  But this worthless dribble is without any sort of ambition, creativity, or skill. Somebody please stop Lucas from further tarnishing the series.  Good call on Hayden Christiansen, George.  I would rather sit through repeated viewings of Gigli than watch this particular film ever again.

Author: ray-18
Review: I just come from opening night and I am really pleased.  This time he really got it right.  This film feels like the Star Wars we all know and love.

Author: Frederik_Andersen
Review: Episode II is, as could be expected, an example of how far Lucas and ILM have taken special effects and computer animation. But it's also an example of how much you lose if you are too focused on and impressed by visual effects. And it's sad, because the story behind Attack Of The Clones is actually quite good. We have the young soon-to-be-intergalactic-lord-of-darkness Anakin Skywalker, who is trapped between his jedi training, `the woman he loves' and the desire to go back to his home planet and save his enslaved mother. And we have the political disturbance in the republic, with the deceiving Palpatin pulling the strings, and a bunch of very distressed jedi-masters pondering and wondering.

Author: monious
Review: I recently finished playing Jedi Knight II: Jedi Outcast for the PC.  The coolest thing about that game was the Jedi battles. And I must say, the Jedi battles in Attack of the Clones was AWESOME. It's everything you could imagine (except perhaps Jedi Armies vs. Jedi Armies), and done to perfection.

Author: lemurbob
Review_Title: Yoda, the great counterweight of cinema
Review: This film has many cheesy points. Many bad puns, many silly jokes, many annoying parts with Anakin the southerner and Padmé the bimbo. However, these are the only flaws I can really think of. It was a great reminder of the amazing effect a Star Wars film has on people watching it on the big screen, on premiere night. Who can forget the undying team of R2-D2 and C-3PO? Or perhaps the endless wit of Obi-Wan Kenobi? Most noteworthy are the battles, where dozens of Jedi (far more than the usual one or two) are shown in battle against hundreds of droids, lightsabers swishing? These things bring life to the film. If you're in it for the plot, I must warn you that the greatest impediment to this trilogy (I, II, & III) is that we already know how things turn out. Because of that, George [Lucas] has a huge restraint on storyline. Many events must conveniently coincide, or the purpose of the films are lost. That said, my advice is ignore the crummy Ani-Padmé bits, and concentrate on the battles, which to me are more spectacular than ever. Yoda is a true pro, and in order to keep the novelty up, I won't say any more about him. Just keep in mind that no matter WHAT people say against this film, YODA will be the word to bring them back. Nothing, absolutely nothing beats his performance in Clones!

Author: bandana
Review_Title: Great, but would be better if Yoda wasn't CG.
Review: As somebody whose main complaint about The Phantom Menace was that it was too computer generated, it was inevitable that I would say the same about Attack Of The Clones.  With this, Episode II, the special effects are greatly improved, as is the story.  Depth is added to characters, the action is spectacular, and in short this is a great deal better than Episode I. However, this movie fails where The Phantom Menace succeeded in that Yoda is now completely CG.  He looks unbelievably synthetic and is, in my opinion, far too different from the Yoda in the other installments of the Star Wars saga.  It can be said quite correctly that Yoda need be CG for some parts of the film, but a more traditional and realistic puppet could have been used for the majority of his screen time.  Nevertheless, this is tremendously enjoyable, action packed fun which needs to be seen on the big screen...and needs to be seen more than once!

Author: brundlefly69
Review_Title: UNBELIEVABLE!! I'm going wait in line for Episode III right now!!
Review: Words cannot express what I am feeling right now!  My fellow Star Wars fans will know what I am talking about.  George Lucas has once again outdone himself.  If I don't see this movie a dozen or so times, I may go back into shock! Absolutely UNBELIEVABLE!

Author: wolszczak
Review: Anybody wondered why Aliens, Blade Runner, Predator were such good movies ? a) a good plot and decent dialogs, and b) great acting. How could Mr. Lucas hire Hayden Christensen for a lead role - he should have remained in Canadian sope operas, who is so wooden he could make up for the Yoda's missing cane. All he does is glimpses from underneath his eyebrows to express some emotions. There is no substitute for acting school, expierience or well, talent for that matter.

Author: canopic1
Review_Title: big step up but a long way to go
Review: Surprise- Hayden Christiansen was not as bad as I feared. However, the CGI effects were as distracting as expected. In my opinion creature effects hit their pinnacle in the 80s with films like Dragonslayer and Aliens. Nothing in the past 20 years can surpass those in realism. The CGI characters in SW 2 were just not tangible or  believable. Yoda was the closest thing to a success in this area but he looked like Sonic the Hedgehog during his duel (even though that was the most entertaining sequence in the film.) Overall all SW 2 was such a vast improvement over Phantom Menace that you have to be somewhat pleased but it is still is light years behind Empire which it desperately sought to emulate (protector and princess fall in love, severed limbs, asteroid chases, etc). Maybe its the Byzantine politics instead of rag tag heroes trying to oppose the ultimate bad guy. It's hard to figure out who you should hate.

Author: crislander
Review_Title: A shameful addition to the Star Wars saga
Review: This movie is, simply put, awful.

Author: chrisgallen
Review: What more can I say? Great movie. Great addition to the series.

Author: pmacors
Review: This movie is great but for ten minutes of honey-love. Absolutely fabulous. Star-Wars is back and Yoda rocks. The duo R2d2 and CPO3 is back on-line with lots of humor. The whole stuff is great. The special effects are incredible and very well integrated. The music is great and Padme is very very very beautifull.

Author: snoop23
Review: To start things off, I'd have to say that George Lucas is a genius. He brought the first Star Wars film (now known as Episode IV- A New Hope) into our lives in 1977, The Empire Strikes Back in 1980 and Return of the Jedi in 1983 and they still remain to be the most magical, imaginative, creative, innovative & influential films of all time. Simply put, they were classics.

Author: dg3
Review_Title: Awful dialogue + awful acting = AWFUL movie!
Review: In the interest of social science, I attended "Star Wars Episode II," notepad in hand, to observe the behavior of the masses and try to draw some conclusions about both the movie itself and the status it has achieved as a cultural phenomenon.

Author: Daleknight
Review: For the most part there is noting new in this one. You know what has to happen to get to episode 4, but they don't always take the most direct approach. But to put it mildly, the last 30 minutes turned this fine film into a beautiful action flick that the Star Wars fan has come to expect. The special effects where even better then episode 1! And master Yoda is a hellcat with a light saber!! Mr. Lucas had a story to tell, and he did another bang-up job of doing it. So if you though that The Phantom Menace was good, hang on to your hats, this is going to be a damn fine summer block buster!

Author: Milian
Review: No, it is not up there with Empire, of course not. Yes, the acting by Portman, Jackson and Christensen is very, very stiff. Yes, the "romantic" dialogue between Anakin and Padme is embarrassingly silly.

Author: aringeorgilocks
Review_Title: I don't believe this film is a 10 but I'm making up for the many nonsensical low ratings.
Review: Not as bad as people make it out to be. It's a 7.5 for me.

Author: fiore-1
Review_Title: IF YOU LIKE CHEESY LOVE SCENES FOR TWO HOURS???
Review: This is a pathetic attempt by Lucas to incorporate love into this 2cnd series...They need to bring back the entire cast of the original series, or quit now. I did not think it could get any worse, but it did. The acting is poor and the direction was even worse. If you want to save some money, do not see this movie..

Author: Clintmeister
Review: Finally!!!!

Author: junior30shs
Review_Title: The best story is the one that everyone seems to miss

Author: briancoughlan
Review_Title: great effects, shame about the acting
Review: Saw it last night. The scenes between Annakin and Padme are terrible. The CGI is great. Yoda was done very nicely. last half hour is great.

Author: jjarv-79079
Review: This is pure Star Wars!

Author: kappnel
Review: This movie had great action, a good story, and great effects.  I'd say the digital effects have noticeably gotten better since Phantom Menace.  The only thing I can complain about is the acting was sub-par and the use of the force seemed a bit low.  Other then that, this was a great movie...arguably the best one yet!

Author: CRoWsNest96
Review: I've never really got the Star Wars thing, I've never felt the urge to camp over night for tickets, when I can go along to a cinema 2 days later and get in with no problem, or waited till midnight at HMV for the DVD release, when I can stroll into Tesco's the next day and pick up a copy.  So Star Wars purists will probably say, what gives me the right to criticise this movie. At the end of the day, I am a movie fan, and can recognise a good movie from a bad movie, and this one sucked, where do I start, acting, script, effects, lack of cohesive story arc.  At least they restricted the terminally annoying Jar-Jar-Binks to little more than a cameo role.  Ewan mcGregor sounded like a cross between Biggles and a Pathe News announcer, 'what the blazes!' and 'a clone armer!' amongst his more memorable lines.  The attempts at humour were risable.  Annikin just looked and acted like any surly pubescant teenager from an aussie soap, christ I was expecting him to runaway from home if he did not get his own way, that'll teach the grown-ups. Yoda trying to bellow orders in is his back to front English, 'The Space Ships, aim for, you must' any trooper would say 'what the **** did he just say' As for Christopher Lee, was he just practising his Saruman role.  One last point, why was it called Attack of the Clones anyway, they don't appear till right at the end. It should have been called Episode II:Annikin, the sulky years.

Author: kelly_bernard
Review: Saw AOTC this morning in a surprisingly empty theatre (don't people skive off work any more?). It's almost as good as Empire Strikes Back but not quite. Anyway, who cares? It's still two and a half hours of pure escapism and after all that's what Star Wars is all about.

Author: steven_w_george
Review_Title: A massive improvement over Phantom Menace
Review: Wow, what an improvement, brilliant acting, stunning special effects and a gripping yet mysterious story line. I loved the way that you can see the conflict with Anakin's arrogance, and the way Palpatine looks even more evil. Can't wait for episode 3!!!!

Author: SCHWAN
Review: 2nd best star wars film after empire. Superior to episode I in every way, especially the plot - which is actually mature and complex. The dialogue in places is awful, but doesn't detract enough from the film. Without a doubt, yoda steals the show. See it, and you will remember how you felt watching the original trilogy for the first time - and hopefully forget the mediocrity of episode I.

Author: jroen
Review_Title: Bring back the plastic, the steal and the scale models
Review: First of all: I enjoyed myself. But that's as far as it goes. Even though EP-II has its moments, I think the domination of CGI makes this film (and EP-I) look pale in comparison to the EP IV, V and VI. Most of the space-ships are too smooth, too fake to be believable. Where as the actual steal of e.g. The Millenium Falcon made it more real. The old spaceships, aliens etc. were made, created and built out of real material and even though a lot the time they were scale-models and Lucas used trick-filming, it worked good. Which cannot be said all the time of the new space-ships etc.

Author: MichaelMcCullar
Review: For all those thinking that George Lucas had lost the Midas touch, think again.  Attack of the Clones is one of the most exhilarating, breathtaking cinematic experiences I have ever had, and more than does justice to the original trilogy.  The film looks incredible, the action sequences are mind-altering, and the acting, from Sam Jackson to Temuera Morrison to the great Christopher Lee, is top notch.  The question on everyone's mind has been, what about Hayden Christiansen?  His performance will be the most hotly debated aspect of this movie.  Your like or dislike of this film hinges on your like or dislike of his performance.  I feel he nailed it. This is a boy, not yet 20 years old, who is aware that he may one day fulfill the prophecy of bringing balance to the Force.  He is brash, cocky, impulsive, and arrogant, almost like a star athlete in high school who knows he's one of the best in the country.  His awkward interaction with Senator Amidala is what you would expect from a teenager trying to impress an older, mature woman.  Couple that with the fact that, because of his code as a Jedi apprentice, he has less than zero knowledge of women, and you find a boy trying to be a man without understanding the responsibilities a man must undertake.  I fully bought Anakin and Padme's love story, and could see the undercurrent of destructiveness inherent in it.  Overall, this movie is unbelievable.  Go and see it 5 or 6 times.

Author: BrokenCycle
Review_Title: Attack of the Fanboys is more like it.
Review: All right, let me get this out of the way first. I LOVE Star Wars it is one of my favorite franchises of all time but, I'm not the stand in line for 386 hours, believe The Force is real type of fan. That said I'll now put my reputation and quite possibly my life on the line here. I LOVED Episode I!!! It had what this film is missing, that Star Wars feel. Lucas has always said that he made Star Wars for 13 year old boys. Episode I had that feeling. While, yes, I did find Jar Jar annoying, he was no worse or more distracting than the Ewoks from Return of the Jedi. The only true complaint I have with Episode I is Jake Lloyd, too hyperactive.

Author: PIBB
Review_Title: Lucas, Why the HELL did you make Boba Fett SO ANNOYING!?!?!
Review: **SPOILERS** I really dont think I will see the next one if it is ANYTHING like this one.I mean this is a disgrace compared to all of the others except Episode 1 (no explination needed). I mean Hayden Christiansen was just a bad actor as Anakin. I mean he is always mouthing off to Obi-Wan (he should have kicked his A**) Boba Fett is this really annoying like 8 year old ( GET HIM DAD, THERE HE IS DAD, HEH HEH) you see WAY too much of Jango Fetts face and not nearly enough of the Jango Fett in his Mandalorian Armor. When Jango Fett *spoiler sort of* gets his head cut off by Windu and Boba Fett picks it up, it seems like his head would have fallen out or something. And im confused, if you are cut by a lightsaber, are you supposed to bleed? because i think Anakin bled when Dooku * spoiler sort of* cut off his hand, but Jango didnt bleed. At the Arena scene, Pamde get cut on her back, right? So why does her shirt get cut like in half? Im not arguing or anything (eh heh eh heh) but it makes no sense. And at the end of the scene C-3P0 and R2D2 are still in the Arena, and at the end somehow they get out. If it is possible, Hayden Christiansen is as annoying as Luke Skywalker was in A New Hope. there is no way i am seeing episode 3 unless it is much better, or you see Anakin and Padmes wedding night......This is PIBB....Signing off... oh yeah one more thing... whatch the Satr Wars fan Awards on Sci-Fi...Star Wars Gangsta Rap...funny...heh.

Author: PIBB
Review: George Lucas gave the audience everything they asked for....more visual effects, more of the Bounty Hunter Fetts, and probably most of all.... VERY LITTLE JAR-JAR BINKS!! Although i do have to say that Boba Fett is extremely annoying and you did see too much of Jango Fetts face.

Author: kentrel
Review_Title: Keep your spirit up during the terrible first half, it'll pay off in the fantastic second
Review: The problem Star Wars has always had is with the screenplay, and this is no different. The first half is filled with cringe-filled dialogue and one-liners, and when Jar Jar Binks appeared early on my own thoughts echoed Han Solo's: "I have a bad feeling about this". However, Jar Jar's appearance is brief though it will have you burying your face in your hands until its over.

Author: bugtronic
Review: The special effects were incredible.  Personally, I think that the digital format is not very flattering to the actors and the make-up artists should have adapted to the medium.  The story was good and the action was rather intense.

Author: jackspudwilson
Review: Let's face it this was by far the greatest movie of all time and I don't think anything will ever come close.This movie was a visually stunning masterpiece with fantastic CGI and well written characters...now that brings me to my next point HAYDEN CHRISTENSEN he was perfect in this movie especially when telling padme how frustrated he was with Obi- Wan.The quote 'It's not fair' portrayed how annoyed he was and the acting is first class.I was completely awestruck by this production.I think we can all agree that Ian Macdiarmid was shamazeballs throughout the entire prequel trilogy(which in my option completely outshines the originals).The lines "I love democracy,I love the republic" and "perhaps an old friend like master kenobi" were so beautifully written that you never think it's a film. Oh my lord the saber fights were in a different league (or Galaxy if you get me haha).the contrast of colours are awesome as Anakin and count dooku are spinningtheir sabers around like nobodies business.As Hayden Christensen delivered the lines "No I'm getting him now" it sent a shiver down my spine and I thought to myself WOW THIS IS STAR WARS, the movie we have waited for since that crock of shite empire strikes back.The action was great,the writing was awesome,the direction was first class and the acting was possibly the best I have ever seen.Oh and we haven't even started on Jar Jar yet to sum it all up THANK YOU GEORGE for this excellent masterpiece, 10/10

Author: kenobisgirl24
Review_Title: The only word to describe this movie...Beautiful!
Review: Star Wars: Episode 2 was a very beautiful movie.  Although in some of the more romantic scenes Natalie Portman seemed a bit...uncomfortable, it was still very nice.  The action was mind boggling and Obi-Wan was hilarious! Hayden Christensen did absolutely amazing!  I can't wait for Episode 3, if it is anything at all like Episode 2, it will be just wonderful!

Author: antelopetube
Review: I won't say much but let's just say the Star Wars saga has returned full force (aha).  Superb, a slow burning plot but one that's worth waiting for. After the disappointing Episode 1 and the early cartoon-like trailers I was worried, thankfully everything was put right for the final film. Brilliant.

Author: xmbmail
Review_Title: The real Star Wars is back!
Review: Forget The Phantom Menace, this is truly out of the original Star Wars stable. All the usual stunning effects including a decent story line and oh did I see some romance in there.

Author: terhosoini
Review: The pacing didn't work at all as a movie and felt like it was meant to be a video game. Scenes shifted with a loose plot around them and the conversations feeled like npcs talking to each other to explain what happens in the next scene.

Author: joseaugustomarques
Review: I'm absolutly crazy about the first three movies of the saga, but Episode I did not convice me ...

Author: frizank
Review_Title: Better than Episode 1, but will pale in comparison to Episode 3.
Review: I don't know why everyone is so gung-ho about this being the movie that puts Star Wars back on track. The franchise never got off-track!! I LOVED Episode 1, but I'll admit, I LOVED AOTC a little bit more. (SPOILERS AHEAD)!!!

Author: xiii_ironman
Review_Title: A Director shall not know anything about anger, nor hate, nor love.
Review: I'm sorry, but how can over a quarter of IMDb voters give Episode 2 10/10 stars? Obviously it's a prequel to the Star Wars Trilogy, so a few people will give it ten stars regardless, but how can so many people ignore the huge, gaping flaws in the film.

Author: logstardeluxe
Review_Title: The Greatest Advertisement for Reading or Playing Outside
Review: I never knew there was an emotion that combined anger, disgust and boredom all in one... until I saw this 'movie'.

Author: i_methos
Review: In this fifth installment of Star Wars, George Lucas delivers a visually stunning thrill-ride through the galaxy.  While I believed there were script problems from day one that show in the picture, it is easy to overlook. Action packed from start to finish, Attack of the Clones makes for a most enjoyable movie experience.

Author: xcanon
Review_Title: In this one, strong the Force is!
Review: Unlike Episode I, Attack of the Clones offers a spectacular journey into the wonderful Star Wars Universe. Blastering lightsabre extravaganzas, an emotional rollercoaster ride and the unfolding of the Phantom Menace itself... Star Wars Episode II, a must see for all fans of the Star Wars Saga! I give this movie an 8+ out of 10 (and now I only compare to the other Episodes since these movies are in a class of their own).

Author: necromanca
Review_Title: different from the old movies but just great
Review: SPOILERS ALERT It was just after midnight (local time 9 hrs ahead of LA) when they started the movie. Since I had the chance to see the original English version, the cinema was not too crowded. Germans had the chance to watch their translated version in several other the theatre rooms in this place.

Author: Iron Horse
Review: The plot is convoluted and confusing. The narrative is full of holes. The acting is functional at best. The script veers from the sublime to the ridiculous The FX are stunning. The fight scenes are thrilling. The lightsabres go zzzzzzsssswwiiiiiinnng.

Author: snakebitt
Review_Title: Behold the return of the Force
Review: The only thing that could possibly have pushed this film farther towards perfection is if Lucas had titled it in a way that let us rearrange the letters in the title to call the film 'Complete Redemption and Deliverance'. Episode I soured many fans, despite it not being entirely worthless--there were good parts in it, and overall it was a decent movie.  But anyone who insists that it had no weaknesses whatsoever is quite possibly due for a cat-scan.

Author: phenomenal cat
Review_Title: For hardcore, joyless, continuity-obsessed geeks only
Review: This one is dumb. I mean, lousy-TV dumb. "Battlestar Galactica" dumb. Dramatically infantile, with laughable, wooden dialog--an endless strings of unwatchable cliches. And so, so long and boring. Ridiculously convoluted. You need to take notes, except that you're bored, it's nice out, and your mind keeps wandering. Looks fantastic, but even the big effects sequences are starting to wear thin as Lucas churns out more from the same trusty molds: a dogfight in an asteroid belt, a high-speed air-car chase through a busy futuristic metropolis. No jaw-dropping moments, no "holy-cow-how-do-they-even-THINK-of-this-stuff" set pieces, no really inspired creative vision. And--most unforgiveably for a popcorn flick--not a single iota of FUN. I suspect that the fans who praise this dreck are emotionally and psychologically wound up in the Star Wars "universe", and really don't give the slightest damn about the actual Star Wars FILMS. Because, evaluated against even the most basic criteria (characters, plot, pacing, tension, etc), this film is an embarrassment.

Author: fbsoft
Review: Well what can i say i expected this movie to rock,rock,rock. But instead i found more of a drama then Sience Fiction movie . The first part ( about 1 hour ) of the movie STINKS i mean c'mon it is kinda interesting but it ain't worth it . I mean i saw better movies . The last part is nicer but still ... it could use some improving

Author: MidnightsEdgeKevin
Review: Going into this movie, I expected a repeat of Episode 1. Terrible lines in places, annoying characters, a bit of a lack of plot, and a very disconnected sense of continuity with the rest of the Star Wars universe.

Author: hunter_d1138
Review_Title: Hey look everybody George is back.
Review: Well what could be only explained as a long three years of booze and drugs; George Lucas seems to have kicked the habit and paid his dues for what is in my opinion the best Star Wars ever.  So what's different, well without giving away anything let's just say that Star Wars actually has been revamped and duely named Star "WARS".  That's right, the battles that Star Wars fans hunger are back, the hot flashy quick love scenes have returned, and the story has a thick background and even though fans know the ultimate outcome, the question is? Do you really.  Sure they got there but how and at what cost.  So you think you know how it all happens, go and see this movie so you can defiately be proven wrong!  Excellent, vibrant, and colorful digital effects and I will spoil this much, just the right amount of Jar Jar!, he only appears for maybe three to four scenes and is in total only in the movie approximately two minutes.  So there is good news all around, great battles, little Jar Jar, nice Amidala outfits (a little more racey than Episode I), and so many plot twists and shockers that you'll have to watch it several times to put it together.  It's good to have you back George and to see that you've put the Wars back in Star!!! Anyone that doesn't like these film please inform me, I'd be more than happy to say that you yourself are a dull idiot that will never ever have a moment of happiness and should you decide that you do need to get a life, don't you certainly don't deserve it!

Author: jcab
Review_Title: A real pity, but not really disappointing
Review: It is definitely better than the first one. But... Characters are pretty bland, and the story is pretty ridiculously bland. Emotional buildup is nonexistent, and the movie is just a succession of cliches. In many ways, it's just like a souped up version of your typical action/soap TV series. Characters have no life of their own. If that's all you want, you'll probably like it.

Author: Lindwurm
Review_Title: A product of its time - loud, fast, colorful and ... shallow.
Review: Just like "The Phantom Menace", this movie lacks what made the original trilogy become a legend: a soul. The mysterious force, the energy field "that surrounds us all", which could only be utilized by some natural talents was e.g. something that contributed to the "magic" of episodes 4 to 6, now it has been reduced to something controlled by miniature lifeforms called the midichlorians (what a stupid attempt to bring a "scientific" explanation into the SW universe) and which is now only used in some ridiculous action scenes (which are not only inspired but stolen from "The 5th Element") to compensate for the lack of creativity to make up a story for a 2-hour movie.

Author: Steffelin
Review: Warning: Possible Spoilers in this article

Author: rogueone99
Review: SO Ep2 rolls around and as usual with anything Lucas does, theres lovers of it and the haters. The film in my eyes delivered the goods, I mean an army of Jedi going toe to toe with so many bad guys  cant be a bad thing can it? And of course Yoda vs Dooku, worth the ticket price alone. McGregor, now settled into the role of Obi-Wan, did a good job of turning himself into Sir Alec Guiness, something most people thought he'd struggle to do. Ok so some of the plot is ermmm a bit lacking, maybe George has other things up his sleeve for Ep3 that us mere mortals arent to know about yet,  and yes I hold my hand up some of the dialogue was a bit iffy at times, but hey thats Star Wars, cast your mind back to Harrison Ford saying to George Lucas on the set of a New Hope " George you can write that s***, but we cant say it" says it all really , but it worked and thats all that matters. Jango Fett was superb and he'll be back for the next film   and it was nice to see the cameo of Boba, and I'm sure theres a social commentry somewhere about single parents familys being happy. Fair enough. This IS a good film,  and I am sure once people see the whole finished article( EPs I, II, II) there will be few complaints and the Trilogy will stand on its own two feet alongside the Classic trilogy. And to all the people who just wanna oput this film down and say they could do better, just ask yourself.......whos idea was this?

Author: rolf_ernst
Review: Being an avid Star Wars fan (I actually liked Episode I) I can only describe this movie as the worst Star Wars ever. From the really confusing story line, never quite knowing which political faction is who, over the worst dialogs imaginable, to Britney Spears (oops - Padme Amidala) - this movie disappoints at all levels.

Author: cherry_pie_15
Review: It's a very good movie... but you must be a Star Wars Fan, because otherwise you won't like it. If you liked the other Star Wars, you will be pleased by this one... There is lots of action, lots of light sabers, and lots of Ewan McGregor and his nice butt! =)

Author: kennycbjr
Review: Ok, maybe I am not that bright, but the biggest problem with the Star Wars is that I have no idea what the **** is going on at all.  OK, I know that the emperor is trying to start a war, ok, good.  But after that I am not sure what his plan is, what the purpose of the clones is, I have no idea what the bad jedi is up to, and I really don't under stand why the princess falls in love Anakin.  The great thing about the other movies was that the plot was understandable and witty, this one is just bogged down in dialouge, cliches, and an incomprehensible plot.

Author: belem
Review: very good movie finally George Lucas is back on track,great story ,great action. a little too much CGI and a bit slow in the first half, other than that Star Wars is back. i was hoping that after the Phantom Menace fiasco we will get something good and we did.The only bad thing now is that we have to wait till 2005 for the third one.

Author: eladg-1
Review_Title: The best one, only it has a goof
Review: In the movie, Anakine comes to his mother's farm and meets his step brother Owen...he than meets C-3PO who works at the farm. In episode 4 Owen buys C-3P0 and R2D2....how come he doesn't know them...??? Other than that the movies is SUPERB. Yoda's sabre fight is by far one of the best scenes in Star Wars history....

Author: idreamedmusic
Review: Yes, Star Wars is back! After having been bitterly disappointed by Episode 1, I was blown away by Attack of the Clones. This is Star Wars how we love it, good story, dazzling effects, great moments of humor (especially Obi-Wan), great characters and the overall feeling - this is it! Really good were all the little references to the original trilogy, and a set of characters that will seem familiar ;)

Author: WapitiKev
Review_Title: good acting and amazing CGI scenery can't saves the terrible script
Review: I love Episode 4-6 (yes, even Jedi) but I was rather disappointed by Episode 1 (I gave it a 7 out of 10).  Unfortunately the news is true, Episode II is the worst of the Star Wars movies.

Author: ekreidler
Review_Title: Can a movie be good when all you remember are the bad bits?
Review: **SPOILERS**I think I liked it. How's that for definitive? Few movies leave me in such a state, but with Star Wars, there's so much more going on around the films that it's hard to evaluate them objectively.

Author: Mist Lynx
Review: I am quite impressed with this new star wars movie.  Now it might not be near the empire strikes back or a new hope, but it does a good job of creating anakin as a darker figure.  The special effects are amazing, and they begin to show the creation of the will-be imperial army.  The lightsaber battle is phenomenal, and the new creatures that are introduced are amazing.  The acting is quite good as well.  They also begin to build the character of Boba Fett, which is nice.  This is a MUST see.

Author: adamjacen
Review_Title: A fun fantasy thrill-ride across a galaxy far, far away...
Review: Awesome in scope and breathtaking in execution, ATTACK OF THE CLONES leaves you wanting more!  The story of STAR WARS is coming together, characters become more developed, and the suspense mounts for the conclusion of the prequel trilogy.

Author: mapdealer
Review: Don't listen to these idiots who say this was not a good installment in the SW series.  When the ending credits start and the whole audience errupts in applause, and these idiots say it is not a good movie!? Please. Those nitpicky idiots who didn't like the film have nothing better to do than complain about every little detail ( and are probably the same anal type of people that nobody can get along with - and that you can never satisfy).  SEE THE FILM. Don't listen to those idiot critics out there. THIS IS A FUN FILM WELL WORTH THE PRICE OF ADMISSION!!

Author: fish_lung
Review_Title: Great Adventure - Huge Step up From TPM
Review: Don't believe the self-important film critics and wannabe indy-film student reviewers, this is a very good film, but more importantly, it's a great time at the movies!  The visuals are incredible, the sets and backgrounds are breathtaking, the special effects are what we have come to expect, groundbreaking, and the battle scenes are unreal.  Seeing Yoda in action alone is worth seeing the film!  The dialogue and acting, while still typically Lucas-style choppy, are better than Phantom Menace, and Hayden Christenson is a force (excuse the pun) to be reckoned with in Hollywood. He delivers a great performance as a coming of age Jedi struggling with the inner demons that will eventually lead him to... well, we all know where he ends up.  But despite that foreknowledge, you're still captivated by him and the rollercoaster ride of his emotions. AOTC follows the same pattern that Lucas established with the first trilogy. While A New Hope, and subsequently Phantom Menace were bright, colorful films, which mainly introduce us to the essential characters and give a thin base story from which to launch the rest of the trilogy, Attack of the Clones in turn follows Empire Strikes Back step for step.  It is dark and brooding, like Empire, it has 2 separate plots which branch out, and then come back together, like Empire, and ends with a battle scene eerily similar to Empire's climax.  And in the same frustrating and wonderful way as Empire, Clones raises far more questions than it answers.

Author: larathecroft
Review: The drones and robots could have done a better acting job.  Just when I thought the series couldn't get any worse, here it is.   Episode II, an even more unstable, unstructured, boring, badly if edited at all, emotionless, sloppy, terrible attempt at movie genius.  The only thing that makes the movie bearable is the special effects, which is nothing in comparison when compared to all of the other movies that came out that year.  No originality, eye widening, or gasping scenes.  The plot line is as a zig zag line, or even a dotted line, which stops and goes in different directions without reaching any impacting climax at the end.  The romantic relationship between Anakin and the Princess was awkward, due to the fact that he was eight years old when they first met, and she was a teenager.   In addition it was just out right lame, forced, and both actors had no chemistry together.  (Spoilers)  The worse was the ending, which is a rushed action scene in which there is no impact at all to the audience, and in the end, Anakin's arm is chopped off with no emphasis.  Then in a pathetic attempt to awe the audience Yoda fights the bad guy.  This is just terrible, but then again, the bad guy really had no deep conflict with any of the characters, so it didn't matter who fought him.  Then the scene in addition is chopped, and we are hurled into the next scene with a horrible ceremony, with two emotionless, bad actors getting married.  I have no idea why this movie received such high reviews, I have no idea how it could make over $300 million dollars just by being a follow-up of it's superior predecessors. Everyone complains about Jar Jar, he was the only character that brought life and feeling to the movie.  Now that is sad.  All I can say is that it is a terrible movie, and I will not waste a penny to see the next one. Take you money and rent the original 3 Star Wars reruns, trust me, it will be more satisfying.

Author: marymcg
Review: I saw AOTC last night on DVD, hoping to enjoy it, because I'd heard good things, and I enjoyed Hayden Christiansen in My Life as a House, and Natalie Portman in Leon, Samuel L Jackson in Pulp Fiction, and Ewan McGregor in just about everything. Oh dear! Maybe it's me, but I'd get as much enjoyment from and episode of Star Trek. While I can admire the geniuses that created the look of the film, the problem is the script. It is just too simplistic, for what is supposedly a big theme, epic movie... The actors looked uncomfortable throughout, and apart from the "It's star wars!" factor, I can't imagine why they would want to do it... Another thing, I appreciate that the film is part of a series, but shouldn't each episode be able to stand alone in terms of entertainment? At the end of this film, there is an overwhelming sense that it is unfinished, like an episode of a Danielle Steele mini-series, following a great family dynasty over 60 or 70 years... "tune in, in 2005, to find out what happens next between Anakin and Amidala, and find out if Obi Wan Kenobi can save the galaxy before his beard turns white". With Harry Potter, and Lord of the Rings, I didn't get the same sense of incompletion. This is probably going too far, but the film feels like a giant advertisement for Star Wars Inc. The company's outlived its usefulness, lets revive the movies, and give it a new lease of life.

Author: CGanim8t0r
Review: Being a huge Star Wars fan guru, this movie contains a balance between what is pleasant and what is unsatisfactory.

Author: gajnak
Review: The WOW is back, but for different reasons from the original.  The first Star Wars film, Episode IV in the saga, was a supremely delightful popcorner that succeeded because of its then ground-breaking special effects, humor and its hint at a much larger universe encompassing its story line. It was absolute perfection for what it was.

Author: stroutjr
Review: This is primarily a love story, and not a very good one!  The clones don't really get involved until the bitter end.  I know it's tough to do a sequel, but bigger and more don't cut it.  The plot was thin, acting bad and there were no real villains.

Author: philipmurphy
Review_Title: And the best actor award goes to... Yoda!
Review: With 20 minutes of editing, this would have a been a great movie.  Those 20 minutes of course would be the "romantic" scenes between Anikan Skywalker and Padme Amidala.  My 7 seven year old son and his friends were just gagging at the existence of "mushy" scenes, while the adults were just embarrassed to be watching what was essentially a high school level performance.  The audience in today's showing in Seattle reacted in the only sane way possible - they broke out laughing every time McGregor and Portman appeared in another silly romantic setting.  What else can you do with a script that has Padme saying "she will not let it happen" (giving us a cruelly false sense of hope) and next is entertaining the puppy-love-struck Jedi by the fire in a very enticing dress....  And the Sound of Music scene?

Author: psychox78
Review: **(Possible Spoilers Ahead!!)** Attack of the Clones is a wonderful film worthy of the name, "Star Wars". Lucas seems to have generally listened to his fans and added (or removed) things that left Episode 1 with a sour feeling for some.  This time around, expect to see: 1). a smaller, less annoying role for Jar-Jar Binks, 2). SPECTACULAR battles (with some of the most memorable scenes in the entire series), 3). an engrossing and informative story--complete with many scenes, lines, and characters that begin to tell the story of things to come, and 3). very good acting--some of the best of the series (including exceptional performances from Ewen Mcgregor and Yoda).  I will try not spoil to much as the film needs to be seen.  It focuses on Anakin Skywalker--now grown--protecting the former Queen--now Senator Padme' Amidala from a few assassination attempts and their growing love affair.  Meanwhile, Obi-wan has put on the detective hat and begins looking into the identity of the assassin and a mysterious Clone Army.  More into the film, as the action begins to heat up, the film culminates into quite possibly the best action sequences of the entire series--with an emphasis on a terrific Yoda.  All in all, I would highly recommend seeing this film, as it contains all the plot, action, and intrigue that a Star Wars fan could ask for.

Author: shortfatandallthat
Review: Honestly was not impressed.  Was disappointed that a good majority of the film was shot on a green screen, and it was painfully obvious.  The dialogue was cheesy, the C3po puns were horrid, and the romantic plot was weak.  I remember the good old days when people spent time in the make-up chair, instead of just pushing buttons on a computer.  I miss the actual alien dudes, no more computers! I would have been just as happy if they had fast fowarded thru the first 2 hours, and push play when we get to the Yoda fight. This was the only thing that I enjoyed. Sorry die-hard fans, but not Lucas' best work. The originals are always going to be the best.

Author: dave70
Review_Title: What happened to the Star Wars saga?
Review: Oh how I long for the days of the Original Trilogy. What now passes for the Star Wars opus is a bunch of overwrought, obvious CGI shots and such wooden acting that makes you cringe (damn was the "romance" scene boring!). This wasn't a Star Wars film, it was The Mummy Returns to Outer Space.

Author: Ozymandias_the_King
Review_Title: It sure looks good...just don't use your brain.
Review: I thought that Jedi were supposed to be wise.  Let's see, Obi Wan goes to a planet which has been erased from the Jedi Archives to find a cloning factory where some Jedi ordered the creation of an army of clones 10 (ten) years ago.  Oddly though, none of the Jedi Council know anything about it. Not even Yoda.  The army is cloned from a bounty hunter named Fett.  Obi Wan follows Fett to the leaders of the Separatist movement, Count Dooku.  Fett is working for Dooku, who tells Obi Wan about the Sith Lord, Darth Sidious. Dooku even tells Obi Wan that Sidious has control of the Senate. Now, Dooku himself is a rogue Jedi.  He leads the battle against the Jedi. Master Jedi Mace Windu not only sees Fett with Dooku, but decapitates him. Why is the dark side so mysterious?  Because Lucas is playing the Jedi mind trick on the weak minded masses.  A clear minded six-year-old could figure it out.  My nephew did.  So why are Yoda, Master Windu, and Obi Wan so baffled.  Because Lucas is using cool special effects for misdirection. Sadly though, Lucas sucks as a Director.  Everyone knows the best two Star Wars Episodes (Empire Strikes Back, and Return of the Jedi) were directed by someone other than Lucas.  It's obvious throughout the whole film.

Author: SherlockJr
Review_Title: The Force Is Strong With This One
Review: Sure, the critics hated it, but they hated it for all the reasons that make the Star Wars series great: cheesy acting in the leads, solid acting from supporting characters and villains, incredible special effects, well-choreographed action, and good versus evil.  If you consider yourself a Star Wars fan, you will love it. If you aren't a fan, see it anyway, so Lucas can finance Episode III

Author: disneyguy1313
Review_Title: Dangerous and Disturbing with Good Reason
Review: "Star Wars: Episode II - Attack of the Clones" is the best "Star Wars" movie to date. Granted that it does have its moments of non-greatness, it is an overall enjoyable movie with an intriguing central character.

Author: franseag
Review_Title: I'd like to see a 10 year-old rate this movie...
Review: ..unfortunately, there aren't a whole lot of 10 year-olds writing reviews. That generation had to like this movie.

Author: mickisdaddy
Review: My wife and I were lucky enough to see it last night at a premiere.  We both loved it.  Lucas sure is making Anikin and Amidala look like their future children (Luke and Lea).  The ending is intense.  Everyone in the theater cheered at the end.  Do go see it if you were not planning on it.  I liked it better than any of the other Star Wars movies.

Author: DragonZfiRe
Review: George Lucas may have created the Star Wars universe, but he shouldn't be directing the movies.  Maybe he was better when he was younger.  Star Wars and American Grafitti were excellent.  He is better at producing and creating.  Episode 5 and 6 he didn't direct and they turned out better than 1 and 2 by a longshot.

Author: w_sasso_mdtv
Review_Title: An emotional thrill ride from start to finish
Review: "Star Wars: Episode II-Attack of the Clones", George Lucas' 5th installment of the Star Wars Saga, is truly a wonder to behold.  The film is rich with dramatic intensity, dynamic story-telling, and some of the best action scenes ever witnessed.  Lucas has gotten back to his roots, and has created one of the finest films in a long time, and, dare I say, the best of all the Star Wars films.  The pieces of the saga are starting to fall into place nicely, as we see the beginning of the end for the Galactic Republic, and Anakin Skywalker's inevitable descent to the dark side.  My grade...A-

Author: mwmills1969
Review_Title: Silly action sequences and poor dialogue
Review: Although many people criticized Phantom Menace, I enjoyed it.  I liked the calm Zen-ness of the Jedis, and the action sequences were "believable".

Author: supagopha
Review_Title: Jaw dropping effects and exceptionally fun moments heavily weighed down by some poor performances.
Review: After seeing Attack of the Clones today I left the theater chatting with my friends about the insane coolness that is Yoda and other such things, but I also felt a little disappointed.  For a good portion of the film I had gone back to my wide-eyed days of a pre-teen as ships raced through the skies and lightsabers sliced the air.  I felt that tingle of excitement as dozens of jedi drew the sabers, preparing for the ensuing battle.  Unfortunately, I am no longer at the age of ten or eleven.

Author: jobo23_99
Review: Attack of the Clones is roughly Avogadro's number times better than Phantom Menace.  The story unfolds to a much higher standard in this chapter of the epic trilogy of trilogies...we get to see many "historical" figures and previously vague references made in the latter trilogy are fleshed out for us for the first time.  Of course, we still have to be bored to tears by flat acting in the romance aspect (although I must say that Padama's outfits were "sheerly" amazing...pardon the pun), which has no business in a sci-fi action flick but, for the sake of understanding where Luke and Leia came from, it is something I can deal with...

Author: tfunk3780
Review: I couldn't help but feel that George Lucas was bragging in the first few drawn out scenes; with special effects fit for an interactive theater.  But I think the man was suckered into making the movie into a commercial.  I hope he knows better. With the latest teenie-bopper actors and terrible cliches (a robot in a diner with a Boston accent and a skirt...come on!) I think this movie is seriously turning away from the direction the original trilogy took us. The plot was good, I think, but elaborated by the wrong cast (except for Obi Wan- Ewan McGregor was flawlessly convincing!)  And thankyou Yoda for the choreography- I was beginning to think you were all talk.  The foreshadowing of Anakin Skywalker's transition to Darth Vader?  Too early, too strong, too cheesy, all said with a pouty lower lip I've seen on my 3 year old sister before. Hey Lucas, ditch the contracting toymakers and give us a real movie.

Author: johnbeer
Review_Title: Lucas has fallen to the dark side...
Review: Being a huge Star Wars fan myself, I was very eager to see the next chapter in this saga. I must admit I have been dissapointed by the Phantom Menace which I found evasive and quirky compared to the more "serious" or "classics" sequels. Nevertheless, I had heard the second one would be different, that it would be targeted at a more adult audience and I hoped some people might have learn from their past mistakes... But what I saw makes me beleive Lucas has fallen to the dark side of the force...

Author: DJ Kris
Review: Since i can remember my self,i've been a great Star Wars fan!I can watch all the movies (yes,EVEN Episode I!) without get bored and every time i like them more and more.I'm not the kind of fun that collects every toy that comes out or stuff like that.I like the movies and their plot,the way that they are made,the feeling that every movie provides... I belong to the fans that were a bit dissapointed by Episode I but i knew that this was only the beginning and that in some years i was going to see one of the best Star Wars movies! I went to the theater to watch a Star Wars movie,to be taken in this familiar universe and have some wonderfull moments.And i was not dissapointed this time...Attack of the Clones is wonderfull made,from the beginning till the end!The story is better than Episode I and the characters have more depth.Ewan McGregor and Hayden Christensen are making an incredible duo,the way they speak and act is very enjoyable! I've read some bad reviews about the chemistry between Christensen and Natalie Portman,but i think that it is set up vey good.It is not Shakespeare,it is not even Titanic but it's ok,just ok,a very good love story in the Star Wars universe.And i don't want to hear anything about comparissons with the classic trilogy!It is the new trilogy and it has a totally new feeling,that is to be expected! My only instance about the movie has to do something with the greatest actor that AOTC has:Christofer Lee.In this final scene,where he challenges Yoda into a lightsaber duel it seems like Lucas wrote it just to please the fans.I mean,what do the fans awaited all the years?To see once Yoda fighting!And Lucas writes a very cheesy dialogue for Christofer Lee's role and it seems like Count Dooku is only there to announce something like "Hey,fans,this is what you have waiting for!See Yoda fighting!".This is my only instance,because when the fight begins,WOW,it was really something never seen before!Good job! I don't know,i would like to tell more but without give any more spoiklers,it's a bit difficult.The movie rocks,it is the movie every Star Wars fan,hardcore or not,wanted to see.It has fun,it has emotion, it has darkness and,yes,it has mistakes but,hell,it is Star Wars that you are watching to!A must for the fans.Well,other people can se it too but only after watching at least Episode I.I rated this movie 10/10 and i can't wait till 2005 for Episode III!

Author: kristopherwaddell
Review_Title: Even better than the real thing
Review: Attack of the Clones is without a doubt the most enjoyable cinematic experience in a long while.  For the Star Wars fan this is the film you have been waiting for....for the partner of the star wars fan this is a movie you can really sit back and enjoy, unlike Phantom Menace, and we all thank you terribly for sitting through it with us.

Author: greggiern
Review: so many newspapers and critics are talking about how bad this movie was, im sorry but your all just very wrong, this was definitely one of the greatest movies of all times, and im not obsessed or anything, ive seen it twice, ill probably see it once or twice more in the movies, but its just such an awesome movie, it has everything!

Author: timstumbo
Review_Title: Tremendous Film Flowing Full of the Force
Review: What can i say, It's a breathtaking movie indeed. The movie was much better than Episode 1 in many ways which you will observe by going and viewing the movie yourself. Over all the love scenes in my opinion were under acted but the Incredible battle scenes and duels make up for it. Over all the movie is well worth the money and I would encourage you to go and see it soon.

Author: darlingp-1
Review_Title: Attack brings the Star Wars movies back to the glory days.
Review: First of all let me just say that although I thought the Phantom Menace was okay it did not live up to the standard of the first three. Now with Attack of the Clones Lucas has restored my faith in the Star Wars franchise. This movie is nothing short of spectacular and ranks up with Empire in sheer enjoyment and awe. I was never board, always on the edge of my seat and wanted to see the film again the second it ended. As far as I can see the only way someone wouldn't like the film is if they hate Sci-fi to begin with. Lets not forget that the origin Star Wars was greeted with countless bad reviews from critics. Don't listen to them listen to the fans and people who go to movies for fun not an epiphany.

Author: sundayseven
Review: This Movie was the best cinematic experience i've had in a long long time. The sound was awesome,  the effects,   even better and story is unfolding very nicely to toward the conclusion that we all know. Anakin has made his first few steps toward turning over. The little death star plan was indeed a nice touch.  Yoda....well he ain't called Master Yoda for nothing!  I found a whole new respect for that little dude.  Mace Windu was efficient as expected.  And the explanation By Anakin of how he attacked the tusken raiders was moving to say the least...along the empire theme music playing in the background. All in all one of the best Star Wars movies to date. Mr. Lucas, i'll be giving you another 7 bucks next week!!!  save me a seat!!!

Author: greg_wilson
Review: How many things in life give you a visceral reaction each and every time you experience them?  Seeing an overwhelming work of art.  Catching a whiff of perfume or soap that an old flame always wore.  Hearing a song on the radio that marked a significant event in your life.  All of these things immediately take me back to the moment when I experience them.  One of the other things is seeing the words `STAR WARS' outlined in blue scream onto a movie screen while the first few chords of the Star Wars theme music stream into my ears.  When this happens, I am 10 years old again, in a dark theater in Pebble Beach, California.  I am clearly not alone in this, as it is widely documented how the viewing of this film was a watershed event in the lives of so many people my age.

Author: pinkflyd777
Review_Title: Finally a worthy successor to the original trilogy!
Review: After the disappointment I felt with "The Phantom Menace, I am very pleased to say that the series is back on track with "Episode 2".   Yoda, R2D2, and C3P0 are finally given more screen time and Jar Jar only has about 2 minutes of screen time.  PERFECT!  The droids have always provided the comic relief and they just don't need the annoying hijinks of Jar Jar. I'm rating this movie a "9" out of "10", only dropping one star because of some hokey dialogue in the love story. But Lucas has really redeemed the series with this one and now I'm really looking forward to "Episode 3."

Author: akenathos
Review: I've seen SW-II, yesterday night, and...what to say? Simply perfect! Again, George confirmed his genius in directing, in creating and transmitting emotions. The film is complete: romantic, dramatic, astonishing, breathtaking, 2:30 hours of pure amusement. The characters are well-"designed", the actors well selected and, obvious, perfectly directed, and the battles...wow, a real thrilling experience! The moment I saw Yoda taking his lightsabre to duel with Dooku...unforgettable. And what about the perfect way of describing the Anakin's dangerous behavior that will lead him to the Dark Side? First, I was very frightened about this film, because it represented a milestone thru the entire SW saga, so there was the risk it could "ruin" all the good work done before, but then...I even stayed for the following projection, and it won't be the last, you can count on it! At the end, a prophecy: SW-III will be the best SW episode ever, the confirmation that George Lucas is one of the best directors ever lived, together with Sergio Leone, Stanley Kubrick and less more... Jesus, still 3 years...how will we do?

Author: Obi-Wan Wilson
Review: I saw Star Wars Episode II - Attack of the Clones the first day, first showing at the closest theatre, I had reserved tickets 2 weeks in advance and I was one of the 4 first people in the theatre.  Why?  Because I knew that Episode II would much better than Episode I.  Many people including me, did not think Episode I lived up to it's expectations.  The special effects were great, but it was too childish for me.  Although I liked the movie enough, it lacked the bang and the excitement of the original films, save for the podrace and final lightsaber duel.  But Episode II definitely made up for all that, with a more serious plot filled with excitement all the way through.

Author: jreiles
Review: For anyone who wants a brief but to the point synopsis regarding whether this movie is a hit or a worse clone of the phantom menance:Yoda is my new idol!!! Need I say more??? I will never see him in the same light again!!!

Author: kentmicho
Review_Title: Nothing Oscar worthy, except special effects, but so what?
Review: The movie was thoroughly entertaining.  Many people have commented on the 1st 1/2 being a little slow, but if it was as fast as the 2nd half, you'd be worn out by the end.  It's a great addition to the Star Wars series.  It's exactly what it needed to be:  fun, action, and a plot that moves us to the next movie.  Was it somewhat predictable?  Of course -- we all know the ending already.  Even so, Lucas managed to get in a few surprises.

Author: kellperr
Review: As usual with a Star Wars film, the special effects are top shelf. The creatures, planets and space ships are all perfectly rendered. Unfortunately, it's the human element -- the actors, scripts and dialogue -- that is a major disappointment. No one has conversations. They give speeches, and some are unintentionally funny, even during serious moments. No one truly seem connected on any level, except that the script says they have relationships of one sort or another. Except for Christopher Lee, who does an excellent turn as an evil Jedi,  the main actors are outclassed by their computer generated co-stars. Quite frankly, I've seen better acting in junior high school productions. The core of the storyline is a split within the Republic that some are trying to heal. But it's never explained why it's such a tragedy that it's happening. And the cutting between one plot line to another was maddening at times. All in all, it's a jumbled mess. The required light saber fights and the battle scenes were spectacular, but in other parts of the film, the computer generated effects just got in the way, as the frame was filled with so many moving objects it was hard to tell what the audience was supposed to be looking at. With a built-in market of hardcore Star Wars fans, George Lucas could just go through the motions of making a film and still rake in millions of dollars. To his credit, he tried, but fell far short of a satisfying film experience. Perhaps the third time will be the true charm.

Author: IL Buono
Review_Title: A treat for all you Jedi Masters out there !
Review: Pure and simple: This is the best sci-fi movie to come down the pike in a LONG time. In fact, since 1980. (The Empire Strikes Back.) Attack of the Clones has faced paced battles, chases, duels, and the greatest FX seen in film to date! I won't give you a sypnosis, you can get that anywhere. Instead I'll tell you exactly why you should see this movie. First and foremost, the movies climax shows us The Battle of Genosis, an engagement that makes Hoth look like peanuts. With literally tens of thousands of droids and clones, this is the first real star WAR. The performances save those of Portman and Christanson are all good. Also, the supporting cast is all given significant screen time.

Author: ck2pr
Review_Title: Attack of the Bad Lines and Plot Holes
Review: I am shocked at the number of people who say they LOVED this movie so much when there were big plot holes and really cheesy badly timed lines!  I liked some of the action in this movie, but for me it was mostly disappointing. First off, the name alone "Attack of the Clones".  How is it an attack when it was a rescue mission for the good guys?!  I just don't get it!

Author: sinema hound
Review_Title: If George Lucas had the technology....
Review: If George Lucas had the technology, I'm sure he would be using digital avatars instead of actors.

Author: tilted_splash
Review: I know that I'm a little late as far as Star Wars fans go but I heard about this website from a friend of mine.

Author: houston-11
Review: I think George Lucas should not be allowed within 100 yards of anything Star Wars.  The man spent $140 million on CGI effects that look terrible when he could have spent $40 million on goo and plastic models and it would have looked real.  Not to mention the fact that there is no memorabilia to show for the movie.  With the old movies you could order Darth Vader's Helmet or storm trooper gear or even an X-wing fighter through niemen marcus but with these last two works of garbage are you going to go on Ebay and bid on the floppy disk that contains the Codes for Yodas skin graphics?

Author: barbs-1
Review: By George he's done it!

Author: padme amidala
Review_Title: One of the coolest movies of all time!
Review: This movie is so awesome! it has 2 great young actors(Natalie Portman, Hayden Christensen)That do absolutely brilliant. It is filled with action, romance, and a bit of comedy from C-3po. Great special effects and it was so cool to see Yoda in this film!This is a must see and it was also better than the first episode. I would give this movie an A++

Author: The Hankster
Review_Title: at least the special effects were good...
Review: *** possible spoilers ahead ***

Author: gilamonster
Review: I am SO relieved this was not the huge disappointment that Episode 1 turned out to be!  (I really wouldn't mind if I never had to see Jar Jar Binks again, even briefly, but that can be forgiven.)  I was worried, given some of the other comments I read, but I will most definitely be looking forward to Episode 3!

Author: user1951
Review: Well it is excellent.  I did not expect an intellectual film, this isn't Frank Herbert, but what it does do it does very well.  The visual effects remain stunning which is no mean feat.  Lucas created a standard for special effects which others struggled to keep up with.  By the time the Phantom Menace was released the effects had become commonplace...this film recovers Lucas' lead in this area. The role of the hero/putative villain is central. In episode I Anakin was necessarily a horrible little kid with a grating voice - after all nobody could imagine a young Darth Vader as anything but unpleasant. In this episode he is exactly right although it is hard to see how the American government allowed this one to get through! I will not give the plot away but Anakin's reaction to his mother's fate on Tattooine is a very good motivation for his eventual turn to the dark side...signified by the use of dark side music for the first time with this character.  The analogy with the Americans in Afghanistan was pretty blatant.

Author: MB091
Review: I was satisfied with how this movie turned out. It was alot better than The Phantom Menance. The biggest battle scene ever in a Star Wars movie was in this one and I enjoyed it. The best parts of the movie were the parts on Geonosis and one part on Tatooine with Anakin. There were the parts on Kamino which were good too. I did happen to like Obi-Wan better in Episode 1 than in this one. There were alot more Jedi in this one and I really liked that alot. My favorite character was Anakin though. I really enjoyed the part where he fought Dooku. Yoda has a couple of surprises in store for everyone in this one. The Clone Wars starts and the Republic is beginning to crumble and will eventually become the Empire. We also get to see the Clonetroopers who will become Stormtroopers I think. Overall this was a good movie and much better than episode one.

Author: JediOfTheNewRepublic
Review_Title: Episode II - Dissapontment Strikes Back1!!! Part 3
Review: ***choreography***

Author: JediOfTheNewRepublic
Review_Title: Episode II - Dissapontment Strikes Back1!!! Part 2
Review: ***Special Effects***

Author: JediOfTheNewRepublic
Review_Title: Episode II - Disappontment Strikes Back1!!! Part 1
Review: Oh dear... Oh dear, oh dear, oh dear.... Mr Lucas... What Have you done?

Author: Mootman
Review_Title: A sort of pretty good Star Wars flick...
Review: A film with a lot of obvious strong and weak points, AOTC is probably a more dramatic experience than 1999´s "Phantom Menace". Nevertheless the story seems to be getting increasingly overcrowded, with all manner of subplots flying in and out of the main storyline(s). The movie´s most disappointing element is probably the handling of the romance between Anakin Skywalker and Padme Amidala. Not many excuses can be made for the faux-poetic and stiff interaction we are given here.

Author: jessgupta
Review: I just saw 'Clones' for the first time at the local IMAX and it is, unfortunately, a poor installment in a steadily declining epic.  I was unaware that there were cuts made from the original theatrical release, however I became suspicious when Jimmy Smits suddenly appeared at the end, eliciting laughs from the confused audience.  Apparently we were supposed to meet his character earlier on, but instead we just see Victor Sifuentes standing amongst intergalactic senators.  Is there a better piece of evidence that Lucas and his team have lost touch with audiences and their original passion for this saga?  Their new service seems to be Industrial Leverage and Marketing, because the 'magic', as with all things digital, is simply a sampling of what it was before.

Author: medla96
Review_Title: I think this trilogy is going well but not great
Review: I have to say that I think this movie and episode 1 were about equal.  For me there was nothing in E1 that was great, but I didn't' think there were any parts that were just bad either.  However episode II had parts that just plain amazed me but then had parts that I just hated.  So I think both films balance out.

Author: JolietJerry
Review_Title: If this wasn't a Star Wars film, I would have walked out...
Review: First, let me note that I have been a steady defender of Episode I. I've defended Jar Jar Binks, Jake Lloyd, and the sometimes wooden acting and bad dialouge of the first prequel. After all, when I go to see a Star Wars film, I'm not looking for Oscar quality performances or some deep insight into the meaning of life; I'm looking to be entertained. I've been entertained for over 25 years by the original trilogy and by Episode I (to a lesser extent...but still entertained). With that out of the way let me say that Episode II is one of the biggest train wrecks of cinema history. True, this movie will make hundreds of millions of dollars - give yourself a hand Mr. Lucas, you've accomplished what is evidently your only goal. Episode I was flawed but I had high hopes Lucas would raise the bar with this film and bring to the screen the epic battles of the Clone Wars we've been waiting for...along with the first signs of Anakin's turn to the dark side. Anakin...oh, Anakin. First Jake Lloyd and now Hayden Christensen. Who in the hell ever thought this guy could act in commercials, let alone one of the biggest franchises in the history of movies. Bottom line...he's terrible. Not that he had a chance with the juvenile dialouge given to him (and nearly everyone else) by Mr. Lucas and Mr. Hale. At two points I started laughing out loud at the ponderous and cheesy "romantic" exchanges between Anakin and Amidala. Give me a break! The epic battle scenes we've imagined? Replaced by more CGI robots vs. uninteresting humans in front of blue screens. Because that's what you've reduced Star Wars to George. No one except you, your army of yes-men, and yes-fans are amazed by CGI anymore...it's old hat my friend. It's been around for over 10 years, get over it. Don't get me wrong, ILM does a magnificant job with what was put on their plate. But my question is...why? Why have such a ridiculous number of CGI shots?
