We didn't need them to suspend our belief 20 years ago and we don't need all of them now. I love good CGI if it's used only when there's no other way of making something happen on screen. Lucas uses it constantly.  Even if they used a cardboard and plastic set  it may look a little phony but it's actually there, and our minds know this. I'd like to know how many sets were built for this movie, maybe 3? Regardless of how good the effects are, our brains still register it as not really there...and it takes away from the experience. Consider a scene where Amidala and Anakin have lunch: did everything except the table have to be CGI? No...a set could have been built and the movie (and actors) would have benefitted from it. Lucas, however, is so in love with his computers he's lost the human element of his movies. This is what Star Wars used to be all about. There is one crowning achievement in CGI in this film though: Yoda. Not only does he show why he's THE master (in a lightsaber fight that desperately needed him to give it a spark) but he's the best "actor" in this movie. Which pretty much sums up the problems with this movie: when a CGI character outclasses all the humans, you've got a problem. Attack Of The Clones: big on special effects; small on emotion, dialogue, competent acting/directing, and carrying on a film legacy. Note to George Lucas: if you still care you have a GIGANTIC task ahead of you with Episode III. Please return this franchise to some respectability. I know your rich and think you can do no wrong but you have. Not all Star Wars fans are mindless sheep following the pack. Please restore our faith. Until then, I'm going to see installment 2 of the "real" trilogy of the 21st century: The Lord of the Rings! I suggest you do the same. You'll see movies made with a love and character I think you've ever known, and CGI used beautifully only where it's really needed.

Author: toddgo23
Review_Title: It's Star Wars, it is required viewing.
Review: If you didnt like Star Wars or Empire Strikes Back, you will probably HATE Attack of the Clones.  So, don't bother.  This review is for the other 95% of humanity that thought those movies were CLASSICS.

Author: dtatz
Review: This movie reperesents laziness in many ways to me.  Even though it does take an awful lot of effort to make a movie, especially one of this flavor and magnitude, it seems Mr Lucas just even trying hard enough.  The movie replaces many elements of realism with overly cartoonish CGI.  The movie seems to almost fully abandon using real sets and people.  The actors spent most of their time in front of a blue screen.  To add to it, we are presented with overacting that would struggle to find it's way even into B-movies, which is supremely sad because much of the cast is quite talented. The script in itself, presents a boring, flakey, and shallow love story.

Author: zack007
Review: Granted, Attack of the Clones was a major improvement from Phantom Menace. Jango Fett was a cool character and any mention of "Boba" is a nice addition.  H. christionson was pretty bad, but what can you expect from a modern Star Wars film.  Am i the only one who thinks the new movies should NEVER have been made?  Also, I might be alone on this but I dont like the CGI.  The puppets used in the early films were classic.  Anyway, thats my opinion.

Author: MezrichA
Review_Title: More boring than George Lucas's check shirts
Review: Considering the effort and technical expertise that went into making this film, it's exceedingly bad.  But what else can we expect from a man who, at this stage in his career, clearly doesn't want to make worthwhile films anymore? When the screen isn't filled with beautiful CGI, it's graced by some of the most wooden acting seen, well, since The Phantom Menace. Natalie Portman is her usual pallid self. The young Darth Vader (Hayden, stop frowning so hard! You'll hurt your face!) has all the menace and presence of character from 'Dawson's Creek'. Ewan MacGregor seems lost in his role and his accent is an utterly stupid attempt to mimic Alec Guinness. On the plus side Christopher Lee wanders in an blows the rest of the cast off the screen. He doesn't even need to speak. Unfortunately, he soon has to make way for some interminable 'action' sequence and the computerised juggernaut comes back to life. What is the point of this film? To give Star Wars fans closure? To add to the sum of human happiness? To demonstrate that computers are indeed very powerful these days?  Or is it merely a tedious, shallow money-making exercise designed to strip mine the wallets of the unwary worldwide. Do yourself and the world a massive favour: avoid this vacant marketing ploy. They are trying to steal your money.

Author: tghillebrant
Review_Title: Why I loved Episode II of the Star Wars saga...
Review: I really loved Episode II.  It was everything I have come to expect from George Lucas and his production team.  The effects were astounding to say the least, and the character development was well done.  I really liked that the Trade Federation, and their role in the scheme of things was expanded upon, and I loved the new alien cultures that were introduced in the movie as well.(Kamino was my favorite) I can hardly wait for Episode III, but will have to satisfy myself with my DVD's of Eps. I and II.

Author: Bobofett1010
Review_Title: All true Star Wars fan's would like this movie.
Review: Star Wars Episode 2 is a good movie yet you may hear it is very poorly written and has bad acting which it doesn't although I could agree it's script was a little poorly written but I could see someone saying that Episode 1 had all these faults but everyone seemed to like Episode 1 more than 2, I really have to disagree there. If anything Episode 1 had wooden acting, not Episode 2.

Author: dwainegibson
Review_Title: Ewan McGregor's dodgy accents ruin films
Review: And I this is enough of grating reason to take away the full and captivating experience of the Star Wars legends. Personally I feel that the main heroes villains should be free from preconceptual baggage and be relatively unknown but very promising actors. Not always possible I know, but Lucas obviously did settle for stars that were at the time, much in fashion.

Author: giammamike
Review_Title: Star Wars Episode II Attack of the Clones
Review: It's hard to say anything that hasn't been said before about Star Wars, any Star Wars. All I can add is anything anyone has against the dialogue in the love scenes, Lucas knew prior to shooting, and it was completely intentional. The love scenes and the declarations of love were written and shot in an old-fashioned 1930s style, as pertaining to westerns and serials of the period. You don't even have to buy it, just read Mythmaking: Behind the Scenes of Attack of the Clones; it's very informative. Episodes I-III are very plot heavy. Each scene means something to the whole. And this episode is very necessary in making Anakin's pledge to the Dark Side work. If you don't watch this first or take what happens in this film as laid groundwork, then Anakin's turn in Revenge of the Sith will sound forced and contrived. I'm intentionally not breaking into a long list of I LOVE THIS and I LOVE THAT because it just sounds pedantic to me. Having rated it 10 (for the entire saga) should be enough. And besides, you can hear all the same crap from someone else.

Author: oddjob589
Review_Title: Better than Phantom, but that's not saying much
Review: *This may contain some spoilers here and there*

Author: diane060284
Review_Title: Love and action all in one
Review: I love how Ani tells Padme while they are away that he loves her. But she can't love him due to it is frowned upon for a Jedi to have love or feelings for the fact. After Ani finds out his mother was sold and then abducted he feels anger that a Jedi shouldn't. More so since the death of his mother. After they go and try to find Obi-wan they get captured Padme tells Ani she love's him. I love it. Then they Marry at the end in a secret wedding. Only R2D2 and C3PO are there. The wedding is set on Padme's home planet. It's action and a good love story all in one. If you want a good movie this is one. I would recommend this movie to all who love a good love story and action movie in one.

Author: paul_meadows
Review: Lucas always said that his prequels would be very different from the original trilogy. How right he was as he has yet to surpass A New Hope or The Empire Strikes Back.

Author: destroyaaahhh
Review: So this is a joke, right ? This is not a movie, it's an unfinished assembly cut at best. Special effects are clunky and look terribly fake, the plot makes no sense at all, the acting is uninspired, the action scenes are confusing and pointless and we have to witness the worse love story ever put to film. This "movie" is just an excuse to showcase special effect that will be turned into toys to make money, it's basically a 2 hours long advertisement campaign for Star Wars merchandise, it's insulting. I could go on and on but there is no point : I would be putting more effort in my review than George Lucas did in this movie . This movie has no redeeming qualities, if I could I would give it a zero, so even less than The Phantom Menace. This is not a movie, it's advertisement disguised as a movie and anyone with a brain and some self esteem should be against this sort of things be put on the screen. This is the death of cinema as an form of art.

Author: yazakal
Review_Title: Special EFX make up for a poor Story!
Review: I really didn't believe in the new trilogy of star wars until i watched revenge of the Sith which i really loved, so i decided to watch Episode II for the sake of Star Wars and i must say i was bored to death for the first hour, i only got excited to watch the load of special EFX at the end with disconnecting my heart from Star Wars as a whole! This is not Star Wars, i cant seem to relate it to the old trilogy as a whole story of six Episodes and thats the worse thing to ever happen to the Star Wars Saga, but thank god Revenge of the Sith redeemed it again! I truly believe Lucas should have pushed the new Trilogy into a single 3 hours Episode (Revenge of the Sith that is) and compress Anakins Story into one Episode named " Revenge of the Sith" or "The Rise of lord Vader" or something cool, but he chose to Kill the whole Saga with Special EFX Overwork! any way watch it for the CG creatures, nothing else is worth watching! I wish Lucas can read these comments on IMDb! I am a true Star Wars Fan George!!

Author: chuckbutterworth
Review_Title: What is everyone's problem, it's a great movie!
Review: I've seen Episode 2 four times now and love it more and more each time I see it.  I'm just enfuriated at all of the negative reviews.

Author: Tim-31
Review_Title: Second Best Star Wars film ever...
Review: Relax.  This film is everything you wanted The Phantom Menace to be, and if you're into lists then the top five Star Wars films of all time run like this: Empire, Clones, Hope, Jedi, Phantom.

Author: eileeshb
Review_Title: Fantastic, but some surprising links to other movies
Review: I saw the movie last night and it was great !!  Much more interesting that Phantom Menace.  Great acting all-round. But some of the scripting, oh boy .. I might be getting cynical as I watch more of these movies.  Some scenes were very similar to scene's in completely unrelated movies - LOTR(mines of moria), Gremlins 2(trust me if you've seen gremlins 2 you'll recognise it)... etc Very surprising really, and unfortunately that scene from gremlins that has a cousin in this movie make the scene funny which I'm sure it wasn't supposed to be. Nevertheless a great film.  Very enjoyable, and plenty of eye-candy for the girls.  Hayden is very cute, Ewan is suitable rugged ( though the beard was a bit too heavy for my taste), and Samuel is suitable impressive. One word on the costumes - FABULOUS !! Amidala's outfits are beautiful, every single one of them.. There were still a few of the excessive hairstyles, and there is a section where she looks like her future daughter (Leia).  Same outfit & very similar hair-style. But I await the next installment with breathless anticipation & to see what the next has in common with the next LOTR ;)

Author: MookieFL
Review: I simply can't believe that Hayden Christensen was cast in this role.  He is absolutely atrocious, and makes the wooden Natalie Portman look like Audrey Hepburn.  The two have NO chemistry--they get together because the plot requires it.  The dialogue is hackneyed from beginning to end, and if not for Ian McDiarmid and Christopher Lee, no human actor would stand out at all...(Ewan MacGregor tries, but he can only do so much with lines like "my Padawan still has much to learn.") The only heart in the movie comes from the digital actors--Yoda (who is unfortunately a source of unintentional comedy at the movie's climax), Watto, that fat fry cook at the beginning, and god forbid, even Jar Jar.  George actually lets them ACT...what a concept.

Author: skachick
Review: I, like many other Star Wars fans was disappointed with Episode 1. Too much Jar Jar, not enough Jedi action. Plot a little thin in lots of places. However, George has completely redeemed himself with Episode 2.

Author: bartman-10
Review: I just saw this movie, and it's worth the wait and the long lines.  I'll definitely see it again.  George Lucas really improved on episode I and returned to the traditional Star Wars we have been expecting, Enough action, battles and Light saber fights to satisfy even the most demanding Fan.

Author: SHD
Review: I think I was one of the few people to go see episode 1 just to be entertained, not because I expected it to be some masterpiece. I got what I came for: SW1:PM was nice, but by no means the best film ever. When going to see AOC, I had the same attitude. Imagine my surprise when this film turned out to be so much better than PM. By the way, even if the rest of the film had sucked worse than a black hole, Yoda's fight scene would have made it worth watching. Yoda kicks ass! Yoda rules!

Author: zabagabe-2
Review: First, let me start by saying yes, much, much better than Episode I it was. Where Menace was overindulgent in its special effects, cheesy characters (Jar Jar, anyone?), and chunky dialogue, Clones was much more character-driven. In addition, the largely reduced roles of the Digitally Animated characters led to a movie that felt much more like Episodes 4-6.

Author: rodster
Review_Title: Best Star Wars since A New Hope
Review: Ok, I know a lot of people were very disappointed about Episode I, though I wasn't I understand where they were coming from.  Ep. II is so much better, I saw it Wednesday night at midnight, and I tell you some of the things at the end which I won't spoil, are breath taking.  It is my personal opinion that attack is the best star wars ever.  I enjoyed it more than any of the others, which might have had something to do with visual effects.  I highly recommend this movie to any star wars fan, or any movie fan for that matter. Don't miss out.

Author: GrGr
Review: Woha, this one gave me my long lost Star Wars feeling back.

Author: jaredean
Review_Title: Seeing it at midnight with die-hard fans is the only way to go
Review: While it is a bit slow in the first 1/3, and the acting is (like all of them) pretty much terrible across the board, the last 2/3 of the movie do split into 2 separate story lines that are interesting and do hold your attention...

Author: Agent Hymie
Review: To me, the anticipation of a new STAR WARS film reminds me so much of my youth. So while i'm standing inline last night for the first midnight screening of EPISODE II: ATTACK OF THE CLONES (at Fox Studios), I felt like a big kid again. The last time I lined up for 3 hours for a film it was THE PHANTOM MENACE, wasn't overly impressed but it still didn't stop me seeing it on the big screen 3 times (and countless times on DVD).

Author: computerronnie
Review_Title: The perfect way to connect Episodes I and II.
Review: Episode II of the incredible saga of Star Wars features a teenaged Anakin Skywalker attempting to put his life together by reuniting with his love, Padme Amidala, freeing his mother, Shmi, assisting the Jedi and bringing balance to the force. Perfect. The perfect way to connect Episodes I and II. The movie starts out quickly by delivering the fact that someone is trying to kill Senator Amidala. Unlike most movies, it brings that point to a brief, sharp point. Technology seems updated and more advanced than in Episode I (*NOTE: Episode I did not have technology that was too futuristic. Rather, their technology was hot-roddish.), and similarities in the technology between Episode I and II do exist so the technology doesn't seem so different that it was fake. The character evolution was another perfection. Anakin shows signs of a bad temper, Amidala still retains her naiveness but still gets business done, Palpatine becomes darker and darker, Jar Jar is no longer annoying due to a decrease in screen time, and Yoda just gets older and wiser by the minute. Some people claim that the movie was too slow. So, the movie was slow, but actually the movie is more like Episode V: The Empire Strikes Back by serving as an update to the characters and events so that Episode III won't be confusing. All the "middle" episodes are just an explanation so that the "final" episodes can deliver plenty of final action without having to worry about explaining much. With a perfect movie preceding Episode III, I can't wait to see how the last installment would do. 10/10

Author: Mullzk
Review_Title: not as good as empire, but best to do
Review: a) i'm a big star wars fan, so I didn't have a lot of expectations after PM. but AotC really is good. Of course, empire, NH were definitly better, and I guess, I'll even like RotJ more (I gotta go watch this one some more times to judge on this). But its really a very cool film

Author: Caz-9
Review: This movie is breath-taking, there isn't a better word to describe it. I certainly have never seen anything so visually impressive in my life - although I think this may change when episode three is released. Attack of the Clones has give star wars fans pretty much everything they have been wanting to see since the original films - Yoda in a lightsaber battle, a guided tour through the Jedi HQ, the list is endless...

Author: Mark-241
Review_Title: Highly Enjoyable, but not without flaws
Review: First off - I must stipulate, I am a movie buff, but not specifically a Star Wars buff. I have enjoyed the first series, but like most was let down by TPM. I went into AOTC with few expectations, and was more than pleasantly surprised. The action was swift, easy to follow, and there were enough silly one-liners. The effects in the fight and action scenes were superb, although were occasionally poor in the dialogue sections. The acting was highly appropriate - just over the top enough to fit in well with the rest. As a Kiwi, it was a bit odd seeing Jay Lagai'a (sp?) and Temuera Morrison on the big screen, still looking and sounding like kiwis, but they acquited themselves well.

Author: widow-2
Review_Title: WAYYYY BETTER THAN TPM, "ALMOST" A RIVAL TO ESB IN ITS TONE
Review: well first off.... it was wayyyyy better than TPM. Better effects, faster paced, longer (gives a little more time to develop the story), and of course.... less Jar-Jar.

Author: AndrewF-4
Review_Title: Oh yes! Star Wars is back on track!
Review: This film really heightens the anticipation for Episode III, it also adds a little credibility to Episode I. The Star Wars saga is really coming along and you can make up your own mind as to what Episode III will bring.

Author: GerardF1
Review: I attended the midnight showing of "Clones" and while it was not the greatest movie ever made it was certainly better than the media has been leading us to believe.  I think that some where placing unachievable expectations on this movie.  Is it ground breaking, like the first all those years ago?  Yes, but not in the same way.

Author: klaus-22
Review: Here one brave and historical saga, killed and buried lies at the hands of its same father. The poor rests, after a careful search, have been find again to you on a planet of the Republic named Tattoine where, after an accurate examination of the DNA  the main responsibles have been discovered. Hayden Christensen and Natalie Portman, actors with little carisma, little fascination, zero sympathy. George Lucas and Jonathan Hales, once writers now undertakers, guilty to have buried the corpse supplying dialogues from soap operas to a love story already poor, and a psychological deepening worthy of an ugly comic (look at the scene of the encounter between Anakin and the mother, than he did not see from years). The authors of beautiful and narcissuses special effects , whose vanity has given the blow of grace to a film series that had been full of poetry without computer and with little models of plastic and cardboard. The motive of the massacre is to be found in the dirty money and large economic interests, that they have carried to re-work, after 20 years, three films that did not have sure need of additions. That the money is with you.

Author: Darth C
Review_Title: This is what it must have been like to see "Empire" when it first came out
Review: I guess I am a relatively young Star Wars fan since I don't remember seeing the original trilogy the first time, it was just something that I grew up with.  I also wasn't disappointed with Episode I because unlike a lot of Star Wars fans, I know that this is George Lucas's story to tell and I would rather enjoy it than look for its flaws.  That said, I think that this was one of the more enjoyable films of the group.  As always, the visuals are amazing and the story line is good, but it was worth the price of admission alone for the battle sequence at the end.  They don't call him "MASTER" Yoda for nothing!  Hayden Christensen also did a really good job with his character, having the perfect balance between the whining young Anakin we saw in Episode I and the angry and powerful Vader we see later on in the story.  There are a lot of characters introduced in this film that have roles in episodes IV though VI and there are some loose ends that are tied up very nicely.  I know a lot of people were concerned with the pace of this movie since a large portion of it centers around Anakin and Amidala's relationship. However, the beginning of the film is intriguing, the middle of the film is full of adventure and like I said above, the climax is amazing!  I came out of this film with a wonderful feeling of fulfillment, even at 3 o'clock in the morning.

Author: coopdale
Review: Yoda the swordbearer! There's no word for that. You shoulda see the sword handling skill of Yoda including awesome Force skill. So many Jedi came to this movie, and left only 12 high council member. But only one Jedi will prevail, it's Yoda. Dark Lord got bigger power, not much like Darth Maul. This movie for Star Wars fan. Every little thing for big fans, such as R2-D2 is climbing up the stairs including extra booster on his legs, Owen Lars and Aunt Beru, Bail Organa, and Boba Fett, the unaltered clone of Jango. Some scenes are really breathtaking. There are some glitches like Anakin's acting (I mean Hayden something) is not fulfilled the subtle shaking of character. He's got great power, but still he can't control of it. Obi-wan can't lead him properly, maybe Qui-Gon would be do better, but there lies the tragedy. Anakin admires and jealous on Obi-Wan because he is very obstinate person, who doesn't allow anything harm to Jedi council and Republic. Some frustrating on Anakin and hidden anger and love, which was taken away by Jedi Order. He needs love more than anything. He lost his mother, and some replacement for it, Amidala the Queen. She was departing to Naboo and Senate. Therefore, he lost everything, mother, Qui-Gon, Padme. These are very hard to perform by a newcomer. I think episode II's Anakin is most complex character in Star Wars saga. If Hayden step up his acting, the movie will become instant classic. But he's fail on short margin. Still this movie is worth to watch several times. So many layers and to-be-founds. Enjoy this movie!

Author: Neo-96
Review_Title: George Lucas needs to step down
Review: George Lucas needs to be replaced with someone who knows what they are doing. This movie is much too tense... the love scenes are pulled right from soap operas, all the jedis seem very grumpy. Look back upon the bickering between Han Solo and Princess Laia and how that lead to their romance... this was much more enjoyable to watch then the sappy crap in episode 2.

Author: KEBLA
Review_Title: After seeing Attack of the Clones, there is no disappointment...
Review: After seeing Attack of the Clones, there is no disappointment in my mind. The movie was amazing; an instant success that will undoubtedly impress everyone, even those who disliked The Phantom Menace. An impressive plotline that begins to connect the entire saga's story, well-developed characters that touched all emotions, and, of course, fast-paced action scenes that will impress both Star Wars fans and average moviegoers, are all reasons to see the movie. And if none of this draws you, then see it just to watch Yoda in battle! And, don't worry, there is an almost complete absence of Jar Jar, for those who didn't like him.

Author: Ivaylo
Review_Title: The Force Returns in Full Power
Review: Dear Star Wars Fans!

Author: DippyHippy
Review_Title: Superb! The Force Is Strong In This One
Review: Like Star Wars? Then you'll love this. Other reviewers have commented on how much better this is compared to the Phantom Menace - and it is.

Author: William Shaw
Review_Title: Maybe better than the first trilogy...
Review: I had a once in a lifetime opportunity...

Author: Morphy-3
Review: I will certainly admit that this film's special effects and cinematography are nearly flawless; however, I cannot say the same about the plot and dialogue. The plot is dry, predictable, and damn nearly juvenile (the whole thing plays out like a Saturday morning cartoon).

Author: jbarde
Review_Title: darn good flick... but something wrong...
Review: Star Wars' newest installment is a darn good flick, it was definitely better than TPM.  There's more than enough bashing of TPM to go around, so I won't add to it.  Though, one thing did carry over from TPM into AOTC, that it's under the direction of George Lucas.

Author: icegod101
Review_Title: I just had to watch it twice....
Review: Not because I thought it was any good you understand, but I actually fell asleep for an hour during it. I actually wish I'd left it at that and not paid to see it again.

Author: steveb-13
Review_Title: The dullness of "Clones" does not mar the magic of Originals
Review: After twenty five years, and a host of very well done and entertaining movies through the 80's and 90's, by fantastic directors such as Spielberg and Cameron, the original Star Wars is still my choice as the best movie of all time.  It combines a very fast-paced plot with a deep feeling for character development, attention to cinematographic detail, and innovations in special effects to make the film possible. You could not suck in every thing the first or second time, it took multiple viewings to appreciate all of the details and foreshadowing hidden within the witty lines.  The second movie `Empire Strikes Back' mostly built on the strengths of the first movie with its continued fast pace,  and detailed plot and character development.

Author: Zooropa7
Review_Title: The most forgettable Stars Wars Episode yet
Review: Many have said that this Episode is much better than its predecessor, The Phantom Menace. I would have to disagree. It's just as bad, if not worse. The reaction of the audience at the showing I saw as they came out was subdued and most had glum faces. Not a good sign. While it looks like Lucas has tried to respond to his critics e.g. cutting out the kiddie humour and upping the action element, this time he's excelled himself by giving us by one of the worst on screen romance in the history of cinema, some awful dialogue, flat acting and a pretty dull plot. Some people have also compared this episode with 'The Empire Strikes Back', but to be quite honest 'Clones' is not worthy of licking its boots.

Author: Agent G
Review_Title: Next Chapter is an action packed Battle (some spoilers)
Review: Ok well, Episode 2 Attack of the Clones. Ok the title is not the best, but hey its also a movie. Ok for anyone who didn't like it, well think of this, ONE its a movie thats the basic thing. Star Wars is Star Wars, its not perfect but its fun and its all fantasy.

Author: mott59
Review: Aside from the special effects and the intriguing origins of the great Boba Fett, this movie stinks to high heavens (yes, even those in a galaxy far, far away). Jar Jar Binks is given mercifully little screen time, but any screen time for that abomination is a crime against humanity. George Lucas should think about making some other films every now and then. He has seriously lost his way with this landmark franchise, and seems hellbent on completely obliterating his own legacy.

Author: jbg7338
Review: This film seems to have been created by someone who has never seen the original Star Wars trilogy, or at least, failed to understand what made it great. Strong characterization, simple but involving plots, memorable dialogue - all have been discarded in favor of decent special effects, and not much else.

Author: villnius
Review_Title: It's no "Empire", but it comes pretty close.
Review: As soon as the music hits and "Star Wars" blazes onto the screen, you are thrown back to a time long ago, when you only knew of George Lucas from American Graffiti. This excitement builds whenever I see the intro, and I am always reminded of the first time I saw A New Hope. You realize this is going to be a great theatrical experience but then you remember... The Phantom Menace made me feel the same way too, that is, until those three paragraphs faded out of view and the movie started. Without giving anything away, I want to say full out that this film is NOT THE PHANTOM MENACE. This is old school Star Wars with new school special effects, plain and simple. We have everything, good guy gusto and bad guy brashness. From the first thrilling scenes to the final close that leaves you wanting more, I felt a tingle that kept with me long after the final credits rolled. But... with all reviews, I have to give some shortcomings. First, the characterization is better (much better) than Menace, but it still feels like Christiansen and most obviously Portman actually have to dumb down their acting skills to play these characters. They don't overact... it's just that they have traditionally played more in depth roles (Life as a House for Christiansen, and Portman's enitire catalog except Menace). Aside from this and one other shortcoming (Yoda is all animated... I miss the puppet. The puppet worked, and looked real enough. Yoda actually gives the movie a cartoony, video game feel.)The movie is fantastic. Most other performances are done extremely well, and for those who think this movie will ruin the classic star wars experience, it won't. I feel it will enhance what you already love, because like I said before... IT IS NOT THE PHANTOM MENACE.

Author: johnstonc27
Review: I love Star wars, I am love it in matter of fact, but not attack of the clones.

Author: rosewood
Review: Let me start by saying I am not a big Star Wars fan.  I did however go to see this because it was the premier showing of a movie with DLP here in Wichita, KS.  I was most interested in seeing that above everything else, and I feel horribly let down in that aspect right away.  From there, the movie did not seem to visually entrap me like was promised with the hype. What really killed the film for me, however was the horrible acting/dialog. I found myself laughing outloud at many parts simply due to the acting being so bad.  If you are true film buff and bad acting/dialog pains you, then skip this movie!  However, if you can forget about those requirements, then the ending of this movie is worth sitting through the horrible acting.

Author: danmoran
Review: It's hard to fathom just how disappointing SW:AOTC really is.  Suffice to say, that before the movie had ended, I was already pondering what movies to rent after I left the theatre.  With the exception of some very nice scenery (including the comely Ms. Portman), SW:AOTC is a total bore.  Only the venerable Christopher Lee brings any screen presence to bear.  With this latest installment, it is evident that the Star Wars franchise has simply run out of steam.

Author: sideshowtricky
Review: A considerable improvement from Phantom Menace.  The back story continues and we start to see some maturity developing in the characters and their interactions. R2 and 3PO seem to be getting on well, the Anakin/Padme relationship is developing nicely and the start of Palpatine's influence upon Anakin is shown.  Finally, Anakin's opening to the dark side is witnessed and we recall Yoda in TESB - "Anger, fear, aggression; the dark side of the Force are they".

Author: Rick-Indiana
Review_Title: At last! Another jewel from this franchise!
Review: As a major fan of these films, I was elated that this film finally delivered on all cylinders what the past two haven't: an equal to the first two movies. Lucas crams all the excitement and flash of "A New Hope" into a film which somehow manages to also provide enough soul-searching and romance to rival "The Empire Strikes Back". After two efforts that seemed to be aimed toward a younger audience, Lucas gets you excited about Episode 3 again by making "Attack of the Clones" a true gem. Ewan McGregor and Natalie Portman turn in grade A performances as Obi Wan and Padme, and Hayden Christensen does as well as can be expected with such a complex role. In one scene, Christensen gives us a fine preview of a dark-force immersed Anakin when he lets anger get the best of him. Lucas seems to have been stung by fan criticism of the Jar Jar Binks character, as Binks is a very minor player in this one. Jimmy Smits as Bail Organa also has a very small role, but will likely have a much bigger role in the next film. The droids provide a few light moments that are enjoyable. Watch for a part where 3PO says "I'm scrap!" I got quite a laugh on that one. Christopher Lee plays Count Dooku (Darth Tyrannus) with ease, endowing the character with the same strength of presence that Sir Alec Guinness gave "Old Ben" Kenobi in the original series. Samuel L. Jackson gets a much bigger role as Mace Windu this time around, and is up to the task. The fight scenes are, once again, finely choreographed and well shot, and if that isn't enough to get you running to the theater: YODA WITH A LIGHT SABER! No spoilers here, but let me say one thing about this scene: if you saw it in person, you might want to laugh....but then you REALLY wouldn't want to tick Yoda off! Minor complaints: A few of the supporting actors seemed cardboard and stiff at times, but that's been true with all the Star Wars films. All-in-all, a very fun movie that leaves you wanting more.

Author: orion-41
Review: I hoped this episode would be better than first, for I consider the Trilogy the best thing in cinema ever made. Well, it was, but just for digital effects (if its possible). Really incredible, but dialogues were very boring. Terrible the falling-in-love-scenes between Anaquin and Padme, worst than a soap opera dialog. Finally, it was great seeing Yoda fighting with his sword! At the end I consider myself satisfied.

Author: sethdove
Review_Title: Quite a relief this movie is :-)
Review: I 've recently rent Phantom Menace on VHS just trying to find out what really sucked about that movie and i must admit i hated it more! So i was sceptic enough when i attended the advanced screening of AOTC here, in Greece.

Author: jtrichardson
Review: I have not yet read the accounts of any other reviewers, and have only heard rumors of their dismaying reports; so mine is a perspective biased only by my love for the Star Wars universe. I went with the expectation of being told a story-- a story which I, as well as any true fan, already well knew-- a story of love, intrigue, anger, and war. I was not disappointed. Already knowing what was going to happen-- what had to happen, to lead into the next story, and eventually, the story which we all know-did not spoil the telling of this story for me, for it was told in a way that captured my attention like few films have. It was a story that I loved-- so how could I possibly be disappointed?

Author: mrroboto-2
Review_Title: Real entertainment - A very interesting piece in the Star Wars Puzzle!
Review: Let's make it clear, Star Wars is not "Apocalypse Now", "Requiem For A Dream", "2001 A Space Odyssey" nor "Solaris". Star Wars is Star Wars. I am a hard critic on movies, but I am always objective. Star Wars was always intended to be spectacle with depth. Attack Of The Clones is a fantastic spectacle. Though it is hard to judge as a single movie, it is easier to review when seen as an EPISODE of the Star Wars Saga. Attack of the Clones brings strong and important elements to the Star Wars whole while offering to the viewer a non-stop, very entertaining chapter to the Saga. I strongly suggest the first time viewer to watch the previous Star Wars chapters in order to fully appreciate this film. No film since the late Stanley Kubrick's Eyes Wide Shut have offer me that kind of visual stimulation. Simply beautiful. Critics that says the film is slow-paced must be living on another planet. That is the fastest (can I use the term for cinema?) movie I have ever seen. The 2 and a half long movie was still too short for my taste, I hope a longer version will soon be available on DVD.

Author: jimothy80
Review: I tried George.  I tried to like.  I wanted to like it, really I did.  I grew up with the original "Star Wars" trilogy, and wanted so desperately to like "Attack of the Clones", especially after I desperately tried to like "The Phantom Menace".  But alas, I just could not.  There simply was not enough there for me to like.

Author: whyte_knyte
Review: Any preconceived notions that Episode II may not be up to par with the hype due to Episode I being a bit of a letdown to some were put to rest.  This movie is the best in the series, especially due to a scene we have ALL been waiting for since Empire Strikes Back, but I won't spoil it!!  Go see this movie over and over again!  Good work George!

Author: Shed-4
Review: It seems to drag at the start as the story develops but then you see why. A huge crescendo builds; the enormity is astounding.  I sense definite anime influences that have maybe been lacking from Phantom Menace and the other Episodes.  Very complicated, fast moving, a lot to get into two hours.

Author: mike8869
Review: for funniest death scene ever.  I seriously haven't laughed so hard in a long time.  Where did they find the woman who played anakin's mom? "Anakin, you're so handsome! I love...youaaach....euuuch......uuuugh..."

Author: zoofer
Review: An excellent eye-candy movie and probably more Star Wars-like than the last film, but this film was supposed to be the 'Empire Strikes Back' of the pre-quils and it just ain't. In fact, it's the first of the Star Wars films that hasn't ended with my mouth watering for the next installment, the way I'm sure most people felt at the end of 'Empire'.

Author: bryanalter
Review: I saw this for the first time in IMAX format.  While a couple scenes were quite good (esp. the gladiator-type scene), most of the movie was just plain awful.  The writing, the acting and the story were often laughably bad. This is a perfect example of the "Emperor's New Clothes".  Won't somebody stand up and tell Lucas that the quality of these movies has deteriorated beyond hope?  If not for Natalie Portman wearing a ripped belly-shirt and no bra (with headlights often on), I'm not sure I could have tolerated sitting through this monstrosity.  I still remember seeing Star Wars in the theater back in '77.  It was an exciting and amazing experience.  Now it's just a hopeless disappointment.  George has ONE MORE CHANCE to redeem himself. Let's hope that he does!

Author: mr_mysterious2
Review: A huge success.  This movie had adventure and excitement. For those who crave not such things, however, it also had intrigue, character conflict, insight, emotion, and an extremely well constructed sense of helplessness.

Author: loowee42
Review: I just got back from the first showing of Star Wars: Episode II.  The movie starts out fast and grabs your attention before settling down to some plot development. The visuals in this film are amazing.  As long as the final product is this good, a 3 year wait is well worth it.

Author: krazoff
Review: I went into star wars episode II hoping for an enjoyable movie that would be better than episode I. Thankfully this was, but that is not saying much. Hayden Christensen was absolutely horrible as anakin skywalker. He showed little to no emotion (with the exception of anger). There was no chemistry between queen amidala and anakin, it was very hard to believe that they were in love. The only saving grace this movie had was the brief scene with yoda fighting with his light saber, also Jar Jar Binks was only in 5 mins of the movie (thank god).

Author: cbbaer
Review_Title: Star Wars is No Longer Just A Movie
Review: First I want to say that I really liked it.  It certainly won't win any Academy awards for acting, or screenplay.  But it was mostly entertaining.

Author: Machbuster
Review_Title: It's GREAT that STAR WARS is coming back in a more "HARD WAY" ...
Review: In my opinion the best part so far was EMPIRE STRIKES BACK - EPISODE 6 . Why - because it simply does not include many "pathetic" passages as for example EPISODE 1 . I think EPISODE 1 was made for younger audience - their buying power & influence is so big we can't even imagine . That is why LUCAS played the first STARWARS NEWCOMER to be the 100% cash success - NOW he can be harder . Episode two included few scenes I would like to see made differently , but It was not so distracting as JAJAR BINGS style in EP.1 .

Author: simonawalker
Review_Title: Short Changed, and possibly worse than TPM!!!
Review: George Lucas needs to start listening to the fans!!  I can understand that the films are HIS and therefore he makes them they way he wants.  But the rest of the world doesn't live in a fantasy world. Anyway....  Disappointed would be an understatement as to how I felt when leaving the cinema on opening night.  Short Changed would be more accurate, and I feel I was not the only one for whom "The Force" did not come home.

Author: jimjba
Review_Title: Lame, wooden dialogue and pathetic acting by Anakin actor
Review: Unbelievable in such a big budget movie to have such wooden dialogue and bad acting, especially by the young man who plays Anakin.  I broke out laughing several times during the movie at how artificial and stilted the dialogue and acting was.  You can see better at most high school plays, heck, elementary school plays.  The pathetic acting and dialogue ruined anything that might have passed for a plot.  This would be poor quality as a production for television, never mind a movie.  How can such a big-budget movie have such awful screenplay and direction?

Author: tinytater
Review: This installment of the Star Wars epic was superb not only as a "Star Wars" movie, but as a movie in general. It had everything, love, action, and yoda beating up an old guy. What is not to love?? The CGI was not as blatent or annoying as in Episode I. And, perhaps the best thing about Episode II: only 5 minutes of Jar Jar!!!

Author: Otto-998
Review_Title: This is what Episode one should......
Review: After the utter disappointment of Episode I, I really didn't expect much at all. I went in with rather low expectations and was blown away by what I saw. This movie is totally different from Episode I, by that I mean it doesn't have the happy go lucky orgie of hollywood. When doing Episode I Lucas in my opinion tried too hard and went away from the original movies but has now returned to what I think is a winning movie. The movie is really a step towards the Episode IV,V,VI. I won't say anything about the acting, directing, special effects etc. the only thing I can say is go see this one. If you love the original movies or just like sci-fi the go right out your door the your theater. I give it a 9/10 on my movie rating.

Author: pudes
Review: Thank you George Lucas for continuing the saga continued from the Phantom Menace. The action sequences in this movie are awesome, the graphics are spectacular. The love story between Anakin and Padme is lacking in depth of acting (or was it the directing?), and dialogue.

Author: Recessive
Review_Title: A Long Review - But It Goes Somewhere
Review: Now, it's only been out for, two days, maybe?  Already a lot of people are saying they loved this movie, a lot of people are saying they hated this movie, but what's confusing me most of all is the sudden consensus that Episode One sucked. Where did that come from?  Three years ago, Episode One ruled the school. Everyone was walking out of theatres everywhere more or less satisfied. Most, more.

Author: Child_Of_The_Sea
Review: I confess I am a huge Star Wars fan, and that my opinion is a little influenced on that, but the fact still remains that 'Attack of the Clones' is closer to the original Star Wars than Episode I.  I do not like the constant use of special effects, but the story line was very interesting and it just sucked the audience in instantly.  The acting, although was never intended to be superb, was very good.  Hayden Christansen has quickly become one of my favorite new stars.  Ewan McGregor did a wonder job, as always, as the wise but sometimes egotistical, Obi-Wan Kenobi.  Even Natalie Portman seemed to live up to her co-stars talent as the beautiful Padme.  While some of the 'romantic' scenes could easily be classified as cheesy in the end you just suck it up and remember that Star Wars is not an Academy Award Winning Movie anymore, but a simple escape into a galaxy far, far away.

Author: morten.hansen
Review: While not perfect, it's a worthy entry in the Star Wars Saga... Sure there are some slow scenes (i.e. the whole love subplot) and some less than perfect CGI effects, but there are so many great things in this movie it's easy to forgive the lesser parts. When the pace picks up and the clone war breaks out - it's pure movie magic, so just sit back and enjoy the ride... Oh one more thing - Yoda kicks butt!!!

Author: Spider-68
Review: This Star Wars film has it all: the battles, the beautiful girl in the tight suit, the fast and furious lightsaber action, and of course the easter eggs (jawas, womp rats, bounty hunters, etc.) Though Episode I may be considered a slight downfall in the series' overall progress, this one makes up for the faults in The Phantom Menace by far.

Author: swan_ton
Review_Title: Forget the dialogue...just prepare to be awed.
Review: We all know by now that Georgy-boy isn't much of an "Actor's Director." Or that his dialogue writing skill is about as honed as a butter knife.  But it just doesn't matter.  Not with Episode II.  Simply put, it's the most fun I've had in a theater since the Matrix.  Every time you think, 'Crap, that was astounding!', something else happens to make you say, 'no no, wait, THAT'S astounding.'  It keeps happening, too.  It's been said by now that the last half hour is among the most amazing things ever to be seen on film. I agree. I'll keep it at that.

Author: Spider-70
Review: I never thought that, at 28 years old, I would actually be starting a conversation with the wrds, 'Back in my day..' but here I am.  My wife and I suffered through the excruciatingly boring Episode II yesterday, and I realized that this movie was so slow and ridiculous it made me miss the Ewoks!  I know, fellow fans the world over are gasping in shock, but I have been a fan my entire life also.  I saw Episodes IV, V, and VI on the big screen (not the 'Special Edition' garbage, but the real movies), so I know what a good Star Wars movie is.  Let me tell you, Episode II ain't it.  We all know how terrible Episode I was (with a few moments of greatness), but I actually found myself debating which movie was worse--during one of the many endless dialogue scenes.  I know, all the die-hards (a group which included myself up until yesterday morning) will say, "He's just setting up the story details for Episode III".  Back in my day, he set up the story details during the opening scroll.  Anyone remember the set-up for Episode IV? The Princess has stolen the plans for the Death Star and is racing to get them home--then she is captured during the first five minutes--after a thrilling gun battle--and we are completely surrounded by the joy of another galaxy. George Lucas used to be able to tella story that was thrilling and exhilarating while delivering a movie that was also thrilling.  There is absolutely no reason I should have to sit through two movies that are complete and utter garbage just so that I will be prepared for the next movie.  Please people, avoid this movie, and maybe he will realize the mistakes he is making and give us an Episode III that deserves our time and money, unlike this latest installment.

Author: paolo.ulivi
Review_Title: The Force is strong with this one!
Review: At last! After the childish Episode I, the Star Wars saga is back on track with this one. The plot is more complex than it might appear at first glance and the dark side of the force has regained the appeal it had in The Empire Strikes Back by seducing young and handsome Anakin Skywalker. I believe that this movie can also be more appreciated by non-Star-Wars-fans for it almost does without of the "fans only" material so frequent in Episode I. My only remark is that the gravity of Anakin's seduction might not be clear enough for non fans for there is no previous discussion of the power of the dark side. Ah, and I live near lake Como where the love scenes between Anakin and Padme were shot. Please have some envy...

Author: The ShadowMan
Review: This is by far the best of the Star Wars films to date, there is a great balance in the force here. The story is good, the humour is funny and dry, not slapstick. The action is spectacular and only used to enhance the story, not as a set piece to wow the audience. The final battles are amazing, Yoda is one cool M.F. (as is Samuel L.) there are some unexpected twists and turns and even few 'in jokes' (try to spot the X-Wing, TIE fighter and Millenium Falcons).

Author: chris.hagn
Review: This reminds me alot of Episode 4 and Episode 6. It is thoughtful and deep, well acted. I can almost forgive Lucas for Episode 1.

Author: Caspianus
Review: After "Phantom Menace" I didn´t expect anything else than - well: nothing. I got to admit, though, that I entered one of the first screenings, after all, Star Wars is something for the child in our hearts. In a nutshell: nice tie-in´s to the already existing parts, nice SFX, nice customes, the final battle is awesome, the Clone army rocks, and unfortunately the script sucks in some crucial moments. Annakins love medley at the fire hearth is cheesy, the rolling-and-frolicking in the grass is the purest cliché, and poor mummy dies exactly after he arrives - this was especially unforgivable. Both scenes have their reason, but their really cheaply written. Too bad.

Author: Ben Mo
Review: George Lucas once again delivers a special effect, space ace, wonder story with his 5 installment of the Star Wars series Attack of the Clones.  This movie was definitely made for the fans, with it constant and sometime overbearing references to later occurring Star Wars movies.  Myself, as a fan, got chuckles and warm feelings inside at the re-uttering of classic lines, musical cues, and of course character cameos.  Sometimes Lucas intently or not steps over the line and movie becomes more about giving props and filling the notions of what if and wouldnt it be cool if instead of creating a good story.  But this can be easily forgiven because it is fun to watch these flies of fancy.  Ewan McGregors sophomore performance of Obi-Wan Kenobi was more like Sir Alec Guinness of the original moves, which I found more to my liking and more fitting to this film since the character has grown up some.  Natalie Portman performance of now Senator Amidala wasnt her greatest work ever but more than adequate.  Hayden Christensen as the teenage Anakin Skywalker I found to be extremely fitting but little heavy-handed in the passionate scenes, where it counted.  And Samuel L. Jackson was Samuel L. Jackson and the role was written for him.  So in conclusion, this movie was made for the fans.  So if you are a fan of Star Wars you have already seen it and if you are not a fan you might enjoy the special effects, fight scenes, and Samuel being Samuel.  I give the movie a 7.5 out of 10.

Author: mr.fabulous
Review_Title: A great film, and obviously, a must-see for Star Wars fans.
Review: Attack of The Clones is a significantly better film than The Phantom Menace, and even the original 3, in many respects.  George Lucas summed it up perfectly in 3 words: "The plot thickens."  Everything you saw in Episode I (Jedi battles, new worlds, amazing creatures, grand armies, etc.) is magnified.  The characters of Yoda, Mace Windu, Padmé, Anakin and Obi-Wan are well-developed, and Jar Jar is only on screen 3 times.  Cinematically it is technically superior and visually more interesting.  There are still minor, noticeable difficulties with interaction between the actors and CGI characters.  More specifically, when an actor is pictured touching or riding a CGI, and there is quite a lot of this.  Suspension of disbelief comes easily.  The CGI creatures in Episode II are the scariest yet, and may be a little much for the younger viewers.  Nevertheless, this may be the best of the five movies, simply due to its overall importance to the story, the well-written script, and the technical achievement.

Author: JamMaker
Review: Episode II is so much better than Phantom Menace, at least to me. Some say that first par of the movie is boring, I wouldn't say boring, I would say, that some scenes should be shorter and, me personally would change just one completely ( I'm not saying which one), but everything that is shown had to happen and is made far better than Episode I! Attack of the clones has a lot more action and adventure, and just... well, it's great! And of course, YODA IS THE GREATEST LIGHTSABER MASTER EVER!!! In the end ,I would say that Episode II is Great in the beginning-good in the middle- AND THE BEST MOVIE EVER MADE IN THE END!!!! (you'll see because of what)

Author: dshramek
Review: I, like many of my generation, grew up idealizing George Lucas.  The seemingly brilliant mind behind Star Wars and Indiana Jones was an icon for me even into film school.  However, with the second installment of the spiraling disappointments known as the Star Wars prequels, we're beginning to see that George Lucas is far from a genius filmmaker.

Author: araidasa
Review: Lucas still is able to construct a good general story line.  The movie did continue to tell a good story and was filled with plenty of enjoyable action scenes.  Any Star Wars fan must ultimately see this movie.  Though it does feel like Lucas is milking this franchise financially instead of making good films.

Author: valandgreig
Review_Title: Eye Candy doesn't make a movie
Review: I've got really mixed feelings here. On the one hand it's Star Wars, so it must be great, but the evidence speaks otherwise. I should say that we went to see it twice, and my opinions changed a little on the second viewing. First time through, I thought it was terrible. The dialogue was atrocious-that line about sand being coarse etc. plumbed new depths. I've played video games with better dialogue. And the guy that plays Anakin is one of the worst actors I have ever seen. I guess the material doesn't help, but Harrison Ford pulled it off in Empire. The pacing is clumsy to say the least. From the first time Anakin opens his mouth you are sledgehammered with his rebellious nature, and those brooding glares he pulls at the camera every few scenes made him look constipated. He couldn't even deliver the most famous line in Star Wars history: "I've got a bad feeling about this". What's with ninja Yoda? I appreciate that he is supposed to the best with a light sabre but I thought it would be cooler if, despite his skills he never has to fight. The battle with Dooku at the end looked like leftover scenes from Willow until the light sabre battle which sort of looked good in a Hong Kong action movie sort of way, but just didn't fit right in the movie.

Author: JimmyM4595
Review: I absolutely love this movie, no lousy critic of Lucas basher can change my mind. I love every single thing: the story, the plot, the acting (yes, the acting!), the direction, the special effects, the new characters, the score, all of it!

Author: had-6
Review: I was looking forward to the Attack of the Clones, hoping if would be at least as good as the Episode I. Being a long term fan of Star Wars, I would not imagine in my wildest dreams I would be longing for the film to end in only half an hour from its start.

Author: rc20001
Review_Title: Over reliant on awesome special FX
Review: FANTASTIC CGI & sound track. Forgettable storyline. Painfully wooden acting. (Yoda and the droids are the most convincing and entertaining parts amongst the lead cast). Im a big Ewan and SLJ fan but both performances are their poorest ever. I wanted to love it like the original trilogy but it just doesnt cut it. Why cant we have a great involving story, great acting and great special effects (in that priority - (LOTR anybody?) . Anyway, Im going to watch the DVD version again together with the extras to see George & Rick explain themselves , I think it will grow on me to a 7.5/10 like episode 1. lets hope George has a new strategy for the final part instead of relying on the FX to impress. Oh and by the way why does the entire supporting cast seem to be a bunch of forced British accents, Dooku, Jango, Zen,  Sidious, Palpatine, C3PO ; Reminds me of Thunderbirds and 5th Element.

Author: al_bateman
Review_Title: Better than the previous one, though still not perfect.
Review: On the good side, 'Attack of the Clones' was much better than 'The Phantom Menace'. For example Jar Jar Binks played a much smaller role and it developed some more of the ideas that will eventually connect the two trilogies together.

Author: ffrittelli
Review_Title: I've a GOOD feeling about this
Review: Episode II is a great movie, no doubt. Story is simpler and more intriguing than episode I but still quite difficult. Good guys: Amidala was a real surprise, completely different from the alien politician of episode I, now she is more similar to her daughter Leia but sexier. Yoda shows us his power, at last. Anakin: very good but not well played. Obi Wan: Great. R2D2 and C3PO are far far away from the first saga. Bad Guys: I love Dooku, he's great as Darth Maul was ugly, thanks to a great Christopher Lee, Dooku is a complex character and I hope Lucas tell us more about his background in Episode III. Yango Fett: good

Author: galahad85
Review: To be treated to such a wonderful movie experience is a unique time to let yourself go and forget everything around you.  I could not do this with Spider-man.  I just didn't like it.  It was ok.  With that said, one week later I saw Attack of the Clones.  This movie is lightyears ahead of Spider-man.  Everything work, even the slapstick comedy and the play on words.  The visual scope od the picture is outstanding.  The two new planets, as well as the additions to the old one (i.e. Naboo and Coruscant) really give the audience a real perspective at not only the beauty, but also the dark and gritty elements that has made the original trilogy so great. The acting is fine.  Anyone who says Hayden Christensen i playing Anakin too arrogantly is right.  That's the character.  Anakin is an arrogant person. This is what makes him greedy for power.  The love story works.  Natlie Portman and Christensen provide a truly ramantic love story that makes you feel that they should be together, while also hinting at their togetherness' inevitable destruction.  The action sequences weere unlike any I have ever seen.  The chase sequence, the asteroid field, the arena, and the lightsabers all look spectacular.  The one character that really does steal the movie is Yoda.  We already knew he was a Jedi Master, now we see why. Lucas has enhanced his vision tremendously.  The Phantom Menace was a decent movie, though not the greatest ever.  Attack of the Clones makes The Phantom Menace a better movie.  If you haven't seen it, rush out for a visual masterpiece that will take you in and leaveyou breathless.

Author: haggymaggie
Review_Title: Has the magic of the first one!
Review: The original Star Wars, Episode 4, was a rehashing of old 1930's serials, but it was a highly fun and inventive one.  Going to Star Wars Episode 4 was a magical movie-going experience and seeing this movie at the age of 17 was the reason that I became so heavily interested in all forms of cinema. From this "serial" series, I grew to love and appreciate all forms of film, from the "crowd-pleasers" to the darker, more thought-provoking and inventive cinema.  It has a tremendous effect on the movie industry and while I certainly don't think it is the greastest film ever made, it is certainly one of my personal favorites.

Author: arslin
Review_Title: Getting back to what star wars is
Review: This movie was what the first movie should have been. Lucas realized his errors. His error was that his target market should not have been the little kids of today, but the little kids of 30 years ago. Many of the key themes that made star wars 4-6 work, returned in episode II, and were lacking in episode I. With Episode I, it was completely unlike every other star wars movie. I am still not sure what it was, but everything about it was irrelevant to the story line of star wars. Episode II on the other hand, is in the line of what you might expect from a star wars move. However, this movie does need a Han sol type person. You know, a charming maverick that normally looks out for himself, but can not help but do the right thing time after time.

Author: neilporter
Review: How can such a poor film receive so many ratings of 10?  It's sad that the many fans of the Star Wars films are rushing brainlessly forward like lemmings to give this film a 10 when it is so obviously not worthy.

Author: morinb4593
Review_Title: Thrilling and Disappointing at the same time!
Review: ***SPOILERS***

Author: stevem99
Review: The story was not very well written. Natalie, although easy on the eyes, is not a very good actress at least not in this movie. Hayden was not much better. Too many overdone special effects also... If the story would have been better it would have been ok despite these flaws.... 3/10

Author: richardcross
Review: This is technically speaking a very impressive film.  The level of detail evident in the special effects shows that an enormous amount of work must have gone into producing them.  If you're not a Star Wars fan, but you like watching "cutting edge" special effects, you won't be disappointed with this.

Author: deltaboy1
Review_Title: Drags a little but overall a good job
Review: I was very excited about getting to see this movie and even got chills when the music and the intro started. The opening scenes were excellent and got you right into the mood. Great beginning! And then Hayden Christensen comes on screen and blows the whole thing. He was wooden and uninspiring. Thank goodness for the rest of the cast. The first part of the movie drags somewhat with the budding romance between Anakin and Amidala. Fortunately, the last 45 minutes is wonderful! The individual fights and the battle scenes are some of the best I have seen in any of the Star Wars movies. GREAT effects and surprises! I was a little disappointed but satisfied overall with the movie. It certainly leaves you guessing about what is coming next!

Author: biki
Review: AOTC's greatest triumph is highlighting how non-Star-Wars TPM was.  AOTC feels like Star Wars. Moreover, it is a better film than ROTJ and TPM.

Author: EnvyGreen
Review: Star Wars: Episode II - Attack of the Clones has one fatal flaw - It has the name "Star Wars" attached to it. Being as such, the movie has been unfairly prosecuted by film critics, which in turn has turned into a negative media spin that develops into bias in the subconscious minds of the average moviegoer.

Author: gradyenglish
Review_Title: Thank god for the battle scene at the end.
Review: The thing that made the original series great was that, even though it was sci-fi, it was believable to a large extent.  Episode 2 (and Episode 1 for that matter) both throw the notion of believability out the window.  From about 5 minutes into the movie until about the last 1/2 hour was nothing but fluff; all cute little things put in by George Lucas to sell tickets....just tell the story.

Author: themacher
Review: Pure and simple:  I'm as big a Star Wars fan as there is without being a fanatic.  Episode I made me puke and made me leery to see Episode II.  I can honestly say that Star Wars is BACK!!!  Roger Ebert, go eat another dozen doughnuts. Great movie  9/10

Author: Torricane
Review: Financially, this movie will clean up; that's a given.  This flick also atones for (a.k.a., cleans up) many of the messes and crimes committed against the series in Episode I.  I'd hate to be the one to spoil the movie for you by blabbing at length, so I'll sum it up in three words: "Yoda. Awww yeah."  See it, and don't compare it to 'Empire'.  Just see it on its own terms and I think you'll be happy.

Author: MattWalker
Review: If you were disappointed by Phantom Menace, don't worry, Attack of the Clones delivers all the greatness of the originals with all the great effects of the Phantom Menace. George Lucas really did a great job with this movie.  Jar Jar is hardly in this movie which is a huge plus.  Go see it, you won't be disappointed.

Author: PBmeteor56
Review_Title: A bad movie with a good back ground...
Review: I thought this movie was horrible, yes the special effects were good... SO WHAT!!! The acting was terrible, and the script was so bad I wanted to shoot my self, your losing it George!!! THIS MOVIE IS NOT WORTH RENTING!!!

Author: gladdyladdy
Review: Well I saw the opening night at Leicester Sq london where we got some preshow entertainment from Anthony Daniels the actor for C3P0, he was pretty funny and handled the raucous post pub midnight crowd admirably! He dealt with a line up of storm troopers the curtains parted and the crowd cheered loudly.  Oh and Rick McCallum also came out and told us it was Fu****** awesome!

Author: jgsgilbert
Review: CONTAINS SPOILERS Bored....bored, bored, bored, bored, bored.  These are the best words to describe how I felt watching Attack of the Clones.

Author: lordbighelmet
Review: All is forgiven, George.  You have redeemed yourself utterly.

Author: morgancc
Review: I have an idea...maybe George Lucas will wake up and hire Peter Jackson to direct Episode III.  Mr. Lucas could certainly pick up some lessons on how to create an epic trilogy.  Mr. Jackson did not have oscar-level actors, or a huge CGI budget.  But he knew enough to film on location, hire someone else to do the screenplay, and keep the CGI down to reasonable level.  I know the CGI per frame in ROTK was excessive, but compare his battle sequences to those in Episode II, at least Jackson made it part of the story instead of making it the whole story.

Author: Pfloydsux
Review: Yeah that's right this movie was a circus from start to finish.  When you have a 2 feet tall 400 year old man in a lightsaber battle you have a circus on your hands.  Not just that, when Obi Wan can't figure something out and it takes a 10 year old child to point out the correct answer you have a circus.  When 3P0 uses the phrase "what a drag" as his head is being dragged you have a circus.  Having Darth Vader say "I like it here its soft and smooth just like you" you have lost control of this movie.  I would have liked to have done a rewrite on this script because if it didn't have the circus material it'd be a great movie.  Instead we have Obi Wan going to some diner and asking the fat slob chef alien the answer to a question he can't figure out.  I kept asking myself would Alec Guinness as Obi Wan say that stuff.  Flat out circus!

Author: jasonmedd
Review_Title: Good effects, poor storyline, some interesting notes to the Star Wars storyline
Review: Overall, the film was quite disappointing. The effects were good and groundbreaking. There were a number of interesting points with regards to explaining some of the history behind the plot points in Episode 4, 5 and 6 (Storm trooper, Boba Fett's origins, the Death Star, etc. However, given that we already know the end result of Episodes 1,2 and 3, a lot more effort could have been made to make the story line more engaging such as decent acting, some decent dialogue, a believable interaction between the characters.

Author: miljew
Review: For me only one thing stands out so memorable from Star Wars Episode II Attack of The Clones is that green muppet fighting with a lightsaber with the full force as his ally in the final lightsaber battle sequence of the film. Yes this is what blew me away! The chase was magnificent, love story was average, the massive battles were excellent but it was the little Green Jedi who is the Jedi of all Jedi who at times sounds like Grover who stole the show. It might have been five minutes his whole fight scene but it was the sweetest five minutes of cinema for one moviegoer in their life. I believe Mr Lucas should redesign the Attack of The Clones movie poster and just put Yoda on there in his karate stance. For me the movie now just has Yoda written all over it. When the 2003 Oscars come the Academy should make a break on the usual traditions and award Yoda for his action performance. This would be one moment I would love to see happen in my life. Yoda deserves it and it should really be his second Oscar after his excellent performance in Empire. So let the Oscar Hype begin for Yoda for the best performance as the leading actor in a motion picture.

Author: hseidelmann
Review: George Lucas finally did it, he made a movie worthy of "Empire Strikes Back". AOTC is an action packed adventure in the true Star Wars style, with lightsaber fights like you've never seen them before. Oh and for those who might have doubted why they call Yoda a jedi MASTER, the movie will show you why.. Only bad thing I have to say about it, is the dialog. As usual it sounds like something off a sitcom, but hey after you've seen Jango Fett and especially Yoda in action, I think you'll forgive George for the dialog..

Author: andrewmcpherson
Review_Title: "That blast came from the Death Star!"
Review: A tear came to my eye as the opening words of Episode 2 began.  Ever since the ending credits of Episode had rolled off the screen, I was in zealous anticipation for this second coming of the new trilogy.  Was it good for all that wait? By God yes. It certainly was paralleled to the originals, in my opinion being just as good as the best; Empire Strikes Back.  The questions this film answers a really welcomed, we are told of where the storm troopers come from, how and why Darth Vader (Anakin Skywalker) is consumed by the evil dark side of the force, and the biggest "blast" of all, the origins and concept of the death star - this revelation was marvellous and left me in awe. And one last thing, we have always heard throughout the Star Wars Saga how great Master Jedi Yoda is. I always questioned this thinking, "this little green thing doesn't do much at all." After seeing Attack Of The Clones, you will certainly appreciate why Yoda is called "The Master." Oh, the film was spellbinding, I have to stop writing, or I may start crying...

Author: jazais
Review: Personally i love this movie but to each his own. I have loved Star Wars ever since i first saw the first movie. Though i must say that GL should have rained in Anakins character a little more. No one spills there guts like he dose in this movie. I think that it is a waste of Hayden Christesen's acting skill. Seeing him in other movies and TV shows he is actually a good actor.the Story line is interesting and the action sequences are amazing. It starts with a bounty hunter trying to Kill Padme and ending with an amazing but short light saber fight between yoda and count dooku. I have always like the costumes in star wars including Padmes wedding dress but what the hell was going on with that wedding veil. I personally would recommend this movie to anyone and I'm eagerly awaiting the third and final installment with high hope.

Author: Noctem88
Review: Much had been riding on Attack of the Clones. It was, after all, expected to make up for The Phantom Menace which, despite unfair galactic sized expectations, still came across as shockingly flat and uninspired. And to its credit, Clones manages to create a sense of adventure and excitement that Menace simply lacked. Clones was also blessed with an edge of maturity that Menace desperately needed i.e. very little Jar Jar Binks and no Jake Loyd. However, when all is said and done, Clones reflects the same stylistic abyss that turned Menace into an artistic farce: there is very little emotion in the telling of this tale. Indeed, the wide contrast between the film's visual splendor and its dull characterization makes it obvious where Lucas' heart lies as a filmmaker. And this problem is compounded by the fact that the prequels revolve around politics, diplomacy, and romance. In short, what the prequels needed was a real filmmaker.

Author: guitarpete987
Review_Title: It seems that so few people get it...
Review: To understand this movie, and why it is the way it is, I think it is essential that this film, like all of the other Star Wars films, be seen as parts of a whole. This is all one big saga, really.

Author: Mike Holmes
Review: Man, i just don't get how these critics can bash this movie...

Author: BSBfan70053
Review: As someone who had seen Star Wars Eps.II 5 times already, I'd just like to say how much I enjoyed the movie. I think George Lucas did a wonderful job. He manages every time to produce a wonderful movie and have people go back multiple times to see it again! After seeing this one, I just can't wait 3 YEARS to see the 3rd and final eps. He also managed to get the 2 most perfect people to play Anakin and Padme'. I'd also like to say that John Williams did an awesome job with the music. The love theme was out of this world. He was able to make it hauntingly romantic and fill it with so much passion and emotion. I'd go back again just to hear the music in-person (and of course for the whole movie! lol) I also think that Natalie Portman and Hayden Christensen did a tremendous job. It always helps out the movie when the 2 most important characters (who are in-love) have...oh, what's the word...CHEMISTRY! (which they had ALOT of.) The two did beautifully! And for those few...very few people out there who maybe didn't like the story.... just the whole Yoda "fight" scene would be enough to get anyone to go back and see it again. I was very pleased with this movie and can't wait until it comes out to DVD.... I'd recommend this movie to anyone who has any taste whatsoever! Awesome MOVIE! :)

Author: MrsGabrielDamon
Review_Title: Put Me To Sleep In Ten Minutes
Review: Ohmygod...! Okay, let me start off by saying that I am not a Star Wars freak. I saw the original trilogy and I enjoyed them very much. They were okay. Then Gerogie Lucas just had to make the prequels, starting with that hideous Phantom Menance. I saw the film once and never saw it again. But let's not talk about that movie, let's talk about the Attack of the Clones. Alright, I had no f***ing clue what was going on. Something about the Trade Federation, Clones.....eh? After five minutes, I had blocked the plot from my mind because I couldn't understand it for the life of me. I thought the special effects would be great. PLEASE! I would rather have the tennis shoe as a spaceeship anyday over all the massive heaps of computer bullsh*t Lucas threw at me. Every frame looked fake. That in turm made me think of the movie as a joke. Lucas was too over zealous on special effects...they looked God awful. Well there always was the love story. What love story? Natalie Portman is hideous in the movie. She wears freaky-ass cloths that happen to get ripped off in key moments. And Hayden Christensen. He's freaking hot at all, but I had to laugh whenever he had his stupid ass little nervous break down thing. There was no love story. The lines were stupid and the actors couldn't pull it off. Maybe we should blame it on Lucas for writing such a sh****y love story. After all, he is no romance writer. Then again, he can't write a decent movie script, either! I thought that Clones sucked big time. It put me to sleep in, okay, 20 minutes. But with all that stupid THX it woke me up and I had to suffer through the whole movie. George Lucas, I want a damn refund!!!!!

Author: madmax-09144
Review_Title: The steaming pile of diarrhoea Phantom Menace had after an all day Taco Bell binge
Review: Just terriblely terrible. Also Anakin Skywalker is poorly acted,presented and most of the movie is a boring love story between him and Padmé. That's right. No you can't see the clone wars but you CAN see Natalie Portman and Hayden Christensen flirt for 2 hours

Author: goid
Review_Title: Lucas seems to be getting back to Star Wars proper...
Review: I thought this movie was good.  After the terrible disappointment of Episode 1, I was worried about this one.  Nine years old when I saw Star Wars in 1977, I've been a long time fan.

Author: Petter_Pettersson
Review: Just saw the DVD version of the film, high expectations since people here says the film is really good (although the rating isnt too high).

Author: Lovehandle888
Review_Title: Explosive action, not so explosive screenplay
Review: This film is a must see for all sci-fi fans. The action sequences and duels are simply mind boggling. The thing I still think it was missing an edgey, mysterious dark figure, like Darth Maul or Vader, but not so under used. At times it good get very borring, like when Anakin and Amidala are talking, but the "sex" makes up for that. All in all the visuals are great, but the plot could've used some touch ups, I wouldn't mind waiting till late june/early july if he spend a bit more time on the dialogue.

Author: Weisselberger
Review_Title: May The Force Be With All Of Us
Review: Thursday night 16th of may.... 22:00pm dutch time.... in a cinema far far away...

Author: kelvin_okl
Review_Title: Star Wars is for fans only.
Review: Episode 2 goes on to confirm that the Star Wars universe can only be appreciated by fans only. I liked Episode 2. I liked Episode 1 as well.
