In fact I watched Ep1 3x in the cinema and never once got bored with it. I liked the characters in both Ep1 and Ep2. I didn't think Jar Jar Binks was annoying. In fact without him Ep1 would have been really dull (Ep 4,5 and 6 had C-3PO to provide the fun factor why not Jar Jar for Ep1 considering C-3PO only had a minor role in Ep1). I think the acting was good. Typical Star Wars. No nonsense, polite (compared to movies these days).  The story is well told and I dare say the ending was one of the only few movies this past year that raised a few Oh I see.... Example: And I thought Count Dooku was..... Oh I didn't expect him to...... And what do you know, both sides were...... And that's why he did it. He wanted to.... This is what happened to me in the end. Truely rare. The only other movie that came close to it was Sixth Sense. I really don't understand critics these days. In fact I think people should always remember the critics name and institution he/she from when reading such critics. Why? I guarantee that the same person would have gone to the cinema and criticised 8 out of 10 movies he/she is supposed to review. It has its faults I admit but waw is that bad till some critics gave it a D???? If it got a D, then almost all other films out there should have gotten a Z. Special effects criticised. Too computer based. Well whether all the critics like it or not, this is the future of Science Fiction.

Author: jboolman
Review: When I went to the theater I had butterflies in my stomach. As I am 26 years old, I grew up with Star Wars and they are still my favorites. When I saw TPM I thought: Well, this is just a warm up for Episode II and III. Now that I've seen AOTC I'm very very very very disappointed. Man, how could George Lucas make a Star Wars movie this way. All the magic, mystery is gone. Instead we get a supersweet Titanic in Space story, including grass fields in which they run to each other. I just started to fall asleep when the excellent ending came. I've got to admit, the ending is one of the best endings ever, but Mr. Lucas: please make Episode III A STAR WARS MOVIE!!!!!!!!!.

Author: jwilhm
Review: Like so many other die hard fans, I waited in line for the midnight showing to see this film, and now I am completely regretting my decision. While it was better than Phantom Menace, as a life-long Star Wars fan, I take offense that Lucas thinks he can get away with putting the worst love story ever into an otherwise interesting action movie. The film would have been so much better if 90% of the dialogue that Amidala and Anikin have together was cut from the movie. Star Wars fans are smarter than Lucas thinks. WE KNOW that Anikin and Amidala fall in love when they're not supposed to. Otherwise, Episodes 4, 5, and 6 don't make sense. Just showing scenes of them enjoying each other's company in the beautifully landscaped scenes would be enough to get the point across. Instead we have to endure crappy lines like "Everything here is soft and smooth", and "I am haunted by the kiss you shouldn't have given me." It sounds like Anakin is making an awkward pass at his sister.

Author: joe-164
Review: Ok now i love star wars, but this movie was bad. The dialoge was awful and Natalie Portman was very non-convincing as an actress. Lucas should not be directing these movies, he didnt direct the empire strikes back or return of the jedi, and those are the best in the seires. This movie went nowhere. But there was some good things , like Sam jackson as macu windu and ewan mcgregor as obi-wan keniobi.

Author: rmoore3
Review_Title: Only one flaw that I saw (heard)
Review: All I can say is the CG is awesome!  Next, that Yoda IS THE MAN!  The story was great.  The only thing lacking in this film had to be Obi-Wan's dialogue.  McGregor almost seemed to tense in the whole movie.....like they actually filmed the movie in scene order and he hadn't received a script. Even though we all know his character lasts until Episode 4.

Author: bigaviboy
Review: Someone needs to beat George Lucas. He did go to film school, didn't he? My mind is baffled that someone could actually make a movie so incredibly bad. For all of you that voted 10, something is definetly wrong with you. Nothing about this film was good; not the directing, not the acting, not the editing, and and especially not the script. The only thing that could make Attack of the Clones worse would be casting Keanu Reeves as the lead. Well there is one good thing about this film...it is the funniest movie of the year. It's so bad it's funny.

Author: sbhatta904
Review_Title: Good Start good ending, but what's all that crap in the middle.
Review: Expectations were high as Obi-Wan and baby Darth joined the assination investigation, but after Padmé and Anakin get together, the chemistry one would expect from these two characters never materialized.  I wanted Portman use what she learned from the professional and put a bullet in Hayden Christensen's head.  They mixed like "oil and water".  I believe it was more Hayden Christensen's fault rather than Anakin's fault.  Hayden Christensen CANNOT act.  Even when he gets angry, his facial expressions appear as if he has constipation rather than realizing that his mother just died in his arms.  The casting for this role poor, and as a result, the middle 1.2 hours of the movie was unbearable.  But, it did redeem itself slightly when Yoda took out his tool and went to town.  And, what's with Sam Jackson?  Don't get me wrong, he is a fine actor, but that goofy "This party is over" line, with a ghetto accent almost drove me over the edge.  Where did he get his Jedi training, South Central Jedi Tech?  I am a die hard Star Wars fan, but this movie sucked?  I gave it a 4 only because I am a fan, otherwise it's a 1.

Author: Eggar
Review_Title: The Force is Back big time!
Review: I have seen the movie TWICE digitally projected and I did hate Phantom Menace....

Author: magniloquent
Review_Title: George lucas renews faith in the Force
Review: George Lucas has created a quality sequel to a much maligned episode 1. the story line and pace is better as well as characterisation. Episode 2 is full of action and humour and ILM have out-done themselves with the special effects. If your faith in the force was rocked by the Phantom Menace then it will be renewed in Attack of the Clones. Thank you George Lucas.

Author: jayb87a
Review: Let it be known that I had never before seen Star Wars in my life. I had always assumed that this is what nerds who wore pocket protectors and spent Friday nights at home watched because they had nothing better to do. So when my family sat down and watched it, I tried to leave, but was ordered to sit down and suck it up. I was so glad that they did. This movie has made me consider George Lucas as a genius. It's action scenes are incredible, and even Yoda kicks ass in this movie. I especially enjoyed watching Padme and Anakin's romance blossom. While Hayden's acting was okay, I thought Natalie Portman charming as Amidala. It's made me go and buy all the series. So I'm, going to watch them all to get the whole story. Episode I here I come....

Author: NYPseudolus
Review_Title: The Young and the Restless..IN SPACE!
Review: When George Lucas announced the title for his second prequel of the six-part epic that is "Star Wars" many fans scoffed.  It was far too reminiscent of a cheesy Hollywood serial from the 1950's.  If only it was that much fun!  With Episode II Lucas reconfirms his inability to tackle important directorial chores that should be taken for granted, primarily casting and dialogue.  There is considerable effort placed on the minutiae of every frame and detail yet all this work can't help piece together a cohesive structure or interesting narrative (like the first trilogy did), even with "Clone's" overwhelming visual proficiency.

Author: NYPseudolus
Review_Title: The Young and the Restless..IN SPACE.
Review: When George Lucas announced the title for his second prequel of the six-part epic that is "Star Wars" many fans scoffed.  It was far too remineicent of a cheesy Hollywood serial from the 1950's.  If only it was that much fun. With Episode II Lucas reconfirms his inability to tackle important directorial chores that should be taken for granted, primarily casting and dialogue.  There is considerable effort placed on the minutiae of every frame and detail yet all this work can't help piece together a cohesive structure or interesting narrative like the first trilogy did; even with "Clone's ` overwhelming visual proficiency.

Author: mhicks
Review_Title: Budget in inverse proportion to quality
Review: A horrible, horrible movie. Badly written (a given with George Lucas), poorly acted (by everyone with the possible exception of Frank Oz),  and generally underwhelming. Hayden Christensen is embarrassing as Anakin. The action sequences are stupid, contrived, and laughable. The chase scene early in the movie with both Obi-Wan and Anakin making leaps of faith is just silly. There never seems to be any acknowledgment of the laws of physics -- momentum in particular seems to be regularly ignored.

Author: mysterywriterii
Review: Sure the acting is wooden, the dialogue weak, but Star Wars succeeds in the only area it needs to.  It is a spectacularly fun romp.  There are some cheesy one-liners that leave the movie-goers laughing.  People and critics tend to forget that the original Star Wars trilogy does not invoke memories of great acting or dialogue.  In fact, the acting in the first trilogy was attrotious, but it didn't matter.  The true star of any and all Star Wars films have been the special effects, the non-human actors.  This trilogy is missing the formidable villian that Darth Vader was in the first trilogy, but the torment that Anikan is having not over his feelings for Amidala but over his feelings of anger and frustration come across well enough to give that foreboding of doom that surrounds his character.  There is some zingy dialogue that foreshadows events that occur in the first trilogy, like when Obi-Wan tells his Padawan learner, Anakin -- well, you'll just have to see it.  I don't want to ruin one of the few dialogue moments in the movie. There are very few dialogue moments.  Obi-Wan has that one.  Mace has one later in the film as does Yoda.  Yoda is the best part of this film and his scenes along with the scenes involving Jango Fett and his clone son, Boba are among the best.  The climactic battle scene is so filled with energy that I feel that I must see the film again because I know I missed half of what was going on film. I wrote a review for Spider-Man not to long ago where I said that Spider-Man failed on the level that it needed to succeed in the action aspect. Spider-Man succeeds where Star Wars does not on a dialogue, acting level. If you combined the two you would have the perfect movie.  George Lucas is not an actor's director.  He gets better performances from his special effects than his actors.  That is the way he directs.  For that matter, who really cares?  The performances do not need to to be Laurence Olivier quality.  The best performance given by any actor in the whole series was by Alec Guiness and that's only because he's one of the finest actors that ever lived and did not need a whole lot of direction.  Young actors like Portman, McGregor, and Christensen need direction.  McGregor gave an outstanding performance in last year's Moulin Rouge.  Portman has been outstanding in various films.  These are not bad actors.  They just didn't get the direction they needed to fulfil their characters.  I'm still not sold on why Amidala would be in love with Christensen.  It would seem to me that she may be sort of sickened by his actions when going to save his mother.  My disbelief can be linked back to Episode I where it is difficult to imagine Portman's sexy Amidala with the young 9-year-old Anakin. Nevertheless, this is a great movie that doesn't rely too heavily on the love story the way Spider-Man did.  This movie relies on gun fights, chases, exploding starships, light saber duels, which includes one of the most unlikely duel of the series and one of the most satisfying.  I wouldn't dare to ruin it for anyone, so I won't. Bottom line, this film succeeds where it needs to and fails where it has never mattered before and still doesn't.  I mean, did anyone really go to see a Star Wars movie to find out if Han and Leia end up together.  That love story was as poorly written as this one and who cares.

Author: ilindsay
Review: After the general downbeat reception of The Phantom Menace, it's good to have the old Star Wars magic back.

Author: nachopol
Review: After seeing the valuation the people has given to this film, the only thing I can say is that all the people wants to believe this one is a great film. I agree this episode is huge better than the first one but it doesn't mean this is not a horrible movie as well. It's just a saturation of FX and a sequence of battles and fights with no sense including a sugarfull love story (Yoda and Samuel L Jackson have more chemistry than Anakin and Amidala). I think that nothing will go on in this presequence that Lucas is doing (nothing but incomes which is what he matters of course) until he tries to make a real plot and forget about the f....X.

Author: dave_mf
Review_Title: Lucas has run out of ideas
Review: This film is far, far superior to the Phantom Menace. However, George Lucas has left himself with too much to do from a storytelling perspective, and appears to be way out of his depth. For all his claims of having the grand storyline written all along, he suddenly has to get from point A (powerful, precocious young Jedi) to point B (most evil man in the galaxy) over the course of two films, and it doesn't look like he knows how. What results is a mess of cliches and rehashes of his own (and other people's) work, riddled with inconsistencies and contradictions, and with parts looking like the opening chapters of My First Book of Love Stories.

Author: celticloveknot
Review: yes people star wars is back on track, and it's better than ever. yes the dialogue is cheesy but let's face it this is star wars not shakespeare. the action scenes kick ass, and only two things left to say yoda rocks!

Author: vhylynx
Review_Title: eps2 is lightyears better than eps1
Review: EVERYTHING ELSE ROCKED!!! the best 9 bucks i have spent this year. the best thing since sliced bread! I WANT MORE!!! bring eps3!

Author: orangetea2
Review_Title: You gotta take the good with the bad.
Review: Though Lucas delivers eye-popping visuals and blood-racing action sequences, this movie has as many (though different) problems as The Phantom Menace. Any viewing audience should go in expecting the most trite and cliched love story imaginable and the sacrifice of a good story to the development of Anakin's character. Yes, one must account for the transformation of a seemingly well-meaning youth into the fearsome Darth Vader, but the love story subplot, riddled as it is with over-the-top declarations of the exquisite tortures of lover-hood, only emphasizes the challenges to immediacy that plague Christensen's acting. Though the plots starring McGregor have a redeeming quality, one must wonder if Christensen will replace the Jar-Jar around Lucas's neck. This isn't to say that the film isn't worth a viewing because it is, but I question that it is the successor that Star Wars fans have been patiently awaiting.

Author: livenkind
Review_Title: This sorry mess of a movie
Review: From the unconvincing assassination scene at the beginning, to the attempt to emulate TESB at the end, this dull, unexciting movie had most of the audience in The Ritzy, Brixton, London, in fits of laughter at each fresh, clunky plot turn, or tired, dated old cliche (Anakin has a bad dream...). Although the FX are 2nd to none, and the fights, space battle and general pyrotechnics are superb, what this sorry mess of a movie lacks is a heart, a centre, someone about whom we can care. Cos God love him, not only has the Anakin character become a crashing bore, but Hayden Christiansen just cannot act. Not at all. Not one little bit. And he's more or less swallowed up by all the crash bang whizzery that surrounds him and his cohorts; Ewan Mc Gregor's Obi Wan is more dull and humourless than ever, Natalie Portman struggles gamefully with the terrible dialogue but in the end does all her emoting through her hair, and the various others involved (Samuel L and Christopher Lee especially) simply fax their performances in. One the minus side, bad dialogue, bad acting, no narrative, on the plus, top FX and a great sabre fight from Yoda. Which earns it 4 out of 10. And that's being generous...

Author: phatguy
Review: couldn't agree more with the front review of this movie Episode I was such a poor movie and I was expecting at the very most an OK movie from Attack of the Clones

Author: Winggod3
Review: words simply cannot justify how great of a Star Wars movie EpII is.  For as much as I though that Lucas could not beat Empire Strikes Back, he has.

Author: furled
Review: Aside from the brief Jar Jar occurances, and the stooges-styled antics of 3PO and  R2, the story actually did a decent job of interweaving character development against the complex political backdrop. Thank god it was better than Phantom Menace.

Author: incognitogrl
Review_Title: I can't believe it could get worse than Episode I
Review: I just got back from this movie. It was horrible. I'm sure a lot of Star Wars fans will argue, and it's good knowing the backround of the characters and whatnot, but the acting, script, and general plot was disgusting. Hayden Christenson cannot act and is definately not worthy of playing young Vader. I think the acting would have been better if they had cast Freddie Prinze Jr. or even Keanu Reeves. That is how bad it is. I adore Natalie Portman, but she was just too dull in this. I can't even think of someone I can give credit to as 'stealing the show,' although I'm glad Samual L. Jackson got more screen time. He deserves it. I'm rating this a 2 out of 10, and I will never in my life ever watch this again, nor will I ever recommend it to anyone, even my worst enemy.

Author: nudaydreamer
Review: I bought tickets to see Episode II at 12:01 AM and 9:30 PM, and my first thought when the film finished the first time was, "I have to wait 18 hours to see it again?!".  I LOVED this movie.  A huge SW fan since age 5, I was holding back tears as the opening theme began.  From that moment, my eyes didn't leave the screen (except for a few moments when I covered them in fear).  It seems like the "cool" trend among "real" fans is to point out as many flaws as possible, such as the movie's admittedly unremarkable dialogue, but you know what?  If loving AOTC makes me less of a fan, so be it.  The film is AMAZING.  There are at least half a dozen visually unparalleled scenes.  The plot blends just the right amount of adventure and intensity with subtle (or not-so-subtle) foreshadowing of episodes 4-6, and leaves the viewer drooling with anticipation for Episode III.  AOTC was everything I wanted it to be and more.  The Force is with us again!  I love you, George Lucas!

Author: davisdirector
Review: Finally, George has gotten it right. He's told a wonderful story very well.. well paced, well executed. And yet, so many morons complain. Why do they complain? Simple... They are morons. Wait, before I continue, let it be known that I very much consider myself a Star Wars Geek. But after watching some of the people who waited in line for ten or more days just to see the movie opening night(I waited two hours to see it at the same time, dummies), and all I heard on the news was "It better be better than Episode One, Lucas has lost his touch," etc. Well, it was, and he hasn't. Why the attack of the Star Wars Geeks out there? Simple enough to answer. They can't just enjoy it anymore. Star Wars has become more than a wonderful series of highly entertaining movies. It has become more than religion to these fools with no lives. They live their lives as if they had family on Alderaan when it was blown up, as if they were nearly destroyed by the Death Star. As if Han Solo loved them, but for some reason fell in love with a hot princess. Get over yourselves, you geeks! Simply put, Episode II: Attack of the Clones, was a wonderful movie, with great special effects and a solid plotline. While the acting isn't quite Lawrence Olivier, it is passable enough for the film. I can't give away any of the plot, but Yoda kicks some major butt, and Amidala is the hottest thing in space... Ever. Go and enjoy a well-made movie. But please, quit yer complaining about minor, moronic details that no one noticed except you and all those other Star Wars Geeks who have nothing better to do than question the genius of George Lucas.

Author: iheg
Review: When the movie begun i thought it would be as bad as episode one.  But the ending was just great , the movie was good after yoda arrives on his ship. But the guy who plays Anikan is terrible , well maybe its just Lucas whos a bad director. The special effects where at times not good enough and some of the characters looked like toys but at other times the effects where wery good. Christopher Lee and Ian Mckellan where great in this film and it was nice to see 3po and R2 come back allthough they aint half as funny as they where in the orginal. The film has improoved a bit but i hope that the last one will be even better.  I just wish lucas would just write the story and then get someone else to direct and improove the dialoge.

Author: KindlyDrained
Review: After I got home this morning at about 3am from watching the midnight premiere here in Miami.  My face was still glowing from the pure delight of watching such a great peice of entertainment.  I do not think AOTC will win any acting or screenplay awards, but the special effects were outstanding and the story line was simply brilliant.  The tie-in's from episode I and to the nostalgic trilogy were great.  The movie had very minor flaws and perhaps a few scenes we could have done without and even went overboard with some of the characters (ie. Yoda, C3P0) but watching Yoda doing his thing was a good laugh. I have always been a StarWars fan and I was a bit dissapointed with Epidode I but George Lucas is back to form with Epiode II. From a fan's point of view I give the movie a 10 of 10.  But from the critics perspective an 8 of 10 (there is much room for improvement in the movie).

Author: jochumtenhaaf
Review: I saw the Attack of the Clones more than a week ago, and since my first viewing I've seen it two more times, and I'm happy to say that, unlike with the Phantom Menace, I start enjoying it more and more.

Author: defythereds
Review: If The Phantom Menace hurt the credibility of Lucas and his franchise, which it quite obviously did, Attack of the Clones saved it. I'm not upset at Menace any more-I've seen the movie seven or eight times and it has won a place in my heart. Attack won over those who were less enthusiastic about Episode I, though.

Author: chrisclement
Review: George Lucas' latest installment of the Star Wars saga, Attack of the Clones, provided a bitter mixture of extraordinary special effects and stunning landscapes along with a story that is presented rather forcefully and emotionally sapped.  The old combination that worked so well in the 70s and 80s has been derailed to the point that frankly, it just isn't fun anymore.  For all the digital technology and the CGI creations and the wondrous imagery that Lucas paints on the screen,  he is simply unable to reinvent the fascinating story that made Star Wars what it once was.

Author: jonbolton
Review_Title: pretty good if your expectations are low
Review: I thoroughly enjoyed Attack of the Clones, although I probably would have been disappointed if I hadn't read all the bad reviews of it before going. The battle scenes are spectacular, Ewen McGregor seems to be channeling Sir Alec Guiness as Obi Wan, Christopher Lee is outstanding as the evil Count Dakou.  Also, the movie is worth seeing for Yoda alone, who has a surprisingly large and *active* role.  On the bad side, the dialogue is pretty poorly written, the guy who plays Anakin makes Mark Hamill look like Robert Deniro, and the love scenes between Anakin and Padme are cringe-inducing and utterly unconvincing.

Author: tjdavohn
Review: I can't help but notice some haters here and there.  Now, I concede to the fact that no movie will please every person on earth, but to some critics Episode II was already a bomb before they even saw it.  One critic even when on and on about how the movie sucked, how this was done poorly, how that was not cool, ect, ect.......only to say in closing that he didn't like the Star Wars Trilogy to begin with and was never a fan!  Now I don't know about you, but that only tells me that some critic's opinion was already set well before he/she saw the movie.  So OF COURSE they're going to say it sucked! DUH, they don't like Star Wars to begin with!  These poor reviews are nothing more than jealous belittling from a hater.  H A T E R........and haters don't make for good critics.

Author: interwill
Review_Title: Great effects can't help the bad dialogue.
Review: When I sat down and watched this movie with about 600 other Star Wars fans I didn't really know what to expect - my expectations before Episode One had been huge but that movie didn't turn out to be very good. Now that I've seen the movie I'd like to comment on two things: first of all the special effects in this movie; they are great - I've never seen anything like it before, the music also plays an important part i the perception of the special effects - the use of drum music, as can be heard in 'Crounching Tiger, Hiden Dragon' makes one of the Light Saber duels into something special. The other part that I wanted to comment is the dialogue - we were 600 people in the theater, all of us had was very excited, and all of us screamed one or two time because of the bad dialogue. The problem it seems, is that the dialogue feels too 'constructed' while this is good when you want to make trailers or punch lines that you want the audience to remember after leaving the theater, it is really bad when you are trying to show a love relationship or something like that.

Author: kradar
Review: Viewed film Thursday 5/16

Author: jon-189
Review: After a disappointing Phantom Menace I tried not to set my expectations too high this time. Which is just as well. For me the script was poor at times with too many cliches and for the first hour I found myself cringing at times in my seat. The love scene was too prolonged and downright corny. The most notable performance was Christopher Lee who was his usual excellent self. The highly talented Ewan McGregor seemed to be struggling converting his Scottish accent into an upper class English accent and Hayden Christensen looked as though he had been plucked from some mediocre amateur dramatic society to fill the role. Although he does have my sympathy as the lines he was given were not exactly inspirational. Having said all that the film did improve considerably in the second half. The battle scenes and special FX were superb which was to be expected. On balance this was a good light entertainment film well worth seeing and certainly a big improvement on it's predecessor. But unfortunately, Lucas again failed to achieve the exceptionally high standards expected of him. I awarded this film 7/10. Had the script been of a higher standard with better casting I would have edged it up to a 9 or even a 10.

Author: w_waggener
Review_Title: The worse Star Wars episode made! Hire Zahn or Stackpole to write future scripts.
Review: I saw the original Star Wars on opening night many years ago as a young girl.  I thought it was one of the best movies ever made and I still do. I would consider it a "Movie Classic".

Author: Sadoldgit
Review: I can't figure out why others thought this was so good.  After so much excitement in the build up, I was very disappointed.

Author: Rayvin
Review_Title: Without Anakin this movie would be great.
Review: It´s a cool movie, much more Star Wars than Episode I, including great fight scenes (especially Joda of course) and with the guys who designed the clone-army the best aliens I have ever seen in a movie. But from the first moment where Anakin appears George Lucas screams in your face: "Watch out, this guy will become very evil". The storyline offers so many possibilities to let the character of Anakin develop, but Lucas simply completely failed with this part of the movie, since Anakin does not develop at all: From the beginning he is arrogant and bigheaded. Together with completely primitive dialogs ("I should be the most powerful Jedi of all time!") Anakins story simply destroys the good impression the rest of movie gives: If you take a look at his behavior, nobody can understand why Padme should love him at all and the moronic death of his mother makes you just shake your head. Not even the best actor could have made Anakins character and his story seem believable (because of the crappy script) and thus Hayden Christensen has not a chance to succeed. Does George Lucas think his audience only consists of idiots or why does he have to present Anakins tale so clearly that you feel insulted and without leaving room for any imagination. I will give this movie a 7, which regarding my harsh stricture shows how good many parts this movie has. But I am still disappointed because I know how good this movie could have been. The way it is it´s cool, but far away in quality from Lord of the Rings.

Author: boydisgood
Review_Title: I'm Back on Board The Star Wars Love Train
Review: Episode I derailed my almost unshakable faith and love for the star wars universe.  It's funny actually, because I didn't hate Episode I, it just got old for me... I wanted more, and I felt Lucas dropped the ball.  Jar Jar was disappointing as a whacky alien sidekick, and made chewbacca's wookie light shine even brighter.  Now that I think about it, Jar Jar is a permanent skidmark on my darth vader underoos, and I say that with conviction.

Author: theseeker75
Review: I got a chance to see Episode II last night, and let me tell you, I wasn't disappointed. I would see things that were absent in the Phantom Menace, for example, the presence of humour, and the storyline that we all remember from the original Trilogy. Does this film compare to any of the old films? No, it doesn't.

Author: derekg71
Review: I must admit.. My expectations for Star Wars Episode II were less than par. Upon hearing all the negative reviews from critics, I went in feeling the movie wasn't going to be the spectacle I thought it was going to be.

Author: HamItUp
Review: **WARNING - SPOILER CONTAINED**

Author: molin1
Review: SWEP2 is unlike any of the other SW films.  It's not really like any movie I can recall as far as the tone.  It's dark, brooding and at times pretty violent, with very few light moments.  But the light moments are much appreciated as a result.  I have no idea what everyone is complaining about, the acting is just fine in this movie - the dialogue in the love scenes is a bit  over-the-top at times (think teen romance, where a kiss is life-or-death), but the actors do fine across the board.  Not flat at all. Everything moves along briskly.  Even Jar-Jar is OK.  The only real complaint I would have is the CG is at times obvious.  In fact it seems Christopher Lee is animated for part of a fight scene, which is a no-no. The technology is not there, especially when the actual guy is already in the movie so you get a direct comparison in your mind.

Author: Pilsaar
Review_Title: The Force... What can I say more?
Review: This movie is da bomb. After seeing the disappointing episode I, I was afraid that Lucas would screw it up again but didn't. He made Attack of the Clones an excellent movie. Specially Yoda rocks big time.

Author: raven_snook
Review: This film was awful, pretty much as bad as the last installment, albeit in a totally new way. The last twenty minutes, particularly the Yoda - Dooku duel were impressive...most impressive, but the "romantic" scenes between the two leads were just WRONG!  When Anakin blurted out to Amidala: "Are you in as much pain as I am?" the audience burst into spontaneous and embarrassing laughter!  Lucas has been living on his ranch too long. He's a man out of touch.  That said, I freely admit, I wish I had one iota of his genius!  I can't say I could make a better film, but I as a fan I have a right to be disappointed.

Author: aggiefuzz97
Review: Maybe I am getting too old, but this film was down right silly, and the actor playing Anakin, while handsome and looking right for the part, couldn't act his way out of a paper bag.  This could have been a much better movie, but with these people in love with digital effects, I guess I should expect more cartoon than anything else.

Author: christianchick88
Review: Episode II was a pleasant ride after Episode I.  Ewan McGregor is a spectacular Obi-Wan, at least I think so. The special effects and fighting were awesome.  Tension is building for the Jedi and George Lucas has put them in a carefully manuevered trap.  C3PO and R2 were great fun, and Yoda was THE MAN!  Even Mace Windu, previously given little screen time, was well done.  And though I didn't like the blatant misuse of Jar Jar's stupidity ( I don't care what anyone says, I liked him)it didn't matter that much.

Author: supermansson
Review: OK...So I know all you Star Wars fans don't want to hear this, but "Attack of the Clones" is quite possibly the worst movie I have ever seen in my entire life.  The acting is absolutely horrible.  As one person was heard to comment, "That movie had the acting quality of a softcore porn."  Also, the story was disjointed and worthless.  The only, and I mean only, reason to watch this putrid piece of rotting wookie carcass of a movie is the fight scene with Yoda, but even then, the guy he fights is horrible, thus following the bad acting characteristics I was talking about before.  Do yourself a favor, rent Mission to Mars, at least you won't have to listen to Jar Jar Binks.

Author: chugchug
Review_Title: Quite Possibly The Most Amazing Film of The Century!
Review: Excellent movie. I saw it today at 4:30PM (special movie theatre employee screening!) and I was blown out of my mind. The acting was excellent, no Jake Loyd, minimal amount of Jar Jar Binks, and some awesome battle scenes with Yoda and Mace Windu. This movie was so amazing. The dialoge was fantastic and so was the story. Incredible.

Author: jr_mcnaughton
Review_Title: Nice Star Wars feel, but does NOT live up to the hype!
Review: This film does NOT live up to the hype. It is NOWHERE NEAR on a par with "The Empire Strikes Back", and it's not as good as either "A New Hope" or "Return of the Jedi". The film is spoilt by flat acting in both the opening stages and the love scenes (Hayden Christensen is a little wooden when it comes to the film romance). There is also, once again, a heavy over-reliance on CGI; so much so that you sometimes think you could be watching "Who Framed Roger Rabbit". This film could take lessons from "Dog Soldiers" in the artistic and subtle use of computer effects, combined with excellent REAL COSTUMES!!!

Author: muckiduck
Review_Title: Good movie, but not so good "Star Wars" episode.
Review: Possible spoilers ahead.

Author: HenkBeems
Review_Title: One big waste of money and time
Review: For someone who doesn't like science fiction movies, one Star Wars may be good but that's it. Star Wars is not only in my opinion, but as a fact, the biggest sorry excuse ever made in film history. I'll tell you why.

Author: danteshicks
Review: On the way home from Episode II, my friends and I concluded that Episode I must have been just a plot set for AOTC. Attack of the Clones delivered so much action, and a great set up for Episode III as well. I was on a star wars buzz walking out of the theater. I am so happy with George Lucas as well. Jar Jar only had a few scenes, and played no real major role in the movie. Threepio served as the comic relief, just as it should be in Star Wars. Another thing, the love scene sounded so bad in reviews, but Lucas played it out so great that there was no real long sequence with just Anakin and Padme. I loved this movie, and will be seeing it much more during its theater run.

Author: danteshicks
Review: He finally made another star wars movie to rival the greatness of Empire Strikes back.  Lucas really out did himself this time!  I highly recommend this one to all fans out there who have forsaken the trilogy due to the childlike nature of Episode 1.

Author: darthtyranus
Review: Everybody knows whether they admit it or not (even the critics) that George Lucas saved American cinema from death by banality and boredom when he released his first Star Wars film and revolutionized the film industry. This installment rivals the original Star Wars in terms of innovation and excitement. It is a sweeping epic that will excite and entertain anyone who isn't brain dead or a professional movie critic (which often goes hand in hand, at least in the US). I've been to two showings and on both occasions the audience was clearly moved and everybody cheered throughout the movie. There was a huge roar of applause from people of all ages after the movie ended.  Some have criticized the acting but in my opinion that is absolutely ludicrous and has probably more to do with the fact that most of the actors are not from the USA than their talent. Hayden IS Anakin Skywalker just as Harrison Ford was Han Solo and its impossible to imagine anyone else taking their place. Ewan and Natalie play their roles well and Samuel Jackson and Christopher Lee are brilliant. I fear many of the critics that have given this movie a negative review have alternate motifs. We must bear in mind that Lucas is not a part of the Hollywood fluff machine circle that the critics move in and churns out one brainless and badly acted move after another to critical acclaim. It is interesting that in Europe AOTC has received overwhelmingly positive reports.

Author: bertop
Review: Just a couple of words to describe ATOC: unforgettable and epic. Lucas returns back to the right emotion, action and philosophy of The Empire Strikes Back. The CG work is amazing and far from other pictures. It is a must see for everyone. Now, the wait for Episode III starts...

Author: mikedonn
Review_Title: Thrilling and amazing addition to Star Wars family.
Review: Wow! I didn't really know what should I expect after the childish and boring Episode I. But what I saw amazed me: Beautiful sceneries (Corussant). Unfolding story (Anakin goes dark). Fascinating creatures (Attention Jar-Jar enemies - he's still there! But look for the beautiful four-handed monster meeting Obi-Wan in the bar - I love this one!) And, last but not least, the final battle of the Jedis! Is there a prize for "Best Action Sequence Of The Year"? (rather century:-) This one must get it! If you like action but don't like Star Wars then you've got to see Episode II only because of the Jedi Battle scene! All in all, it's a very sweet reward for 20+ years of waiting for a Star Wars sequel worthy of George Lucas!

Author: superogue
Review_Title: John Shaft with a light-saber, what else can you wish for?
Review: After early reservations, long waiting lines and a number of seat-switches (to get a bit further away from the screen) i was ready to see "Attack of the Clones", and boy it was worth it!

Author: elsie b
Review: Lame love story; wooden acting (except for McGregor); a plot that lacked originality or wit; cliched dialog; and a battle scene that went on forever. I liked the visuals though.  Maybe I've just outgrown the whole phenomenon as I am old enough to have been an adult when the first one was made. Spiderman was intelligent enough and well-acted for even an oldtimer like myself to enjoy.  I think this Star Wars episode will be the last one I shell out admission for.

Author: jhynoski
Review_Title: Did we all see the same original trilogy?
Review: Been seeing some funny things in this review column, comparing the new films to the original trilogy. I love the criticisms... wooden acting, shallow plot lines, bad love scenes...

Author: Man in the Planet
Review_Title: When it's bad, it is very bad...
Review: Final Fantasy has proven that the filmmaker can create the most dazzling special effects, and immerse the audience in an intricate virtual world, but it all comes to nought if the filmmaker doesn't draw the characters well and give them something intelligent to say.

Author: gpheck
Review: It's been interesting reading some of the more emotional reviews for this movie.

Author: linalove
Review: Wow.  This movie was one of the best I have ever seen.  The scenery looked awesome, the costumes were great, and the acting was quite good.  The story line itself and the characters involved were really neat and developed quite nicely.  The only bad thing about the movie was that it had to end at all.

Author: Cpt Gabok
Review_Title: The Force Is Strong With Lucas
Review: It was simply awesome!  I'm not kidding, in the first ten minutes, it is already better than Episode I, which I liked.  But by the end, you are completely lacking coherency, so amazed by all the amazing visuals you are seeing, and the emotions filling you inside.

Author: athena13-1
Review_Title: love the story, hate the movie... almost
Review: I cannot consider myself a Star Wars fan even though I have seen all the movies. I love the story and mythology behind it, but Episode 2 was a bit of a disappointment.

Author: Mattyproff
Review_Title: i had a bad feeling about this.....but i was wrong
Review: Well, after the success of the original trilogy, Lucas made the mistake of...well....the phantom menace. Although it was ultimately a childrens film, it lacked any of the magic wonder and awe of the originals. With episode 2, Lucas made a truly wonderful and griping saga which shows Anakin Skywalker take a huge step towards the dark side.

Author: commodore-64
Review: I hardly believe that most fans have the same opinion. After the flop with Episode 1, Lucas made a bigger flop with Episode 2.

Author: m_skipp
Review: Honestly, that's only word that comes to mind. This movie was fabulous if you want something to make fun of the entire time. I have never been so thankful for the ending credits. It was soo lame that I found myself cringing each time Anakin (however it's spelled) told Amadalla how much he loves her. The special effects were fabulous (as was to be expected), the story worked but the dialog was such crap. The writer should be slapped repeatedly and then stripped down and flogged publicly. And all the guys were such wussies. In the first movies, the characters were so badass, but this movie made me lose all respect for each character. The blue crab monster was cool though.

Author: jamesp-7
Review: These are a few things that just occurred to me. 1. (This has been mentioned by others) I feel sorry for future generations who see the Star Wars movies in chronological order. Because there will be no mystery, "Luke, I'm your father" who cares, "Leia you're my sister", already knew that. The prequels give it away. 2. This didn't just occur to me but, the effects are good, but lack the warmth of the originals. 3. The dialogue and characters also lack the charm of the originals, and dialogue is painful at times. 4. I don't like comparisons between LotR's and Star Wars, but... The new movies don't compare to LotR for feeling, charm, and energy. The Originals stand beside LotR's as two great cinematic sagas. But the new Star Wars movies are just their aspiring stable boys. 5. If you really want to get more out of the Star Wars universe, beyond the original trilogy. Then read some of the books. It's sad but authors like Kevin J. Anderson have done better by the original story than George Lucas's new attempts. Finally, I love Star Wars and I really hope Lucas makes things right with Episode III. But right now Ep I & Ep II feel more like we're watching dry re-enactments of events, rather than the original events themselves.

Author: jamesp-7
Review: This movie was boring the first time I saw it. Why? Well the "love" story is the simplest explanation. It doesn't have any real emotion, and the dialogue is painful at times, (myself and friends went for a walk at those parts of the movie the second time we saw it). Now I will say the battle scenes in this movie are on a huge and vibrant scale. But they are not as good as the final scene in Jedi, (Wedge, Londo, Ackbar and that big-eyed dude can't be beat). This movie is better than Phantom Menace,(not hard), but can't beat the original three.

Author: FishCurry
Review_Title: Poor excuse for a Star Wars film
Review: Blech, what a poor excuse for a Star Wars film. What happened to the epic feel of Episodes IV, V and VI? The character development is poor, and the acting is sub-par. The only worthwhile reason for seeing this film is for the action. Anakin muttered some of the most juvenile lines throughout the film. Its seems that Anakin still hasn't matured from Episode I. Oh well, hopefully, Episode III will be able to capture the epic feel of the IV,V,VI episodes.

Author: rudyscalisi
Review: What a great film. It was visualy stunning, it had a great story and YODA ROCKS! I felt the Star Wars of old in this one. THe action is totally awesome. I cant wait for Episode three. Why are you still reading? Go see the movie. Now!

Author: yankeefan2358
Review_Title: Puts the 'Wars' back in Star Wars!
Review: The Force is back with George Lucas, without a doubt! Ewan McGregor is hilarious as a more sarcastic Obi-Wan Kenobi this time as he tries to tolerate and instruct his arrogant and somewhat whiney apprentice Anakin, played in a mixed performance by Hayden Christiansen. Hayden does quite well in the second half of the film, but he falls short in the first half with some very cardboard lines and some pretty fake emotions. However, after one encounter on Tatooine, everything changes and we see the anger in Anakin. That's what we've been waiting for, and Hayden delivers. Natalie Portman, finally free from some of her awful dialogue, is handed a somewhat more palatable script, but she still has some clunkers to deliver. However, she is given a much sexier and personality and wardrobe this time around, and manages to balance the diplomatic side of Padme with the take-charge fighter. The effects are unbelievable, the lightsaber fights(while not as elaborate as in Menace) will leave you cheering, and the villains Jango Fett and Count Dooku ooze malice. All in all, a great overall movie! If only George would have re-written the dialogue for the romance scenes....

Author: grimpeuros
Review_Title: A very weak movie with impressive visual effects
Review: The only reason to see it is for its state-of-the-art visual effects, if you can survive the childish script, dialogues and (possibly consequently) acting...  The only convincing and interesting characters are Count Dooku and Yoda, while the script is 98% predictable.

Author: deathcloset
Review: my favorite star wars yet! the attention to detail in this episode is...unparalleled. stunning.

Author: wrestler114
Review: Episode II is much better than Episode I.  The action, acting, story, and even Jar Jar (note that I still hate Jar Jar) was better.  Though Jar Jar messed everything up for the entire galaxy thats ok, this is a must see and I give it 2 thumbs and 2 big toes up.

Author: buster964
Review: ***It is possible that some of my comments could be contrived as a spoiler, if in any doubt don't read on.***

Author: Elad-K
Review_Title: Bring Back The Glory That was Taken By Episode I
Review: This movie simply ranks right up there with the last 3 episodes (4-6) and offers a great story-line,amazing visual effects and a rather unlikely (and somewhat flimsy) love story. Still This movie is a must see - not only for the star wars freaks but for everyone who saw episode I and was disapointed.

Author: ristohristov
Review: Amazing story, amazing effects,incredible sounds and exotic cities everything that quality movie needs. Incredible fights, contrast between full distruction and true love,breath taking fight between Yoda and Dooko, that is a complete movie. Everyone should watch this incredible movie. Finally THE BEST HAS ARRIVED!!!

Author: mosiroar
Review: Starting off... I like a good romance... The romance in EP2 was some clumsy garbage.  There really wasn't a lot of time given to devolop a real sense of romance.  The only way was through some really embarressing lines. Really awkward.

Author: awmitchell
Review: The scenery is mindless and pointless. Hayden Christensen is absolutely AWFUL throughout this film.

Author: Sullydawg
Review_Title: Go see this movie, my Padawan Learner
Review: Okay to start this off, I just want to state the fact that I am one of the biggest Star Wars fanatics in the world. Star Wars is less of a movie and more like a religion to me. So when Episode I ended (and slightly disappointed, but I understood it was just a start), I began the three year anticipation for Episode II. Thankfully, the anticipation was WELL WORTH IT. I consider Episode II not only to be a great Star Wars movie...but (some may say I'm wrong) I consider it to be my second favorite in the series (sandwiched by #1 Empire, and #3 ROTJ). Episode II starts off with a big bang, literally. When there is an attempt on Senator Amidala's (Natalie Portman) life, the Jedi Council assigns Master Obi-Wan Kenobi (Ewan McGregor) to protect the headstrong senator. Lo and behold, Obi-wan arrives with his padawan, a 20 year old Anakin Skywalker (Hayden Christensen). From the offset you can see that Hayden tackles the role very well, bringing a depth that Episode I lacked. The Jedi have a mandate that states they must protect the queen, but in doing so they pursue her assassin. I won't spoil, but suffice to say, the pursuit leads them into deeper...and darker, things. So what everyone wants to know: Is this movie less one dimensional than Episode I? YES. It has everything that Episode I had (EXCEPT JAR JAR, HE ONLY SHOWS UP FOR ALL OF 10 MINUTES-GOOD STUFF), knockout special effects, incredible lightsaber fights (Let's just say that an little green Jedi master fights), great action sequences(Great Clone War sequence). But it also took a note from Empire and built on subtle underplots and love themes. Anakins transgression to the Dark side pops up in Episode II...but wait till Episode III for the full transformation. This movie did not disappoint this Star Wars junkie at all. The Force is strong with Lucas and his team once again. I'm very happy to be a fan of the greatest movies of all time. So to sum it all up...go see Star Wars Episode II: Attack of the Clones. It's more than worthy of your time. Whereas Episode I was all killer,no filler; Episode II is a Pie of buttkicking.

Author: tezmondorosso
Review_Title: Forget what you've seen and heard regress and enjoy.
Review: I can't believe that there are so many bad comments about this film. For a lot of people my age seeing Star Wars was probably they're first recollection of a cinema experience so that in mind I do take some unnecessary and unintelligent comments and cast them aside.

Author: slimccaig
Review_Title: Amazing story, in-depth characters, and a little green guy who steals the show. (contains spoilers)
Review: WARNING: SPOILERS Wow.  No other word can describe the feeling you get after seeing this movie and letting everything sink in.  Yoda is the greatest of all Jedi, and he shows it in his duel with Darth Tyrannus.  The story was great.  I'm not much for love stories, but this one just worked.  It gave more emotion to the execution scene, and to the movie in general.  It sets up Episode 3 so perfectly.  Though I didn't like the character Anakin, you really aren't supposed to, Hayden did an amazing job.  As did all the other actors.  I dislike the fact Jango was killed...but when Boba picks up his helmet, a chill runs down your spine.  One thing that bothers me slightly, is the fact that Tyrannus defeats Obi-Wan, Anakin, and then basically ties with Yoda. I know Anakin is not matured yet, but he is still supposed to be the chosen one, and Yoda is the most powerful of all Jedi.  At any rate, this movie could not have been done any better.  The war scene was great, special effects were incredible, John Williams yet again does a great job with the soundtrack, and in my opinion, Lucas redeemed himself from the Episode 1 failure.  I liked Phantom Menace, but I'm glad he cut Jar Jar Binks down to about 3 lines and 2 minutes of total time on-film.  See this movie if your a fan of Star Wars, or just a fan of great films.  I couldn't be any more pleased with the results of Lucas and his team's hard work, AMAZING!

Author: Patman007
Review_Title: A gripping sequel to a disappointing prequel...
Review: After seeing this movie the opening day (wow I feel like a trekkie...), I must admit that it definitely does not disappoint. I won't give away any key elements of the story, but I'll give a few points on why I believe that it was one of the best Star Wars movies. First off, this one, unlike Episode 1, had an interesting plot. There was lots of action, and enough inaction to balance it out. The Anakin/Padme issue actually added to the movie, as opposed to making it worse and bogging it down. Another point I'd like to make, is that this movie had some wonderful puns and inside humor that Episode 1 sorely lacked. It was enough to keep the audience laughing in some parts, which is almost unheard of for a Science Fiction movie. My third point, is that the visual effects and new races were simply stunning. These are some of the best special effects I've ever seen. To make my last point, I have merely one word: Yoda. I highly recommend this movie, even to non-science fiction buffs.

Author: d-stock
Review_Title: Please do not waste your time with this film
Review: Only the most devout follower of the force could sit through this dreadful waste of 2 hours of their lives ! The plot is bad (I challenge any child watching these films to tell me what is actually going on !), the acting - no sorry can't call it acting because no one can act in this film!! - Ewan McGregor is an insult to the memory of Sir Alec Guiness !! and I could not wait for the film to finish so I could do something more interesting than watch the soporific love story unfold !! I hope George Lucas never makes another film.

Author: mohser
Review: This was by far the worst of the Star Wars Movies.  The others were o.k. to excellent.  This one's dialog was stilted and uninteresting and the plot unimaginative.  I was very disappointed.

Author: false prophet
Review: Many people feel George Lucas has vindicated himself solely because "Attack of the Clones" is superior to "Phantom Menace."  That's similar to saying a lemon is better than a totalled automobile.

Author: herwarth
Review: I have seen this movie on friday because I am a Starwars fan. I was really disappointed in Episode I, only the last action scene with Darth Maul was fantastic. So I thought Episode II could only be better. And it was! Damn this movie is so good. The environmental scenes are so beautiful made. Technologically the movie is top! All the decors are rendered very nice. Also the plot is much better than Episode I. A romantic part in this movie was necessary (Luke has to be made :) and well done. Also the development of character Anakin Skywalker who becomes more angry in the movie on, so he is turning to the darkside is well done.

Author: benfranklin
Review: I've noticed a certain backlash from people when reviewing this film. You see there are a lot of people who hate George Lucas, so when viewing one of his films they give it an absolute pasting. Its not fair - considering he has created one of the best (if not the best) film sagas of all time.

Author: maven-1
Review: Despite what you may have heard, this movie is not horrible. It has a couple of low-points but they do not detract from the film nearly as much as everyone is saying. Mainly, it rocks in an Empire Strikes Back kind of way. Any true Star Wars fan will love it. And when I say any true Star Wars fan, I am not talking about the little kids who liked The Phantom Menace? I am talking about the people who have all the bad dialogue from episodes 4-6 memorized and are really happy about it. I am talking about the people who own the limited edition 1978 Boba Fett action figure. But most importantly, I am talking about the people that love Star Wars because it's truly a great story.

Author: stealth1ninja
Review_Title: Poor execution of a possibly great movie
Review: First of all, I would like to state I am a very big fan of the first trilogy, and love them dearly.  I have been looking forward to episodes I-III since I first heard they were going to come out.  This said, I was sorely disappointed by the mediocrity of the first film.  I was in awe of the breathtaking visuals and the fantastic worlds envisioned by Lucas.  I was very displeased with the syrupy acting and mostly uninteresting plot development.

Author: dboothe
Review: I will say that I didn't expect great things from this film, and I was pleasantly surprised.  It seems like Lucas really listened to the griping about Episode I and did his best to not commit the same mistaked.  He's never tried to write a love story before, and in my opinion he needs some practice.  Don't get me wrong, it is necessary for later plot developments, I just found it a little weakly constructed.  My other complaint is that there are certain scenes I felt were delivered in such a way for no other reason than to get cheers from the audience (which they did), although in my opinion they might have been more appropriate a little less overdone.

Author: ccantley
Review: Ah... relief.  After a somewhat disappointing Phantom Menace, Attack of the Clones was superb.  The plot revealed several connections to the first trilogy that I often wondered about.  Yoda's fight scene was simply astounding.  The only real question that was brought to mind was "Why is Mace Windu (Samuel L. Jackson) the only Jedi with a purple-hued lightsaber?" I did not see it in Digital format yet, but look forward to do so sometime in the next few weeks.  If you have not seen this... WATCH IT!

Author: tj10564
Review: I love Star Wars.  I watch them with my kids over and over.  With all of the hype we've been eating and sleeping nothing but Star Wars waiting with great anticipation seeing the new film.

Author: bjs269
Review_Title: Very Cool, But Tedious At Times (spoilers)
Review: This is by far superior to episode 1 and in my opinion just as good as return of the jedi however it does not live up to the empire strikes back. Jar-Jar Binks has a much smaller role in e2, even so people booed at his every appearence at the screening i saw. The tedious part part of the movie is in the numerous drawn out love scenes with flat lines and flatter acting by Hayden. My other complaint would be that Obi-Wan seems a little weak in the movie, easily getting captured and putting up almost no resistence to Count Dooku. However the shortcomings of the film are made up with a cooler than ever jedi battle royale with an army of droids and Samuel L Jackson triumphantly chopping off the head of his foe. However the coup de ta comes when we finally get to see Yoda kick some Dooku but, and exclaim "You have much to learn!" The ticket price is worth it just for this scene alone. The entire audience was cheering when yoda made his hobbling entrance. George Lucas has the force back.

Author: popcorn paul
Review: Great special effects and dazzling monsters can't make me like the latest piece of the Star Wars epic, but they certainly tried.  Of course, some people enjoy Star Wars films precisely for this reason and I can't argue with that.  However, if you like your films to contain a well-written script, believable characters, good acting, and chemistry then look elsewhere as this movie fails miserably.

Author: Ezekiels_Shadow
Review: Alright, I've read a bunch of reviews and talked to a bunch of people about this movie, I feel like it's time to throw in my two cents.

Author: TheGrinch
Review_Title: A vast improvement over the Phantom Menace
Review: This was one of the two movies I chose to see this weekend in Russian because I knew the dialogue would not be the best aspect of the movies(the other one was Spider-Man). From what I could understand, the lines were a bit flat. I didnt get in all of the story, but I loved the CGI. It was very very exciting. Thankfully, Jar Jar Binks had a very small part in the movie. I was a bit confused as to the story's plot, but i still enjoyed it very much. A must-see in the theatres, just because of the wonderful effects.

Author: jeffreysig
Review_Title: Worth the wait, lives up to the hype!!
Review: What can I say about this movie, other than it was all that a fan could hope to be.  Unlike the Phantom Menace, in AOTC we get to learn about the personalities of the characters.  The opening sequence is incredible, and the plot is strong enough to carry the entire two hours plus.  The romance parts may see a little sappy, but they are necessary.  Hayden does a great job portraying Anakin's emotional character, and he is really believable as the boy who will be Vader.  Obi-Wan becomes a more likeable, and often humorous figure, who is by far the most entertaining person in the movie. The end battle scene is of course all it's been hyped up to be, but there are some major twists and a few startling surprises.  It definitely follows the structure of Empire Strikes Back, all the way to the final scene.  The action in this movie is fantastic, yet it leaves plenty of room for the characters to distinguish themselves.

Author: whit9757
Review_Title: George Lucas Had a Dream, and this is NOT IT!
Review: Ok, So much to talk about, so little time so i'll make this brief.

Author: lonewolfe_6
Review_Title: Not everything it's cracked up to be!
Review: I am a Star Wars movie fan.  I have enjoyed numbers 4-6 and even enjoyed The Phantom Menace (which wasn't all that wonderful).  I entered this movie with high expectations from all the "rave" reviews I have seen out there.  I was very disappointed!  The plot was good but the movie moved REALLY slow! The last 20 minutes of the movie were the best and Yoda really kicked butt! However, this 2 hour movie could have been down.  Half way through the movie my kids wanted to leave.  Maybe my view is clouded because we watched Spider-Man recently and it was sooooo wonderful!!!!  The special effects in the movie are excellent but at times the music and sounds are so loud it is hard to hear the dialogue between actors.  Overall I say don't waste your money, wait for the video :-).

Author: sicatuba
Review_Title: Lucas concentrates too much on the story and neglects the acting
Review: Lucas is probably planning for another big hit out of this episode.  The special effects are great and the story is much better than that of episode one.  The aggressive negotiation scenes set up for great action. The audience, Star Wars fans or not, won't be able to resist reaction to Yoda and other Jedi.

Author: GreenLantern519
Review: What a movie .... I would have to say by far the most action Star Wars yet. Many people said that it was going to be a lame movie just like Episode 1 but it was the totally opposite. The best by far was the final battle scene bewteen Duku and Yoda. He doesnt need his cane when he is flying around and using a light saber but he does when he just walking  But over all I give it a 9. George Lucas must have had  great time working on this movie and i think it will show in the box office .

Author: beware_the_enigma
Review: The Star Wars franchise is getting back on track, and Lucas is starting to get some of his old magic. I went to see this movie as soon as I could, because I was anticipating it so much, and I got what I expected. Note, I did not expect anything as good as the first trilogy. The plot was as strong as the first trilogy, and the acting was great (Hayden Cristensen does an excellent job, you can almost feel this dark energy flowing from him), but it seems that Lucas has lost his flair for dialogue and the love story seemed a little predictable and cheesy. The action scenes, however, more than made up for this. (I really got a kick out of the Crouching Tiger, Hidden Yoda stuff) This is not a love story, but it is a great action movie, and probably the best Star Wars "date" movie you could take someone to. It was what I expected, just don't expect too much.

Author: aftiel
Review_Title: (no spoilers) Only five minutes worth the ten bucks...
Review: ...the rest, sadly, is not.

After the heartbreaking disappointment of The Phantom Menace ("yippee","mesa Jar-Jar") - and having watched it several times, it is still a disappointment - my expectations were lower for this one.  But over the last few days before it's release, I started to get excited again.

Author: fam30steve
Review: I attended the NYC screening on May 7, and while I won't give any spoilers or anything, rest assured: this is the movie that fans have been waiting for.

Author: FartyParty7
Review_Title: Doesn't pay off in the end....
Review: I was very excited to see this film and went in with an open mind. I did not line up or camp out for hours because that's just ridiculous nor do I consider myself a Star Wars fan but still enjoy the series.  Yet again I sat through pointless jedi council discussion scenes just waiting to see what I came for.  About 1hr and 50 Mins later I got what I came for and it was pretty good.  The end "battle" was very good and seehing Yoda with a Lightsabre was hilarious.  But then when it started to get good the film just died off and ended without any thought provoking finale or any hint about Anakin's darkside.  It just ended!  I also thought that Hayden I dunno how to spell his last name I just won't bother, his acting was horrid. Jeez this guy makes Jake Lloyd look like Tom Hanks for crying out loud!  He whines and whines and in the end I only was amused when I saw Padme` dress in another sexy costume.  I'm not going to bitch anymore, just see it. Samuel L. Jackson and Yoda ruled the film, they truly had the best scenes.

Author: Bora Tokel
Review: I do not agree with the harsh comments on Hayden Christiensen.He played his role how it should be.After his evil smile and his unstable character (some say unstable acting),I can't think of anyone playing to-be Darth Wader instead of him. I do not know what people who havent liked this movie had been expecting, but this movie is going to be one of the classics,time will show. After watching the old movies hundreds of times of course this one is yet too fresh. This movie has one of the epic battles you can see in star wars movies. I am very pleased with this movie and i can't think of any other way this movie could have been done. You can't expect,of course,and unexpected story with unknown characters,since this is a sequal.A kickass one.

Author: Jinkz
Review_Title: Lucas is back on form and this time the force is with him!
Review: The Clone wars, treated with such high regard in the first trilogy.  Who would have thought that they would begin with such a bang. The Phantom Menace has been slated as the weakest movie in the Star Wars saga, many had fears for Episode II, let me assure you the force is strong in this one. Its a love story, its an action film and its a Star Wars film finally. With new worlds, new societies and exotic characters.  The evil Count Dooku is more than a match for Darth Maul as a true movie villian.  While Jango Fett is amazing as the hired gun. This is a must see.

Author: Bulging_Bruce_Banner
Review_Title: Not quite there yet... but getting close.
Review: Note: I'll try to keep this review spoiler-free.

Author: mfloparco
Review_Title: The First PG-13 Star Wars Movie
Review: This movie is awesome!!!!!!  I know this is rated PG movie-but damn! This movie was intense. I'm glad all the kiddie crap is gone from TPM and ROTJ. I have a message for all the critics who bash this movie-What the hell are you guys looking for? This is just a fun movie which will be loved by fans. Was Mark Hamill that great when he cried in ANH because he couldn't hang out with his friends. The acting in the OT was not very good. How many times does Leia say, " Let's get out of here" in ROTJ. IN ESB- the dialogue seems forced- "who's scruffy looking"or "A death mark is not an easy thing to live with". The dialogue in AOTC is no different than the previous films. Granted, I do feel ESB is the best of them all. I think critics blast this film because their not Star Wars fans. I told my wife- I think Star Wars fans will love this film: Critics will hate it because they don't focus on the big six part picture. I swear these critics try to find something to rip because Star Wars is not artistic. I bet if SW consisted of avant -garde Clone-troopers or a gay anakin skywalker they'd like it. Most of them are too grown up to enjoy Star Wars. Last Night I felt like a little kid. That's what these movies are all about. SPOILER- When Jango got his head cut off by Mr. Jackson I got so excited. Man-That was cool!!! Hint go into these movies with the mind set of a 12 year old- You'll love it.

Author: 10breakalpha

Author: couqui
Review_Title: One of the best Star Wars Films to date...
Review: As a loyalist to Star Wars, I have nothing but great remarks for the movie. Nonetheless, I will try to make an objective critic of the movie without giving away details.  First, this movie has more action sequences than any other Star Wars film; incredibly action packed.  The movie puts you on your feet with the opening chase sequence, and then settles you down telling the love story between Anakin and Padme, then you're strapped on a rocket and away you go.  This movie is the link between Episode I and the older Trilogy we respect so well. Not to get into detail, but it starts to show how Anakin will take down the Dark Side and how the human Anakin starts to become the mechanical Vader.  It shows how Bobba Fett will begin to follow in his fathers steps.  How Luke Skwalker ends up with his Uncle Owen Lars and even when plans of the Death Star begin.  All these things come into play. Lucas did a marvelous job with the story, which is what Star Wars has always been about.  In the midst of the story, Lucas throws in some hardcore battle sequences unlike nothing ever seen.  The ending leaves you waiting for the third film.  I am not on the academy award staff, but there were some one liners that did not seem to belong in the film as far as dialogue.  But when you look at it, those are the little things that are in all films.  These professional critics are hell bent on trashing movies because there were clichés in the movie.  What movie doesn't have clichés?  In all, Star Wars has never targeted audiences for Best Actor, Best Actress categories, it has always been about telling the story.  Ask yourself, why did you go see Star Wars?  You went because you want to finish learning about the story or you went because it's going to be an action packed movie with special affects. You did not go because you wanted to see how well some new actor said `I love you'.

Author: ddehora
Review: Disappointed with every aspect of the movie. Awful acting by Ewan McGregor, Natalie Portman and especially Hayden Christensen who was weak throughout the movie. The `romantic'  scenes between Padmé Amidala (Natalie Portman) and Anakin Skywalker (Hayden Christensen) were pathetic and unnecessary. Yoda just isn't the same with his new digitized appearance, he looked transparent at times almost ghostly and never `real'. Plot (I think there was one) was feeble and all over the place at times. Special effects were not all that special; you've seen them a thousand times already. What more can I say, except that this movie doesn't not deserve the money it is going to bring in (i.e. your money) which is what prompted me to write my first ever on-line review. Don't go, save your money! SNUB the FORCE...

For example, many people believed Episode 1 sucked, I can see why they may think that if they don't look at the whole story of Star Wars. Episode 2 is the same, only it tells his chapter in the series with great success.

Author: stella-100
Review_Title: Love Blooms, the Dark Side Looms....
Review: Episode II of the Star Wars series exploded onto our screens this week. Filmed in various locations including Tunisia and Australia, I was stunned by the visual feast and unbelievable audio (the most significant moment sound-wise is when Jango Fett is chased by Obi Wan and he throws some supersonic type bombs, the explosion sound is quite astounding).  This film brings together the love story between Anaikin and Amidala, Natalie Portman shows grace and poise as the latter and relative newcomer Hayden Christensen is good as the teen Anaikin but not great.  Ewan McGregor does nicely expanding Obi Wan's character and there are some good supporting players including Jimmy Smits and Christopher Lee.  There are some very funny moments in the film and the crowd I was with at a midnight screening cheered and clapped in quite a few scenes.  Best moment for me was one featuring Yoda and Duku, you will be quite amazed!!!

Review: About a year ago Frank Oz revealed in a rare interview that in the upcoming Star Wars episode Yoda would have a chance to show more than he usual self. The time has come. Next to the old style cross-fades and a story that can measure with 'The Empire Strikes Back" this is a must see film with small parts of it already legendary.

Review: Ok, firstly, before I write about the bad points - AOTC is a great film. If you like Star Wars you wont be disappointed.

Author: joeking79
Review: The movie is 2 and a half hours long which is a plus nowadays, but the content sucked. It is worth going to once, but not more than that. When the Phantom Menace came out, the only reason I was excited to go, was to see Darth Maul. With the lack of a menacing villain (pun intended), the movie drags on and on. The only things worth talking about is the Jango/Boba Fett backstory and the 40 second fight between Yoda and Dooku. I'm not saying not to see this movie, I just don't recommend seeing it more than once.

I was desperately hoping to see a marked improvement since "The Phantom Menace" and fortunately, this was the case. At least I didn't slip into a boredom induced coma within the first half hour!

Author: dramagrl05
Review_Title: much better than 'phantom menace', hayden christensen rox!
Review: episode II was everything i hoped it would be and more.  the film as a whole was very well done and interesting, with exception of a few annoying appearances with jar jar that we could have done without.  although the critics may have critized it, 'clones' was much better than the past 'menace'.  the story had much more substance.  especially enjoyable was the romance, and the thrilling performance by hayden christensen as anakin. you can see him becoming darth vader-feel the tension and the force driving him to be evil. what probably surprised me the most was episode II's ability to hold my interest for it's whole 2 hr 22 min running time.  i was completely entertained with what i saw on the screen, and while the acting as a whole isn't oscar material by any means, it's still convincing.
