Review: Before I saw Episode II I didn't have  extremely high hopes for enjoying this movie. That was because of the negative reviews written by nonsensical people such as Roger Ebert who wrote the absolute worst review I've ever read of this movie and every other movie up to this point. By worst meaning not making any !@#$%&* sense at all except the part in his review where hacks at the dialogue which to a certain degree I do agree with. He also said the images were fuzzy or something to that effect(maybe he was eating from his super-sized popcorn tub and occasionally glancing up at the screen so fast the images seemed blurry.) He claimed it was the digital effect on a giant screen where there wasn't a digital projection. He also mentioned the actors were stiff and seemed like they were chanting there lines, which brings me to this question; how could Ebert write a negative review about a smashing sequel to a crappy ass movie and say that stupid movie was good which it wasn't!!??? (If you have not guessed what that movie was just think Jar Jar Binks who gets his head cut off by a Jedi's lightsaber in this movie[off camera though :( ] Why did he give two stars to Clones(which was a far better film than TPM) and give Menace three and a half stars. Episode I had crappy dialogue, flat wooden actors, and long boring political talking sequences. These are all things that Ebert claims occurred in Episode II. The ironic thing however is that almost everything that was crappy and disappointing in TPM is improved in AOTC, not to mention it is more like the original trilogy. And yet he only gave it two stars. WHY!!!!!!!!! Roeper thought the opposite about the movie and thought it was great, and.........the best of the five movies!! Roger your film criticizing counterpart is smarter than you are sometimes it seems. Overall AOTC is MUCH better than TPM. I don't know what all those crack heads were smoking when they were writing those negative reviews about this film. Don't we see these movies to have fun?, by the why Yoda has the best fight scene in the entire series in this! If the Academy doesn't nominate the little green alien for best supporting actor I'm going to be so @!#%$& (just joking)------I hope the IMDB doesn't terminate my registration..................NO!!!!!!!!.......

Author: zakkks
Review_Title: The force is strong with this one!
Review: To say Star Wars The Phantom Menace was a box Office smash hit would be an understatement, but to say it left only a few Star Wars fans disappointed would be a understatement as well. the Phantom menace was heavily criticised for the Disneyesque Story style and wooden characters (the less said about the annoying Jar Jar binks the better) and with movies like the Lord of the Rings and the Matrix challenging Star Wars for the title of Movie epic it seemed like the Star Wars franchise was under threat for a moment. Thankfully Star Wars: The Attack of the Clones shows George Lucas hasn¹t lost his touch,  the movie is a special effects feast, beyond anything we seen recently, mixed with plenty of battle sequences and a love story on the side. For all you non Jedi fans, a quick re cap. Episode two of the Star Wars series deals with the gradual transformation of young Anakin Skywalker, to the Dark Side of the mystical Force and turning to the evil Darth Vader. Episode two starts ten years after the The Phantom Menace,  the old Galactic Republic is going through a time of political turmoil with the danger of a civil war looming. The defenders of the old order the Jedi Knights are increasingly over stretched and opposition in the Senate (led  by Senator Amidala played by Natalie Portman) has blocked plans to make a grand Army to crush the separatists led by Count Dooku (played by Christopher Lee a Desi connection here, he played Quaid e Azam in the Movie Jinnah!). The political backdrop, with the gradual decay of the old order, the contempt for politicians, and the intent of the ruler to gradually increase his power, through emergency powers is something we often see happening in the World. Ewan Mgregor reprises his role as Obi Won Kenobi with the usual stoicism and the growing rift between him and his apprentice Anakin Skywalker played by Hayden Christenson. Hayden comes of well as an increasingly angry and bitter Anakin who has little time for the patient approach of the Jedi order. Samuel Jackson returns as Jedi Knight Mace Windau, happily in a bigger role than last time, watch out for his spectacular show down with Bounty hunter Jango Fett. Another high point is the light sabre duel between Count Dooku and Yoda. I do have a few complaints, unlike the original trilogy, there is little chemistry between the characters, Anakin and Amidala and the whole love story seems a bit contrived. Another problem is the sheer number of sub plots, it tends to distract from the characters. Despite the criticism, this is a good family movie and sets a build up for (what should be a dark) finale.

Author: ncc1701-1
Review_Title: I should have waited to see Star Wars II on DVD
Review: Star Wars: Episode II - Attack of the Clones was pretty much what I expected.  I wasn't really looking forward to going to this one since I had been disappointed by the "re-makes" of episodes IV, V, and VI.  (So-called improvements to IV, V, and VI failed to eliminate artifacts and visual flaws in scenes with star patterns for example.  In those re-makes I had expected technical adaptations, not character additions).  But with Episode II - Attack of the Clones, I could not detect such imperfections (short of the tape change markers).  In my opinion, the continuity to the story could have been better; there seemed to be some jumping around from one set of characters to another.  The fact that the story takes place before episode VI limits the parameters to the extent that there was little room for expanding the story itself.  In my opinion, the movies should have begun from episode I instead of episode VI.  In any case, I managed to sit through much of the movie with some level of patience.  About the last 20 minutes contained most of the action which was (in my opinion) somewhat predictable. I emphasize somewhat.  Perhaps I would have enjoyed Attack of the Clones if I were 16 again, but I would have preferred to see it on DVD & on my 70" TV. When the movie was over, there was NO APPLAUSE. This is the first time that I have been to a Star Wars Movie when this did not occur.  The small crown could have had something to do with it...maybe.

Author: genehoke
Review_Title: I Should Have Stayed Home And Watched The Empire Strikes Back
Review: Okay, first things first: Attack of the Clones is a definite improvement over The Phantom Menace. Jar Jar Binks, not in movie much is. Special effects, good they are. But script, very bad it is still.

Author: caracena
Review_Title: This is a work of art.
Review: This movie was a moving work of art from start to finish. (Period)

Author: oneelephant
Review: I saw Attack of the Clones today, and what a relief! Gone are the fear and horror of seeing another Phantom Menace. This new movie is considerably more entertaining, fun, and (yes, Jar Jar) MUCH less annoying than Phantom.

Author: sjlinnyc
Review_Title: The most fun I've had at a movie in years!
Review: I remember the first time I saw "Star Wars" - I was 11 years old and living in small-town Iowa. The moment the closing credits music ended and the lights came up, I knew my life would never be the same. Now I'm 36 and a jaded New Yorker, but for two and a half hours early Thursday morning, I was a kid again - thrilled to be discovering a new visual vocabulary courtesy of George Lucas, and amazed to be able to just have FUN at a movie! Say what you will about some of the dialog or a few line readings, it doesn't matter. This is "Star Wars," in all its glory - action, laughs, jaw-dropping effects, and lots of good old-fashioned cheese. I wouldn't have it any other way.

Author: xtomx
Review: I'll just make this short : This 95% animatated film has got NOTHING to do with the brilliance of the old SW movies. It's full of unimportant and stupid dialogues - it's from the beginning to the end just cheap in action and made without any love (or force). The computer animations are breathtaking but that's all the movie has to offer. Don't waste your money

Author: oscar2044
Review_Title: A Fresh and Exciting Chapter in the Timeless Saga
Review: Making a film that will be highly anticipated long before its official release is indeed a difficult task. For writer/director George Lucas that difficult task came when he set out to make the long-awaited first prequel to his immensly popular "Star Wars" saga. Unfornately Lucas failed to please most of the fan base which made the original "Star Wars" so popular, and "Star Wars Episode I: The Phantom Menace", although a box office smash, left a lot of loyal fans disappointed, including me.

Author: venusadonis1
Review: With only one installment left, it's beginning to become evident why Episode IV is entitled `A New Hope' - it's the light at the end of this disappointingly darkened tunnel.  Although technologically savvy - there are several moments of visual splendor - these new episodes are huge on plot and effects, and little on heart.  And ultimately, when we think of Star Wars, that is the reason we love it so. Moreso than droid armies and speeders - it's the heart.

Author: JBP22078
Review: I am a huge Star Wars fan and really enjoyed this movie. So did everyone I saw it with.  I firmly believe though that even regular fans will have a lot of fun at this movie.  This movie is in my opinion the best Star Wars since The Empire Strikes Back, SEE IT!

Author: dustyrhoades
Review: This is a great movie...up until the point where someone, ANYONE,  starts talking. The original, classic  flicks contained some corny dialogue: Alec Guiness' "you will never find a more wretched hive of scum and villainy" is the prime example. And the way the Jedi and the Senators talk in the prequels is consistent with that kind of formal "high-flown" delivery. And therein lies the problem. Since the recent movies concentrate on the story of the galaxy's "nobility", we really miss the more down-to-earth speech of farm boys and smugglers.

Author: p3t3r88
Review: To sum up SW: Episode II - BORING in all aspects especially the dialogue (thruout the length of the movie), the love scenes and the acting.

Author: Ilikehotguysinmovies
Review: Movies like Star Wars, Spider Man, and the Tolkin series get it real easy it doesn't matter of the movies sticks everyone and there brother is going to go see it. Well I have to give props to George Lucas because he defiantly didn't take advantage of that and make a stinky movie. He went all out, as usual. Now if your like me the cheesy moments between Ani and Senator Amidala (SP) will make you ralph right there in the theater, but once you get over that and have finished regurgitating your dinner it's a really well done good movie. On all it's very comedic and silly. The best part is you can take the kids to see it. There are absolutely no cuss words. George your the man.

Author: rock_oasis
Review_Title: the force is strong in this one!
Review: Star Wars is back! And it's penultimate release is among the series' best so far. Attack of the Clones is an ideal star wars movie. Has great special effects, great story, great music, awesome action sequences and a love story. Well, what can i say, the force is strong in this one!

Author: Darth Anakin
Review: I saw EPII for the second time last night. I could see a lot of particular that I' couldn't see the first time. For me Lucas and ILM did a great Job on visual effects and sound effects. The story is strong and the screenplay too, not as in EPI. Now for the last episode of the saga, my expectation are big, because there are a lot of ministory to reveal and I'm very curious to see how the event go trough.

Author: Darth Anakin
Review: Well, I'm a huge Starwars fan, here in Italy the movie was release 16 May, with great expectation. After the good but not superlative Episode I, Finally we can feel and see the epic saga of twenty years ago. What a movie! What a story! What a visual effects!! Thanks George for this. My vote is 10/10.

Author: rustygingerdolly
Review_Title: So close and yet so far
Review: So close and yet so far, this is exactly how I felt when I left the cinema. This is the only way I feel best to describe this latest installment of the Star Wars trilogy.  This is because it almost fulfilled my expectations but always seemed to let me down when I felt it was finally getting somewhere.

Author: sexy_sexystud
Review: Firstly I went to see the film on the back of all the things that I read and heard in the media, I am a true fan of the star wars films and think that they are the best fantasy films that have ever been released. I wanted to keep an open mind when I saw the film because I am a firm believer in making up my own mind. The Film is Excellent !! the special effects are second to none, the acting good, and the much maligned dialogue was good not superb but good (I think a lot of us forget that these films are made primary for children!) as I was leaving the cinema everybody leaving was of the same opinion the film put the star wars name firmly back on the map. I think that if anybody complains I think that the only reason can be that they didn't understand the film, but Lucas cant cater for people with an IQ of 10.

Author: rsre4
Review: 7 out of 10.

Author: zschiharis
Review: I feel sorry for the occasional decent bits lost in this pointless, over-expensive mess. Those bits would include the Fett family (why, oh why did anyone ever cast a Jake Lloyd in a world where there's kid actors like this?!), Christopher Lee, a few short excerpts from the lenghty fights and the blade-runneresque scenes.

Author: startripper
Review: Worst dialogue ever; zero acting, worst continuity ever, FX that look like a video game - hey buddy it's 2002, I play games that look like it. Just horrendous. I cannot believe that sentient beings would actually enjoy this movie. It must be true what they say about dumb americans, I guess - and it hurts me to say so. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY HERE!!!!!!!!!!

Author: Veruzak
Review_Title: Won't win any Oscars, but is it supposed to?
Review: I'll admit it, I'm a passive Star Wars fan. I didn't camp out or stand in line for tickets, but I did see Episode 2 on the opening Friday.

Author: growlur
Review_Title: The "fantasy" of Star Wars is alive and well!
Review: Since first seeing Star Wars around age 12, I've been fascinated by that scene on Tatooine when Obi Wan Kenobi is telling the young Luke Skywalker about the fate of his father...describing how Darth Vader hunted down the elder Skywalker and murdered him...alluding to the Clone Wars. For 25 years we've waited for a glimpse of the time when the Jedi kept the peace until, as fate had it, war broke out. We've been disappointed by Episode I (which was not THAT bad). Now comes Episode II: Attack of the Clones.

Author: flick_sf
Review: He has shown again with Episode II that he can't handle both producing and directing these pictures.  I'm guessing that he's concentrating too much on perfecting the look of the scenes to be able to concentrate on creating a captivating story and script which ties us in emotionally to the characters.

Author: kataniamk
Review_Title: The best Star Wars Ever(warning spoiler ahead)
Review: This made all the other Star Wars look like the old 8-bit Atari (compared to the videogames systems now). Any how the music is great because you hear a lot of the "old" music such as Ben's Theme,  Vader Theme, and the Emperor's theme (listen very carefully). The battle scences were spectacular.The dialogue was well delivered and the actors pulled it off without a hitch. Natalie Portman is the most beautiful actress of her time (of any time if you ask me).McGregor was the "kill joy" of the group.Hayden was the perfect arrogant girl-crazed teen we all were at one time. Oz's character hasn't changed, still a funny little green alien. There is humorous scene with Yoda near the end in which Yoda leans on his cane (as usual) and grunts with every step then fights Doku,and after the fight,picks up his cane and resumes his grunting. Anakin and Padme' the typical teen couple.There is scene in which Padme' tells Anakin not to look at her a certain way, she says it makes her feel uncomfortable,and when she turns her back Anakin still is looking at her in the certain way only with a little smile this time. Palpatine is still a creepy liar (you just want to punch him).See it you must!

Author: netcitizen_one
Review_Title: I can't believe we keep going to watch this kind of crap
Review: It has good FX but terrible acting despite several good actors involved in the movie. The have twisted the original idea sequel to the extreme, I remembered that originally the Jedis were almost extinct but here in this movie you could see they are a whole squad and a school.

Author: matt0523
Review_Title: Nifty Special Effect, but no substance
Review: I should start off by saying that I loved the first three movies. They were milestone events in my childhood. However Lucas has been unable to reproduce whatever magic made the first three movies good. I couldn't care for the characters, the acting was laughably bad, a hundred monkeys on bad acid could have typed a better script, and too many scenes looked like they were planned around the video game. There is some great eye candy in this movie, but leave your brain at the door or you will be sorely dissapointed.

Author: dozo
Review_Title: the star wars saga has reached a new low
Review: Lucas definitely shouldn't have directed this one.  The quick cuts, while superficially hip, kept me from truly enjoying the lavish computer generated imagery.  Except for Portman, the performances were atrocious.  Yoda was the best actor of all, & he's CGI!

Author: Ian_Malone
Review_Title: What is wrong with you people?
Review: Who in their right mind could possibly vote this as one of the greatest movies of all time? I cannot believe that the rating for this film (I struggle to call it even that) is anything above a 5. Sure it is a fun romp and is much, much better than Episode I, but is that really enough?

Author: Gsaygo
Review: This has some spoilers if you feel this movie can be any more spoiled.

Author: eminemshow
Review: This movie was great. perfect.yoda was the best in the movie.It WAS JUST GREAT WHEN HE FIGHT!!!!!i loved it.and it has some funny parts.Plus, it had awesome action and love scenes. I give this movie a perfect 10.

Author: Emilio-3
Review_Title: please, take away starwars from George Lucas!!!
Review: I'm sorry, but this is George Lucas at it's worst...again. Episode I was painful, but Episode II is ridiculous. I had already low expectations, but I came out with even lower. This movie proves (like many before it's time) that Sequels, even worst, Prequels, don't work. Mr. Lucas has murdered a classic.

Author: ThePhiladelphiaKid
Review: It wasn't as bad as Episode I. And, I'm happy to see that "death sticks" make it to the future.

Author: dethlamp
Review: I found this entire movie to be one of the most boring experiences of my life. The acting seemed forced and most of the plot was aimed towards the fanboy faction. The graphics were visually stunning but, overall they were to constant and blatant. Many of the scenes seemed to scream "hey look CGI, LOOK AT THE CGI", as though it was some how supposed to be able to draw your attention from the boring dialogue. The one scene seems to have Anakin spouting awful gothic poetry. I personally give this movie a three out of ten. There were a few action sequences i found enjoyable but for the most part the whole movie dragged along too slowly.

Author: ChrisKorea
Review: I find it really depressing to know that people will flock to see this film. All of my friends had warned me about it, but I had to go anyway - it's Star Wars, for Pete's sake! Of course I came out fuming that like everyone else I had allowed myself to be bamboozled into going to see a film that, were it not part of the greatest epic of modern times, would flop at the cinema like other trash of this kind.

Author: girtiggint
Review_Title: The second episode is worse than the first.
Review: Note: I have never been a diehard star wars fan. Sure I know the storyline and read Timothy Zahn's excellent follow-up trilogy to the first movie trilogy, but I simply enjoyed the first trilogy. I saw it when I was 15 so there was no real kid nostalgia in it for me. When I heard the prologue trilogy was going to be filmed, I was thrilled, expecting to get an entertaining storyline, beautiful cinematography and just plain fun.

Author: drsceye
Review: Legendarily dense? Legendarily stiff actors? Erm... Sorry, folks, but this movie destroyed the whole jedi mythology for me. Apart from that, the acting was atrocious, the plot annoying and pointless, the story poorly told. Oh, well, I guess I didn't like it.

Author: fiwentelcontar
Review: Though this film was good (Hayden a Anakin a real big plus!) I felt that this film was not one of the best.  As a fan of the original trilogy I thought that the Phantom Menace was a good film and expected this one to be just as good.  I however almost fell asleep during certain points.  The film isn't all bad however,(be warned here be spoilers) my favourite part had to be when Yoda fought!!!!!!!!!  It was so funny.  In general I enjoyed the film though it could have been better.

Author: yeap
Review_Title: Star Wars Episode II - Attack of the Cliches
Review: Star Wars episode II was a let down. First of all, the title "Attack of the Clones", sounds like an old 1980s cliche. Secondly, the plotline was not as original as the rest of the movies, and the special effects are starting to lag behind the 1977 release of Star Wars. However, the Yoda 3d model looked great, and the lightsabre duel was one of the best choreographed scenes. That scene alone makes the movie worth watching, but it is the ONLY thing that makes the movie worth watching. The rest of the movie was dull and boring, and not much happened, other than the usual spaceships shooting at each other stuff. The hype was over-done, and the movie was pretty boring.

Author: cmatlin
Review: You can sum it up this way:

Author: obrienmackenzie
Review: Anakin and Padme are better than Jack and Rose. Change my mind.

Author: rosa-riobo
Review: Although i am not one of these fans who knows by heart every actor's performance in any of the five episodes already seen, i would like to add some comments. Too much use of the computer in the making of the film turns it into a semi video-game. The original three episodes were more authentic since they were filmed with less technical devices but the results were amazing. There are scenes in the attack of the clones in which you can easily realize how this or that creature is a virtual one and it is not very well mixed with the real environment. On  the other hand the actor who plays Anakin is a very bad one. Maybe he is too young or it was his first time. He is not very convincing in this role. The guy of the phantom menace was great at playing young Anakin. I loved The Phantom menace and i almost disliked episode ii. Even the love story between Amidala and Anakin does not make it better. In the story plot there is one point i consider quite original. The fact of making the audience understand that what takes Anakin to the dark side is his rebellion against Jedi's principles. But this rebellion is based on his love to his mother and Amidala. Does this mean that to be a good Jedi one  has to say no to life?. Are they priests? Who is in the dark side then? This seems quite good to me. I am willing to see what is going on.

Author: kickmeimamidget
Review: One of the most fascinating things about Episode II was that you could distinctly hear important themes from Episode I and from the Trilogy being brought together, just like the plot lines. Certain undertones of the imperial march give us foreshadowing in scenes with Anakin, and we know what the future of the clone army is. The music that told us who was a Sith in Episode I is present as well. We can view it as sort of a musical evolution, because the music of Episode I is making way for the music in the Trilogy, through Episode II and will probably do the same in Episode III.

Author: Jason-Druebert
Review_Title: No two ways - this is a bad movie
Review: Almost all of the elements that made the original Star Wars one of the best movies of all time were missing from this film.  The effects were spectacular; but rather then adding to the story they bloated this movie. I could go on about the acting, story-line, and such; but what struck me was that everything had to be a special effects tour-de-force.  I remember sitting in school and drawing x-wings and tie-fighters; no kid outside of art-school will be drawing any of the ships from this film, and that is not intended as a compliment.

Author: Actinfreak
Review: I was a big fan of the Star Wars movies until I saw Attack of the Clones. The Phantom Menace had great action and special effects which barely managed to make up for the dreadful acting. In Attack of the Clones the action scenes were all that kept me from falling asleep during this dreadful movie. The plot was hard to follow and it kept coming back to terribly acted scenes where all you wanted to do was strangle one of the lead characters to get them to shut up. One of the ultimate worst lines goes like this, "I've been dying a little bit each day since you came back into my life." To say this line is spoken in a monotone is giving it too much credit. All the lines are spoken in this same fashion and I found it difficult not to turn it off. As I said before, the only reason I didn't turn it off was to see the action scenes which were quite impressive. Ewan Macgregor who plays Obi-Wan should be recognized as the only person in the movie who can act. The strange thing is all the other actors, such as Natalie Portman and Samuel L Jackson, have proved their acting skills in other movies. Is George Lucas to blame? I don't know. If you have the good fortune not to have seen this movie already, then I suggest you don't and spare yourself the boredom.

Author: dororthy
Review_Title: What happened to the old Star Wars?
Review: I do not quite know what to think of this movie. I saw the Phantom Menace and was at best an indifferent viewer. But this one-well, this one gave me the shivers.

Author: lets_go_get_some_tacos
Review_Title: George Lucas is the destroyer of beauty and happiness.
Review: `Attack of the Clones' was a horrifying hate crime.  I would rank the making of this movie with the creation of the atomic bomb in terms of sheer negative impact on the general well-being of human civilization.

Author: GlobalDictator
Review_Title: A 'B movie' but with an accomplished cast
Review: As I sat there in the cinema I couldn't help wondering whether George Lucas really has what it takes to fulfill the legacy he initiated many years ago with Episode IV.

Author: emmagata
Review: I saw this last night on TV and it was painful to sit through it until the end but like a car wreck, I had to see what happened.

Author: LTWood
Review_Title: Finally! A Real Link to the Original Trilogy!
Review: I loved the first three Star Wars, and though I thought Episode 1 was a bit impersonal, I still enjoyed it.  After coming out of theaters having seen Episode II, I realized that because of AotC, the Star Wars Saga is finally coming together.

Author: BogleMcNeep
Review: This makes ALL the same mistakes that made The Phantom Menace the biggest disappointment in cinema history...and adds a truly awful title for good measure. Alluding to sci-fi B movies before you've even reached the opening credits is hardly a stroke of genius, and this bad judgment is present from start to finish.

Author: moneytongue
Review: ***SPOILERS***

Author: cdogtoo
Review: Only slightly better than Phantom - but that is not saying much since Phantom was stinko!  Could Hayden Christensen have been worse?  Just horrid, and we have to put up with him in Episode III. Yuk!

Author: Michael-Knowles
Review_Title: Simple, clichéd, frustrating and just rubbish!
Review: Its a shame for the 1,000 word max cos i could have crit this film until the cows came home.

Author: octhrice
Review: The only good thing about this film is filling in the gaps, but that's basically the entire trilogy of episodes 1-3. This has probably one of the worst love stories I've ever seen, coupled with terrible dialogue. Things happen because they happened in the later episodes, but if the story were to unfold without the end being told, I don't think that Anakin and Padme would end up together, it doesn't make any sense. He's a horrible brutish man that kills an entire village and she wants to be held by him and stay with him. Wrong. Just a bad movie, a couple pretty shots don't make up for the fact that he gets bad performances out of all of his actors and has a terrible story.

Author: inspirenyc
Review: I just read a comment by another user that I'd like to add to. The idea was that these first films basically have nothing to offer people who aren't Star Wars fans. It asserts that ordinary people couldn't care less about the Republic and the Empire. And, that's when it clicked.

Author: inspirenyc
Review_Title: I wouldn't let my clone watch this garbage...
Review: I'm thoroughly embarrassed and angered that I wasted five plus hours of my life for this movie. I've decided to post this review because I went to watch the film again after seeing the trailer for the third episode. I hoped that I was wrong the first time, when I saw this disaster in the theatre. I wasn't.

Author: simonnolen
Review: The director has set his reign of terror upon the world audience. He represents digital projection, digital video, poor acting, and poor writing. All of this and he still sells tickets. Attack of the Clones, proved that Darth Lucas is not out to change film, but yet his pocket size. People will repeatedly go to see his films and line his wallet with the tools to destroy film. The dark side truly is strong in Hollywood. It is as if people are scared to state that they did not enjoy episode two. I am here to say that not sense Titanic has such a horrible film been made. I gave the film a one only because, I could not vote a lower score. This movie is not fun and is not intelligent, nor does Lucas care as he dances to the bank with money derived from an audience that is being treated as the clones he creates.

Author: PauseBreaks
Review: ***WARNING***: This post MAY contain spoilers, and MAY ruin the plots and scenes of the movie/film under interrogation to those who have yet to see the movie/film that is in question.

Author: runirokk
Review: This is by far the worst Star Wars movie yet (only one to go). Summing it up, I primarily credited it to a) awful script b) bad directing and c) bad editing.

Author: rsteiner969
Review: I wouldn't change a thing from Wayne Mallin's June 13, 2002 review of the film, except to say Natalie Portman's performance wasn't that good either. But, I agree, there really is no comparison to Christiansen's awful performance.

Author: phwhitfield
Review_Title: Don't even think about wasting your time like that...
Review: I don't get it. Everything would have been there. Great Actors, a nice effect team and a great universe to tell stories. But Lucas screwed everything.

Author: laxi11
Review_Title: Good try, but the worst so far!
Review: Okay, first of all, I don't like how George Lucas is turning Star Wars in to a "special effect show off" like The Matrix is. Second of all I don't like the love story part, but it's alright though.

Author: Adam_M
Review_Title: Overuse of computer graphics kills this film
Review: This is the second part of the new Star Wars films, and as films go is pretty average. Nothing really stands out and this isn't aided by some poor acting in places and a corny and absurd script that tries far too hard to be Shakespearean in places but falls down dismally.

Author: FilmFan2104
Review: For me Attack of the Clones is not only the worst film of the prequel trilogy, but the worst of the entire franchise.

Author: mattbrant
Review_Title: By Far the Worst of the Saga
Review: SPOILERS AHEAD!

Author: srb-41311
Review_Title: A Better Sequel, But Still Flawed
Review: After the disappointment of The Phantom Menace, many people hoped that Attack of the Clones, the second installment of George Lucas' Star Wars Prequel Trilogy, would fine tune some of the issues that plagued the first film. In same ways they got that, in others not so much. While the film improved its storytelling ability and lessened the amount of Jar Jar on screen, fans still moaned over the script's corny dialogue and poorly written romance. And in a way, I'm right there with them, though I think I give this movie a little more credit that others do.

Author: blunznkistl
Review: If it wasn't called Star Wars, I would have not watched it longer than 20 minutes. What a pile of junk: The effects are plenty but unrealistic, the characters seem to simply walk through this environment without any influence on the climax and whoever searches for something plausible in their behavior will get very disappointed. Christopher Lee is too old for this role, not to mention that Yoda seems to be less of a cripple than thought, Anakin is a brat instead of a deep character and everything we see seem to be the result of a poll: What did you like most in the original trilogy. The moment I got closest to being shocked about the story was the droid factory, that looked as being taken out of a Looney Tunes cartoon.

Author: neilaking
Review: Please, please, please keep George Lucus away from movies!

Author: dmkidd
Review: I find myself agreeing with almost every review that I've read.  I know that sounds ridiculous.  I think it comes down to this:  I like this movie, but I completely understand that it's a bad movie.  If someone tears this movie apart, I can't really argue with them.  Heck, I could probably join in. BUT...

Author: ChillChe
Review: One could post a billion gripes with George Lucas' latest installments in the Star Wars series, but I'm gonna mention just one.

Author: Bobair
Review_Title: Is the world blind to this movie's technical problems?
Review: I was excited to see this new form of High-Resolution Digital film making that George Lucas has been shooting off at the mouth about for the past three years.

Author: Fozz
Review_Title: Money obviously can't buy a script...
Review: Lucas goes all out to bring back some life into the Star Wars saga, but forgets that style, acting and a good script are actually required.

Author: AlexMorr88
Review: Total rubbish. Abysmal acting, laughable dialogue, video artifacts almost obscuring faces in the early scenes. A video game masquerading as a film. For a real fantasy film see LOTR (a masterpiece). How can this tripe get such a high star rating. Star Wars fans are easily led...

Author: asco
Review: They have shown already everything they have to show and now they are just repeating themselves. So it's nice to see what a lot of money can buy but the knowing of what will happen and who will be alive in the end spoils a lot of fun.

Author: MacKonsti
Review_Title: A movie rush for two+half hours!
Review: Being in my early 30's, which means that I grew with the Original Trilogy, I am one of those people that were genuinely interested to know, in the Star Wars storyline, what happened before the Original Trilogy, and after. Timothy Zahn's books were great, and covered most of the Trilogy future; so when George Lucas announced he will be filming the first Trilogy, and changed the focus from Luke Skywalker to make it a six-part story on Anakin Skywalker/Darth Vader, my interest grew more.

Author: m_m
Review: The star wars series just get better and better. The second episode is much more different from episode 1. Both acting and development of the story has been improved. It is nice to see that Jar Jar Binks' role has become less important than in episode 1. I really hate that creature and can't figure out what he is doing in that movie at all. I just wished he would die in episode 2, but I didn't get that lucky:-(

Author: Pielo
Review_Title: George is still looking for an original idea
Review: Let me begin by saying that this film is way better than Ep I.

Author: Robbie-22
Review_Title: A vast improvement from Episode I, but not quite there yet
Review: A darker tone than in Episode I and a more serious note (all those who hated Jar Jar and cute little Ani will be pleased) makes for a step very much in the right direction compared to the messy kiddy movie  that was Episode I. The characters benefit from a deeper profile and a fuller content in terms of a story (although not yet close to the consistent and easily followed storyline of episodes IV - VI) that does a credible job of teeing up the evolution of the character of young Anakin Skywalker and providing additional background to the rise of the empire. The movie does however suffer from sub standard acting performances by almost all parties involved (with the exception of a brilliant Christopher Lee), but on the other hand it's Star Wars, who cares?  Fantastic effects and camera work as usual, but the good Mr. Lucas is becoming too smitten with the possibilities offered by digital imagery. Every shot is overloaded. Overall not bad, and certainly provides faith that Episode three could be just right.

Author: bruzasd
Review: I must say I was very pleased with Episode II.  George Lucas took the advice of his fans and nearly rid us of Jar Jar, and thankfully Anakin has grown up.  I will admit, there are still a number of instances where the dialogue could have been written better, or simply omitted altogether, but Star Wars fans don't love these movies for the dialogue.  We get to see lots of action, and it really feels like Lucas wrote this movie for the fans of the series, unlike Episode I.  There are some very humorous lines, and tie-ins to the other episodes are numerous.  If you like Star Wars, even if you hated Episode I, please see this movie, you will like it!

Author: ducke
Review: I saw the new film and I must say that I really thought it was better than Episode One.  These actors do not have the same chemistry that Harrison and the others had in the earlier films. Its a two hour historical reference that answers many questions, visually amazes you, but left me wondering if I really was entertained.  You probably have to see this film more than once to catch it all.  I might have a different point of view after another viewing. Lucas needs to work on the emotional side of the story more, with better dialog , instead of cramming us with a huge history lesson.

Author: hopkins-5
Review: Just got back from seeing Episode II. Great movie, thoroughly enjoyable, but cheesier than a ploughman's lunch.

Author: rsvp-2
Review: This is simply one of the worst movies I have ever seen. I'm not saying the story is bad. The story is good, really. The evil plot to create two armies in order to end up with one is fantastic, but the incredibly bad dialogue and even worse acting by the Anakin Skywalker character are almost without equal. When Anakin "Crybaby" Skywalker says, "Tell me you're suffering as much as I". I wanted to scream out in the theater, "Yes, yes, you're killing us all with this crap!" People in the audience were moaning, sighing, snickering, laughing, and even talking back at the film. Lucas has lost it completely. He's gone from movie making legend to "how the hell did such a terrible director ever make the first Star Wars".

Author: Grinch-6
Review: First, I would like to say for all the fans and non-fans who have seen this film and are posting to this website, everyone has an opinion.  Just because somebody has an opinion that differs from yours does not mean that you should insult them.  There is no such thing as a perfect film.

Author: kiwi-man
Review: I saw this film one minute after midnight on May,16th, and at first i wasn't very amused about this picture. To call it boring would be exaggerated, but the story begins slowly and is growing more and more. It all begins with the rivalry between Anakin and Obi-Wan and it ends with?

Author: pinion-2
Review_Title: the force is strong in this one
Review: I enjoyed the movie a lot. I have to admit that I was a bit afraid before I entered the Cinema but 15 minutes into the movie I realised that I won't be disappointed. Not just because of Yoda, or Obiwan's sence of humour, or the purple lightsaber or the evil that actually talk, or the similarity to Empire, but because of everything!

Author: iggy-16
Review: I waited almost 20 years to see jedis in action and I saw that. I expected to see great movie, but so great. I couldn't say a word after a movie, I was so full of impression.

Author: Delphi-4
Review: How I wish the devotion that went into making sure Natalie Portman had a different gorgeous outfit for every single scene could have been contagious for, say, writing, pacing, or even a variety of facial expressions.

Author: Cooney
Review_Title: Episode I Should Have Been This Good!!!!
Review: Well, this movie really lived up to it's hipe.  And Jar-Jar is in it for about 15 minutes!!!!

Author: Alice-20
Review_Title: Great - it's the best Star Wars Episode so far!
Review: I've seen it in Zurich, 6. of May 2002 and I won't forget this date. I loved Lucas before. But after this movie... More than two hours of fun and breathtaking action. In episode I we've seen how everything begun. And now the disaster seems to take place. But don't lose hope!

Author: Teowyn
Review_Title: Most painful 2 hours of my life.. might include spoilers
Review: First off, I heard/read all the critics warnings about their being too much dialogue.  I disagree with that. There was too much BAD or RECYCLED dialogue.  I'm putting money down that no one had to remember a single line because they've all heard it or said it before.  Take Christopher Lee - who is Saruman in Lord of the Rings.  Do we REALLY need to hear him say "The Dark Lord" in the middle of a Star Wars movie after just seeing him in LOTR? If you have any knowledge of LOTR, those words coming out of Christopher Lee's mouth right away take you out of the movie experience and give you a chance to stretch your muscles as you roll your eyes. His storyline was great and could have been brilliant - if not for the weak dialogue - especially the part where he might as well have come to center stage and said, "And now, audience, you will see the much anticipated and highly ridiculous light sabre battle between Yoda and myself."  Don't introduce a battle, just get to it.  Back to the comment about the battle being ridiculous - Yoda reminded me of a green Sonic the Hedgehog with all the hopping and spinning.  I thought this was supposed to be one hell of a battle. The people in the theatre with me were all either laughing or crying.  I still can't figure out why the other two Jedi in the scene just stayed where they were doing nothing to stop Count Dooku from escaping. Yes, they were injured - but not as much as the audience.

Author: Mony-2
Review: I mean, I was really prepared for a root-canal of a movie. Prepared to grit my teeth through the whole thing. (Jar-Jar broke my heart. I know a lot of you can relate.)

Author: Ree-7
Review_Title: All the effects can't save this awful movie
Review: I was excited when the title appears. But after being amazed by the visual effects for half an hour, I became more and more bored. The film is slow and unengaging and then fast and pointless.

Author: TrekWars00
Review: I'm speechless...

Author: NDKate
Review_Title: everything we love about star wars
Review: Attack of the Clones reveals how beautifully complex the star wars saga is. There is a whole level of complexity that the original three movies lack, and this movie delivers completely.  It is obvious why Lucas waited to do the first three episodes.  The  intricate battles and sequences in episode II would have been impossible to do with the limited special effects they had, nor would a new audience be as appreciative of the significance of the actions that happen in episode II.  Knowing what will eventually happen attaches so much significance and awe to the actions in Episode II.  Lucas delivers but he also leaves plenty of mystery with episode III.  We STILL do not know what will happen.  This movie reveals the most information out of any movie before it, but at the same time becomes the most personal.  We care about the characters because they are people not because they are heroes in a movie.  It is the reason the star wars movies are a success because it reaffirms everything we love about the previous four.  A gem

Author: Steel1
Review_Title: Awesome, best special effects ever and GOOD acting
Review: I have just seen AOTC and from the first minute i knew this was going to be so much better than Phantom Menace.  It is better than Jedi aswell. As for the other two i dont know.  Ive seen those hundreds of times and AOTC once so time will see.

Author: Edbear
Review_Title: Not bad, but packed with cheesiness.....
Review: ***SPOILERS***   ***SPOILERS*** As of this writing this movie is ranked #206 all time, which is somewhat hard to believe. I can only assume these numbers are inflated by obsessive Star Wars fans and the fact that this movie seems so much better than Episode One.

Author: myoung
Review: Ok, so they got the visual effects more or less right, but that's about it. There was no story to speak of, the writing and acting were laughable and the chemistry between the young lovers was non-existent. Was anyone involved in making this movie actually having any fun?

Author: aardvark-17
Review_Title: Quite Probably The Best Movie I Have Ever Seen
Review: George Lucas has outdone himself this time. If you want to know how good this is, get this: It's better than Episode I! I didn't believe it was possible.

Author: CYeates
Review_Title: If you're a fan, you should like it!
Review: I say that admirably. For all these people who keep proclaiming themselves to be huge fans of Star Wars but continually critique the saga as it unfolds, you're not really Star Wars fans -- you're Han Solo fans. If you read through these comments, you'll notice that the people who didn't like Episode 2 all had one complaint: no Han Solo.

Author: heydasch
Review_Title: This party is definitely not over...
Review: I am such a gigantic Star Wars fan.  Sure, I don't own a lightsaber, but that doesn't make me a SW outcast...does it?

Author: Cerbegor
Review: I was very pleased with the new Star Wars movie.  While I didn't hate episode one it was extremely disappointing for me.  Attack of the clones finally kicks it back into gear.  I especially enjoyed the humor and the tie ins to the original three.

Author: timgreenwalton
Review: This has some brilliant parts: Anakin when he goes ballistic in the Sand people camp Battle scene Light Sabre fight Yoda! Music!!!

Author: johnicon
Review: I would give it 1 star but for the excellent visuals, the performance of Christopher Lee and the interesting plot as it relates to Episode I. Otherwise, the acting was mostly horrible (although I'm pretty sure it was due to the ridiculous lines), the editing was poorly done, which caused the whole film to bog down, even during the "climactic" final 30 minutes, there was very little humor and what was there was so poorly done as to cause me to cringe and of course there was the PG rating.  George Lucas seems to have a big fear of losing the very young audience, but by dumbing down this and the last Star Wars films, he totally shuts out the now grown up fans of the first three films.  I hope George doesn't plan to write and direct Episode III, which should be the darkest of all six of them, because he will probably turn it into a childish "adventure."  If you see this film, don't expect too much.

Author: thomasalisi
Review_Title: it could have been a good movie...
Review: in my opinion amidala & anakin are very weak actors. absolutely there is no "pathos": in "return of the jedy" you can see luke skywalker fighting against himself and the dark side of the force, but anakin is just a spoilt kid angry for the loss of his mother. some locations are ridiculous (the city at the beginning of the movie, the pursuit with  the speeders... just a bad carbon copy of blade runner). I liked very much Yoda's fight against christopher lee and some scenes of the war.

Author: gmdavek
Review_Title: A timeless Classic of this Pointless Era
Review: The New Star Wars films present us with a saga that will last a lunchtime. Episode I was filmed in 20 minutes, Episode II took even longer. Every blunder George Lucas made in The Phantom Menace he did away with in the Clone Wars, so to make room for all new blunders.  The movie is action packed, it is so action packed that one tends to forget the plot, as well as the action.  The movie opens with Anakin, who is now a teenager who's primary interests are girls, video games, and punk metal, and his mentor Obi Wan Kenobi chasing an assassin through the Red Light District of A Galaxy far, far away.  I first saw this chase scene in the movie theater, and about 15 minutes into it people were heard asking "Does anyone know what this is about?"  They still had no answer at the end. After this, Anakin is assigned to transport Senator Natalie Portman to another, safer area.  When Portman first appears she is wearing a lot of clothes, and a weird hat, but the audience need not worry: By the end of the movie she will look more like Britney Spears. Meanwhile, Obi Wan Kanobi finds out that Mr. Fett (the father of Boba Fett, who's first appearance was in the second Star Wars film-- A STAR WARS HOLIDAY SPECIAL-- though he was far more prominent in THE EMPIRE STRIKES BACK) is building an army of clones for some reason which apparently was too important. So far, sounds better than Episode I, right?  Well don't worry, JAR JAR BINKS IS BACK!!! And better than ever!  But I won't tell how, because this is too important a plot point to spoil. What really amazes me about this movie, though, is that it is far more violent than I'd like to see Star Wars be.  It involved more than just the innocent fights of the original Star Wars, this time we get to see people get their heads bitten off and such.  Unlike the Trilogy, I would not take little children to see this movie. But this can't surprise us.  George Lucas had almost 20 years to think of a way to make a round peg fit a square hole (Which is what he is doing--- trying to create a prequel to something that was not meant to have a prequel), but instead he gives us nonsense. If you're looking for a good movie to make out with a date during, I reccomend Star Wars  Episode II:  The Clone Wars, because you won't be missing anything.

Author: farina.8
Review_Title: Good movies can't be bought with million dollar animation.
Review: It's so very sad to see a good thing stoop to such lows. I felt this movie was 2 hours of bad acting followed by 20 minutes of heart stopping animation, that came too little too late.

Author: gemal
Review: This movie was bad... my expectations were high, but the young actors just didn't do it. Way tooo much love scenes.... The story did work either Looking forward to episode III which I hope is much better!

Author: pjrot
Review_Title: Mixed Feelings about this latest installment. (Spoilers!)
Review: As an original moviegoer to Episode IV way back in '77 and all the episodes thereafter, I had mixed feelings about this latest installment in the Star Wars saga.  My views can be either attributed to my age showing or maybe the wisdom that comes with age. The opening scenes needed a little more action.  One of the higher points in The Phantom Menace was the opening droid battle with the familiar Star Wars theme pumping in the background and the flashy new Jedi moves.  There was nothing in AOTC until the speeder chase scene, which I felt, came too late and could have been shorter.  I also found Anikins outbursts and undisciplined manners hard to swallow.  For someone who has been training as a Jedi Knight for ten years you would think that discipline would be taught before swordsmanship or use of the force.  At times, he acts more like a preschooler than a twenty year old.  Then came the love story.  A necessity for future episodes but sadly underwritten.  I believe both Natalie Portman and Hayden Christensen are superb actors but have nothing to work with here. The scene with Anikins mother at the Tusken Raider camp is in my opinion the most important scene in the film.  Anikins turning to the dark-side really begins here.  Haydens evil `Jack Nicholson look' is perfect and creepy!  I could feel the dark-side just by looking at him!  Again we are cheated though.  This scene is just a crumb of what it should have been. Although the Jango Fett scenes were very cool they were not needed.  I think that Lucas added the character because Boba was so well liked in the other episodes.  Boba really didn't have that big of a role in the other episodes to warrant anymore screen time UNLESS something still lies ahead in Episode III.  Finally, during the last half hour we get a bombardment of what Lucas does best.  The Jedi battles are superb!  I almost started crying like a newly crowned Miss America during the final showdown with Yoda and Dooku! AWSOME!!  To sum it up, the movie starts at a medium pace, slows to a crawl, and then jumps into lightspeed.  Although the last action packed scenes are the best in any Star Wars film to date the movie as a whole ranks in last place in the saga so far.

Author: filmbuff-64
Review_Title: Yoda kicks a** - but otherwise ordinary
Review: Aside from Yoda opening a can of whoop-a** there is little excitement in the film as action yields to character development but even then it could have been more interesting.

Author: mariana-4
Review_Title: the less achieved episode of the saga
Review: Part of the expectation arisen around Episode II..., is owed to the love story between Anakin and Padmé.  But lamentably, this ingredient of the movie had a so careless processing, that are the texts of the dialogues of the scenes of love, the ones that spoil all the assembly of the movie.  The lines said between Anakin and Padmé since their arrival to the Naboo lake retreat, until their arrival to Geonosis' execution arena, signified an attack for more than one spectator willing to become detractor of the movie. And to think that who did the roles of Anakin and Padmé were destroyed for their work in Episode II...! Their critics forgot that good actors or actresses do not supply what lacks in the script. To us (the spectators) remains the doubt of if we lost of something that remained in the editing room, or we owe to the scriptwriter the do not to have worked better the love scenes as was done with almost all the other ingredients of the movie.

Author: mordrid1
Review_Title: Better than Episode One, but plot-holes need to be resolved
Review: Much in the same vein as Episode 1, there were many scenes which, if removed, would've made the movie much better.  However, there were fewer of these than there were in E1, and overall I thought E2 was *much* better than E1.  I didn't think 3-PO was all that funny, but as a forced comic-relief character he wasn't nearly as annoying as Jar Jar.  It's also ironic/very Lucas that Jar Jar is indirectly responsible for ultimately creating the Empire.

Author: mike056
Review_Title: Possible spoilers mostly my interpretaion of events
Review: I see mostly bad reviews for this latest installment of Star Wars, and I wonder, why? First, I say read the book. I have never seen a movie that was better then the book. The book would probably make much more sense to people than the movie, and eliminate many of these stupid postings from people who can't think. Most of the negative reviews talk about the story not making sense, being too complicated, or too dull. I ask how can this be complicated for anyone over the age of three? Naturally, what follows is my interpretation of events and may not be entirely accurate. Ten years before, around the time of The Phantom Menace Palpatine/Darth Sidious arranged for the creation of the clone army. I know they mention Sifo-Dyas as arranging it, but that could be Sidious/Palpatine or Dooku/Tyranus. The Dark Side of the force kept Yoda and Mace Windu from knowing of its creation, implying a connection. In addition, Jango Fett says `a man called Tyranus' (Count Dooku) recruited him. After the clone army was in creation Palpatine arranged the Separatist movement to create need for the army. The need for the army led to the senate's decision to give Palpatine extra powers. Powers which he claims he'll `lay down when this crises has abated.' This puts him in the position to name himself emperor, which he will probably do in Episode III as the empire is already in place in IV. Many people say at least this was better than Episode I, but I don't think Episode I was as bad as people say. In fact, and right after I say this many people will no doubt think I'm an idiot and stop reading immediately, I think Episode I was better then the first three, but not as good as II. The reason I have for this is IV, V, and VI have an unfinished feel about them. There is almost no mention of anything that happens in the first three aside from one reference to the clone wars, the one mention of Luke and Leia's mother and a few mentions of their father and is turn to the Dark Side. They just seem more complete. Naturally, there couldn't be mentions because they didn't exist yet, but you should get what I'm saying. Episode I sets the stage. For anyone who wasn't and isn't bright enough to understand, the major event in Episode I was the electing of Palpatine to Supreme Chancellor. Never mind the Trade Federation's defeat at Naboo or Jar Jar Binks (Side note: listening to everyone talk how annoying he is and how much they hate him and want to kill him is worse then Jar Jar himself) the main thing was Palpatine. Ah, now to the romance or lack thereof between Anakin and Amidala. Again, I say read the book. From the book to the movie about three-fourths of the scenes with them were cut out, making it seem like she was with him 5 minutes then started to love him. They removed when they have dinner with her family, and she admits to her sister Sola that she is starting to fall for him. A minor thing I only saw once or twice was someone saying Anakin was basically good-hearted and that they couldn't see how he would turn into Darth Vader. I ask, did you even see the part where he slaughters all the Tuskin Raiders? He lost control and let his hate rule. He killed the women and children. That's pretty bad. This is another guess of mine but I think it is pretty fair. What if he lost the person he loves? Now we know that Amidala has Luke and Leia and even that she had to live for a while after having them because in VI Leia recalled her mother as being beautiful but always sad. Now, Anakin/Vader didn't know of his kids, showing he was not with her when she had them, probably because he was Vader, and Anakin no longer. The question, what would turn him to the Dark Side? My guess is he believes Amidala was killed, then in his anger turns to the Dark Side, with help from Palpatine of course. Once he has turned, Amidala goes into hiding because there's nothing she can do to turn him back, has the kids then is killed somehow. After all, I really can't see how someone could turn to the Dark Side if the person they love is right beside them.

Review_Title: Great action, effects, story elements, and some humor carry this one past eps 1 and 6
Review: Some spoilers ahead, some of a general, some of a specific nature, no overall plot summary:

Author: richardh-8
Review_Title: It's not perfect, but it's pretty damn good!
Review: Like any Star Wars fan that grew up with the original trilogy, I looked forward to Episode II with a great deal of excitement, and I must say, having seen it now 5 times and having had many opportunities to digest its pros and cons, that it really quite extraordinary. As with anything that has such hype and historical success attached, viewer can't wait to tear it to pieces. After all, initially people complained about the title. For God's sake, was the titleThe Empire Strikes Back so inspiring, Return of the Jedi something special? And what does the title title matter anyways? After my first viewing, my initial feeling was wow!! What degree of imagination, design, craft and sheer graft must have gone in to creating such a movie? it is probably the closest to George Lucas' far away galaxy that we've yet seen. The characters, far-away-worlds and their applicable religons or beliefs are phenonmenal. And to think that this has all been brought forth from the in of one man is even moreso. If nothing more, George Lucas deserves praise for his vision and perseverance. As for the movie, sure it has it's faults. But what film doesn't? Some of the dialogue is a bit clumsy, but don't forget that it is designed to appeal to all ages. It's not Shakespeare and it's not Rugrats and neither is it meant to be. The enduring success of Star Wars is its universal appeal - and that may mean simplification, particularly where speech is concerned. The story is superb, especially when wee links to the original trilogy are thrown in. I particularly enjoyed Obi Wan's remark: "You'll be the death of me". Visually, the film is astonishing! The cityscape of Coruscant, the damp Kamino and the mysterious Geonosis all look fabulous. The action scenes including the early changeling chase, the Obi-Wan and Jango Fett battle and the always anticipated lightsabre showdowns were amazing. The performances were so-so. I can't still quite get used to Ewan McGregor's "Guinness" accent, Natalie Portman seemed a little bland while Hayden Christensen was good. For me though, the presence of Christopher Lee made all the difference. His brief scene with McGregor clearly showed the difference between "master" and "apprentice" in the acting stakes. As a fan I was thrilled. Whether you are a fan or not, cut the film some slack. Sure, note it's shortcomings, but recognise its merits, as there are many. And above all, just enjoy the fun, because it is after all, just a movie.

Author: sncns
Review: Yes, the dialogue is boring and very flat.  Yes, Jar-Jar Stinks has some speaking parts (only a few thank God).  And YES this thing ROCKS!  As someone who saw the original Star Wars in 1977 on opening weekend at the age of 7 and was forever altered, Attack of the Clones may very well be the best one yet.  I think all Star Wars fans like each of the movies in different ways.  The original will always be the best because it was the first.  But Clones is definately the most beautiful and breathtaking of them all.  The dialogue sucks, but hey, it does in all of them, even the first three, just watch them again and see.  It doesn't help that there is no Harrison Ford to help out the lame script, but at least Jar-Jar is kept to a minimum.  But in Clones a lot of the fun is just watching how everything is tied together. The other fun comes in watching all of the action, much more than I thought was supposed to be in this one.  All in all, I'd put this one as my second favorite right above Empire Strikes Back, then Return of the Jedi, and lastly The Phantom Menace.

Author: zyvo23
Review: A spectacular film that recaptured the magic of the first two episodes. When talking about the quality of a Star Wars film, it is only proper to evaluate within the context of the series.  That being said, this film is easily the equivalent of each of its predecessors.  The acting, which is being panned by many major critics, was as strong as that of any other Star Wars episode.  The story was more intriguing and more enveloping than any Star Wars film to date, and the both the sound and visuals were amazing.

Author: merlin.magician
Review: WARNING - POSS. SPOILERS

Author: davjhmcr
Review_Title: A case of spectacle over substance.
Review: An anti-climax, a disappointment. Disbelief can only be suspended so far. My issue with this film is that while the spectacle - the effects, the sets, the costumes, are superb - someone forgot to write a decent script. Ewan McGregor is wooden and looks as if he's reading from an autocue. Hayden Christensen (who?) never seems to have acted before this film, is this his first feature? Even Samuel L Jackson seems to groan inwardly has he spouts Jedi rubbish. This is great if you're 12 years old and part of the Jedi religion, if you're not either of these you're screwed. Get a grip Lucas.

Author: bulbushead
Review: Despite being a huge Star Wars fan, i really didn't expect too much out of this film. I was praying that it would be better than the Phantom Menace, and my prayers were definately answered. Watching Attack of the Clones reminded me of what a true Star Wars film was all about, a perfect blend of a story of love and incredible action sequences. I was concerned about the casting of Hayden Christenson as Anakin Skywalker, but i was wrong about him. He was amazing in this role. He was the perfect actor to show the signs of Evil in the man that would later become Darth Vader. When the movie ended at around 2:30 in the morning on Thursday, the first thing that entered my head was how great it was to see that George Lucas could still make a great film. I can't wait for Episode 3 when Anakin makes the transition from a life of peace in the Jedi Order to becoming the Evil Lord Vader. Thank you George, you did it again!

Author: klrobinson
Review: Flawed, yes, but serious fun nonetheless...will probably go down as one of the big fan favorites of the Star Wars serials, if only for the high octane final hour, and the Yoda battle scenes.  Makes Episode One a stronger movie by its inclusion, and serves as a bridge between the positive story of The Phantom Menace and the darker foreboding of the yet-untitled Episode 3.

Author: armando_reixa
Review: I was really willing to see this movie. After what i considered "The Phantom Menace" as good movie and on the same level of excitement as the others. But now, i was really disapointed. The special effects were really good, but the texts and the acting were terrible. It looked like that was made in a hurry, and put the movie in the same level as a crap love story try to make someone cry.

Author: boba_fett_20
Review: Incredible!!! The second episode in George Lucas' immortal "Star Wars" saga has just been released and it has surpassed even my highest expectations. "Attack of the Clones" is an amazing, action-packed thrill ride not to be missed. I won't waste my time summarizing the plot, for fear that I might give away some plot spoilers and such, but I saw the movie on opening night and I do plan on seeing it maybe two or three more times during its theatrical run.

Author: falko.jahn
Review_Title: The first one was annoying, the second one just boring.
Review: I saw the movie yesterday in a sold-out theater in Paris. Although the audience seemed to like it, it was a very disappointing experience for me. I didn't like the actors, the dialogue was flat, the love story didn't function at all. There was no sense of timing or suspense in this picture.

Author: indestructable_2000
Review: This was a class movie, really! I wasn't too impressed with the 'sound of music' Scenes. Although the film is basically set around Anakin Skywalkers quest of knowledge, I still felt he dominated the movie, leaving not much screentime for favourites such as Mace Windu, Jar Jar Binks (I'll get back to him later) and the almighty Yoda! He must only be in it for less than 30 mins altogether he has a cracking scene involving himself and Count Dooku, I wont give away what happens you'll have to see with your own eyes to believe it, after this scene I really think that Yoda must win best supporting actor in next years Oscars! Jar Jar Binks was really left out of this movie, he wasn't as mental as the previous movie, why does everyone keep dissin' him.

Review: Just wanted to throw in my 2 cents since I don't really see the comments that most people who have seen it have:

Author: reverend-7
Review: All concerns that this film would fall into the same traps that Phantom Menace suffered from were banished in the first half hour.  'Clones' delivers plot and action in spades, the visuals are outstanding and the soundscape is very impressive.  Sure the dialogue and acting aren't great, but hey this is Star Wars!

Author: mindlkaciv
Review: While the movie is a bit tedious at times it was better than Phantom Menace (which is not as bad as many would have you think).  The last half hour is an amazing action sequence topped off by the fight between Count Dooku and Yoda.  I only wish that the movie had had a darker ending similar to Empire's "what will happen to Han?".  While many questions are left unanswered, AOTC did not end in a true cliffhanger, which I would have preferred.  Either way 9 out of 10.

Author: machinesway
Review_Title: Fabulously entertaining. Critics should check their history text books.
Review: --SPOILERS-- From the moment it's kickstarted (that being when a Jedi leaps out the window of a miles-high building) to the much-too-soon ending, this movie left me breathless.

Author: cvb-4
Review: I was sceptical about this one after episodeI, but to my surprise this one really lives up to the original ones, and I even think that this one might be the best one yet (might take a couple more viewings though). It was a much darker movie than episode one, and in many ways resembles Empire in its style. It also has a great sense of adventure like the original ones along with multiple story lines also like Empire. The sound track was the best I've ever heard and the score great with a few new themes along with all the good old ones. I hated EP1, but this one I will definitely go see again and again and again. It does have a few weak point on the acting especially Hayden Christensen is not always too believable, but hey - he's a Skywalker - being a bad actor must run in the family. Oh, and watch out for Yoda - the little green guy can be pretty surprising. If EP1 had been this good, it would have met all the expectations and more. Even my wife, who has always hated the original Star Wars was crazy about this one.

Author: kukipapa
Review: So I hate the whole Star Wars universe I saw all four parts before and I found them really boring.This time I was surprised of this movie 'cause I enjoyed it so much.I thought it'll be another boring part but it's a real good film!

Author: publi.recla
Review_Title: Darth Vader was a teenage weenie.
Review: It's totally unbelievable that this Anakin-kid becomes the most evil person in the galaxy. Obi Wan should have slapped this weenie a few times in the face and Darth Vader would have never existed. Save yourself some cash and watch the original trilogy at home.

Author: mydrrin
Review: What was good:  the amazing special effects and background generation...although some was obvious most was seemless, the plot depth and complexity.

Author: moog826
Review: George Lucas seems to have gotten lost somewhere in his life's journey between the original Star Wars in 1977 and the release of the Phanom Menace in 1999.  Attack of the Clones confirms it.  That is not to say that Attack of the Clones is a bad film, it is not, however the prequal trilogy seems to be entirely out of sync with the original films.  I may be in the minority but I feel that CGI effects do not look real, in fact they usually don't even look good when used in excess, which Lucas seems to enjoy doing.  I long for the ggod ole' days when filmakers relied on miniatures, matte paintings and models rather than filming everything in front of a blue screen and adding things in later.  What results are films that seem as two visual layers that do not work together. That being said, Attack of the Clones is a good Star Wars movie not a great one.  I am hoping that Lucas finally finds his footing with Episode III and makes a movie worthy of the original trilogy.  The first hour and 15 mins. or so of this film are bogged down by scenes that are too long and the development of a love story that is flat and unconvincing.  Yet somehow by the end, perhaps because of our knowledge of what is to come, Annakin and Padme do seem to be genuinely in love.  Portman is better here than in Phantom Menace, Christiansen gives Annakin some depth that was lacking in Phantom Menace and has the perfect face for the part.  In one instant he can seem heroic and loving and in the next we can get a hint of Vader within him.  The rest of the cast is good for what they have to do.  Ewan McGregor has more to do in this movie, but still lacks the depth that Alec Guiness brought to the character.  Christopher Lee is great in the few moments he is on screen and Yoda...Yoda is at the top of his game.  He is entirely digital, which looked better than I thought it would.  But his lightsaber duel with Lee's Count Dooku near the end made the movie for me and mroe than made up for the listless pacing of the first half of the movie.  In fact I would go so far to say that this scene was one of the best of the trilogy. But the good parts do not gel together and the whole movie does not eminate the word "Classic" like the original trilogy.  But I have a feeling that when all six movies are seen together it will all come together and even the Phantom Menace's detractors may change their opinion about that movie.

Author: ao_gabriel
Review: The problem with critics is that they are just that.. they'll deny the greatness of a movie because by itself, it is lacking.  But that's just it about the starwars saga.. you are not to watch just one movie by itself.. the entire entity that is the (soon to be) 6 movie epic is -1- story.. it's just too long to tell in less than 30 years. :)  Watch this movie in that light, and you'll realize that this is so far the greatest installment yet, and it does nothing but point the way to the next movie and how amazingly phenomenal it's going to be..

Author: jpmcdaniel

Review: More and more of the movies I see lately make me wish silent movies were still popular.  The score and sound effects were fine, but the dialogue was just plain awful.

I only hope the next three years pass quickly so that all the answers we have always wanted will be provided and we will have a grand 6 film story to watch and love forever to come.

Author: steve-748
Review_Title: IMHO - The best in the series!!!
Review: Well, I feel as if the people panning this film must have been watching something else?

Author: manzico
Review: Downright awesome.  Here's 5 words why this movie is so fantastic:  Yoda, Yoda, Yoda, Yoda, and Yoda.  Here's some more: Mace Windu, storm troopers, Yoda, Anakin flirting with the dark side, Yoda, battle scenes, and Yoda. Lucas has definitely gotten his sea legs back.  Some people have criticized the dialog, and the slow pace of the first half but it really plays into the whole calm before the storm thing going on in this installment.  And by the way, Yoda kicks ass.  Go see it, I'm going again.

Author: tgrone
Review: As a Star Wars universe fan, I found myself concentrating less and less on "Attack of the Clones" as a movie in and of itself; the dialogue (terrible!) love scenes (cringe-inducing) and CGI (rubbery) made it hard to applaud this work.  However, the ideas in the movie, and the plot threads that connect it back to "The Phantom Menace" and, especially, forward to the original trilogy definitely make this worth the eight bucks.  Go with friends who've read all the novels and discuss amongst yourselves afterwards.

Author: ryttse
Review: I've just come home from the World premier of SW 2 and what can you say.. The movie felt like it went on for only a few minutes, thanks to the plot pace was good, with a speed increase the longer into the movie you get..

Author: bwilson-6
Review: Okay, here are the real problems with the new SW trilogy:

Author: Tim_
Review: Saw it last night and loved every minute of it.  Way better than the first one with more plot development, action, and romance.  My eyes were pretty tired by the end though, I don't think I blinked once!  You have to see this one or your going to miss a truly epic movie, so don't delay.  I'm definitely  going to see it again asap!!

Author: ee353
Review: For most of its slightly more than 2 hours, this is a great film, with some wonderful moments (Yoda returning to him shuffling gait after the wonderful seen with Dooku was for me particularly amusing!).  Unfortunately it is marred by some staggeringly bad dialogue during all of the love scenes - I get the impression that Hayden Christiansen and Natalie Portman thought the dialogue to be bad as well, if their stilted, wooden delivery is anything to go by.  Actors of more quality may have been able to produce something out of the dialogue, but both Portman and Christiansen are so outclassed by a cast that includes Samuel L Jackson, Ewan MacGregor and the timeless Christopher Lee, that the holes are just far too obvious.

Author: feldyfeld
Review: Midnight showing; Pittsburgh.

Author: robroy1971
Review_Title: I love it when a plan comes together.
Review: Just saw ATOC at Disney Downtown at the weekend. We saw it on DLP, instead of 35mm. Looked and sounded great. The movie was a heck of a lot better than TPM.

Author: get2meat
Review_Title: Better than I would have hoped!
Review: After a little disappointing Episode 1, I said that Lucas had to do better! He did!

Author: kdfan-2
Review_Title: The force is with us all now - 4 star review
Review: So, what did I think about Episode 2: Attack of the Clones?  Why would you even care what I have to say?  Well, I think you should care what I have to say, because I am a Star Wars Fan.  I waited in line to see the 12:01 showing in Westwood at the Village MANN with about 1200 other fans and I have to say it was a blast.  First, let's talk about the action sequences...

Author: mufti
Review_Title: One Of the Greatest, If not the One...
Review: This is the movie which brings balance to the Force.

Author: tekmage
Review_Title: Much better then I had thought it would be.
Review: Ep II proves again that Lucas should hire people to direct his screen plays. He just can't seem to get much out of an real actor.  Beyond some flat parts on the dialogue and awkward "romantic" moments the sprit of the story was very good.  What carried the film was the Special FX.  Those FX people get a 10 hands down. ILM showed us, again, who the big dog of the movie FX world is.  Hats off to modelers, animators, and hundred other people that pulled that off.

Author: Steve Boisvert
Review: Well...  I had some friends waiting in line for this morning's 12:01am showing of Episode II.  There were still tickets available at 6pm last night so I figured, "Aw, why not?"   I should've gone home and gotten some sleep, instead.

Author: metrent
Review_Title: Great only because it's Star Wars
Review: SPOILER:  Yoda does more than save Anakin and Obi-Wan; he saves the entire movie.

Author: yakirz
