Review: I will have to watch Attack of the Clones again soon. I saw it last Thursday, opening day here in the U.S.

Author: bastardx-1
Review_Title: A little bit good, but mostly crap
Review: This is surely better then TPM, but still a childish piece of film. The acting is quite horrible all over, almost the entire story is one big predictable thing and apart from the 'love-theme' the music is not very good either. All by all this film, like TPM, still feels like a very poor excuse to earn money, and if 'Star Wars' was not in the title it could be considered a simple B movie made by some unknown director.

Author: indianadrew
Review: I want to warn you folks that i may spoil some things for you. That said, Star Wars Episode II is one of the greatest Star Wars so far. One may even argue that it's the best since "The Empire Strikes Back". Unlike Episode I the story takes a while to develop but when it gets going it takes off. The characters are very well developed this time around (and more good news, minimal Jar Jar). The main story in the production of it all was new comer Hayden Christensen who did a very good job with the evil building up in Anakin but not so good on the love for his mother and contempt for Obi-Wan (but maybe I'm just jealous because I didn't get picked for the part). Like the originals the comedy comes in the form of droids. The banter between C3PO and R2D2 was one of the things that made the originals so great and it's brought back to life in this showing. And of course Yoda and Mace Windu (Samuel L. Jackson) live up to the hype (infact Jackson delivers the best line of the movie, a line only HE could deliver). So my overall rating is a good 9. If you were weary about this one because of Episode I, like I was, don't be. Go see it. This one was well worth the 3 year wait.

Author: stuart.m.ridout
Review_Title: Fantastic ! Going to see it again !
Review: Just come back from the 11.45 pm showing of Episode II. When can I get my ticket for the next showing. The film was really good.

Author: uselessness
Review_Title: Looking for a love story? Skip "Episode II."
Review: As a movie standing on its own merits, "Attack of the Clones" is an exciting, memorable action flick. I was on the edge of my seat nearly the whole time, and just when I thought things were going to settle down, the energy fired up again. However, as a member of the Star Wars saga, this movie is sadly a let-down. Gone are the witty one-liners and quips that define the original trilogy. And yes, there's actually a male-female relationship. I don't dare use the words "romance" or "love," because the acting is so stiff that it's impossible to believe that Anakin and Padme really care about each other. Though considering that Anakin is growing into Darth Vader, the idea that the whole thing is just teenage lust is a little more believable. I don't think it would be possible for Padme to see anything good in Anakin because he was so shallow, bitter, and downright disgusting to her. What was she thinking? I could swear there was a jedi mind trick in there somewhere.

Author: putmanjim
Review: Why do people like this movie? The dialog is pathetic and the acting is as weak as the story. There's no subtlety... Characters say everything they're doing.  30 years from now this movie will be in the 99cent DVD bin allong with "Pokemon 2000."

Author: Crispy-18
Review: Great effects supporting a well thought out plot. Go the Kiwis!! - the Fett family - Temuera Morrison and Daniel Logan. I won't say anything else, don't want to ruin anything for you. Bring on III

Author: daginge
Review: Star wars have always been fancy fighting with deathplanets and all that. In this episode the focus of the film is on anakin skywalker and Senator Padmé Amidala. Its a lovestory with a little bit of action and fancy details and special effects. But if you have seen all the other Star Wars episodes you will know that this film builds up for some very heavy action in the next episode. I gave it 6 out of 10 point because it could have been 30 minutes shorter and still get the story told.it got a little bit BORING

Author: delta_knight_1
Review_Title: Everyone I Know Loved it. Needless to Say, I hated it.
Review: Star Wars Episode II: Attack of the Clones was a hard movie to stomach for me.  Some had dubbed it Lucas' return to form, his return to creating a movie with passion, adventure, and most importantly, a soul.  I was looking forward to this.  Even though I liked Episode I to a certain extent, it was nothing compared to the epics of storytelling that comprised the original Star Wars Trilogy.  When you break it down, The Phantom Menace was nothing but the depiction of a group of people wandering around trying to find some replacement parts for their ship so a bunch of stuff could explode by the movie's third act.  Even though it was wholly boring at some parts and seemed directionless, I accepted its flaws because it was Star Wars.  I had a hard time doing the same for Clones.

Author: adam-243
Review: definitely better than episode I. Huge variety of new cool creatures, vehicles and characters. I got the willies the first time jar jar appeared, fortunately he had very few lines. The acting in the first half was terrible but did get better for the second half. Amidala had some nice outfits but I would've been happy if they had just kept her in that final white number. Wow. For the amount of time they spent on the politics you'd think they could have come up with something a bit more plausible.

Author: dakkon
Review_Title: Star Wars and classical themes are alive and strong.
Review: The movie was great, one of the ten best movies in a long time. First off let me say that at the time of writing (approx. one hour after seeing the film) my head is still swimming in the turmoil of this movie. This installment of the Star Wars saga is the most involving chapter to date.

Author: thanos_316
Review_Title: Better than EP1, but not great
Review: I finally got to see the film, and I was definately impressed by the improvement over Episode 1.  However, there were still quite a few problems I have with the story:

Author: dropdeaded209
Review: because it really really sucked. wow, this was a huge letdown. Hayden Christiansen was awkward and clumsy as the future Darth Vader, and Natilie Portman fared no better as Queen Amamamammama. The love scenes were hilariously bad, with some of the poorest writing this side of, well, Episode I. Slow, boring, and wholly unfulfilling, the film falls flat on its face, and resorts to a lightsaber-wielding Yoda in one unintentionally hilarious scene. The only actor who manages to salvage a little credibility is Ewan MacGregor, and not much at that. At two hours and forty mintues, this movie is a bloated, and uninvolving "epic" about people who don't even make the slightest emotional impact. Oh, and watch for the scene when "annie" skywalker's mother dies. it caused some of the biggest laughes in the entire movie theatre. George, let the trilogy rest in peace. Please.

Author: daveski_26
Review: I had the extreme pleasure to see Episode II last night at 12:01 and let me say that it was what star wars fans have been waiting for.  Far better then Episode I, Episode II is second only to The Empire Strikes Back.  The Fights are amazing the story told very well and Hardly any Jar-Jar!  Go see Episode II it is worth the wait in line!

Author: jak112
Review: What happened to George Lucas's directing ability? I watched "Attack of the Clones" last night and was so disappointed with the lifeless acting. The special effects were pretty cool, but it seems like just before the opening someone physically took the life out of the acting. I think I read somewhere that George Lucas said something like, " The actor's don't matter anyway" or something like that. He couldn't be more wrong about that. The people want to see Jedi stuff. That is what was so cool about the first Trilogy. The force was such a mysterious thing in the first ones. In this mvie it is just some other thing. Also, the acting in the first one is so much more personable. They actually seem human. That is what made it so beautiful! The only good part about 'The Clones' is the end.

Author: sajoyce-75909
Review_Title: Hayden Christiansen is the worst casting selection in history
Review:
This kid couldn't act his way out of a wet paper bag. Whoever made the decision to cast this lightweight should be banned from ever selecting actors again. It was probably George Lucas, to whom I would say, "stay in your lane, bro."
The poor acting of Mr. Christiansen cannot be overstated, as it ruins the entire film (& Episode 3). I can only imagine how frustrated the cast & crew must have been in being forced to work with such an obvious amateur.

Author: austonia
Review_Title: Pretty pictures but dissapointing script & many plot holes
Review: I grew up on Star Wars and had all the original toys. Even though I am a fan of the old movies, these new ones deserve fair examination.  Episode II : The CGI was beautiful, probably the most advanced to date. There was detail given to the environments. Some of the action scenes later in the movie were enthralling. However that did not save this movie. The most obvious problem is the dialogue which is pretty lame by any standard. Characters did not come across as real people, or at least anyone you cared about. Love scenes were amusing in the way of a cheap romance novel. People in the theater either laughed or groaned.

Author: minispielberg
Review: You have probably all heard by now the many critics lining up to batter Star Wars Episode II:Attack Of The Clones with old puns (Star Bores!etc)but please ignore them,as I can honestly say, without my own personal bias,that they must have seen a different film. Last night I went to the regional British Premiere in Peterborough an while sitting in that theatre,I got that rare feeling of unity with the whole audience.You could literally senSe their mutual enjoyment,and so proving that  critics areoften off the mark when it comes to audience's enjoyment.

Author: mrCoriolis
Review: The argument of the film is quite simple, the conversations are plain, without depth, boring.., the psychological touch has been definitively left, the story is a pretext to show big visual effects, etc... The worst of the series, as i had said.

Author: timmyllew
Review_Title: Oh my god... please be over!
Review: Throughout this film I was watching my watch more than the screen, and this comment comes from a lifelong Star Wars fan.  At no point was I interested in the plot, the characters or even the pathetic "special" effects. I just hope that someone does SOMETHING before the third film in released - I hate to see such great potential ruined.

Author: a_v_baker
Review: Star Wars Rocks!

Author: ghoff0507
Review: This movie is terrible. Anakin is so bad in this movie. Their is only 2 good scenes in this movie. Also it is SO BORING holy shart. I almost fell asleep watching this for the first time. The only saving grace was Ewan McGregor who was average in this movie but he was the best actor out the whole cast. The worst Star Wars movie by far and one of the worst movies I've ever seen. The war at the end was good and the part where Anakin chops off the sand peoples heads is nice but that is it. Fuc this movie.

Author: Happe
Review_Title: No more a movie for the guys
Review: I went to see the movie yesterday and I was frankly quite disappointed. Star Wars I was so bad that it is a good thing Lucas did not start off with that. That movie is targeted at "dad and his kids" which is quite brilliant from a marketing perspective. It is no coincident that Mr. Lucas is - to say the least - quite wealthy. For a normal guy I was sadly disappointed as I had hoped for an action movie with a humoristic twist, as I had seen in episode 4 and 5.

Author: tstovall79
Review: I was so glad that I read the reviews of this film before I went to see the movie.  I purposefully anticipated horrible acting and two-dimensional characters along with some corny jokes and bad lines.  When I emerged from the theater nearly two and a half hours later, I was pleasantly surprised because it wasn't that bad!  Sure it had it's moments, but doesn't EVERY Star Wars film?  This installment blows Phantom Menace out of the water in every way!  The story itself is becoming much more complex than I had ever imagined.  I am more intrigued by the evolving story of how the Empire came to power rather than I am of the fall of Anakin.  This movie had many subtle and not so subtle references of things to come.  Along with some trademark quotes from the Star Wars franchise, such as "I've got a bad feeling about this!" and the most intense fighting scenes ever in ANY Star Wars film, Attack of the Clones has brought back that Lucas magic that he perfected 25 years ago.

Author: boyrp
Review_Title: Briefly: different but better than Episode 1
Review: I just came back from one of the sneak-previews of Episode 2 here in Germany. Before I start, this: I generally hate dubbed versions of movies in English language although I'm German. I can't wait to have the possibility to watch it in the original language -although the dubbing team here in Germany did a really good job as far as sound quality is concerned. Back to the movie itself: Stunning special effects, brilliant sound, very good score (thanks to John Williams). After Episode 1 I honestly thought "With what can Lucas top this in the sequel as far as technical stuff is concerned?". Hmm, seems as if he could do it. The story(board) of this episode seems to be better than the one of the first. Although I liked Episode 1 I was a bit disappointed. Attack of the Clones was much more appealing to me. I think Lucas learned many things from The Phantom Menace.  It seems as if he is on the right way to deliver a masterpiece in form of the final prequel.

Author: derrillcrowbar503
Review: I have seen this movie many times, and that is a understatement. When my family got the DVD about 8 years ago me and my brother would watch it together. At the time, the movie had enough eye candy visuals to keep us mentally stimulated and fixed to the screen. Well, for me anyways. Sometimes my brother would fall asleep. I really liked the movie then, and now 8 years later, I still like it. I like it still even after reading all the negative reviews I could find out there, including red letter media. I popped the DVD in again after years of watching it the other day, and I was struck with a realization that so many others seemed to have realized long before hand. This movie really is a bad movie. Now this is all subjective how one feels about this movie I understand, but I finally realized personally that yes, this is a bad movie. A bad movie indeed. Most strikingly it was the CGI that I noticed had not stood up well over time. The movie looks almost like a cartoon now. And the movie seems more childish than I remember. That was my initial feeling after seeing this movie after so many years. It simply has not held up well visually. I cringe now at the love scenes between Anakin and Padame. I see fallacies within. Stiff, forced acting. I can go on and on, but other people have reviewed this movie analytically better than I could ever. One thing that was interesting is that I never cared much for the originals growing up. It was the prequels that sparked my interest in Star Wars and then I began to watch the originals. After going back to the prequels I realized how inferior they are compared to the originals. The OT felt real. The PT, more like cartoons, Attack of the clones more so than the others. After it is all said and done, I still enjoy this movie, although I'm still trying to figure out exactly why I do. Perhaps I have an affinity for B movies. Attack of the clones is one of the best B movies there is.

Author: jayhaack1
Review: For everybody out there who seems to be obsessed with trashing this movie because they think they sound smart, I have a comment for you.  Let it go.

Author: danny-178
Review: At the time of writing this, my first ever IMDB review, 'E2: Attack of the Clones' has a rating of 8.1. This is just plain nuts, and can not stand. One of the best things about IMDB is the rating system. It allows us, the users to get a good idea of what sort of experience we are in for. I fear the ratings are becoming worthless when this film has an 8.1.

Author: gumzilla
Review_Title: Good overall, but has some problems
Review: It's hard hot to notice the wooden performances by Natalie Portman and Hayden Christensen (the worst offender here.)  They have no on-screen chemistry.  Jimmy Smits is sadly miscast and looks very much out of place. Samuel Jackson- normally very good- also looks vaguely out of place. Christopher Lee, however, is brilliant here, and is an inspired choice.

Author: carrie-56
Review: I must say that I was really surprised last week, when I got to see this movie..

Author: audreymat
Review: The dialogue was so corny that I was laughing. Daytime soap operas have better writing, acting, and story development. The main characters and bad guys were so cold and boring that I couldn't root for either of them. This movie has no soul. Either Lucas is entirely ignorant of how terrible the last 2 films are or he just doesn't care that they're terrible. Everything that made the original Star Wars great (fun dialogue, a sense of humor, lovable side kicks, a bad guy with presence) have all been lost and forgotten in the new series. Yoda's fight sequence was the only redeeming part of the movie that got any kind of reaction from the audience.

Author: simguy99
Review: It seems that everyone is too optimistic when it comes to this movie.

Author: kerkko83
Review_Title: We need a little bit anger and more hate and the Darth Vader is born.
Review: Darth Vader is almost born. We need a little bit anger and more hate and then, the Darth Vader is born. Great story again from George Lucas. He has, again, surprised us. Great connection between these "new episodes" and old ones (4, 5 and 6). I loved it !

Author: jchase
Review_Title: An excellent middle chapter to the prequel trilogy.
Review: "You'll find that many of the truths we cling to greatly depend on your point of view." --Ben Kenobi to Luke Skywalker, "Return of the Jedi".

Author: claudevervoort
Review: Lucas did not resist the call of the dark digital side. Those dammed pixels are everywhere, in every frame, flooding the screen with an unreal aura of cold perfection. Is it a movie? Is it animation? Actors seem to be just the last accident, happening to be there drowned in this numeric soup. And for how long? Yoda has already succumbed to the call of the dark digital side. But the others, the humans, here they are, trying to catch desperately the audience's attention. A tough job indeed when your only weapons are virtual sets and the slimmest and most unbalanced script. I found it funny enough to be able to create quite effectively the illusion of a million troopers and mighty star destroyers, but yet to fail to convey the emotion of a simple 'I love you', the very most basic human feeling. The audience was laughing on every single of those 'romance' scenes, and I was wondering why did I pay to see such poor filmmaking.

Author: Thomas La Scala
Review_Title: wow wow wow...I want to see the third one now!
Review: I'm sure this episodes is one of the best ever made by Lucas, with great plot, fight scenes and ,of course, a little bit of love...all the actors are perfect for their roles, especially McGregor, which is the real heir of Alec Guinness and...nothing else, just may the Force be with all of you!

Author: michaelzois
Review: Manage to catch the film in a midnight show on Wednesday.I'll try to be short and spoiler-free.The overall feeling one gets after seeing this film is that STAR WARS ARE BACK!!!Really this film delivers and is superior to the Phantom Menace in all aspects. The story is very good and its laying the groundwork for the classical trilogy.Humor is there in the right moments and in the right amount.Obi-Wan has the best lines and it was so lovely and funny to see C3PO and R2D2 sharing some screen time.The only thing that doesnt work is the love story.Written very poorly but performed ok is a step below the rest of the film. The work of ILM is clearly superior and if you have the chance of seeing the digital projection you will fully understand.The images are richer in depth and color with great details.You'll have to watch the film over and over again to apreciate its work.The work in Coruscant is excellent and the planet of Camino is great.The Caminoeans are the best aliens in this film. Acting is clearly far better due to the presence of a convincing Hayden Christensen,a very nice work from Natalie Portman(they match very well on screen), a perfect Ewan McGregor and of course Christofer Lee,Temuera Morrison as Jango Fett, Ian McDiarmid as Senator Palpatin.The role of Samuel L Jackson is expanded and his fighting scenes are great. The action is this movie is UNBELIEVABLE.Star Wars means action and we surely get what we want.There are great sequences like the chase of the jedi starfighter by Slave 1 or the fight between Obi-Wan and Fett.The fight in the Geonosis Arena is like nothing you have ever seen in a Star Wars movie.And finally Yoda is the one to watch for in the movie.Yoda as you have never seen or imagine before.Just sit down and enjoy. On the whole this is a hugely entertaining movie,is a real Star Wars movie which will keep you going back for more in the days to come.The best movie of the year is here!!!Dont miss it.

Author: LNSonata
Review: I've heard from the critics that this movie lacks in many areas, after seeing it myself I would say that its very hard or impossible to find as many flaws as they claim exist. I enjoyed every minute of this movie, its so much better than The Phantom Menace.

Author: Arthur
Review_Title: Dare I Say I Wasn't Thrilled?
Review: Attack of the Clones. It and The Phantom Menace do not compare to the Classic Trilogy for several reasons, and I am getting tired of trying to point this out to people. 1) Too much CGI! There is something in writing we call "suspension of disbelief"...too much CGI over blue/green screened backgrounds wears down your attention, you keep wondering why Obi-Wan looks so flat... Lucas wants you to feel like you are in that world, and I can't while I am busy wondering how I slipped into a world where perspective is askew. 2) Wooden Romance. The romance between Anikan and Amidalla was described as wooden to me...I second the description. When she confesses her love for him, I was not there. Anikan's rage and sadness I got, I did not get this love. 3) I realized the biggest problem; no good lines. My friend figured this out, and I agree. I can quote the Emperor's lines from RotJ word for word. I found maybe a few lines from tPM and AotC to quote. The script is too hard, rigid, it isn't natural. I feel like I am watching a poorly made documentary about the history of the Republic and the rise of the Empire, not a Space Opera! In closing, Attack of the Clones is a good sci-fi, but it does little to live up to the Classic Trilogy. Sorry fanboys.

Author: nick_collings
Review_Title: Great dialogue, acting, romance, plotwhere was it?
Review: **POSSIBLE SPOILERS** Before going into the cinema to watch the latest George Lucas franchise, I had pre-conceived expectations  and after leaving 140 long minutes later, they hadn't changed. Was this the best looking video game I just saw? The special effects and locations were undeniably spectacular, but a successful film needs story, pacing and acting first and CGI not to get in the way. The love scenes and the lulls with senators sitting around in circles had me looking at my watch, which can't be a good sign for a Star Wars movie. And the less said about the poor actors spouting such banal and cringe-worthy dialogue the better - who says the word `dreamy' anymore? And Anikan comes across as a spoilt brat and not a tormented soul on his way to becoming evil dictator Darth Vader - a missed opportunity. But what about the positives, as there are some visual treats. The last half an hour turned a mediocre movie into an entertaining ride, the Gladiator style monster battle was visual eye candy to behold. OK you knew none of the `good guys' was going to die not even a sense of danger, but please bring a little tension and unpredictability next time. There is however a great scene of Yoda putting down his walking stick to kick 80 year old Christopher Lee's butt. A crowd-pleasing moment that needs belief suspended, as judging by Yoda's highflying moves, why does he need a walking stick in the first place?

Author: thekillingbean
Review: Thanks George for this great movie :) When I saw this movie I thought "Yes, where back on the right track". This movie is great!! The effects, the music and the actors where all very good. Even Jar Jar is not annoying, and it's even nice to see him again. First I had a bad feeling about the computer Yoda, but Yoda looks great. I also liked Jango en Boba Fett. I was very cool how Boba looked up to his old man :D This Episode Rocks!! Can't wait for the last part :)

Author: tee_x1
Review: This film, for me, did not live up to the hype. Or maybe I just didn't get it. I went in there, expecting an action packed movie, not unlike the first installment. I ended up getting a love story, which dragged on, with very few and far between, although quit good, action sequences. I actually fell asleep during the movie. It didn't grab my attention and I forgot, what happened in there, when I walked out of the cinema. I'm sorry to say this but, it was literally the most boring film I had watched this year. It reminded me of the time I rushed to see the first installment of Mortal Combat. I walked away filled with disappointment then and I'm working away filling disappointed now. What makes it more so it that, I was really looking forward to seeing it.

Author: anime-man
Review_Title: Simply the best Star Wars ever...
Review: If Episode 1 was a kid movie, which was for most fans a failure, this one has nothing to do with it. No more Jar Jar Binks, no more midichlorian stuff, no more playstation-podracer championship.

Author: wolfie76
Review: Ok, its definitely official.  I just saw Star Wars here in Tampa last night (12:15am) and the movie is excellent.  Oh, and Yoda Rocks !!  I just don't understand what the critics are looking for.  I mean, yeah Phantom Menace wasn't the greatest movie of all time or anything...but it wasn't the garbage you would think when the critics bashed it.  And this movie, well, it is a vast improvement and I really think it is an incredible achievement. The special effects are absolutely amazing.  I think this movie has set a new bar for special effects in films.  Wow !!!

Author: griffey006
Review: If you liked Empire Strikes Back, then you can think of EII as a better version (but for the first trilogy). I won't give major plot elements but I can tell you everyone plays thier role well. I will tell you that Jango Fett has a very important role in the movie. You will enjoy this movie, defentitly if you are in any way a Star Wars fan. Probably a B+ to a A for a non-Star Wars fan, a A+ for a Star Wars fan. Go see it, you will love it.

Author: usmant
Review_Title: I don't want to say that I am disappointed but I really expected more!
Review: Saw the first show of Episode 2 on this side of Atlantic last night in a special preview after midnight. And man was it an event, but that's expected I presume of every Star Wars movie. Anyway getting back to the point, I really expected more than what the movie eventually offered. I heard people saying on television movie programs, those who had seen it in the Trebecca film festival in New York, that its better than Episode 1: The Phantom Menace and so on. But I beg to differ. I am sure that its not. Though I feared a complete love story after watching many many rushes in the last few weeks but luckily it has a lot more. Unfortunately it all doesn't seem to be linked to each other that well.

Author: fsunole21
Review: For those of you who are avid Star Wars fans, but not Phantom Menace fans, fear not, the Force is with Attack of the Clones.  From amazing battle scenes.  A beautiful love affair, and Yoda kicking some major butt, Attack of the Clones has it all.  See it again, and again.  I am quite pleased with Lucas' latest installment.

Author: Bakmeel
Review: Despite of a minor failure of the theatre's sound system, I was mostly impressed by the great sound effects in this movie. Spaceship flyby's explosions etc, really made me shiver and shake! ;)

Author: mrmrsp
Review_Title: A brilliant segue into the future (past) of Star Wars...
Review: I was thrilled with "Attack of the Clones". The action kept me at the edge of my seat, the cinematography was breathtaking, the comedy made me laugh out loud, and the romance - well, it is so believable. I applaud George Lucas - telling the middle of a story when everyone in the world knows how it ends - an incredible task. "Attack of the Clones" ties together so many relationships from the original 3 movies. Hayden Christensen is perfect for this role, Natalie Portman again does an outstanding job. Ewan McGregor even looks like Alec Guiness a bit. And, Yoda ROCKS! I can't wait to see it again.

Author: Inspektah
Review_Title: You people have just outgrown it.
Review: I can't do this in less than 1000 words.  I gotta say that Clones left me speechless, much so that I don't wanna do a review about it more than I wanna do a review about these punks who assert so much about how bad the last two Star Wars episodes are. Peep the math!  I didn't like Jar-Jar and I'm not excited about the corny remarks continually made throughout each episode.  Nevertheless, I'm intelligent enough to know that when I was a little kid I really liked the Jawas, the Ewoks, the droids, the remarks, and every other little annoying thing about the first three flicks.  That's the genius of Star Wars. People of ALL ages can enjoy it, unlike your favorite Tarantino flick or that new Fatal Attraction-copycat Unfaithful or whatever the name of it is.  Clones not only is true to the all-ages format, it exceeds all saga criteria to be justifiably in an argument for the best episode ever. Now, for all you punks.  When most of you liked Star Wars you were probably little innocent kids, like I was.  Now you're grown.  Things have happened in your life, you've seen other movies, and innocence has been lost.  The same things don't please you anymore.  I defy any of you b**ches to name one motion picture, novel, or story that is so compelling to so many people more than Star Wars.  Lord Of The Rings?  Give me a break!  I haven't seen it yet and I'm sure it's a great flick, but the line to see the next episode of the saga won't be laden with kids AND adults dressed as characters in the movie.

Author: annacloudberry
Review: If you loved The Phantom Menace, this is nothing for you. The Phantom Menace was a kid's adventure movie, this is a dark story of passion and pure evil. Anakin Skywalker is now a grown-up, and he is well on his way to embrace the dark side. The love-story between Anakin and Padme is central to the story, the rest is merely essential to tie this trilogy to part IV-VI. It's a great adventure movie, and I really recommend it!

Author: mistermox
Review: This one is even worse than Episode 1. Instead of JarJar annoying us now we have a silly lovestory and a dying mother. The only good things about this movie was to see Yoda himself fighting with a lightsaber. The acting of Christopher Lee was very good as always. But in general the movie was very disappointing, it is definately not as good as any of the original Star Wars movies. I rate it 5/10.

Author: vcallag
Review_Title: When will balance be restored to the Force?
Review: After watching George Lucas' latest opus I am still questioning why I wasn't impressed.  The major consensus between other people who have seen the film is that it is better than the disappointing Phantom Menace.  Well to quote Master Yoda "Better it may be, but good it is not."

Author: mmaness
Review: I was a little wary about seeing Episode II after the demise of Episode I. But I have to say I was very pleasantly surprised.  Great story, excellent action, Anakin is hot, and Yoda kicks ass! Only one gripe...who the hell hired Jimmy Smits to be in this movie?  It was such a small part, and he just didn't fit into the fantasy.

Author: POvidiusNaso
Review_Title: Don't be a sheep. This is a bad movie.
Review: In Star Wars: Attack of the Clones, George Lucas has finally put the kibosh on this once glorious series.  The fun and melodramatic world of Luke, Han, Leia, and Chewie has been chewed up and spit out into a cud of technological mishmash and confusing, boring plot lines.  Though hints of the old magic are there, Lucas absolutely refuses to engage with it, choosing glitter over substance.

Author: rogerskp
Review_Title: Great special fx, poor script, poor acting, poor direction, poor ...
Review: I can't believe people give this film 10/10.

Author: hscheuren3
Review: I have seen the movie twice now and after seeing it a second time, I'm thrilled to see how much of an improvement Lucas did over Episode one. Unlike most of the overly harsh critics, I see genuine improvement in several areas. In addition to the improvements in character development and visual effects, the aspect of parallelism within the series is present specifically in regard to Empire Strikes Back. If you go back and look at the two movies, you see how Lucas patterned Attack of the Clones just like Empire Strikes Back right down to the ending. Just take a close look and you'll see.

Author: drthought
Review: Star Wars Attack of the Clones was at best mildly entertaining.  The first hour and a half was filled with the worst romance to ever hit the big screen.  The only entertainment came from laughing at the horrendous dialog and equally bad acting.  The last 45 minutes of the movie would have been enjoyable if you didn't have the previous hour and a half of boredom hanging over you.  Even the last 45 minutes was plagued by C3PO's very unfunny one liners.  Unlike the previous Star Wars movies, Clones does not leave you with the desire to see the next installment.

Author: Himmy
Review_Title: Just a ordinary movie which doesn't feel like "StarWars"
Review: I just went to that movie yesterday and like Phantom Menace it was a real disappointment. Most of the people will have seen the movie by now so I won't bother about the contents of the movie. But a few thing have to be said. At first the setting is beautiful made. The locations the costumes they all look beautiful and the special effects are awesome. The music is quite good and has a nice opera effect when hearing it. But this doesn't make the movie a "good" movie. Although the landscape is beautiful made it has no atmosphere. The whole look is like seeing a normal US city in the future. The whole concept of another world with its own culture and civilization has been neglected. Those people in that planet is nothing more than the USA in the future. And all the people in the movie behaves the same. No cultural differences. The whole idea that the queen had become a senator was terrible. The whole personality, and elegance of an aristocracy have been wiped out by this idea. A chosen queen??? The whole meaning that Luke Leila SkyWalkers background is "chosen" and "special" is just gone. And the way she acts is so ordinary that you don't find her to be an important person like the people in the movie suggest she would be. The whole concept of the Jedi knight was meant to be some kind of an elite order of knights within the system. In the movie they just differ from the rest of the soldiers that they are fighting with light sabers and not with laser guns. It doesn't fell that they were special at all. They had no special customs or rites. No symbols or mythologies. And the fighting scene was very nice done but also dull. Those people are fighting robots... The excitement is missing when you know that they are just machines. All in all the movie lacks the "magic" and "atmosphere" of a good epic space opera. It wasn't epic at all.

Author: MattNoe
Review: This is in parts even worse than Episode I, but in some parts also as good as RETURN OF THE JEDI or A NEW HOPE. Nevertheless it never gets the intensity of EMPIRE STRIKES BACK. One main point to critisize the movie is that it's overloaded with three things: Ludicrous Dialogues, omnipresent CGIs and too many sub plots. The Love story seems not very moving and again Lucas spits in Composer John Williams' face by deleting his E II scoretracks of the great Battle Finale and putting in reedited parts of the Episode I score. And the worst thing: It has long parts, where it's just BORING as hell, which relies on both: Story and photography (on this water planet the set looks like a cheap 2001-Copy). And the scene, when Anakin makes his first step on the dark side by kill-kill-kill !?!? The idea is OK, but the scene is a desaster (not the killing, but the scene before). The worst example of class 3 acting by good but bored actors.

Author: smileysmile
Review: Star Wars has always been about fun, 2 hours of pure unadulterated fantasy, nothing too heavy, nothing too brain taxing, after all, the films are kids films (big or small !!!!!).

Author: pipster2000
Review: This is not so much a criticism of the film but a criticism of George Lucas, a man I once venerated above all. I forgave him for the Ewoks in Return of the Jedi, I forgave him for that annoying kid who played Anakin in Menace, hell, I even forgave him for Jar Jar Binks... BUT what I can't forgive him for is the waste of space that is Attack of the Clones. The dialogue is bad, very bad, in fact the worst of ALL the films. The character direction is very very bad. But lets forgive George for this I mean it's only a kids film' (his words not mine), but what I can't get over is how appalling the film moves along. It drags, far far worse than Menace ever did. I've read some revues that criticised the 'love' scenes, oh dear, they didn't go far enough.. Natalie Portman is a good actress, but George (light on direction, large on wallet) Lucas can destroy this ability instantly. The only good thing in this film is Ewan McGregor, he IS a young Alec Guinness.

Author: Dr Trains
Review_Title: I've never wanted a lightsaber so much!!!
Review: Man, it was beautiful. A Star Wars fan's dream. Unbelievably good. Everything I ever wished for in a star wars film. This isn't much of a review because I don't want to spoil any of it for you(particularly the END, man was the end good). I saw it not knowing anything about it, (deliberately) and that was the best way to see it.

Author: acompletevidiot
Review_Title: George has more than made up for his last two installments!
Review: If you are a fan of Eps 4 and 5, you will not be disappointed.  This film is chock full of interesting sights and sounds, hugely ambitious (and successful!) mass battle sequences, and carefully paced plot twists and revelations.  Any fears I may have had as the lights dimmed were completely quelled early in the story when I realized we were going to get to see a much darker vision of the galaxy than previously shown, with a bit more grit and edge.  The relatively uneven performance of Mr. Christensen in no way detracts from the overall beauty and feel of the movie.  I will definitely watch this detail-rich beast again and again.

Author: Foolbag
Review: This movie had me moderately excited, what with a lot of people claiming it to be the best SW since ESB, personally I'm really not that fanatic about SW but I was hoping for something that would at least surpass Ep1...

Author: ruffnerj
Review_Title: Better than Episode One--but takes itself too seriously
Review: I actually debated whether or not I would EVER see this film, after the trailers seemed heavily weighed in the romance direction, but seeing an advance screening convinced me that there is still hope for the franchise.

Author: can_ozden
Review: When Lucas announced that he's going to make a new Star Wars Trilogy, i thought how wonderful watch the Star Wars in Cinema.But SOMETHING went wrong and Episode One disappoint me.But Lucas didn't make the same mistakes in Episode Two.Special effects(it's the best I've ever seen even better than Lord of the Rings),music(john Williams will win the Oscar for sure),camera movements and acting(except Hayden Christensen)was perfect.He is the only reason for giving this film a NINE.And the greatest Jedi Yoda fights for the first time in Star Wars History and even for this I can see it for second time.I think this is it,Lucas knows how to make great films.At Oscars we will see a great fight with Jedis and Hobbits(I hope hobbits win).This film is really must see.

Author: sebba
Review: I were one of those who didn't like episode one. This movie makes the new starwars-movies justice though. More serious buisness and less humour and last but not least minimum of Jar-Jar Binks... An 8 for this justicemaking Star Wars Episode...

Author: enigma2472001
Review: Bad Acting, Dialogue and Storyline.

Author: jockefr
Review: Lucas has once again created an excellent movie. The action in this movie is brilliant, its easy to follow and intense. Its sad that Episode I was so bad, because it kind of sabotages the saga. My vote 9/10 and the best movie of the year so far.

Author: turmanc
Review_Title: Great Movie -> Star Wars Or Otherwise
Review: I read almost all of the reader reviews (without spoilers) that I could before going to see Episode II.  I went in with a sense of dread, half expecting to be full on let down by the latest installment of the Star Wars saga.  I had many key phrases from those reviews dancing through my head. I looked for the "wooden lines" spoken by the actors, I looked for a "jumbled" or "muddy" plot.  I looked for everything that I heard was bad.... and it wasn't there.  This movie returns the series to the Star Wars that most people know and love.  I must admit I'm a Star Wars fan, but you can lump me in the category of people that did not like Episode I (at least the first time I saw it).  Episode II delivers everything I hoped for and then some.

Author: Darkmark64
Review: This movie was just awesome.  Cool light saber fights, fills in episode 1 a lot better, and its just burly!!!  I thought that with the love story added in that it would detract from the movie.  But Lucas did it right, and it rocked!!!   And just wait, Yoda is the bomb!!!

Author: morricg
Review_Title: Everything I'd hoped for and more! The force is strong with this one!
Review: Simply amazing.

Author: iamthegame86
Review: I'll admit. I wasn't blown away by "The Phantom Menace", but it wasn't bad, by any means. It just lacked the "umph!" that the original trilogy had. Understandably, though, seeing as it was his first Star Wars movie in 20 years. All of that has changed. Watching "Attack of the Clones", I couldn't help but be reminded of the Empire Strikes Back, arguably the best in the series, even though I favor RotJ. Never before has a musical score guided the movie so aptly. When Anakin is full of rage, you can tell, just by the music. Several emotions play out through the amazing music. There were solid performances all around. Hayden Christensen is astounding. As the movie goes, he fills with more and more hatred, and Hayden pulls it off unbelieveably. Ewan McGregor does great as Obi-Wan, and you really get a sense of wisdom and responsibility. Natalie Portman, gorgeous as always, is great as just a Senator. There is not one part I didn't love. I guess the only complaint I would have is that sometimes, the special effects were "campy". As I walked out of the theater, I was already filling with anticipation for Episode 3, so I guess George Lucas did his job well. I would recommend it to anybody, and everybody. Ending, I would just like to say, that this movie, has my favorite battle/war scene I've ever seen. You'll know what I'm talkin' about. And at end, I'll say that Yoda kicks major, uhm, behind ;)

Author: dshegle
Review_Title: Star Wars is back and better than ever
Review: All I have to say is wow!  I cannot believe the magic in that movie, it blew me away!  From the attention grabbing beginning to the INCREDIBLE end, it was pure star wars rush.  the stuff they do in this movie is absolutely incredible ******possible spoiler warning!!!!  YODA fighting with a lightsaber is the coolest thing ever and is hilarious as well!!!!!!!!******* end spoiler..  That alone is worth the ticket price.  I totally can't see where critics are coming from when they complain about weak acting of a stilted romance, the romance, in fact, seemed way above the "titanic" level, and was very natural, and all the dialogue fit right in with the characters and they're feelings.  A wonderful rollercoaster ride - the last hour is the best science fiction ever put on film!

Author: christian catu
Review_Title: A major leap from Episode I
Review: My god was I shaking when i exited the theater yesterday. This movie is just so full of everything I ever loved about Star Wars. Episode I was a bit long at times but this one almost ended before it began, or so it felt. I had heard a little about Yoda's light saber fight, and feared it would be too silly, and in every other movie it really would have been, but in this one, nothing seems more right. I can't wait till 2005 to see how they're going to end this spectacular adventure. Imagine if the quality leap will be as wild from Episode II to Episode III as it was from Episode I to Episode II!

Author: jsiedlik
Review_Title: Lump it with IV and V, not VI and I
Review: Just saw an advance screening of 'Attack of the Clones' yesterday and was BLOWN AWAY.  While 'Phantom' had a lot of cool things about it (light-sabers doing everything you'd ever wished for) it also had several things weighing it down (Jar-jar, lil' orphan Annie...etc.) This time around, however,  Lucas seems to get things right, sometimes even (god forbid) letting the actors ACT.

Author: jrefior
Review_Title: Leaden and disappointing given the potential
Review: The only thing really worth seeing was the lightsaber fight between Yoda and Dooku.  That was really cool.  Unfortunately it was also really short.  The other lightsaber fights were pretty lame.  They should have gotten a better actor to play Anakin Skywalker.  It might be an ok teen movie, but for any adult the alleged love scenes are not at all convincing.  Obi-Wan Kenobi is strangely a weakling in this film.  He should know by now that Anakin is turning to the dark side.  Samuel L. Jackson is a good fighter but is oblivious to what's going on around him and makes bad decisions.  There is no hero in this movie and Yoda is the only great character.  That none of the Jedi realize that the chancellor that they work with every day is the dark emperor is a little hard to believe at this point.  The acting is generally stilted, which is forgivable but they sure could use a Harrison Ford--someone who clearly enjoys both the humor and adventure of his situation (being an actor in star wars) and makes light of it enough to bring some spirit into his character.  Some parts of the plot don't make much sense.  After dazzling heroics, a promise to never fail again, and a compelling reason to protect Padme, Anakin seems to get bogged down in weak enemies and give up his responsibility to protect her in the conveyor belt scene, for example.  Padme goes on vacation as soon as she gets home, does no work as a senator and doesn't even keep up with news, and spends most of her time emerging from doorways dressed to allure to meet her spurned Jedi protector.  Anakin shows her that he is turning to the dark side and that he has killed indiscriminately out of hatred and vengeance, and yet she does not seem concerned by this and never brings it up with Obi-Wan or Yoda as you would expect her to do.  Samuel L. Jackson has Boba Fett and Count Dooku under the sway of his light saber, but he leaves them to go fight drones. It seems clear that Yoda could have kicked Count Dooku's ass, but he waits too long to strike a blow and Dooku escapes.  And the way the jedi kill seems inconsistent with the struggle between Luke and Darth Vader in the original Star Wars series.  If Luke kills darth vader he becomes him.  When Vader strikes down Obi-Wan, Obi-Wan becomes stronger than ever before.  Why doesn't this struggle between the light and dark have meaning in the actions of the jedi in episode 2?  Indeed, where is the struggle between good and bad?  It seems that good is really just a confused few led by Yoda.

Author: thoughtpolice2k
Review: Believe the hype!  Episode II will go down as one of the signal most thrilling and satisfying movie-going experiences I have ever enjoyed in my life. In fact, it may be the most wonderfully entertaining film I've ever seen period.

Author: mcyoung12
Review_Title: God bless Lucas for Star Wars
Review: I've loved Star Wars since i could remember watching movies.  When I heard Lucas was finally going to make the prequel trilogy, I was ecstatic! Episode I had obvious flaws, but it was still great in my book, it's part of Star Wars!  As for Episode II.  I Loved this movie!!  To attack the critics reviews, here we go:

Author: ranko74
Review_Title: A few lines on why i love this
Review: Awesome, and probably the darkest of all the episodes. My favourite to this date has always been Empire Strikes Back and i believe this is very similar.The battle scenes are grand and intense and the sound the best of any movies i have ever seen. I will surely be seeing it again a few times, a breathtaking movie experience. Bring on Episode 3

Author: slobber
Review: Yes, The Force has returned. Ep II is a lot better than the previous one. The plot is better (still not good enough.. :) ), dialog is reasonable and the whole thing just seems to work better. The acting is good overall but Hayden ´WhatsHisName´.. REALLY can´t act.. FX are great (what do you expect?! ) and the musical score simply outstanding. Just go and see it yourself. May the force be with you.. ... . .

Author: crbfox_37
Review: Having grown up on Star Wars, this was a must for me to see.  After the Phantom Menace, this was the film that was supposed to right the Star Wars ship.  However, even with my standards lowered by the much maligned (some of which was much deserved) Phantom Menace, I still left the theatre with the unnerving opinion that these prequels never should have been made.

Author: stoffnbert
Review: I just saw this movie and found it to be an exciting thrill ride of a movie that made me feel like I was 8 again watching Star Wars and wondering if the force was with me.  Much like Lucas's Indiana Jone's trilogy, Star Wars is about larger than life characters, doing what we all wish we could and done in the pulpy style of the films Mr. Lucas enjoyed when he was growing up. Are there plot holes, yes. Is some of the dialogue sound like something from a fortune cookie you get with your Chinese lunch special, unfortunately sometimes yes.  Is this what we expect from Star Wars, ABSOLUTELY!!!  The Star Wars world has always been a fantastic, over the top world, a place where the bad guys can't hit an 8 foot hairy Wookie but the good guys never miss, and the most wise character shares his voice with Miss Piggy.  Do we care?  No.  The critics may say we should but why should we.  These movies do what they are supposed to do, they bring us to a magical place for a couple of hours, a place where while we are there, we can all channel a bit of that mythical stuff Lucas calls force...and be 8 again, if only for an hour or two.

Author: jasect
Review: Marvellous film, very Empire Strikes Back ish.  This will please most people.  Lots of plot, but still lots of action too. Excellent performances from Natalie Portman and Hayden Christensen. Christopher was suitably evil and scary but Yoda beat him up anyway.

Author: LMBC
Review: First of all, I regard the first trilogy (4,5,6) with such respect and awe that I really don't think that any movie will ever top the grandeur of them. Even with the amazement I have at Lucas' genius for creating the story I was one of the many who were disappointed with his Phantom Menace.  It had its moments, but overall it fell far short of the most remedial expectations one could have for 20 years of story plotting.  So after the 99' disappointment I didn't have very high expectations for Episode II.  Even though I got the same feeling I did while watching PM - that there was just a bit too much CGI, I REALLY enjoyed this movie.  And I had made up my mind that I was going to be very critical.  Well, Star Wars got a little bit of its magic back.  That special feeling that you only get when you watch a SW movie.  There were some amazing moments in the movie that I didnt see coming that really did work - Anakins telling of the sand people incident.. the last shot of Boba.. Yoda, nuff said.. and the early reference to the Death Star was pure GENIUS..  I think either by blind luck or maybe a sudden realization, Lucas got back to what, in the end made the original series stand the test of time and it wasn't the special effects, because effects of sw were soon outdone and it wasn't the acting (never been one of starwars strongpoints with the exception of a few characters) but the friggin story!! Thats whats so amazing about the series, and I was into the story the whole time.

Author: Fellowship_Legolas
Review: The film has it's moments but not constant joy like 'em old ones. Now it's all about looking good out there with fancy fights and beautiful animations created by George's amazing computers. Too bad, that the magic is lost in time...

Author: wmd204
Review_Title: This is THE MOVIE to see this summer
Review: I saw the film last night at a press screening and was just blown away.  It is a return to the feeling of excitement and urgency that made the original trilogy so great.  By far it's the most thrilling of all of the movies.  And it's close to being the best.  Hayden Christensen's portrayal of the gifted yet troubled Anakin Skywalker is spot-on.  Just fantastic.  The story is great.   It pulls you in, and once it gets going, it doesn't stop.  It left me wanting more and I can't wait for the all of the answers to this mystery to be revealed. My only problem with the film is Portman's character.  It's very underwritten, and since she doesn't have much going on internally she just falls flat.  That's what stands in the way of the romance working as well as it should have. But there are so many other things that just left my jaw on the floor for almost the entire running time.  So everyone, SEE THIS MOVIE before everyone is talking about it and spoiling it for you.  You won't be disappointed.  Trust me.

Author: maratona
Review: After the disappointing Episode I is the force back.ATOC has not only the missed Star Wars-feeling, also the acting and of course the special effects are great.This film is not only for fans it´s a film for everyone who wants to plunge into a phantastic world.

Author: ecr917
Review: There was a reason Lucas did episode 4 first; it isn't that complex. Honestly, 4-6 are really just the good versus evil story that has made the original trilogy so popular.  What we are seeing now, is that there is actually more depth than that.  Though I felt some of the dialogue was a little forced, and some of the scenes less than perfect, I also felt Episode II was a very complex and difficult film trying to incorporate many very different pieces.  In the end, it was a challenge well met.  The digital creations performed excellently in actions sequences (though less than perfectly in some other scenes).  The backdrops were great, and most of the digital characters (including Yoda) were beautiful.  I left pondering the truths of the universe, and totally enthralled by the power of the force. Despite her mediocre acting job, I was also totally in love with Natalie Portman.  All in all, a great film that will stand up to repeated viewing.

Author: legallee_99
Review: This movie was long on effects and combat, and unfortunately far too long on pure syrupy SAP.  That Anakin is a Basketcase, mad at Obi Wan, then mad at the Tuscans (killing their women and children, come on!), then madly in love with Padme (many years his senior).  His last name should be changed, by the way -- from Skywalker to ChickStalker.  He will not leave her alone!  And the speech by the fireplace is enough to make you blow your popcorn -- "you torment my soulllllll!"  Gag me.

Author: coreyloftus
Review_Title: Like a rollercoaster- starts out slow, but picks up speed.
Review: THERE MAY BE SPOILERS, YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED

Author: dantes1815
Review_Title: *spoilers* good and bad of ep. II
Review: Where to begin?  There were parts of AOTC that exceeded my expectations and other parts that fell far short of them.

Author: anakinacting
Review_Title: An abomination with a capital A
Review: this movie can be summed by ten words that start with the letter D

Author: devilish_demon
Review_Title: The Greatest Installment Of Star Wars
Review: I really want you to believe me, but I know you won't, because what I'm saying is ridiculous, but, hand on heart, that's how I feel right now, Attack of the Clones is not only the greatest single instalment of Star Wars I've had the pleasure of seeing, but the best damn 2 hours I have spent in a movie theatre. It helped of course, that the movie theatre I was in, was London Leicester square, the night of May 15th, the official Public Premiere of the movie, yes that helped, the gang of guys dressed as rebel pilots, and the cardboard jango fett, that helped too, not to mention the appearance by Anthony `C3PO' Daniels and Rick `Da Man' McCallun, sure all these things were contributing factors, least not forget to mention the amazing Digital projection and the sound, all these things are fillers, gloss, a little nibble of bread before the roast dinner, and what a roast dinner my friends, what a roast dinner. From the moment the camera pans up instead of down after the opening crawl appears on screen, this movie feels different, we linger on shots, we flow with the crowds, I get to analyse the buildings as they beautiful cut threw the clouds, I admire them, my heart swells. I was so scared that I knew too much about this movie, id bought the graphic novel, read the script, read the SCRIPT, but nothing, nothing prepared me for the sheer joy and wonder I saw on that beautiful digitally projected movie screen. I loved every single digital frame of this movie, every single one, this movie is destined to be watched by me hundreds, no, thousands of times. Attack Of The Clones excelled in every single aspect I could every judge a movie on, storyStory, I loved it, I loved seeing the clones conception, I loved seeing what becomes of Anakin, how all these things are set in motion, how the Emperor will tempt and convert him, how OBI-WON will live on after death, all the clues are here. The Acting, this has seen the most criticism, and you what, I don't understand what people are talking about, even if, even IF, you thought the acting was bad, the whole love section of the story, its gone even before its started, its quick, its painless, and It didn't bother me at all. Hayden Christenson was so much better than I was expecting, There are two stand out moments for me in this movie, and both of them are the brilliance of John Williams mixed with acting I never thought I would get the pleasure of seeing in a Star Wars movie, the first, the moment Anakin looks down at what the tusken raiders have done to him, and looks up, the music starts, we know the s**t is going to hit the fan, and then BAM! Chaos. The second, Anakin's painfully poignant and haunting confession, over the top of the Imperial March theme, and you know, you know that mask is only another 4 hours away, and the worst part is, you can't wait. I'm not sure I actually have words for how fantastic that end battle is, but the seamless blend of CGI at last with live action is incredible, are those Clone Troopers Real/CGI? Do I care? Hell no, I was having too much fun, I loved the Obi Won/Anakin confrontation here, no one seems to be talking about it, by I was on the edge of my seat, I half expected Anakin to start waving a lightsabre in old Obi Won's direction, but no, Lucas is saving that for later, you big tease. And yes the Yoda fight scene, this prompted the loudest roar in a cinema I've heard, well ever, every fan knew it was coming and now, now it was time, now it was time to see the Master lay the smack down, and prove why he's at the head of that council.  As soon as Yoda force pulled his sabre out of his belt, everyone, and I mean EVERYONE around me was in geek spasms they were having TOO much fun, TOO much, and the moment Yoda picks up his walking stick at the end, after running rings round Dooku, fantastic, brilliant, comedic genius. This movie promised everything and delivered, I can't wait for Episode III, its going to be the longest three years of my life.

Author: andrewsdavidson
Review: I watched this movie having been told by someone I trust that it was almost as good as the first Star Wars (episode IV, not episode I).  I don't trust him any more.

Author: cloudofthought
Review: As many people are, I'm a big fan of the original trilogy.  Before waiting in line at midnight to see this movie I had read three reviews of AoTC, each pointing out how badly flawed this movie is.  So I just went in anticipating to see at least some good saber duels.  And those were delivered ... during the last 20-30 minutes of the movie.

Author: Captain_McCormick
Review: Before I went to see this movie two times, I was pretty certain that AOTC was destined to be the best in the Star Wars series, and I was right! I absolutely adore this movie. It has everything a Star Wars movie need: action, romance, suspense, a little humor, etc.. It was far superior than the TPM and it was well worth the wait, too. See it for yourself and I hope you'll enjoy this one as much as I did. Don't believe what all the critics are saying about AOTC, see it first, then decide for yourself if weather you liked it or not. Have fun! :)

Author: mbhaisten
Review_Title: The Star Wars saga just died for me tonight.
Review: [Contains one plot element that is not really a spoiler. It is a happy moment in an otherwise dismal experience.]

Author: dylanb-1
Review_Title: Impressive - they did it right this time
Review: This time Lucas and Co. bring back some of the feeling from the original series, and manage to get the pacing right.  This movie was just fun to watch from the opening frame to the last, and I am very disappointed with some of the official reviewers, who seem to be ultra-critical(looking for some of the mythological undertones of the originals I assume, and not looking deep enough, while simultaneously forgetting that movies are about entertainment and other forms of art, and don't necessarily have to fall on the same side of the tree as their predecessors).

Author: ebc1973
Review_Title: Star Wars is back on Track!!!
Review: Attack of the Clones puts Star Wars back on the Map!!!  I thoroughly enjoyed this film.  It is a very, visually stunning movie, and the plot moves along, smoother then any Star Wars movie to date.  While there may not be an acting performance worthy of an Academy Award, this does not hinder the movie one bit.  As with all Star Wars movies, there are bits in this movie that may get annoying at times, but there is so much more that makes you forget these small flaws.

Author: or3ital
Review_Title: This is what we were waiting for
Review: This is not just a movie many fans of Star Wars have been waiting for since Episode I, no, this movie might just be everything you could ask for in a movie in this genre. Those of you who liked the prequel to this, there are no doubts that you will love this one.

Author: mirrorsh
Review_Title: Didn't think anything could be WORSE than Phantom Menace...
Review: I didn't think it was possible.  I seriously, literally, did not think it could be possible to make a movie more horrendously atrocious than Phantom Menace.  And yet, against ALL ODDS, George manages to do this.  Now don't get me wrong, there are plenty of INDIVIDUAL scenes that are incredible. In isolation they would be worth watching over and over.  But the movie as a whole, the manner in which we go from one scene to the next (as well as the entire love "story") is complete and utter trash.

Author: bunky_bunk
Review: I saw Ep2 at midnight on film then saw it today at a theater with digital projection.  Holy cow!  What a huge difference.  The sound and clarity was unbelievable.

Author: geofarl
Review: Episode II - I saw - on the second day after the release.  A midnight showing - it was.  All right, enough of Yoda speak with the direct object before the subject.  I must admit that Yoda was the best part of this movie. However, if there was a person in the audience who knew nothing of the Star Wars series the he/she would think this was a comedy.  During the most serious scenes, the very partisan and loyal audience that I sat with laughed uncontrollably.  The first hour and a half is really, really bad.  The rest is okay with the last scene making it a little respectable.

Author: macwelsh007
Review: i know everyone was dying for AOTC to be good after the last load of crap that Lucas dumped on us, but there's no need to lie to ourselves or to anybody else. it sucked. i'll admit that it was better than the Phantom Menece, but is that really saying much? the acting was the worse thing this side of Keanu Reeves. literally, everytime that Christensen kid opened his mouth i cringed. Portman, as lovely as she is, didn't do much better. Ewan McGregor did his best Alec Guinness impression, but they all seemed lost acting in front of a blue screen. acting has never been a strong point for Star Wars films, but it has hit a new low this time. i'm not even going to get into the terrible script. i wish Lucas had done what he did for Empire and let someone else handle all the real film making work. he's obviously more focused on "dazzleing" special effects. but to me they were about as dazzleing as watching my lame room mate playing video games on a friday night. maybe i'm old fashioned, but i miss the old days of puppets and creative makeup. they seemed much more realistic. as far as technology has come, alot of the scenes stilled seemed about as real as Mary Poppins dancing with cartoon penguins. i could whine all night about this and that, but what good would it do. yes, i'll be there when the next one comes out on opening night just like i was this time. but untill then i'll be watching the origanal three movies to try to reclaim what's left of my childhood after seeing the last two.

Author: seancasey
Review: Lucas somewhat redeemed himself for Episode I.  II, for me at least, was very entertaining and advanced the story of the jedi to bring us back to 'A New Hope'.  Saber battles rocked, and Jar-Jar's role was significantly reduced.  All around, Good Stuff.

Author: Anjelfly
Review_Title: Attack of the Clowns is more like it...
Review: As an avid Stars Wars fan since I was first introduced to the franchise at age three, I, must sadly say, I was horribly disappointed once again in "Attack of the Clones".  The anticipation was killing me... the trailers were impeccable.  I consoled my deepest fears by telling myself... `It can't be worse than 'Phantom Menace' can it?'  While scene to scene, `Clones' was much more visibly exciting than Phantom... there was no more substance. Some where between 1977 and 2002, Lucas forgot that in an epic story... THERE NEEDS TO BE A FREAKIN' STORY!!!  I tried really hard to follow the muddy plot, but alas I was not successful. and I'm a David Lynch fan! Yes, this is as expected a visual masterpiece. The costumes and digital effects were spectacular, and so was the acting... spectacularly awful that is.  Now... don't get me wrong... I don't expect Oscar winning performances from this epic sci-fi franchise (although LOTR: Fellowship of the Ring was acted astonishingly well), but Lucas's now obviously inferior performance as a director has lowered these actors' Oscar caliber talent to a mere line readings by 7th graders.  By this, I would like to note I'm referring to your average 7th grader, not a Haley Joel or any prodigy of that sort.

Author: andrealphus44
Review: I wasn't expecting anything from Star Wars after Phantom Menace. However Lucas did a god job with attack of the Clones. The movie is definetly darker than EpisodeI . Although Haygen wasn't a good choice as Anakin Skywalker the movie was still watchable .The cinematography was amazing for Star Wars . The fight scenes were original and the plot was solid . And Yoda Ruled :))

Author: Gormley0824
Review: First, let me say that i enjoyed Episode 1 (yes i was the one). Though it wasn't as great as 4 or 5 and at times it was childish, it was still incredibly entertaining. Episode 2 delivers the excitement of 1, but comes across as much more complex and an overall better film.

Author: buzzingstar
Review: I have just been to the midnight screening of ATOTC and left with a very strange feeling. I was sat one row from the front and I think it ruined the movie for me, or was it the movie that ruined it for me.  I need to go again but at this moment Episode 1 is more memorable for me (maybe for the wrong reasons).

Author: britesparc
Review_Title: The best Star Wars film ever
Review: Depending on your point of view, Attack of the Clones must either be the best Star Wars film ever, or the second best after The Empire Strikes Back.

Author: boesejose
Review: Who thought that "Episode 1" might be a disaster, have to see "Episode 2". It's one of the worst movies I've ever seen. The script is chaotic and boring, the dialogues are clumsy, Ewan McGregor, Nathalie Portman and Samuel L. Jackson haven't been worse in their whole lifetime. The special-effects are superabundant. And George Lucas attends his own legend to the grave. Guess what N-Sync-lookalike Hayden Christensen turns out to be a stroke of luck.

Author: nerd_hour
Review: I will start off by saying that I hate giving this movie a one since it deserves so much less but whatever, if i must. Now, this is my least favorite movie, the dialogue is nonexistent, the characters are literally just cardboard other than Ewan McGregor giving a decent performance with the trash basket of a "script" he was given, and the movie looks and is paced so bad that I physically cannot finish it (I constantly forget there is a fight with Count Dooku because I turn it off after that garbage factory scene). There really isn't much else to say other than "oh god just don't watch it, for the love of god just do not put yourself through the anal tearage of a movie that Attack of the Garbage is."

Author: homersimpson_esq
Review: After the Phantom Menace, many felt that Star Wars could only get better, and waited for Episode II expectantly, but with trepidation.

Author: badgerman
Review: After Episode I my only wish was to be a 7 year old boy (right about the age I was when I first saw Ep. 4 in 1977) just long enough to watch the movie and enjoy as it was meant to be enjoyed. I loved the movie the way you would an ugly sister, because you feel like you have to. With that in mind I went into Episode II with a lot of hope and a lot of apprehension as well. Would Lucas save himself from the shame of Episode I. Well, the good news is George Lucas can live.

Author: Vol Chic
Review: Before I went to see this movie I really didn't know what to expect. After seeing Episode I, I was a bit disappointed.  I felt that the movie wasn't what it was hyped up to be, and I didn't like that Jar Jar Binks was one of the leads in Episode I.  I was satisfied to see that he was in Episode II, but had very little to say.  I was totally amazed amazed in Yoda's ability.... you have to see what that little green guy can do.    It was also nice to see Natalie Portman/Senator Padméé Amidala have a bigger role in this Episode.  Her ability to act has grown since Episode I..... I give her 2 thumbs up.  Ewan McGregor and the very talented Hayden Christensen also did a great job at bringing this movie to life.  Now I can't wait to see what George Lucas and Jonathan Hales have in store for us in 2005.   I give it an 8.5 out of 10.

Author: stp918e
Review_Title: Lucas needs help writing and directing
Review: Dialogue was weak, unintriguing and lacked wit.  Story was slow and the love story was hokey.  Flat performances from Actors that have done well in other films. Casting seems to be an issue. Weak Characters can't bring any life to the film. Just a disappointing film all around. There is noticeable drop off between episodes 4, 5,6 and episodes 1 and 2

Author: the_mascara_snake
Review: I went to see Star Wars Episode 2 expecting it to be bad after the horror of Jar Jar Binks and crew displayed in Episode 1.  I got exactly that. This film has to have one of the worst scripts imaginable at times the dialogue was so bad that I genuinely felt embarrassed on behalf of Mr.Lucas.  Don't get me wrong I was a huge fan of the first 3 films they are true classics and the prequels could have been superb, there are many good ideas in them and they do have there moments e.g the fight with Dath Maul in Episode 1 and The Storm Troopers (Clones) in the dust on this outing.

Author: adamcarpenter73
Review: CGI Killed this movie. It lacked any kind of physical presence. The models and puppets of the original movies may be more cumbersome and time consuming, but at least they are physical matter, and they look a lot more realistic than the digitised backgrounds and characters in AOTC. This movie is basically an animation with a few humans here and there. Terrible dialogue, and moments of terrible acting. The original films had a great lived in look that was very believable. As CGI takes over more and more, these kind of films will drift further and further from any kind of physicality and realism until they won't bother with actors or human emotion at all. Also, George Lucas obviously has vision and an amazingly creative mind, but the man needs a director to give shape to his ideas. Look how good Empire turned out with Ivin Kreshner at the helm. George please let somebody else direct Episode 3. Overall I give this film 1/10

Author: asec31
Review: Apparently most of the future aircars have damaged mufflers. It is a little bit hard to see why the republic wouldn't do anything against the use of two stroke engines in their crowded airspace. The filmmakers clearly haven't spent as much thought on sound as they have on computer graphics. Secondly, where did they get this anakin from? For a supposed jedi prodigy (even considering his inclination to evil), his whole manners and dialog are simply to blunt. CGI would work much better if it were hold together by a coherent logical story and characters.

Author: i96clajo
Review: I must admit I was a bit disappointed after the first part of the film. But the last one and a half hour made up for that and then some!! I just love what they have done with yoda, the way that little "man" move is the most impressive i ever seen on film.

Author: DS3000Z
Review: This film has some of the best special effects since The Matrix but this alone cannot make a film. Lucas seems to want to make us see the loving side of Skywalker but unforunately these scenes are quite awful especially the one with the two rolling around in a field - this is meant to be Star Wars where are the light sabres. In the end they did make a superb appearance with possibly the Star Wars fight EVER yes EVER it is Yodas fight with Count Dooke. When the script failed a joke was stuck in some worked others didn't. As usual Ewan McGregor was very good with Samuel L Jackson proving again that he is one of the best actors around. In the end i looked at my watch to notice just how quickly the mega 150 minutes had gone by only then to think what has actually happened no much the answer! but then again it is Star Wars!

Author: daggerz-1
Review_Title: Be honest people or broaden your minds!
Review: While this movie does not come close to the atrocities of such movies as Manos, the Hands of Fate it is sorely lacking from anything brilliant or even the quality of the original Star Wars which was not perfect by any means.

Author: chrischene
Review_Title: Disappointed with the actors & the 1st half of the movie
Review: I'd been looking forward for this movie and the least i can say is that it's been disappointing.I hear people say this is the real return of Star Wars,that episode 1 wasn't very good,but for me,it was better than this one.Let's start with the good stuff:the story is really getting somewhere,we start to understand where the next episodes come from(why Anakin became Darth Vador,what the supreme chancellor plans are...),and the suspense at the end is good,which makes us wanna see episode 3.Now with the negative:the acting is really bad.Christensen doesn't seem to know what he's supposed to do:am I a good or a bad guy?Portman is more of a princess than a fighter and it shows during the big battle(even htough she is really sexy).Their love story is sometimes really ridiculous.Overall,the movie really starts after its 1st half when the talking is over and the action really begins(what's the point with the murder attempts on Padmé's life).Anyway,I'm now looking forward for the next episode:let's hope the acting will be better and the romance won't be so absurd...

Author: ben2550
Review: This movie was awful.  The acting was awful, the photography was awful, the script was awful, and even the action scenes were awful.  This was by far the most disappointing movie of the year.  If you are in the mood to watch something with acting as bad as "Showgirls" - this is your flick.  If you are wanting something that is well acted, written, and produced, watch Empire Strikes Back.  This is a great example of how too much focus on the technological aspects of a film can make you forget that the story is what is most important.  No matter how pretty the cover of the book is, it's the words inside that make it interesting.  Don't waste your time or money on seeing this.  I wish somebody would have persuaded me not to go.

Author: youzhibide
Review: The transformation of Anakin Skywalker from the previous episode is astonishing. This Anakin Skywalker neither reminds me the little Anakin's innocence nor does he possess any quality that can be find in Darth Vader from the first trilogy. From the first appearance, he looked arrogant, disrespectful, and annoying, which continued throughout the film.

Author: h_harker
Review_Title: Totally new generation Star Wars film, makes unbelievable viewing
Review: Great Film Sir George Lucas, Thankyou.

Author: dub_moth
