Review: this film is clearly the worst example of the kinds of trash perpetrated on a cinema audience. this is THE worst film i've ever seen offered at commercial cinema complexes. it pushes the boundaries of 'narrative' cinema in as far a negative view as i would ever care to inflict upon another human being. why? it is boring. i question whether those who were involved in the making of this film know what scripting means.  i doubt the aims and or intentions of those involved in the making of this film as anything other than to make as much money as possible from as many people as possible. cinema as spectacle has a very lengthy tradition that is occasionally predicated on quality (witness the first three 'star wars' films) but more often on trash. this is expensive trash posturing as expansive on a series of 'deep' ideas/ideals it has no interest in developing or revealing in even the most remotely clear way. modern mythmaking? only in so far as the processes of 'filmmaking', 'scriptwriting', 'characterisation' or 'respect for one's audience' is concerned. peter jackson has issued a a series of films that mark Lucas' work as that of cinematic amoeba. mr lucas, you ought to be ashamed; friends of mine have produced work with NO budget that work so much better than this tripe.

Author: flinn-1
Review: (this mentions an important , although not surprising, appearance of a major character late in the film, although it doesn't give away what happens) The first 20-25 minutes of the "love story" were soooo painful. Hard to know whether to fault the actors or simply bad writing. BUT... it definitely picked up, and actually had a Parisian audience applauding by the time Yoda steals the show.  So just bear with it, especially if you are a Yoda fan. (also problems that plagued the Phantom Menace in terms of suspicious accents continues to be a problem, although perhaps slightly less glaringly so.)

Author: Librarychica
Review: Really, this movie was terrible.  The actors weren't even allowed to be crass and annoying in their bad acting like they were in 4, 5, and 6. This time out it was flat, stale, emotionless acting.  What's the point of hiring good actors if you're going to make them act like cardboard?  The cool effects couldn't make up for this snore.  My husband fast-forwarded through the lame romance sequences, while I started cleaning the house.  And I sat through Jurassic Park III, people!  That's a movie I thought I'd never want to watch, but it was a masterpiece compared to this. What a bummer that George Lucas can't direct actors at all.  He should just computer animate them as well.

Author: gwoman
Review_Title: A mild improvement on Episode 1, but still a pale shadow of it's predecessors
Review: CGI reigns supreme, at the expense of compelling character development, laudable dialogue and exuberant performance - all of which made the original Star Wars trilogy a noteworthy, and immensely entertaining cinema experience.  The audience is so distanced from the characters in Episode 2 that we don't care about their fate when a halfway decent action sequence, that places them in peril, presents itself.  Alas,  the newest addition to the "saga" is unengaging, "pretty" and not alot else.  Lucas and co. need to understand that technical proficiency does not a good movie make, and return to their roots as tellers of fantastical space tales populated by vital characters that you wanted to be, or be with.  Somewhere between picture book and computer game, Episode 2 is not abysmal - just...sad.

Author: pseudolynch
Review: I just got back from a midnight screening of Clones and have to say that it was enjoyable from start to finish. I think any Star Wars fan will be happy with the outcome of this movie. George Lucas did a great job on this one: Jar Jar is pretty nonexistent, Padme wears some sexy outfits, and Yoda is well... Go see for yourself.

Author: jazztunes
Review: Uninspired acting.  Slow plot.  See it, but only once.

Author: rmonares
Review: This has to be the most ridiculous love story I have ever seen. The little boy with a crush on the big girl. Instead of the circumstances getting them together, it was just a horny kid looking at smooth and soft skin. "Don't look at me like that". Wow, how deep. As for the visual effects, they simply are impressive. The battle between tha clones and the droid army is spectacular. Also the Yoda and Dooku duel is amazing. Overall, a better Star Wars than Phantom Menace. But way far from the quality and mystique of Empire Strikes Back.

Author: achurch
Review_Title: The best SW movie ever made
Review: I just finished watching the movie and all I have to say is: WOW.  Although I enjoyed TPM, this movie does away with almost all of the bad things from the first movie and the rest is just unbelievable.  All Star Wars hype aside, this is one of the best action movies I've ever seen, and the love story between Padme Amidala and Anakin Skywalker brings in another entirely different part of the movie to the masses.  There is plenty for both men and women to enjoy, young and old.

Author: w_geoff_martin
Review: Attack of the Clones is a good movie.  All of the critics who have reconsidered (justifiably) their past positive reviews of Phantom Menace are taking it out on Episode II.

Author: marcbergman
Review: As a Star Wars fan, I was looking forward to this film.  Unlike others, I liked the Phantom Menace and thought that it was good beginning at explaining episodes 3-6.  However, I walked out of AOTC very disappointed.

Author: talasonic
Review: I thought this movie was passable in the theater, but wasn't planning on seeing it again any time soon.  My friend rented it recently, and I watched it for a second time with him.  About half-way through, I decided that I never wanted to see the movie again.

Author: valtr0n
Review_Title: A wonderful return to the elements that made the originals great!
Review: Regardless of the disappointment of Episode 1, I found myself standing in line for 3 hours on Wednesday afternoon, in the blazing hot sun, in eager anticipation of the midnight showing.  I had mixed feelings about it as the time finally came to enter the theater, but once the film began, those all disappeared. It took a while for the action to get really worthwhile, but in the meantime the story is filled with plot developed as skillfully as the original trilogy, with plenty of references to future events which the audience already has knowledge of, and C3P0 is once again the comedic humor, replacing the much-despised Jar Jar Binks, who has much less screen time this time around (maybe about 5 minutes, total). Even if you don't like the plot, and you don't like the movie, the last hour of the movie is worth watching just because it's one of the most incredible things you will ever see in a movie.  The final showdown, from when Anakin, Obi-Wan, and Padme are prisoners up to the final lightsaber duel are some of the best moments in cinematic history, with the true epic feeling of the original trilogy being brought back in full force (no pun intended).  Samuel L. Jackson does a wonderful job along with Hayden, McGregor, and Portman, as does Christopher Lee, who portrays the evil Lord Tyranus perfectly. One final thing that I loved, was the fact that he gets away, unlike the villainous Darth Maul in Episode 1.  It's nice to have something to look forward to in the next one (the inevitable showdown with Lord Tyranus). All in all, if you were disappointed by Episode 1, you should go see this at least.  It will restore your faith in George Lucas' ability to entertain and listen to his fans, and believe you me,  you'll be thoroughly entertained for the whole 2 hours and 15 minutes that the movie runs.

Author: sibod
Review_Title: Excellent movie, big improvement over Phantommenace, ups the ante.
Review: Anyone expecting their life to change after seeing this will be bitterly disappointed, and that goes for the minority of huge fanboys out there that beleive that A New Hope was the second coming.

Author: ronbamberg
Review: Taken as a stand-alone piece of filmmaking, Attack of the Clones is good, but definitely not great. However, as part of the growing saga of Lucas' universe, the film succeeds wonderfully. While Clones leaves open as many questions as it answers, the viewer's understanding of the world(s) of Star Wars is greatly enhanced. And, despite some critics' comments to the contrary, McGregor, Portman and Christensen all perform well.

Author: agento101
Review: Star Wars is my life.  I have ate, slept, breathed and dreamed about Star Wars for the better part of my 26 years.  I have grown so attached to this piece of cinematic genius over the years it's hard for me to separate Galaxy from Reality sometimes.  When I was 13 years old or so My father took me to see Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade, while we were there he mentioned to me that "They" were making a movie about Darth Vader before he went bad, when he was still a kid.  That day set into motion nearly a decade of anxiety and anticipation to the likes never imagined before my mortal man.

Author: Stephan_Wi
Review: I guess I won't find enough words to describe my emotions, but after viewing the movie yesterday I was just as excited as I was 20 years ago.

Author: conelli-1
Review: I'd rate this film 11. Lucas proves himself as a great writer and director. This film has such a brilliant story, it makes you even forget all the negative criticism on ep 1.The plot shows the birth of Palpatine's career as a dictator and Anakins first steps to the Dark Side. And among this great action, a wonderful tragic-romantic love story, brilliant computer animation, a fistful of new planet and eventually Yoda in action.

Author: SvavarMuzak
Review_Title: A redeeming and strong chapter in an epic adventure
Review: I just saw the movie at a pre-screening in Iceland... well, I can only say that George Lucas has totally redeemed himself in my eyes. Although the movie takes a bit of a slow start, it is really captivating and delivers in a fulfilling and clever manner. The only problem I encountered is a scene in the middle of the movie whose only point seems to be to prepare for the video game... Otherwise The Movie Rocked! Go! Go! Go!

Author: jazzygirl
Review: After a pretty dismal Episode I, Episode II comes as an extremely pleasant surprise. George Lucas has done a fantastic job with "Attack of the Clones". The story is  full of those successful elements which makes a good story - heart pumping action shots (great light sabre fights!), well developed characters, great themes, and a lovely musical score which ties in themes from previous and "future" Episodes.

Author: go_kula
Review_Title: Great piece of cinema: fun, exciting and emotional
Review: I loved this movie.  I dig all the Star Wars movies, because they capture so much of what is and always has been right about epic films.  The series has also managed to hold the same aura about it since 1977, and still draws huge crowds generations after the original's release.  That itself is amazingly impressive.

Author: inspiredbsmith
Review_Title: Maybe The Best Science Fiction Film Ever Produced!
Review: I have seen all of the Star Wars movies out and by far this episode is the best.  The production was a work of art & the fight scenes where the best yet.  You have to check out Master Jedi Yoda fighting with a light saber to understand what I am referring to.  Overall this was a great movie, my wife even loved it.  If you have not seen it then make plans to watch it!

Author: gemada
Review_Title: atrocious writing and acting strikes again
Review: need i say more. maybe it was the awful writing or maybe it was just plain bad acting. the film's only saving grace was the battle scene at the end. Could the chase at the beginning been any longer or more unnecessarily pointless? What happened to Natalie Portman's british accent and "proper" speech patterns from episode I? Now she's talking like a teenager from texas.

Author: z0va
Review: It was a really good movie. It is worth the money to go and see it! i want to see Episode 3 now! :) I think about to go and see it again.

Author: thetrashpile
Review_Title: Possibly the finest movie of all time
Review: ok...now that I have your attention...

Author: lyutan
Review: I'm a Star Wars fan. I've seen all four previous films for the nth time (yes, even that dreaded Phantom Menace)... and what I can say about Attack of the Clones is it's a fun and enjoyable ride and I will definitely watch it again.

Author: rlabuzz
Review: One can only imagine who would want to waste time or money on this piece of crapola.  Who are the people praising this movie? Losers who can fall into any underdeveloped, poor scripted, and horrible acted movies.  This movie went back and forth from a completely uninteresting, unbelievable, stomach sicking something of a non-connecting love story to a over the top pile of computer generated garbage.  Lucas relied entirely to much on overwhelming the audience with special effects that it actually took away from the movie.  Because for all that have seen it know the script and acting didn't keep us glued to our seats.  I think I actually looked at watch more times than the movie made its transitions from romance(whatever) to bland characters.  Nothing was left to the imagination.  No antagonist in this movie, unless you were supposed to really hate Hayden Christinsen for his acting. And poor Samuel Jackson.  Leave it to Lucas to even make him particularly boring.  I don't even want to waste any more of my time writing this.  In ending--- pig vomit I'd rather watched a goat rodeo........................

Author: turboteen77
Review: With the myriad of terrible things you could point out from this movie the thing that stands out the most for me is the terrible character development of Anakin Skywalker. I don't know if it is a result of bad acting or bad direction but Anakin never seems to be truly good nor a friend of Obi-Wan's. I found this a little disturbing because in the OTC Obi-wan points out that Anakin was a good man and friend. For me I think what would have remotely helped this film would be to show Anakin as good person with a bad temper. I think a lot of us know people like that. People who are in essence good but have conflicting emotions and inner battles that causes them to do impulsive things. Anakin in this movie does a lot of impulsive things but without any trace of good character. Overall he just appears as the wannabe bad boy of a boy band.

Author: intr0vert
Review: Star Wars isn't to judge as most cinema. it is its own category and style. dont compare it to other movies outside of the series. Episode II was brilliant, beautiful, and light years ahead of the rest. i cried for the last 20-30 minutes of this film. it was that beautiful. George Lucas has done such a wonderful job creating a universe that you can't help but want to live in. its a 10.

Author: MichaelColeFan
Review: What a romp! An amazing peice of film making! The most incredible StarWars yet: Lee, Jackson and Yoda with a pointed stick! This film is quite literally a dream! Justifying any degree of misdeamenour committed by the first film...in spades! Kind regards,

Author: Aule
Review: Awesome, spectacular, fantastic! The special effects were breathtaking and the fight scenes were incredible! And now for the other two thirds of the movie.

Author: stanleyfilms
Review: if i preferred this film over the last installment, it would be merely because of its darker leanings.  the transitions between both stories was a bit jarring (watch "empire" to see how much more of a flow it has).  and the romance was very forced.  i found the action sequences to be too busy and noisy, preferring the essence of suspense over spectacle displayed in the first two star wars films.  yoda fighting might've been cool on a visceral level, but was it necessary?  in the end, does it take away the mystery that is part of yoda's charm?  overall, i find lucas' new direction for his saga to lack the majesty and enchantment of the original series.  it's a shame really.  but i can't be too upset.  afterall, the original three are good movies, not great ones like the mass public would like to think.  the first three have lasted this long and have made such an impact on our generation simply because we saw it as children and now they contain a certain nostalgia, something the new movies would never be able to compete with. but compared to the action films of kurosawa (who was a large inspiration for lucas), the star wars films lack the brilliance, insight, and - yes - imagination needed to be a true masterpiece.

Author: jankoviky
Review: Im bad like the movie attack of the clones........

Author: rex_mcd
Review: Lucas must have listened to input on Phantom Menace.

Author: jamesdeanmartin
Review: Went to see Episode II last night at 11:45 PM. Theatre was pretty full, although not at capacity. Unlike with Episode I, there was no spontaneous pop when the lights went out, or when the Star Wars theme started. Sort of an ennui seems to have set in after the first film.

Author: davehoustonmusic
Review: In nearly all the reviews of "Clones" seen thus far---from reviewers both professional and amateur, and reviews both scathing and exalting---people seem to take great delight in excoriating its predecessor, "The Phantom Menace". The opportunity to verbally eviscerate Jar Jar Binks is reveled in by most. One could very easily forget that the latter film set and held box-office records which were only broken recently. (Am I to believe that NONE of these 'Phantom'-bashers were among the millions of repeat viewers or DVD consumers? Allow me to scoff, please.)

Author: jnavarro
Review: I am an avowed fan of the original Star Wars trilogy. I watched them a thousand times, I bought the merchandise, I loved the characters. I don't understand why the two movies of the new trilogy have not affected me as much. They had too much of the techno stuff, and not enough heart. Even in Episode 2, where Anakin and Padme fall in love, I did not was as enthralled as when Han Solo and Princess Leia did. I hope the third movie will bring my faith back in the force.

Author: Laughton Kilcoyne
Review: Like many Star Wars fans I was deeply disappointed with The Phantom Menace. However, Attack of the Clones has completely restored my faith in the series.  AoTC is a darker, more complex tale than its predecessor.  This installment provides Star Wars fans with what we want to see -- action. Anakin (Hayden Christianson) and Obi-Wan's (Ewan McGreghor) exploits are on

Author: paulfrederikson
Review: Minor spoilers contained within...

Author: kcharles
Review: I have one thing to say, I will personally take on anyone who dares to knock this film. I will be kickin' it Yoda style on their ass. And for the record, wooden acting and bad dialogue is an intrinsic part of the Star Wars universe, so stop acting so shocked that you didn't get Shakesperian delivery.

Author: pretzel62
Review: Attack of the Clones is everything Lucas Film promised and more.  The movie has the most tenacious action sequences of any other Star Wars film, and is rewarding to the patient audience who knows that a spectacular ending is near.  AOTC is a teaser for Episode III to come and leaves the audience feeling empty, as did Empire Strikes Back in the original trilogy.  There is a class and sophistication that reemerges is Episode II because of the contribution that Christopher Lee makes to this feature, similar to contribution that Alec Guinness made in Episode IV, V, and VI.  The love aspect of the movie is fair, but troublesome because we know what is to come of Anakin.  Do not miss this movie, even if you have never seen Star Wars before.  This movie will expect a prior knowledge to the Star Wars universe, but seeing this movie will make you want to jump back into your childhood as the story unfolds and the actions sequences emerge.  This movie's contribution to the strength of the Star Wars saga is immeasurable.  Also, I loved Spiderman, but AOTC makes Spidy look elementary.

Author: crovax2623
Review: This movie was so intense, and over the top it brought George Lucas back into a positive eye for me. After he dissapointed almost everyone that saw The first prequil, I thought this would also be dissapointing. He brought us as far as modern cinema can take us, while still having enough suspence to keep us dying for what is next. In this movie he had incredible action sequiences, but still had a strong story as a base. Compared to Episode 1 the acting was top notch. It shows the story we have all put pieces of together in our minds from the bits and pieces that he gave us in the original trilogy. The directoral style includes all the transitions we loved from the Original three, while making it way more of an epic movie. The story flows and tells us that this is not a movie that can only be enjoyed by our kid brother and sister. Everything about this movie is so fulfiling, and perfect that all i want is Episode Three. Plus there is only three minutes of Jar Jar. I will wait for Episode 3, but not get my hopes up, just cause this one is good, doesent mean the next will. Lucas just do what you did with this one and we will all love it.

Author: maverick9390
Review: I was fortunate enough to attend the screening of Episode II over the weekend at Lucas' charity event in San Francisco. In my opinion, this is the best episode yet. Attack of the Clones is packed with action from start to finish and finally displays the true might of the Jedi Order in their age of power. The love story provides more depth to the Star Wars storyline than fans could have anticipated and the backgrounds of many secondary characters are fleshed out in more detail, helping to bridge the gap between the original trilogy and the prequels. Brought to us in digital form, Lucas' latest masterpiece is visually and audibly stunning in every detail and lives up to the hopes of Star Wars fans everywhere. The wait was definitely worth it!

Author: Jerec5502
Review_Title: It was so worth calling in sick!
Review: This movie was awesome.  The lightsaber battles, the chases.  It had everything i could've asked for.  I've been a Star Wars fan for as long as i can remember, and it just keeps getting better and better.  The thing about Clones is that it starts to show the history of where everything in the original movies came from.  It shows primitive star destroyers, and answers some burning questions Star Wars fans might have. Overall it was worth calling in sick to see Episode 2.  I went to the first show in the area, and it was packed.(I hope it breaks Spider-man's record)  The only complaint i have is that we have to wait until 2005 for Episode 3.

Author: johnkingjk
Review: This movie just stinks. From the creepy early scenes between Christensen and Portman, to the corny and out of place humour during fight sequences, this terrible movie was summed up best by my 9 year old son, who is watching the entire series for the first time: "This is sooo cringey."

Author: stoicrhetoric
Review_Title: horrible dialogue, excellent eye candy. the last third of the movie saves it.
Review: hayden christiansen does not project the power and confidence that skywalker should have. his lines are delivered without conviction and his timing for delivery is unnatural. the love story that unfolds is like those bad 'after school specials', it makes you want to turn away and cover your ears.

Author: anjanaamin
Review: First of all i would like to tell all the viewers that ,JUST GO and WATCH it like a normal movie. Please don't watch the movie for finding mistakes.Critics (who are basically fools) will keep on murmuring but the truth is that , anyone can point out mistakes in any movie.

Author: todd_theisen
Review: I had heard mixed reviews on this film. Many said that the acting was bad, that the love story is annoying and that the film was generally not a worthy prequel. I have to disagree. First of all, everyone seems to have forgotten that the acting in the first star wars films was not always top notch. But, bad acting added to its character somehow. I think that the acting in Episode II is perfect for the type of film it is, it adds character. All of you love story critics out there, are you forgetting the love story in the original three. I bet you even liked it, admit it! It is absolutely necessary in this story in order to show one of the forces pulling Annikin off track. In the original three episodes the love story was basically superfluous, so why complain about this one? It is essential to go into this film with an open mind. Forget about the magic of the original films, and forget about the disappointment of episode I and you will have a great time.

Author: NicApicella
Review_Title: Loads of action and romance - a packing movie for everyone
Review: With Episode 2, Lucas sets a new milestone in his Star Wars saga. You could say love plays a major role in this movie and thus, the movie is action packed at the same time. Anakin Skywalker has to fight with too many problems at once, revealing his strength as well as the fact he indeed has still a lot to learn. Senator Amidala is Overwhelmed by her love for Anakin, but does not reveal it until she thinks it is too late. And coming towards the end, finally all the Jedis set up a great fight together...with Yoda showing all his talent. A great deal of emotions are evoked throughout the movie, supported greatly by the magnificent special effect and by the always coherent touch of George Lucas, who does not betray himself.

Author: Slackerking
Review_Title: True to the Galaxy, Not to Our Perspective
Review: In Episode I we caught a glimpse of the world that Lucas had envisioned when he created this dream universe.  However seeing this world the way he wanted brought to many a feeling of unrest and even sadness, maybe a longing for the times when movies had that raw dirty feel to them.  It was released and even though the acting wasn't horrendus, the movie was not accepted.  But, Lucas being the genius that he is, was merely introducing you to the galaxy with Episode I.  In Episode II he reaches his stride and proves that he is not the same horrible Director we saw in Episode I, no he is in fact the creator of yet another phenomenol chapter in this never-ending galaxy of adventure.  Episode II fulfills all expectations and then some, it mixes that clean sence of humor remeniscent of the original trilogy with a wonderful drama.  The movie is well scripted and the young cast carries the movie exceptionally well.  All in all this movie fits nicely into the series and with the Special Edition releases Lucas created in the late 90's there is virtually no continuety errors.  So sit back, order a pizza, and enjoy this movie with your family . . . as soon as it hits video stores.

Author: Zrinak
Review: I have seen the Episode Two on its premiere night in Zagreb, Croatia. Apart from it being organized as a very exciting event, I was disappointed. The new prequel of the Star Wars saga lacks in many things that would make a good movie; good story, good acting and good dialogues. Yes, special effects are great. Yes, the movie is almost perfect _visually_, but other than that...

Author: bmlw2
Review_Title: Great movie, but still not up to par in my opinion.
Review: George Lucas is a creative genius. He has the incredible ability to visualize and animate a whole other universe and place one of the most compelling stories of all time into that breathtaking setting. What Lucas is not as skilled at, however, is writing. This movie suffered from one of the same problems that plagued "Phantom Menace", lack of a script that does justice to Lucas' imaginative fluency. Nevertheless, I still enjoyed "Attack of the Clones," very much and place it third on the list of the best Star Wars films with "Empire" and the origional 1977 film ahead just because of the strength of the story and it's visual effects. But if Lucas could find someone to write a script that incorporated a witty, sharp diologue that featured a less blatent, robotic, cliche filled, romantic relationship such as in "Attack" (a-la Han and Leia in "Empire") this film and episode 3 would benefit greatly.

Author: LeeWebs
Review_Title: Shut up fools(bad reviews) and rejoice in the fun
Review: I had a blast....was well done. The love scenes were wonderful thanks to the internet morons who made me think they were going to be SOSOSOSO bad. With the expectations so low...it made them seem just fine to me.

Author: lil_mike43
Review_Title: Better than what some might lead to believe...
Review: Before I start, may I just point out to those who have blasted this film repeatedly to hear me out.

Author: xdiso
Review: Much better than the Phantom Menace, but still could have been better.  A little slow in the middle, but a solid 7 none-the-less.  I saw it at 12:15 am on the 16th and at some points I struggled to stay awake (my girlfriend fell asleep after the first 45 minutes).  Great ending, but the rest was decent at best.

Author: matt-westcott
Review: Ok, some people may not like it... But there are always people like that. Some people say they don't like the film focusing on one story then going to the next over and over, but thats how film scripts are meant to be written. Some people hated the love story, but it was necessary for the story line. I don't think George Lucas even would have enjoyed writing it.  The start of the film starts strong, then drops off and builds the tension up to the final fight.  Films are meant to be written like that though, think of every film you've seen before (introduction, complication, resolution).

Author: junkybenny
Review: Attack of the Clones is much better than the Phantom Menace.  First of all, Annacin is a great character.  The kid, I forget his name did a great job. I think he was the dynamic character that Episode I was missing.  Also, Jar Jar is only in it for a couple of minutes, if that.  Third, everything is beginning to wrap , which is really cool.  Fourth, Yoda kicks ass.  Fifth, Natalie Portman is amazing.

Author: cbird
Review_Title: Star Wars Episode II needs A New Hope
Review: George Lucas has always had a style of intercutting various places and making it come together in the end, but this is all over the place. Unlike other Star Wars movies where there is a planet to start on, a space sequence and another planet, Episode II takes the viewer too many places many of which are not exciting at all.  I know Lucas had to establish the connection between Aanikin and Padme more in this episode but it seems like over a third of the movie is simply exbisition.    As a result, this is unfortuantly not the summer blockbuster that it was made out to be.  The love story really slows down the action part of the story and looses the attention of the die hard fans quickly.  And people new to the series can forget about easily following the plot.  In all, there are only two memorable scenes in the entire movie, R2D2 flying and Yoda kicking ass. There are messy editing techniques in the Gladiator scene where ObiWan and Anakin suddenly get lightsabers after losing them earlier, and the role of Jango Fett is not described nearly well enough.  I am glad to see that Jar-Jar has been given a much smaller role than his previous in Phantom and that the classic comedy comes from the R2D2 and C3PO characters again. However the stupidity in Jar Jar comes through too much still as he makes one of the biggest mistakes in the galaxy as a senator.  Overall, if you didn't like Phantom chances are that you probably won't be crazy about Attack of the Clones.  As a huge fan of the original trilogy it hurts to say that I would rather see Spider-man again rather than sit through this once more.

Author: kiddolemite
Review: This film is EASILY the best of an admittedly great set of films. The effects are incredible, the story is told very well, the action just keeps going, and we get ourselves a Jedi duel the like of which we may never see again.

Author: lars_von
Review_Title: A welcomed change from The Phantom Menace
Review: First of all, let me say that this movie is extremely baller. I saw it twice in one day! Everything that was wrong with The Phantom Menace was eliminated or corrected in Attack of the Clones. Most importantly, Jar Jar had drastically fewer lines, and therefore, did not ruin the movie. One thing I liked in particular was the fact that you find out what happened to the characters we already know about. For example, instead of some random character like Darth Maul, we get to see what happens to Anakin as he is learning the way of the Jedi. If you haven't already seen this movie, turn off your computer, get up, get out, and go see it. Greatest movie ever.

Author: StormBot4Pi
Review_Title: a brief overview of the movie, nothing to spoil it really badly...
Review: Well, the middle SWs seem to be the best, first Episode V, now Episode II. Padmè is now just a senator, since Episode I she has finished her two terms as queen of Naboo. Oddly, Anikin and Obi-Wan have both aged over ten years, but Padmè hasn't aged at all. In Episode II many things are beginning to lead up to Episode IV, there are plans for the Death Star, Obi-Wan is aging quite a bit, Anikin is swaying to the dark side, Luke's step-grandparents are introduced, and an early type of Stomrtrooper and Imperial Cruiser are introduced, yet they are good and working for the Jedi! Even though it is hyped up as a love story, it seems to have even more action that most of the other SWs and has way less mushy stuff than you would think. Overall it was a great movie, and worth a wait in a long line. ;)

Author: tt58021
Review_Title: The digital world and creatures don't fit in
Review: I really didn't like the movie because the feeling was very much avry. The digital effects looked unnatural and clumsy. For example there were a group of jedi standing in a room. All the human actors stood still and looked grave, but the master of all jedi, Yoda, had to look around and twitch and twirl unnaturally all the time. I really didn't think Yoda was hyperactive. If a 3D specialist has nothing better to do than try the limits of his imagination then don't let him do it!

Author: dgels
Review: Do not listen to the hype.  Save your hard-earned money, people.  I am a Star Wars fan, but I'm also a rational human being who knows crap when he sees it.  This movie made me WISH for another Episode One, a movie I, like most, didn't even like.

Author: hstrugar
Review: Great movie! The story is great, it explains everything at least to me and there is enough plots for the third part. I think the general problem with the fans of the old trilogy (I am also one of them) is that they are expecting again to see Luke, Leia and Han in action. This new trilogy is something new and it is good, special effects are great, battle scenes and let`s not start with the battles with light sabers. All in all everybody has a right to say his/hers opinion and this is mine the movie is great! Can`t wait for the next part!

Author: whippet65
Review_Title: Episode III is going to be amazing on this evidence
Review: I saw episode II last night, and after the disappointment of Phantom Menace, went in with slightly lower expectations this time around.  I needn't have done so.  This is a much, much better film than Menace.

Author: chrisforberg
Review: George is the man; episode II is a stunning movie.  The visuals are breath taking, the action is intense, and the Empire is coming.  What else needs to be said? Okay maybe one more thing.  May the force be with you.

Author: matt_obyrne
Review_Title: Star Wars is back with better visuals and effects than ever!
Review: Well for all of you who have been waiting for another great movie, here it is! Star Wars Episode II combines a magnificent plot with spectacular visuals to produce a killer film. The storyline follows the classic Star Wars path, while adding new ideas to the already great adventure. The Visuals are cutting edge and really sell the film. Go out and see this film if you are at all interested in a good action adventure flick.

Author: imageblaster7
Review: I saw the digitally-projected "Attack of the Clones" high-definition version. and I was ASTOUNDED by it!

Author: Aqueous969
Review_Title: Cheesy romance flick, not a quality film
Review: "Attack of the Clones" stars Hayden Christensen, Natalie Portman, Ewan McGregor, and Samuel L. Jackson.  It tells the story of the growing up period for the cruel Jedi taken over by the dark force (Darth Vader)or whatever you call it.  When the queen's life is suddenly threatened (Portman) and is in stake, the Jedi use all kinds of ways to keep her safe. I personally am not a fan of George Lucas.  I have seen all the episodes 4, 5, and 6, and also 1 which was released in 1999.  I recently viewed the 2nd Episode and absouletly hated it.  I also think it had no redeeming qualities whatsoever.  Athough the special affects were pretty good and the scene where the Jedi Master Yoda fights with his lightsaber, the rest of the movie flat out sucks.  It has a horrible script and storyline, the acting was cheesy and it was filmed in digital, unlike the previous episodes.  If you are in the romantic type movies than this might be a good one for you but if you are than don't call this movie and action movie, it's way far from that.

Author: channlsrfr
Review: All of the critics' comments I have read say that the characters are cardboard, there is no good dialogue, and all the rest of the favorite this-movie-is-not-all-people-make-it-out-to-be cliches.  While perhaps the acting was not as impressive as it could have been, and there may have been the occasional cheesy line, Episode II was not only a great Star Wars movie, but a great film on its own.  The romance subplot alone brought an emotional level to the movie unmatched by any previous Star Wars episode, while I thought the characters in general had a more natural, human aura to them than before. Okay, the first, very political portion was a small exception, but it was only small.  This was a very dynamic movie; in addition to the benefits that the romance story brought, the action was just as intense as--if not more intense than--that of previous Star Wars movies.  Nobody should regret seeing this.

Author: psylent_22
Review: I was a midnight showing for AOTC and didn't have the highest of expectations for this film, especially after Episode 1. I can honestly say I have NEVER had such an amazingly good time whilst watching a movie. Some of the best action scenes I've ever seen on film (be it digital or otherwise).

Author: greaterdebater
Review: While I beleive that Lucas did make everything that was wrong right, I would like to point out one major flaw. Hayden Christiansen or whatever his name is, is NOT a good Anakin Skywalker. I was disgusted with his performance. Duely noted that there aren't many out there at the age to portray Anakin that are available, but he was completely dull and was embarassingly rigid with the lines. While i understand Anakin is supposed to be a whipped little Jedi boy, the actor did not get into his role, instead it was Hayden playing Anakin instead of Hayden BEING Anakin. Aside from that Yoda kicked ass in the duel and the rest of the movie was extravagant, casting too, It's just that some people can't act, and well they have to face themselves sooner or later.

Author: stonecoldmolchan
Review: Before I begin, let me say that I have studied literary criticism at the post graduate level, so naturally my training as a critic will come through in my review of the movie.

Author: youridechesne
Review: Episode II is a huge improvement on episode I. Jar Jar Binks is only in the movie for a few minutes and there are a lot more action scenes.However, the movie cannot compare to episodes IV, V and VI, by far. Somehow George Lucas seems to be unable to get back that atmosphere from the last 3 episodes, Episodes I and II are just too colorful. There's a lot of romance in this episode. Not a problem, one would say, thinking back to han Solo and princess Leia, but in Attack of the Clones it's over the top. It is extremely annoying to see Padme en Anakin rolling about in the grass, totally in love, but still denying it, suported by horrible quasi-romantic music. yugh. The movie really gets going after this part. The second part of the movie is loaded with great action scenes, the best being Yoda fighting count Dooku with a lightsaber. Respect Yoda! All in all it's a good movie, with a lot of references to the older episodes. You won't be disapointed as was the case with episode I

Author: larkin_shaun
Review: Well I saw Attack of the Clones and must say I enjoyed it. It has good entertainment value. But it had all the problems that the other 2 Star Wars movies that George Lucas directed were filled with.

Author: oilerfan07
Review: Being the ripe old age of 35, I can remember Episode 4 being released in theatres when I was 10, and how excited about this movie I was.

Author: Josh Doyle
Review_Title: The darkest episode since Empire Strikes back - a powerful film, as good as the original trilogy.
Review: No spoiler review....

Author: fkranjce-news
Review_Title: Very nice effects but boring lovestory and dialogs
Review: I am not big fun of SW serial but original films was for me very good and interesting. In Episode1 there was too many childish stuff and in Episode2 there is too many love stuff. Love is important for story but i didn't like how it was showed. The dialogs and some parts are like Mexican lovestory serials :(

Author: wuzonge
Review: MINOR SPOILERS AHEAD

Author: quebecmagali
Review: This movie must be a joke. Holy crap. I cannot believe Lucas-and-friends did that. All-the-way cliché, stupid development of the cuty love story, bad acting (besides Mcgreggor). I was not a huge star wars fan, but creep, that was not a good movie. At all. Laughable.

Author: thegrtone
Review_Title: Better than the last one, thank God
Review: It's opening night of this movie and I've just come home from the theater. Sadly, Jar Jar Binks is still in this movie. I tried to use the force myself to have his character killed, but it didn't work out. As far as storyline goes, this movie was pretty good because it really brought a lot of things together. People and events of the original 3 movies (IV, V, and VI) start to come together in this one. The problem with it is that Lucas still felt it necessary to include the lame, infantile one-liners that make people over the age of 10 cringe. Shoreline Theaters was overrun with little children who have probably never seen the original films, and who probably can't appreciate any plot developments (yes, it has some). So as I expected, I was struck by the commercialism of the movie and at times I felt as if I were watching an infomercial, not a film. Lucas included some garbage that made it hard to take some of this one seriously. All I can say is, thank God it wasn't The Phantom Menace again.

Author: bumboybee
Review_Title: Better than Phantom menace but thats not saying much
Review: Just a short review.The positive elements of episode two was the great special effects and inventive worlds that were created by lucas and his talented team.But sadly all this energy was channelled into visual elements of the movie and someone forgot about the plot,characters with depth and dialogue (a mixture of Z grade sci fi and midday soap opera). The love interest aspect of the movie just didn't fit it seemed and felt like someone added in for the cash in(titanic any one).To me it seemed like a wasted opportunity because both are promising actors but their scenes together are limp and lifeless,lacking any real intensity.I could go on but it feels like waste of my own energy and time to do so.All i can say is i hope the next episode has some backbone and remmembers that some us enjoys a movie that has a bit of heart and uses it s head and dose'nt just rely on a pretty face.

Author: jamesrounce
Review_Title: A Great film, but only seemed to be getting started!
Review: Well where to start. Firstly I have to say the special effects were brilliant. Everyone will probably know at least a little about the general story line so I will omit that for the time being. With that out of the way, onto some more important factors.

Author: marklyn
Review_Title: I don't like watching computer games.
Review: I am a big Star Wars freak, having been totally captivated by the original movie as a 12 year old boy. Having said that I must say that Attack of the Clones was very disappointing. There are two fundamental things that bother me about this movie. Firstly, the plot is unlike anything we have seen previously. In other episodes, good and evil were always clearly defined, with good struggling against seemingly impossible odds to emerge victorious, or at least not lose too badly. In this movie the good side seem to be consuming themselves with there own stupidity and arrogance, and it is hard to feel any empathy for their struggle. The other grating thing is the CGI. It is right over the top with too much happening on the screen at one time to make a strong impact. A lot of the CGI heavy scenes seem to be straight out of a computer game; but not a particularly good computer game. The big battle scene at the end almost saves the movie, but it is too little too late.

Author: fuzio
Review_Title: only one word to say - boring
Review: I heard that this film was good, so despite the very uninteresting first episode I finally gave the 'glone wars' a try. And boy, what a mistake it was. The first ninety minutes was something like 'gone with the force', the romance between young anakin and amidala was soooooo interesting. I expected battle, thrills, mystery and instead i've got a boring romance. Geez, if i would've wanted romance i would try english patient. The last 30 minutes has all that the rest of the film lacks, fighting jedi, battles, and is quite fun. But master yoda fighting with lightsaber is so childish. This film is all about romance with some action at the end, and is not worth watching at all. Unless you are a hardcore sw maniac. This is much worse than episode one and episode one was way below bad. Do the math.

Author: nixelle
Review: at first glimpse, attack of the clones seems like a mixture of bad acting, confusing plot, WAY WAY cheesy lines, and pretty darn good CGI. After the phantom menace fiasco, I wasn't sure what to expect on Episode II.

Author: warmonger17
Review_Title: Brought a tear to my eye
Review: When i was watching that battle at the end i almost lost myself in the movie, forgetting about everything that was going on. Attack of the Clones was wonderful. I must admit the love story part of it was not my favorite, but i would never take it out for obvious reasons. Over all this is close to being my favorite Star Wars movie so far. It is so wonderful to truly see the jedi in action, and not just one or two at a time. And of course, YODA ROCKS. nuff said!

Author: fs01calu
Review: My english sucks but anyway, WOW!!! The first 45 min of episode II is so amazingly BORING... It´s feels like nothing happens, just some love stuff. Then suddenly you get all aroused. The movie changes from a family-movie to an action-movie. The plot is not so well written. But who gives a sh... You dont get annoyed by lousy acting( like anakin in ep1). You see a lot of those characters who will be starring in ep 4,5,6. I didnt know what it was but the movie captured me. See this mowie, it´s a must. George Lucas has made a movie better than ep 1,5,6. I had very low expectations but this movie is really great. once again, SEE IT.

Author: GErickson3
Review_Title: May the force and all evil be with us.
Review: All I can say was that Star Wars Episode 2 is a keeper regardless of what anyone says.  Forget those stupid critics, they don't know a thing.  I am very happy with the movie and think that it is great not only for Star Wars fans but the action fans as well.  This is a great movie and I think that anyone should see it.

Author: chris_v_25
Review_Title: Restores your faith after the E1 slip.
Review: I am a Star Wars fan. These films captured my imagination at a very young age and, except for Episode 1, (which, IMHO was worthless outside of the lightsabre duels) have had me ever since.

Author: thegryffindors
Review_Title: Yoda is the greatest Jedi Knight!!
Review: I must admit I was afraid to go see Episode II, even though I´ve been a Star Wars fan since I was 4 years old. I had liked Episode I, but somehow didn´t expect Episode II to be any good. Boy was I wrong!!

Author: boyracer82
Review: A friend of mine recently gave me a bootleg copy of AOTC, and I began to warm up to it after a couple of viewings, partly because the confusing details of the dissent and division in the Republic became clearer (which I find to be the most interesting part of the prequels).  But also because it was a bootleg: the poor quality countered the overdone CGI effects and made the film seem visually closer to the original trilogy.

Author: LILANDY25
Review: This movie was a great example of how well George Lucas could juggle a terrific story with astonishing special effects.  It was cool how Jar Jar was actually tolerable; he wasn't just a bumbling piece of lame comic-relief.  The noise that Jango's seismic blasts made was absolutely stunning.  I'm sure that everybody is sweating Yoda's lightsaber battle, and with good reason; he was a spunky little fellow.  I don't want to spoil anything else for all you folks out there who haven't had a chance to take in this masterpiece. Bravo, Mr. Lucas

Author: goosetickler
Review: After the first film "The Phanton Menace," the disappointing prequel to his "Star Wars" trilogy, i went into "Attack of the Clones" expecting a big improvement. oh how wrong i was! i am a huge star wars fan and after all the hype and anticipation about this film i was shocked to see how bad it really was.

Author: Sam Punia
Review_Title: who needs dialog and acting when its Star Wars!
Review: I went into this movie after reading the horrible reviews it recieved.  I thought it was a great movie and the only reason critics didnt like it was because they were comparing it to the first three star wars movie and not just reviewing it as its own movie.

Author: eheav
Review: What the hell was that?!?!? Ok, visual effects are just as good as you can hope... But what happened to the story???

Author: LensiDK
Review_Title: Everything that we could ever ask for!
Review: This movie has everything a Star Wars fan could ask for. All the cool scenes are there. Sadly, though, there are minor flaws in visuals. Like in the scene where Anakin rides one of the huge animals. The intro scene is just as it should be. It's intense and kept me on the edge of my seat the whole way through. We also learn new things. I like the scene were Kenobi "accidently" achieves knowledge on the Clone army. The movie's main theme is the "development" of Anakin Skywalker. I think the change of him and his "turning dark" is magnificently presented to us. On another note, reviews say the actors' performances are beyond poor. I must disagree. I give this movie 10/10 - Star Wars is back!

Author: Private_mojo
Review_Title: Some Good Comments about the film with only few criticisms.
Review: Seeing the movie at a press preview before it's release, many people were asking me what i thought of it and wether it was worth watching. I said 'Hey, it's Star Wars, it's always worth watching!' And i was right. The second installment of the epic is a great movie to watch. It's fun, has great action sequences and, occasionly, funny. The strong point of the film is the action. It's brilliant and better than it has been before. The final battle at the end of the movie is stunning, pitting 200 Jedi against Count Dooku's droid army. the clone soldiers are brilliant, the design of their uniform is cleverly close to that of the Storm Troopers, showing what is going to happen to them in the end. The special effects are also a brilliant feature in the film. But what did we expect from Industrial Light and Magic? ILM are ahead of everybody else when it comes to computer graphics. For the first time in all of the Star Wars films, Yoda is no longer a puppet but computer generated. At first i was think that this would ruin the movie, but it is superbly done and i have nothing bad to comment on it. What is hugely dissapointing is the script. It lacks that certain thing that is seen in the original trilogy. The lines that Obi Wan Kenobi (Ewan McGreggor) finds himself saying are utterly rubbish some of the time. I found myself laughing at a couple of them at the very most. Then the scripting leads onto the acting, which is done consideringly well. Newcomer Hayden Christensen portrayed Anikin very well, showing his love and anger (both should not be shown by a Jedi) very well. Overall, the new installment of the Star Wars saga is a great movie. Certainly better than Episode 1 in most areas, fans of the Star Wars universe should not be disappointed. Movie Goers who arnt that involved with Star Wars should still enjoy.

Author: bornholm
Review: `Episode II: Attack of the Clones' is not the rebirth of the Star Wars saga.

Author: animaldisguise
Review: Yet again, more horrible CG special effects that look like they were pulled from the Sci-Fi Channel's latest TV series.  Everything in the film is computer generated, and I could barely sit through the entire thing.  It doesn't even feel like a Star Wars movie, but a cheap imitation / demonstration video for a CG program. If you do see this, please watch one of the originals afterwards to wash yourself of this horrible atrocity. I imagine George Lucas in pre production telling everyone to not use any of the things that made the originals so great.  This along with Episode I is one of the most horrible, disappointing events in film history.

Author: vans28
Review_Title: Kind of good stuff...except for that dialogue thing.
Review: So you've waited three years after seeing "The Phantom Menace" and ended up bleary-eyed and with some trails of snot escaping from your nasal passages, well, don't worry, Episode II is actually a decent film.

Author: soyovuebeendumped
Review: Well it's here -- the eagerly awaited next instalment of the 'Star Wars' saga. The last one - 'Episode I' - was decidedly average and this one clocks in just above that. Anakin Skywalker (the new kid) is annoying and the love story between him and the Senator Padmé Amidala is lacking in chemistry and believability. The effects are as good as you'd expect from a 'Star Wars' film -- the flying and fighting sequences are great -- but if anything they go overboard with them -- as you can just see the video game footage being churned out straight from the movie! The only other real complaint I had with the film -- is all the bouncing around can be a bit tiresome and confusing. C3PO isn't in it nearly enough but when he is, he steals the show. Yoda's quips and 'Crouching Tiger' moves were enjoyable as was the always delightful Ewan McGregor. At the end of the day, the movie will be HUGE and it is better than the last one. "True" 'Star Wars' fans will no doubt enjoy this and see it again and again. Once was enough for me, I think, though. If you do go see it, stock up on plenty of food as it clocks in at nearly 2 and a half hours! Enjoy! :)

Author: dcporter
Review_Title: Glossing over a lack of imagination
Review: This has to be the most highly awaited and disappointing movie since Episode 1. George Lucas has failed to recompense the paying public for the sham of a film that was The Phantom Menace, by producing yet another stomach-churningly lame excuse of a film.

Author: rolsby
Review_Title: May the hype be with you
Review: I'm not usually a believer in hype.  The only premieres I have ever been to were Batman, Interview with the Vampire, and Gladiator.  After Batman didn't quite live up to my expectations, I decided to choose my movies more carefully from then on.  NOT THIS TIME!!! I pre-ordered tickets.  I stood in line.  Finally, I stayed up until 2:30am watching "Attack of the Clones." I can proudly say it was worth it.

Author: weerdo27
Review: the storyline of this episode was for lack of a better word weak.  two out of the 7 of us fell asleep during certain parts of the movie.  and there could have been a way better cast for anakin skywalker.

Author: broncoboy87
Review: I loved this movie.  After being extremely disappointed by The Phantom Menace, Attack of the Clones restores any faith I had lost in George Lucas. It's not quite as good as A New Hope or The Empire Strikes Back, but it's leaps and bounds better than Phantom and even Return of the Jedi.  What I enjoyed the most, other than the action, was the way it advanced the plot and connected to the Original Trilogy in more ways than one.  We see several people, things, and weapons that will eventually pop up and play major roles in the original three films.  This film was so much fun.  Did I mention I loved it?

Author: reelinsider
Review_Title: SPOILERS "Attack of the Clones" more than makes up for "The PhantomMenace"
Review: If you were one of those people who asked "why George why?" after leaving "Star Wars Episode I - The Phantom Menace" then let me tell you this........

Author: phizza80
Review: Basically this movie would have been as good as Empire if George did not not direct. He's a great storywriter and producer but he ain't a great director. Now I thought TPM was a good movie however it cleary did not sit with the stamina of the originals........but Attack of the Clones is truly a superb star wars movie.......Lucas must have really tried hard with he directing skills on this one......because he did better as a director on this one than I would have expected and it shows. I personally thought the love scenes were executed terrifically......it was completely believeable.....the looks in their eyes as they spoke their lines......fantastic. However thats not to say the love scenes weren't cheesy......but thats the whole point!!! When people say that the love scenes in this one were nowhere near as good as Han and Leia in Empire.....I think these people should re-watch empire........you think "I've been dying a little bit each day since you came back into my life" is worse that "My hands are dirty......." "My hands are dirty too........" heh

Author: SimonFlackett
Review: Special effects, action, plot all amazing, George Lucas has done himself proud. This is was of the best films I have seen. It was really a joy, I had two kids with me, they were in awe. We talked about the film all the way home. Only two years to wait to find out what happens next!

Author: johnsonium
Review_Title: Much better than Episode 1, but still lacking heart
Review: First off for all those people who liked this movie and are urging people to ignore the critics, think for a second.  You are a critic when you give any review, even a good one.  So, by that logic they should ignore you.  A discerning potential moviegoer will survey a variety of opinion, both good and bad, and decide accordingly.  Trying to divert this process by discrediting other people's posted opinion does everyone a disservice.

Author: dodgeball_ninja
Review_Title: Makes up for the fact that Episode 1 sucked, and then some.
Review: Wow. Episode 2 is amazing. I wasn't all too excited, seeing as how Episode 1 was such a piece of crap, but Lucas more than made up for it.

Author: stonecoldpizzaman316
Review_Title: This Movie Was Worth The Wait!
Review: Star Wars Episode II was one of the best movies I have seen this year. George Lucas does it again! Now we have to wait for Episode III. Please hurry Lucas! The story of Anakin Skywalker will unfold in the next movie and I hope to see more action again. Bring forth the dark lord.... Darth Vader!

Author: ssaabye
Review: I was lucky to get a preview of Star Wars: episode II. This movie is a big improvement compared to episode I. As Jar-Jar isn´t as visible. Personally I think he(?) was a bit too much in the first. Also in this episode we begin to see another side of Anakin Skywalker, and there´s more action.. But I will not reveal it all. My simple conclusion is see it !!!, I´m going to see it again after the world premier.

Author: bassman_55
Review: I anticipated this movie to be good.  Unfortunately I did the same thing for Phantom Menace.  I was not let down in this case.  Although the title leaves something to be desired, the storyline was fairly well done.  Acting (Besides Hayden) was incredibly good (As always).  In a sense, Hayden did a good job to create dual personas, which obviously will come into play in the next episode.

Author: angelemily85
Review: it was awesome!! i went with no expectations whatsoever, and thoroughly enjoyed it. if you aren't expecting much when you go and see it, then i think you'll be pleasantly surprised. the special effects were awesome, Ewen McGregor's a stud, and Yoda is so my hero!!

Author: scarlett1214
Review_Title: A vast improvement over Episode I!!
Review: My family and I just returned from one of the Sunday, May 12th benefit showings of Episode II, and we're glad to say that it really lives up to being a "Star Wars" film.  So much happens story-wise that explains what is to come that I'm not sure one could get it all in just one viewing.  The effects and sound were excellent; we were fortunate enough to view it in a theater that recently installed a digital projector, and the picture and sound are a welcome improvement over actual film.  I don't think "Star Wars" fans will be disappointed in this installment as they likely were with Episode I.  It's not a perfect film, but it was satisfying enough, particularly in its plot lines and their developments.  We already have tickets for opening day, May 16th, and are eagerly awaiting seeing it again to pick up on what we missed.  Overall, not as good as Episodes IV and V, but better than Episode VI, and much, much better than Episode I.

Author: kamyki
Review: One is sure - Attack of the Clones is much better than Episode 1. There's no children in this part, there's no funny creatures either. But, too bad but there is BUT. First 30 minutes of the movies is a bit boring. It reminds me brasilian soap-opera...how does he wants her and how doesn't she give him..... The real movie begins when Obi Wan comes to the cloners planet and when we see the first real fight between Obi Wat and Jango Fett. Too bad that George Lucas once again kills the bad guy, whos one of the best character of the movie (the same was with Darth Maul). Overall Episode II is much better than first one, it's darker and we've got lots of fights, but Lord of the Rings is better anyway :)))

Author: loganeyesonly1
Review_Title: The force is Strong with this one
Review: I just saw this at a press screening and can happily say that at Last, Star Wars returns to the heady status it reached with Empire strikes back, one of the best sci-fi films ever produced. The film takes a while to get going, after a fabulous chase sequence, it appears to steer down the path of exposition, and becomes heavily focused in politics. However it soon picks up again and the last half hour leaves you with a strong desire to see more. There are other problems, at times the CGI is glaringly noticable, and you can't help feeling that Yoda doesn't quite look right, no where near as good as the puppet. Similarly there are some scenes which are a tad on the long side, and some of the dialogue appears to be lifted straight from the Carry On leftover bin, primarily C3p0. Yes Jar- Jar is Back and annoying as ever, but at least he gives us an official excuse to hate him. Despite the gripes however, this remains a solid piece of entertainment, highly enjoyable, with great acting, and a wonderful script.

Author: mp3jack
Review: Now this time (if you compare it with Episode1) George Lucas really made a great film. The main thing which was improved in my point of view is the great, interesting story. The love-story element was included such as a funny jumping-around Yoda and some nice fights against the monsters in the arena. Although it is wellmade, many elements and ideas are taken from the first 3 films, thats the only thing where I thought that it could have been made differently.

Author: DDerekblowsgoats
Review_Title: Star Wars Episode 2 Lucas got it Right
Review: I have just finished watching Star Wars Episode 2 (Attack of the clones) and I must say that George Lucas has bounced back for the horrible episode one. The story has much o deliver to both long time star wars fans, and new comers to the universe.  The movie is filled with many twists and turns, and delivers with the things that episode one had left out.  (Jar Jar with only about three minutes on screen time).  The story takes place ten years after menace, and puts you right into the action from scene one.  The story gets a little slow and redundent through the corny love scenes, but makes up for it with Jango and Boba Fett.  After seeing The Lord of the Rings; Lucas had much to live up to to compete with that film, but he managed to do it.

Author: JelloTFC
Review_Title: I came... I saw... I almost fell asleep.
Review: Wow. I saw a screening with some friends last night... and boy was this a lame attempt of Lucas trying to regain his PERMANENTLY LOST creative talent. I have to admit, it WAS better than Phantom, but it will never beat the old trilogy.

Author: MisterMike
Review_Title: A treat for those who were disappointed in "The Phantom Menace"
Review: It's been said here several times but I'll add my two cents. If you were somewhat disappointed in "The Phantom Menace" (or "Return of the Jedi" for that matter) this movie is definitely a return to the grand storytelling and action of the first Star Wars films. It's just as spectacular and engrossing as "The Empire Strikes Back" but it is the broadest visually of any of the Star Wars films. Fantastic Details seem to fill every frame. See this film in the theater because I suspect some of the awesome imagery will get lost on video.

Author: jimbobjeff85
Review_Title: does everything right, even with the faults.....
Review: When i read reviews of "Attack of the Clones" i thought hey, there's a distinctive pattern going on here. There's the serious critics who scorn it, and the star wars fans who love it. With me being a Star Wars nut I thought i would love it, but couldn't shake off the feeling that it would underwhelm me as Episode One did. Thankfully i thought the film was absolutely brilliant.

Author: michael_3685
Review: It's ten years since little Anny started his training as a Jedi, and he and Obi Wan Kenobi have been sent to protect the ex-Queen Padme Amidala from separatist assassins.  There are not enough Jedi these days to protect the universe from the separatist threat, so a clone army is being created.

Author: mangeberg
Review_Title: One of my favorites among star wars!
Review: I saw it yesterday and thought it was just great! Much more humor and action.

Author: akoskatona
Review: With AOTC Lucasfilm did not make the same mistake as they did in 1999. The movie opened in 30something countries on the same day, and fortunately in Europe we ( first time in history ) were able to see it 6 hours before than our american friends. Honestly I did see the movie on Tuesday on the media screening.

Author: mymja
Review_Title: This is the best one of the five!
Review: I had the chance to watch it on yesterday with a few lucky people in a early projection event. I was afraid to be disappointed because I didn't like Episode I at all, mainly because of the boring Disney-esq creatures on Naboo, among many other things. But now whoa! I have to admit this one is amazing!!! I never seen such a movie! So much CGI work, you cannot believe what you see! After Episode I, I thought Lucas was finished and good for retirement, but now I think he's gone completely mad!. The characters are also more elaborate than in other Star Wars movies in my opinion, which is a real progress.

Author: sag720
Review: Apart from the usual fantastic special effects we are used to seeing from George Lucas, this movie lacks the drama the original trilogy put forth.

Author: Ic32k1
Review: I was lucky enough to get tickets to the opening night of "Attack of the Clones" and let me tell you it did not disappoint. As bad as the name of the movie, I was expecting something along the lines of Phantom Menace. This is far from the truth! While Phantom Menace put emphasise on the special effects, AOTC goes into much more story detail. Without ruining it for you all, basically it starts off 10 years since Phantom Menace. Anakin Skywalker is older and more arrogant and Obi-Wan is more efficient at being a Jedi Master. This sets and backgrounds of the movie are unbelievable, and the music totally rules. John Williams has once again put a masterpiece together and used it on another master piece. Not only that, but he uses known tunes to signify important parts, such as the Imperial March.

Author: mauke
Review_Title: Better than Episode I, but still not like IV, V and VI.
Review: Propably all hated Episode I for Jar Jar Binks and it's cartoon-like character. To me he looked like Roger Rabbit in film Who framed Roger Rabbit. I really hoped that Jar Jar Binks made his first and last appearence in Star Wars episode I, but was disappointed. He appearenced in the film and more than once. It may be due to a technical advance to make characters like that, but to me puppets that were used in Episode IV, V and VI looked more real and had more feeling. And to speak about the plot itself, it was cheesy. Too much happened in too short time. I think Lucas tried to add too much to the film and so he still couldn't produce the feeling the older episodes had. The old man is just too creedy. I think Episode II is fun to watch, but is almost as naive as episode I.

Author: joeboyer
Review_Title: Genuinely good film. Lots of good humour and action
Review: This is a great film.  Lots of good action sequences, and these ones are actually relevent to the plot (unlike Episode 1).  The plot never drags, though one fault I found was that it switches between simultaneous plots too quickly.  All the acting is brilliant, though some of the CGI is obviously fake and this could be done better.

Author: PGRATTON
Review_Title: Great FX,Bad Acting ,Rename "Attack of the Clowns"
Review: From the start to the finish the special effects were great. But the rest of the story was boring and predictable. And what the hell happened to yoda one minute he is Hobbling around with a walking stick then next he is doing Jackie chan moves with ease!!

Author: rexfrost-56536
Review: I liked the movie but the acting was awful. The person playing Anakin must have something on someone to have gotten the part. My five year old grandson is a better actor. Most of the actors and actresses were not good even the well known ones. Jackson was bad also. There are just too many star wars. Why did they need to go back and do these after the original start wars?? Just a bunch of money hungry greedy things. I liked the first movie the best the rest just put me to sleep. The acting is not believable. I would never go the a theater and pay to see this garbage. They should have to pay people to watch this. I am watching all of the movies again but the acting will never get better for the first three. These movies make me thing of Christians against muslims. For the most part the computer graphics and very good. These movies are good to go get lost from reality in.

Author: Spiritcatcher
Review_Title: Big ! Bright ! Cheesy ! The most professional Bad Movie i've ever seen.
Review: Fans will cut this episode down, too. But i won't be the scenes with Jar Jar Binks, that will be sent into oblivion... you've seen Gone by the wind ? Ok, then you know what you're in for. I can't judge Mr. Christensen, but this is by far Mrs. Portmans worst movie by now - she gets exactly no chance to act. Leave the the cool scenes to Yoda (and the best joke, too !) and the rest of the laughs too the droids, but the rest is, well, pathetic. Except for the fantastic robot fighting action scenes. Too bad these only make for the last half hour, the rest of this flick just called for some heavily MST3K'ing (which we did). Wait for the missing *thud* when li'l Boba picks up... well, you'll see yourself.

Author: stephan-25
Review: Just got home from Star Wars 2 - Attack of the clones and i have to say great job Lucas! Much better then Phantom Menace, the special effects are amazing and cool lightsaber fights too :) I can't wait for Episode 3. GO SEE IT! It's well worth the money. Darth Vader rules.. LONG LIVE STAR WARS!

Author: ronafios
Review_Title: Nothing here for anyone but the die-hard fan, and the kids.
Review: Frankly, the average viewer will walk away from this film wondering how such a high budget and highly anticipated film could be released with such pathetic dialogue.  Because 'talk' makes up such a large part of this film (filling in plot lines, etc) the cliche and wooden performances are brought to the foreground, leaving the truly impressive stuff (CGI, action sequences) to wallow alone in the back.  How is it possible to assemble such quality, skilled actors, and come away with such awful performances?

Author: mjt-1
Review: Definitely a step up from Episode 1.  The set ups established in the first installment are elaborated greatly, particularly Anakin's sense of discontent with the Jedis.  The character's roles become more defined, particularly those of the Jedis, and for those who were asking the question, Jar Jar Binks does have a (large) part to play in the saga.

Author: mmsairan
Review_Title: Loved it - as a very biased long time fan
Review: Just walked from home from first official screening in Helsinki, Finland, and spent some minutes reading other new comments. I share many of the views, especially the ones on wooden dialogue, breathtaking action and amazing sceneries, and I honestly don't think the plot has much to offer to others than die hard fans but as such the film delivers lots of fun and enjoyment and lived up to the expectations. Don't take it so seriously - feel the Force and let your imagination do the rest! :)

Author: evansncl
Review_Title: Worth staying up for, mos def :)
Review: I've just seen Ep 2 at midnight on the morning of May 16, and it was worth it. I won't try to describe the film's storyline as *you'll see it very soon* (old jedi mind trick :), I just want to alleviate fears of Phantom Menace syndrome. The title, Attack of the Clones, really is the only stinker in this film.

Author: woocash
Review_Title: an enjoyable feature; great surprise after Episode I
Review: An excellent Star Wars movie. I was put off by the first trailer (the love-story one) and the Episode One itself... but the movie turned out way beyond my expectations. Story, special effects are great - perhaps the characters a bit bland (although Anankin is scary at times) and acting could be better but then, it's not the heart of the movie.

Author: nobi_keeper
Review: After sitting through almost two and half hours of special effects I have gotten some new respect for Lucas.  Not for his overall storytelling which is mind-numbingly weak, but for his overall insistence on using special effects to sell the movie.  For parts of the movie, it is actually quite engrossing.  However, I was disappointed in the overall movie as I expected a much better effort following the disasterous Menace.  Anakin and Amidala do not come close matching the fire, the spark, the wit (basically everything) of Leia and Han and Anakin is actually quite a drab character overall.  Thankfully, Jar-Jar is an inconsequential bit-player in this movie and for that, we can all be thankful.  I would rate this movie a 'C' and going by the 1-10 scale .. a '5' is a fair value for the movie.  Not as dreadful as Menace .. but not as satisfying as the original trilogy.

Author: Lance_LeGrande
Review_Title: This is what Star Wars is all about!
Review: In summary, it is everything that made Star Wars the greatest craze of all time and more! George Lucas has undoubtedly hit the jackpot, to use an American expression. Watching this movie reminded me of what Star Wars really is about. Never mind some of the corny dialogue and cliche scenes, because that IS part of the original Star Wars formula.

Author: aractus
Review_Title: The best experience I've had in a cinema!
Review: The Phantom Menace was a great film, despite widespread comments on Jar Jar. Believe it or not it wasn't about Jar Jar, it was meant to re-introduce us to the Star Wars galaxy and introduce the key characters to us. It did this and so much more brilliantly!

Author: adamrlrichardson
Review_Title: The story continues in a brilliant film
Review: If you had not seen any Star Wars films before, this film is brilliant with great acting and special affects. This is the only reason I could not give full marks because as a film on its own the story may seem a little confusing. However, as most of the world have seen episodes I,IV,V and VI this film is a masterpiece. It does the job that is requested of it. Not only does it continue to tell the story but it tells it incredibly well. The film has everything including Lucas' first real venture into a love story which he pulls off extremely well.

Author: aidenw
Review: Managed to catch the 12.05am opening session last night and the atmosphere was electric.

Author: Insert
Review_Title: Yoda Fighting - Greatest moments in cinema history
Review: As a rather avid star wars fan, it seems blasphemous to give the newest addition of the series such love, but I can't however, find flaw with Episode 2.  It is a non-stop rollercoaster ride, with enough light saber action to satisfy the most discerning of critics, and a romantic sub-plot that is both entertaining and moving.  George Lucas really does himself rather proud, and Yoda fighting...well.

Author: shwarma-imktzatharif
Review_Title: Positively AWFUL, far worse than Phantom Menace
Review: One of the most puzzling experiences I've ever had: when the credits came up at the end of the 12:05 AM showing of Episode II on opening night, the filled-to-capacity audience with whom I saw the film broke out in a huge ovation.

Author: ryehigh
Review: AOTC is a far cry better than TPM.  Thankfully, Jar Jar scenes are kept to a minimum.  Hooray.  C-3P0 lays on the puns quite thick, which sometimes gets distracting and stupid.  The visual effects were amazing.  There are surprising and at times predictable and cheezy scenes.  There were also several unfortunate direction flaws which opened up Anakin for some rude jokes among viewers.  However, fully worth the price of admission.

Author: IvyFilmSnob
Review_Title: What happens when you market a film for all audiences.
Review: Well this is an excellent study in what happens when a director tries to make a film that offers something for everyone, basically catering to all demographics. The result is at times inevitably mixed. Episode 2 remains true to the franchise but at the same time has perhaps what true purists might consider a bit too much of a romantic subplot.
