This in and of itself is not truly a bad thing but the script and lines could certainly have used some work in this department as most of the lines come off as corny or sappy. This is frustrating as you'll frequently find yourself laughing when one probably shouldn't be. Lucas does make up for this however with more than adequate doses of action and a genuinely intriguing storyline as one would expect. Don't expect to be swept off your feet when you walk into the theater as you might with the common whiz bang explosion openings most common in action films today but rather give the film time to mature and you should leave the theater thoroughly satisfied. When Clones is good it's GREAT, but when it's bad it's horrendous. However, from the looks of things Lucas is back on track with this overall greatly appreciated addition to the series.

Author: DigitallyWasted
Review: Seeing this movie on the midnight showing was possibly the biggest waste of sleeping time I could ever imagine. I loved the original trilogy, and have never met a person that didn't. It was fun, it was engaging, and more importantly...I could believe it. In 2003, however, George Lucas has a bottomless pit of a wallet, and can shell out all he needs...to make this horrible, repeat...HORRIBLE movie. I thought, as would every fan, that Lucas would listen to the mistakes he made from the first. No, actually, he ignored them. Altogether, ignored them...and made a film equally bad, even if Jar Jar only makes a slight appearance as opposed to a full fledge role (a casting mistake from the start). First of all, because I do have basis, is CG. Computer graphics. Why is this a bad thing? Fake. It all looks amazingly...FAKE. I believe that I saw maybe one scene with C-3PO in a real, original trilogy, man in a metal suit, C-3PO suit. From there on? CG. In fact, Lucas decided that C-3PO is so amazingly cute, that he allows the droid to catch a 75 MPH hovering repair car by his hands in midair. We're talking, the same droid that could barely hold onto a wrench in A New Hope. Everything in the movie looks so unbearably fake. Lucas seems to have totally misused his position and vision, to give us 2 full length, badly scripted cartoons (the scripting was THAT bad. No scene took itself seriously, and was hardly believeable). The same ships, troops, and machines we found so amazing 20-25 years ago are now pale, cartoonish, and convenient. By convenient, I mean that the realistic, battle worn fighters that maneuvered their hearts out in the original series now conveniently zip around the screen like it's no big deal. Luke was a Jedi, and a damn good pilot, and even he can't make his ship double it's speed whenever he deems it convenient. Battles were horrible, paced was too fast (especially if you compare them to the long drawl of a buildup), and never got to the heart of it where we found ourselves so comfortable. In Jedi, we found ourselves a part of the action. It was dramatic and wild and engaging. Now, we barely get a chance to catch a glimpse of the action. Impersonal invasions by millions of CG (once again, the CG curse looms on) troops are barely followed, and if they are, it's too fake looking to buy.

Author: sneakabout
Review: First let me say I have loved every Star Wars film so far, yes even Phantom Menace. I got my ticket early to see the first showing. Kept my wife up to go to the show at midnight and be up until 3 in the morning watching it because of course it would be amazing. Wow....I can't believe how wrong I was!

Author: cgierbolini
Review_Title: I have one thing to say:
Review: I just got home from the 12:01 AOTC viewing in Orlando, FL.  I was lucky enough to see it in full Digital Heaven!

Author: pbarbs96
Review_Title: A ray of hope in a world of digital technology gone bad.
Review: A love story. A coming of age tale. A mystery. And yes, a comedy, too. This movie was way better than episode I. You will care for the characters just like you did for Han Solo and Chewie. The script-writing surpassed that of the 1999 so-called Star Wars film "The Phantom Menace". One would have to try extremely hard NOT to enjoy episode II. Some have complained that it moves too slow, I say hogwash. The development of Anakin and Padme's relationship calls for patience, as does love in everyday life. Besides Yoda putting the smack down, the other fantastic element in "Attack of the Clones" is C-3PO and R2-D2's humorous relationship. They bond like they did in the days of "Return of the Jedi" and episodes IV and V as well. I was almost moved to tears at parts of this film, like when Anakin figures out a horrible fate has befallen someone in his family (I'm trying not to give it away). The emotion evoked in this portion of "Clones" could never have been reached with a 50 foot pole by "Menace". Hype didn't kill "The Phantom Menace", bad dialogue did. And forget the notion that Lucas dwells too much in the realm of digital technology, because with the script and directing that "Clones" had, the technology blended well with the romance and mystery which the film so tenaciously held. You will see why Anakin is such a dangerously powerful force to be reckoned with, you will understand Boba Fett's bloodlust, and you will be glad that Jar Jar Binks is only in a fraction of the film. Give this film credit, because it's a fantastic sci-fi blast for a new generation of movie-goers.

Author: bookhouseboy
Review: It's been 9 hours since I came out of the theater where I was checking out the newest installment in a Star Wars-saga. My hopes weren't that high when I was going in mainly because the lack of attraction in Episode I. Don't get me wrong, Episode I wasn't a bad movie but for Star Wars...

Author: basscheffers
Review_Title: Best Star Wars movie to date
Review: Many say Episode One was disappointing, but this movie makes you realise a good plot setup was needed, and really, how much heroism can one 9 year old boy do? Attack of the Clones is action packed from beginning to end and the visual effects are yaw dropping. It kept me entertained for it's whole runtime, and days thereafter. I felt better for having experienced it.

Author: mfalcone
Review: The best star wars movie yet. It has something for everyone, A love story for your girlfriends or Wives, action for the guys, a great story line much better than Episode 1. The Graphics were Undescribable.

Author: mdzwolf
Review_Title: THE MOST AWESOME MOVIE I HAVE EVER SEEN!!!!!
Review: You guys I just saw this movie at 12:03am on opening day and it kicks ass. It is better than episode I, not that I found anything wrong with that one but apparently some people did, and is right up there with 4, 5, and 6.  I really can't choose a fav but I can tell you that you won't be disappointed by this movie.  Lucas has really out done himself this time.  It leaves you dying to see episode III, which is ages away :(  The fight scene at the end is just incredible.  YOU MUST SEE THIS MOVIE AS LEAST ONCE!!  Believe me I will be seeing it quite a few more times.  Star Wars Rocks!!!!!!!!!

Author: justin-75
Review: You'll be COMPLETELY amazed with just how great this story is when you see it for yourself.  I went in thinking it would be just okay, but I was quite taken by how the movie blended a love story and an amazing war story.  Of all the Star Wars movies, I can now easily say that this is my favorite of them all.  I wasn't so big on the first one, but this one has DEFINITELY energized my interest in the Star Wars series.  If you want to see one movie that will get your blood pumping and touch you with a great story, see Star Wars episode 2.

Author: NBraunUCSD
Review_Title: Though imperfect, Episode II has renewed the faith.
Review: First, I would like to say that anyone who hasn't seen Episode II yet should go see it and come to their own opinions about the film, there are a few spoilers in this review. That said, everyone must admit that this new installment in everyones favorite intergalactic saga proves that The Force is indeed back.  With no mention of mitichlorians, relievingly few "meesa think..." comments, and an action packed storyline that keeps the audience at the edge of the seat the whole 2 hour length of his latest opus, George Lucas has renewed the faith feared lost after the glaring shortcomings of Episode I.  This is not to say everything in Episode II is perfect, but rather to say that the film is comparable in overall quality to the first three.

Author: stickitupyourhole
Review_Title: A good film, it is. See it, you should.
Review: There was a very excited full house in Dublin at for the first showing in Ireland. There were a few hard-core fans with light-sabres and other merchandise. I have never witnessed a better atmosphere in a cinema during the 25 years I have been a regular attender.

Author: patricmartin
Review: After a dissapointing E1 George Lucas gives us the 2nd part of his epic Sc/Fi-fairy-Tale!!! Its not that colorful as E1 and its much darker, especially when Anakin takes revenge for his mother.... The whole Movie reminds me of E 5...

Author: damiank
Review_Title: The best movie I have ever seen! Spectacular!
Review: This movie is simply spectacular! Visually Stunning. Awesome sound. Excellent Action. Nothing has ever came close to this movie in entertainment value!

Author: gillesX
Review_Title: It was definitely better than Episode 1, in all points !!!
Review: The Story was a lot better

Author: rawr_uk
Review: I was absolutely gobsmacked by Attack Of The Clones! I wasn't expecting the film to be a tenth as good as it was which has left me utterly stunned as to how amazing it is!

Author: JLJohnson
Review: I just saw the midnight showing of Episode II last night.  I had heard and read mixed reviews from the critics and fans going into the movie.  So, I was cautiously optimistic.

Author: RandallVision
Review: Well first let me say I was really looking forward to this installment in the series.  After I left the theater last night it is safe to say I came away with mixed reactions.

Author: Seimos
Review: After years of anticipation, and a private screening at 12AM on the opening night, my hopes were way up on this one. But while EP2 is better - strike that, much better - than Episode 1, don't expect a second "Empire Strikes Back".

Author: gimmemoreschorf
Review_Title: George Lucas is the real master of the force
Review: "OH MY GOD!" These were the first words that came to my mind when I saw just the first scenes of ATTACK OF THE CLONES! The movie's just one of the greatest films I've ever seen in my whole life. It fortunately reaches the limit of the original Star Wars movies in all its ways and it brings Movie-action to another level of excitement and tense. It is just thrilling to see how incredibly fast the chase through Coruscant is and what a STAR "WAR" can really be like when thousands of Clones and Battle droids and hundreds of Jedi fight in a gigantic battle. The characters are perfectly performed and the story is just great when you sit there in your seat and see the development of political corruption chancellor Palpatine is performing. This is really the science fiction movie of the 21st century!!!

Author: sim_dey
Review: I've just seen Episode II and I felt the same disappointment of three years ago. I can say officially that the magic has gone. I don't know what I was expecting but the film let me down on nearly every point. It was crammed to the eyeballs with effects (which I often found very distracting to the main action) but had an unnecessarily convoluted plot. I felt the whole film do not gel and had the feel of your run-of-the-mill summer blockbuster. Maybe I'm just getting too old or maybe Lucas is. Episode I and II has nearly destroyed the magic. Episode III has to be damn good to restore it. I ,for one, will not be holding my breath as I did for the other two. Why Lucas, why?

Author: joe-419
Review: Episode II has done a lot for the Star Wars saga. I went into that theater expecting something average. I expected that rather then answering questions about the Star Wars universe, it would pose more, like Phantom did. I was wrong. It not only answered a lot of questions posed by Phantom, but also questions posed by the first films.

Author: KelRel
Review: I saw this movie at 12m today (Thursday May 16th- Opening day) and was blown away. This movie is great! George Lucas has done it again. The story was great, building up to Episode 4+ beautifully and the graphics were insane. The best part of all would have to be Yoda and his moves in the light saber battle with Count Dooku. It's about time we get to see all the skills that everyone has been saying Yoda has- they weren't lying. Amazing movie...I'll be seeing it again.

Author: WeedMaster
Review_Title: Not more real Star Wars, sorry G.L
Review: Ok this film is nice to view and the effects are really great. But i miss the old Star Wars flavour what made the eps 4,5,6 so good! And the Story now is very complex so i think not all in it is logical... So have fun watchin this movie but don´t expect too much...

Author: loki5174
Review: That was the sickest( in a good way)thing i have ever seen i cant tell you but your jaw will drop when this little green devil whips his thing out. the performance was decent and the story was above par but im sick of lucas limiting himself to a pg rating get some blood with the fight scence. im not talking black hawk down here but take it up a knotch.

Author: KerrieLH
Review: I cannot believe how bad this movie was... First lets get the discussion of the visual effects out of the way. Of course, they were stunning. It's George Lucas, after all. And if visual effects are all you care about you'll enjoy this film.

Author: rochr
Review_Title: The saga has lost it´s magic.
Review: First of all, i want to point out that i´m a scifi-fanatic. About Episode 2... As a scifi movie this one is great. However, as a Star Wars movie, it sucks! Lucas has managed to kill every part of that special mood the Star Wars movies always had. What we have here, is an orgy of 3D animations. Nothing wrong with that, but this is too damn much. And those "realistic" 3D animated stand-ins, doesn´t move especially realistic. Everyone can easily see that they are animated. (Lucas, you should have contacted Pixar in that matter...) Humor, like in the first 3 episodes? Forget it! Kids will probably like this one, but old Star Wars fans wont! Episode 2 is not even close to worthy the name Star Wars!

Author: crusher-1
Review: This movie definitely had some interesting plot twists to it. The Senator is an absolute baby doll!

Author: Milierkovic
Review_Title: Go see it! you won't regret it
Review: The first hour is a bit boring, and you start to think where is this going to, it is too much of a love story. But the second half makes it up, what a nice action scenes, especially, when all the jedi's come together in the arena. I am gonna see this movie at least 5 time's i think. another fine job.

Author: Dane_anker
Review: Wow, I went to see Episode II opening day, Thursday may 16, at 12:01 AM, the first showing on the east coast. I loved the star wars movies, but I wasnt seeing episode II because it looked particularly good, just on principle for a lucas film. I was in for a great surprise, episode II was freakin' awesome. Between Kung-fu, lightsaber-fu, jedi force powers, spaceship battles, clones + droids, Padme's tits, Samuel L. kickin ass, and Yoda.... i wont spoil that but I gave the movie a 9(not a 10 just because Jar Jar was back AND unmaimed) Hayden Christensen's acting was very unconvincing and his kiss with Nadalie Portman (if you didnt know that they're going to kiss, your dumb)was poor. It might've just been that as actors and their characters are inexpierienced but - shrug - that's not what your seeing the movie for anyway. All in all a great movie expierience, i recommend it to all star wars fans, or movie fans in general, I can't wait to see it again, or until it comes out on video.

Author: MikeSaska
Review: I have to say, I went into Attack of the Clones with extremely high expectations.  My expectations were blown away.  I caught the earliest showing I could on opening day, and I left the theatre feeling like a million bucks.  Without saying too much, it was just amazing.  The cliffhanger at the end of the film , makes me feel like I cannot wait the three years for the next installment.  Hayden Christensen was absolutely awesome.  His ability to portray Anakin was absolutely perfect.  Natalie Portman was great, she did a far better job with this then she did with Phantom Menace.  Ewan McGregor was superb, he really played Obi-Wan to Alec Guinness perfection.  Christopher Lee was absolutely amazing.  If you love movies, see this.  The cinematography and special effects are breathtaking. If you love Star Wars, see this.  Any Star Wars fan will leave the theatre more than pleased.

Author: DanielTurner
Review: This movie is a huge improvement on the Phantom Menace! There is almost NO Jar Jar which should make you want to see it more. The audio and visual effects are awe inspiring. The story comes together and it becomes clear to everyone why. Hayden Christensen who plays Anakin Skywalker surprisingly fills the role well and it is totally plausable that he will become Darth Vader. Natalie Portman is totally beautiful and her character is allowed to do so much more. Ewan McGregor even if he did look like he was from the Bee Gee's displayed a more mature character. There is too many to go further into their performances! The climatic battle rocks but the highlight is the light sabre duel between Master Yoda and Darth Taranus. Where Yoda proves that the dark side is not stronger and that size matters not.

Author: tdth99
Review_Title: Critics of this film are way too jaded...Good vs Evil has never looked this good.
Review: I honestly don't know what people are thinking when they criticise this film. It is an stunning epic in every sense of the word. While most ordinary fans love it, movie critics in magazines and newspapers blast it. Don't listen to them, they wouldn't wouldn't know entertainment if it splashed into their cup of latte.

Author: plaloe
Review: This second episode of Star Wars is stunning visually, amazing in sound effects, impressive in scenery and interesting in plot. Several amazing sequences are state of the art. For example, a scene involving a meteorite field is even more impressive than the pod racing of episode I! I truly enjoyed it for all the adventures that happen to the well known characters of Star Wars. Watch it and you will see why Yoda is such a great Jedi master! You will discover Boba Fett's background. You will witness the events that affected Anakin Skywalker's life. "Attack of the Clones" has more weird & wonderful aliens which of course is all part of the Star Wars universe, which I particularly liked in this episode.  For those of you who were disappointed by "The Phantom Menace", or just annoyed by Jar Jar Binks' character, make sure you watch "Attack of the Clones". Jar Jar's character only has three scenes. And for fans of the original episodes IV, V & VI: you should enjoy R2-D2 and C-3PO's roles and the battle scenes as impressive as the snowy "Empire Strikes Back" ones.

Author: bernarddogg
Review: Putting media hype aside, here are my thoughts on the second Star Wars movie.

Author: ninjatown
Review: Some friends and I were waiting 2 hours in line last night to show our support for struggling film company Lucasfilm's latest amalgamation of collective conciousness's hopes and dreams entitled Attic of the Clowns.  In line I wondered what people would think of the series thirty years from now. What my children would think of it. (Though waiting in line for Star Wars movies will likely not add to my procreating anytime soon.)

Author: cdrummond
Review: ***** WARNING! Possible Spoilers *******

Author: mikethefunny
Review: Honestly I loved this movie.I loved it enough to see it the first day it was out and the second day it was out.I loved it from beginning to end.I loved the fight scenes,the love scenes,and every scene in between.Too many people are crying about it being "not lucas like",but i think they are just stupid.This man has wowed us over and over again.Granted,at first i hated episode one but now that i have seen this one,number one makes more sense,and thus looking better.And as for Lucas,he pretty much has the right to tell us what to like and hate he is that talented.I loved all the actors performances.They could have done without all catch lines from C-3po,but i loved the leading on quotes.Like the one from Obi "I feel you will be the death of me" to Anikin.I especially loved the fight scenes of Obi vs. Fett and Yoda vs. Dooku.the fight between fett and obi was just cool,and as for the Yoda fight scene.(gasp)Sure it might have looked kinda funny,but it got its point across that Yoda is the freaking Jedi of all Jedi.All i can say is go see this movie with the open mind you had when you were a kid,when you first saw Star Wars,when Mr. Lucas(im not worthy of saying his first name)first started the epic story that will forever be remembered when our generation is spoken on.

Author: nate_dur
Review: This movie is great and is full of action. It is great for a Star Wars buff and for just normal people. All of the boringness in The Phantom Menace opened up every thing. Most of the middle of the movie was based on Anakin and Senator Amidala being in love which was just down right retarded. But otherwise a great action Star Wars movie!!!!!!!

Author: Team_England
Review: I watched "The Phantom Menace" for the first time in a long time on May 16, just hours before going to see Episode II. I was pleasantly surprised. I thought perhaps that everyone (including myself) was unduly harsh in their criticism. Even Jar-Jar didn't seem all that bad. Then I went to see "Attack of the Clones"....

Author: tony_cluedo
Review_Title: One of the BEst Sci-fi Films Ever
Review: This is a quality film period.  I've read a number of reviews online criticizing the film since I've seen it.  In my opinion these are people going out of their way to put down the film.  I went in with no expectations and no plots already worked out in my head, and came out thinking the film was great. On another point, those puting down the CGI are talking rubbush.  I saw nothing wrong with it.  It all looks good.

Author: palbrightwsc
Review: Well, I check out the movie last night, and I must say about 45 minuets into the film, I thought I would be whole heartily disappointed.. Again! but have no fear, after the pretty long drawn out plot development, that nearly put me to sleep, The movie Picked up big time, the action scenes where amazing and Yoda, well he was just amazing. All in all, if it wasn't for the first 45 minuets of boredom this movie would have been a 10, but it gets 8 from me. Better than the First? Well Jar Jar has very few lines, and the action is much better, so I would have to say yes, but by much? Nope.

Author: MaceWindu101
Review_Title: Highly Enjoyable, Especially With The Right Audience
Review: I saw Episode II last night - or early this morning - at the midnight showing.  We waited in line with other serious Star Wars fans for a couple of hours - lightsabers in hand, mind you - and then we were seated.  After two hours in a theater of Star Wars fans, the movie began.

Author: blrucker
Review_Title: Not as completely awful as Episode I - but close.
Review: Not as completely awful as Episode I, but it makes up for it with dialogue to daydream by.  Sets were great.  Acting was uneven.  Story was boring. Surprises were few and far between.  I maintain that NO ONE could save this prequel-trilogy since by definition -- the audience knows what's going to happen, knows who will live or die, etc.  It was just a completely stupid decision to make these 3 films.  Instead, why not do episodes 7, 8 and 9? Pick up with the sons and daughters of Solo, Skywalker et al...  At least then I wouldn't be yawning through death-defying scenes -- knowing that the character HAD to live to be in the future stories.

Author: java-4
Review: Lot's of eye candy but that's it.  All candy and no food left me sick to my stomach.   A good movie has a well-told story with solid acting. A great movie has this and the candy too.  Sorry, 1 out of 3 just doesn't cut it, especially when the candy is the main course.

Author: psychguyz
Review: People who want to have fun at the movies will love this.  Don't be fooled by the over analytical bores that hold this movie to higher scrutiny then all others.  The original STAR WARS believe it or not got a lot of mixed reviews.  This movie was fun, actioned packed and decent story. Yoda ROCKS. Go see this for fun and not with a critical eye and you will not be disappointed.

Author: revdrenner
Review_Title: poor dialogue, but that was never lucas' strength. brilliant otherwise.
Review: "the clones" gets off to a great start, moves slowly in the middle act, then brings us home with some brilliant sequences.  it has been criticized for its lack of meaningful dialogue, but look back on the other four "star wars" films-- lucas does not seem very interested in it.  the love story angle of the film works only because it has to-- there are many uncomfortable scenes between anakin and padme.  visually, "episode II" is great, and it was fun getting to know old, familiar characters better through action.  lucas wisely leaves out the things that made "phantom" weak-- jar jar plays a very minor role, the word "meticlorene" (sp.?) is not mentioned, and there are no jokes involving bodily functions.  "episode II" is strong, and it sets us up for a great adventure in "episode III."  i rated it an 8.

Author: Sofokles
Review: I just saw Star Wars: Episode II. It´s great to see a picture like this on the opening day.

Author: christianparkes
Review_Title: If you see one movie this year, see this one!
Review: Still not quite the original Star Wars, but it tears strips of Episode One.

Author: infiniterecord
Review_Title: Disappointing, a really mediocre film, not up to the saga's high standards
Review: Don't believe the hype - this is *not* the best Star Wars movie since the venerable 'Empire Strikes Back'. It's better than 'Phantom Menace' but then so is flossing your teeth for two and a half hours straight. It's on par with 'Return Of The Jedi' maybe but nowhere near as good as 'A New Hope' and insignificant compared to 'Empire'.

Author: danewby11
Review_Title: Slow start with an out-of-this-world finish!!
Review: The movie started rather slow but quickly picked up pace and finishes at breakneck speed.  I wasn't totally disappointed with the acting by Portman and Christensen but rather the often corny dialogue given.  This Star Wars is light years ahead of Phantom Menace and inspite of it's few flaws, it's an enjoyable movie and more like the Star Wars I watched growing up as a kid.

Author: chris_tann
Review_Title: Awesome! Took me back to the original Star Wars
Review: Absolutely brilliant! The film started quite slowly, and I found that the CG got in the way early on - and I was especially upset to see that Yoda was now down in CG as well! But, as the movie heated up, the action and excitement rose to fever pitch - and the entire cinema errupted when Yoda took on Count Dooku! OK, I forgave them for doing Yoda digitally after that!

Author: stato
Review: Slight spoiler....... I have just seen AOTC and thought that it was a really good film that brings the series back on track.

Author: jjussi_com
Review_Title: Digital version, is that better than analog?
Review: I just came back to home, from watching movie. Digital version of course! Somebody may ask, "was that better, than other (analog)". I would say YES! You get feeling that you are "there", middle of everything, ofcourse if that movie would be projected to inside "half ball" ceiling THEN you get totaly feeling being there! OK, back to movie, (Natalie Portman) Senator Padmé Amidala was pure "sexy", and Yoda's battle scene was something to see... I wouldn't mind to go and see that movie again, right away! ;-)

Author: darininthailand
Review: After seeing Episode I, I was not expected much, but Episode II surprised me.

Author: rapeman_jr
Review: The Obi-Wan story-line was very well done, but the whole Anakin line was a horrendous let-down. I was kind of figuring that his turning would involve someone betraying him, or something along those lines, but as it turns out he's just stupid! 10 years of Jedi training, and all he thinks about is a girl he met when he was 8 (or so). Don't even get me started on how (or why)Jar-Jar got elected as a representative in the Senate..... Overall, I think they spent more time on figuring out effects and visuals than they did on the story and script. Which is really disappointing considering that this is supposed to be the genesis from which the original 3 came from. Hopefully they'll take a little more care in doing the last one. First Phantom, now this...it's not looking very good ...

Author: depauwta
Review_Title: The best movie in the series!
Review: The critics have said that this is a dull, uninteresting story, with uninspired performances and overwhelming CGI graphics.  The critics who report that are missing the boat on the Star Wars phenomenon.  This is Star Wars where the story and the action go hand in hand and predicate each other.  The characters draw you in not by their acting but by their uniqueness and flaws.  Take Boba Fett by example, this character has less than 10 lines in the entire saga, yet is one of the most beloved Star Wars characters.  Jar Jar Binks is universally hated, and what does that say right there?  Usually people can't agree on much at all.  It's difficult to compare performances by any of the artists in these movies.  I'll agree most of Star Wars is hype and marketing, but in the end it lives up to it's billing.  Have you ever noticed that when people talk about the Star Wars movies they say what they like and didn't like, and everyone is instantly part of the conversation.  This is a universal truth that Star Wars has brought together a generation of people.  I don't know anyone who's never seen each of these movies, nor hasn't an opinion on them.  Everyone has they're favorite characters and sometimes they are villains.  As for this movie, it's probably the most compelling, at times its slow and you yearn for the trademark action sequences, but you also feel drawn to the destruction of Anakin.  Hayden Christenson is either a real talent or "The Force" George Lucas did a masterful job of directing him on how to link his performance with Jake LLoyd, there is a strong resemblance, as well as some of the same facial expressions that work well.  Ewan McGregor is much better as ObiWan this time and links his performance to Alec Guiness very well. It will be interesting to see how the relationship between ObiWan and Anakin/Vader unfolds.

Author: ihatecrappymail
Review: Just got back from seeing Episode II a few minutes ago and let me just say I was blown away. Everything is starting to come together now and you'll begin to see how Anakin eventually turns into Vader and how the Empire is born. The action sequences in this film are incredible. The story also develops nicely especially the relationship between Padme and Anakin. I highly recommend seeing this movie. One other thing, don't mess with Yoda!

Author: Steviefull
Review: I have to be honest i didn't mind Phantom Menace, and thought it was harshly dealt with, but that is by the by.

Author: the_darkknight
Review: Portmans acting is a bit poor and over the top. eg lying on the sand moaning and groaning and when asked if she is alright gives a strong "Yes" and jumps up. This got a good laugh when I saw it in the theater yesterday (probably more of a laugh then the R2-D2 & CP3O comedy duet) Some of the CG creatures are a bit poor but the CG Yoda is great. Over all its a great move, and its great to see how its developing towards the situation of the original (A new Hope). Its got romance, mystery, political intrigue, tragedy and revenge and most of its got sci-fi action a plenty

Author: AndersMH
Review_Title: Still not quite back on form, are you Lucas?
Review: As a whole, it's pretty much the same kind of movie as Episode 1; Overly dependent on CG; bad casting and bad acting, as well as very cheesy dialogue.

Author: rockynate
Review: The whole Jar-Jar madness of the last film had my loyalties waning slightly. I imagined the Star Wars saga going the way of the Superfriends when the WonderTwins and Gleek were added.

Author: gpoman
Review_Title: I would give it 6 out of 10
Review: Quit your Whining Anakin???

Author: shorbay1
Review: ...What can I say, unlike Episode I, Episode II actually made me feel like I was watching the Star Wars saga of old.  I don't think anything can make up for the embarasment of the "Phantom Menace", but this movie definitely shows that George Lucas hasn't completely lost his mind!  "Attack of the Clones" was an imaginitive movie that created new worlds and characters in the old Star Wars fashion instead of just recreacting old Star Wars themes and gimics in a dry, uninspired way.  I'm very impressed and I will be going back to watch this one in the theatre more than twice!!!

Author: OllieC
Review_Title: A fast paced action flick with substance to boot.
Review: The first installment of star wars left a lot to be desired and was in George Lucas own words a tad "infantile". Thankfully this has be redressed with Episode II:Attack of the Clones. In AotC the characters introduced in Episode I are fleshed out some more, we catch up on young Padawan Anakin Skywalker, and how he has developed under his Jedi Master Obi-Wan Kenobi (suitably played by Ewan McGregor) as they are assiged to protect Padme ( the beautiful Natalie Portman); the former Queen Amidala from unknown ruffians.The story unfurls steadily towards a dazzling climax, carried in no small part by the sublime special effects ,certainly the most advanced yet seen, and Lucas' trademark dissolves. Lucas has created a magical Universe populated with as diverse and colourful characters as imagination will allow. Whereas Episode I left a sour taste of "scorchio" , Episode II the viewer gagging for a sequal. A thouroughly enjoyable film. And Starwipe to Episode III.

Author: Scatter-brained
Review_Title: My Review Of Attack Of The Clones
Review: Just got back an hour ago! The cinema was packed! When I say packed, I mean packed! I went for the 9:00pm showing, but I turned up at 8:00pm to be safe. There was already a massive queue! But luckily most of the people went to the top left hand side of the cinema, so I got a lovely back row seat on the right side :D

Author: wombatjoe
Review: This is the film most fans were waiting for.  Attack of the Clones returns the series to its original base of fast action, a great story line and interesting characters.

Author: worf473
Review: Though little shallow in plot, it is what movies are supposed to be...ENTERTAINING. Which Phantom Menace wasn't. It is definately worth the wait and when you see the cast of "old friends" in this episode you are reminded of why you loved the orignal series.

Author: Schiffer-1
Review: With a somewhat bland opening scroll I thought I was going to be disappointed.   It sounded more like C-span than Star Wars.   Then there were the first lines of dialogue between Padme and her chief of security that sounded as wooden as a high school production of a comical whodunit. I sat with disgust in my plush stadium theater chair with 32 ounces of artificially flavored lemonade drink and thought that its insipid flavor might be the most enjoyable part of this experience.   Well, I was wrong! Yes, this movie has some faults that are easy to spot; they may even reach distracting and annoying to most fans of the Star Wars saga.  However the compelling action, visual artistry, and mythic scope of the original movie are back and pushed up to modern standards.   This isn't just Star Wars redone, but a Star Wars for those who came to the move to see the trailer for the new Matrix films.   What is the Matrix you ask? Yoda is the Matrix! Yes, as you probably know by now, Yoda is a bigger part of this film and the little green sprite shows why he is afforded so much respect. Lucas has made a film that will satisfy all his fans on some level.  Just remember when C3PO's highly annoying banter is making you hate what Lucas is doing, that the developmentally disabled guy next to me in the theater laughed his ass off.   C3PO will quickly go away for at least a few more scenes of glorious Jedi combat, or perhaps for the harsh moment that turns the heart of a little boy named Boba so ice cold.  When C3PO returns, or Jar-Jar, or whatever, just gloss it over and remember that it is not there for you.   The rest of the film is for you.    Stick to appreciating the parts you like and you will find this one of the most satisfying films in the series.  If you go into this film hating Lucas for Phantom Menace, then you will find faults and you will hate this film.  Just remember, had you never seen Menace, and if this had been the first film after more than a decade of waiting, that you would be singing Lucas's praises as the greatest producer ever. This film establishes several facets that the previous film failed to do. Most importantly is a couple of villains that are more than just the ugly and scary looking threat of Darth Maul.   Sure Maul looked cool, and his moves were a highlight of Menace, but he was just another Jedi warrior with no real character, no real sinister side, a real one-dimensional bad guy. Here we have both Jango Fett, and Count Dooku/ Darth Tyranus.   Jango is a proud father, a cunning warior, and a unique link to the original series. Count Dooku is a villain with charm who can cunningly use lies to seem to be a hero of sorts.   Not only that, but his skills as a dark Jedi seem greater than our young heroes can match.  In Menace we knew our hero's skills were greater than an inept trade federation, and even a more than fair match for Maul.  There was never any threat.   AOTC delivers threats that seems more dire and real. The next improvement is an Anakin that is just about perfect for his part. He is the essence of teenage hormones running amok and as rash and stupid as real teens are.    To adult fans of the series the quick, rash, and sometimes nonsensical romance between Anakin and Padme may seem stilted and false.   Just think back to when you were just learning to date and remember your own rash and nonsensical behavior as a rebellious teen. There is a bit (which would be a spoiler, I will just hint that one of Anakin's actions would probably wind up tried at a tribunal in The Hague) that seemed right for the development of Vader, but comes at a place in the movie where both the audience and Padme must gloss over it and still consider him a hero for the rest of the film. Finally we have a real increase in the wonder factor.    Menace gave us a muppety two-headed alien announcer that talked like ABC sportscasters, more of the same old Hutts, and an annoyingly earthbound, and downright offensive, patois spoken by Jar-Jar.  AOTC gives us a goul/insectoid run robot factory, a waterbound race of supermodel thin, globe-eyed scientists, and a capitol city/planet that takes off where Bladerunner left off.   To be fair, Naboo still looks too much like the renaissance Italy right down to a gondola, and Tatooine isn't exactly a stunningly original local. You still can't ask for much more wonder than an all-out land battle between Jedi, droids, clones, and fearsome alien gladiatorial beasts. All in all Star Wars fans should rejoice and enjoy a fine addition to the series.   If you find this film annoying and faulty, that perhaps you should sell your vacuum-sealed collection of mint in-package Star Wars action figures and go get a real life.

Author: parktek
Review_Title: I found this really starts putting together the pieces
Review: Early critics have already condemned this movie, but do they understand that these movies aren't meant to stand alone.  George Lucas has really taken the time to not only provide great graphics but also provide a story that is well thought out.  My son and I raced home to watch the original Star Wars just to recap all the pieces.  Great Job!

Author: mjjohnstonjr
Review_Title: Still waiting for the excitement from the first series
Review: Disappointed once again.  I know I'll have to go see Episode 3 when it comes out since I am now hooked, but I have to say after these last 2 attempts I'm going in not expecting much.

Author: JUNKMAIL4
Review: Okay, so its actually a terrible movie.  But thats what makes it so good! Like the wretchedly bad Spiderman, this movie's success lies in the unintended laughter it ellicits.  George Lucas' sudden inability to write good dialogue is overshadowed only by his obscene lack of directorial talent.  GIVE ME SPIELBERG!  Though the man is loathe to me, he is good at what he does.  However, the sad turth is, no matter how bad Lucas is, it doesn't matter now; he will still make millions off of each piture, in ticket sales, rentals, and of course, merchandising.  Already, my home is flooded with Republic Gunships and Jedi and Clone troopers.  And thats just the beginning.  SOon come the myriad Lucasarts games, all of which will be terrible (note: some releases have been good, see Rogue Squadron or the X-Wing/Tie Fighter games.)  Thus, Lucas is confident that no matter how bad he doe with Star Wars, it will be successful.  And apparently, his actors know this too.  From Natalie Portman to Samuel L. Jackson to Hayden Christensen, and yes, even Ewan MacGregor, every actor/ess in this movie is talented to the extreme.  See Natalie in Heat or The Professional, see Samuel L. Jackson in Pulp Fiction or Jackie Brown, see Hayden Christensen in Life as a House, see Ewan MacGregor in Trainspotting or Moulin Rouge, all display fine talent.  So why do they all sleep through this movie? Similarily, what the hell was wrong with Ewan and Liam Neeson in Episode One?   Have you ever seen Rob Roy?  Liam!   Come on!  All the actors in these movies wander about aimlessly, delivering the terrible lines, which they do have the power to make work, with equally terrible skill.  And I'm not even going to discuss Christopher "Count Dooku" Lee.

Author: The Agent 0f God
Review_Title: The cunning rise of both the Dark side and the Empire !!!
Review: This film is what good Science Fiction really is about. It has a mesmerizing plot, great characters and interesting predicaments. It is filled with nice exotic places to visit, mind boggling action sequences and a very pleasant mood to it all. George Lucas' Episode 2 masterfully succeeds to get the Star Wars series back on the right track, compensates for the mediocre Episode 1 and will entertain even those unfamiliar to this far away Galaxy. The dark pieces, vital to the empire's rise are slowly and Insidiously coming together. There also are so many, SO MANY established or "will be" bad guys, it's no wonder the honourable Jedi knights will sadly be exterminated. The dark times are coming...

Author: blood_thief
Review_Title: A visual feast that puts Episode I to shame.
Review: I used to be a hard-core Star Wars fan. Hell, I grew up with it. But when Episode I came out, the disappointment- combined with the saturation of licensing, truly put out the light for me. I couldn't stand Star Wars after that. Sure I still liked it, but I had immersed myself so much in the release of the new film that it actually left a negative effect on me. In fact, I had no idea when Episode II was coming out until about a week ago.

Author: fuyumang
Review_Title: Star Wars is now OFFICIALLY back!!!
Review: This movie was awesome. While Anakin's acting was bad in the beginning of the movie, but he turned it around with a good performance the rest of the movie.It had kick ass fights, and not just 1v1. Its final battle was huge, epic, realistic, and just incredible. It kicks the butt out of last movie's massive army battle. It has great plot, and Anakin is a pimp, he just keeps putting the moves on Padme until he got a result. The twist is great and the set-up is incredible. It also show a bit of common society for the first time in star wars history, giving a the best feel for the ground roots of the star wars universe. Great, great movie!!!! I am going to see it at least a few times. Phantom of the Menace may not have had the true star wars feel, but this definately has it. It is probably either the third or second best star wars movie.

Author: pepsidate
Review: aside from the bad actings, the real problem lies with the bad dialogues. i mean come on, the script is so bad, it makes rollerball's "pow" look good. lines such as "i truly deeply love you," or "i hate them" just don't work in their respective moments. then there's dooku... who's nothing more than a 70 year old guy with lightsaber. was he really necessary to the franchise? other than that, the effects were pretty cool i thought but they couldn't save the movie. overall, im left with another disappointment.

Author: crdone8
Review: I would first like to categorize my comments by saying that I would rate myself as a big star wars fan but not a fanatic. I don't know if that makes me less critical than others but I loved this movie. Like most I was disappointed with Phantom Menace when I saw it in the theater. Since viewing it on DVD repeatedly, I would say it has gotten much better with each viewing. Yes Jar Jar can get annoying, but hey who doesn't have a friend that doesn't get on their nerves once in a while? That being said, I think that Attack of the Clones was a great movie. Right up their with my personal favorite, Empire Strikes Back. I will not try to summarize everything for you. I would primarily like to say to everyone who is saying that this doesn't rate with episodes IV or V: go back and watch them again. I think maybe you've forgotten how less than perfect they were. Just think of Luke whining about going into town when Uncle Owen wants him to do chores. It is comically bad. So all the criticism about the love scenes etc I think are way overly critical. For me, this movie worked, even worked great. Lighten up and have fun.

Author: Eagle4015
Review_Title: I don't care what the critics say, I loved it!
Review: I was so excited to see this movie i didnt get any sleep the night before. I have to admit that there were a few slow parts but what movie doesnt have those.  I wont go into plot because you can find that anywhere but regardless of what ppl are saying on here there is a plot and it is carried along decently.  But the action is where this film realy shines.  There are great chase sequences, huge armies, and of course lightsaber battles.  If you have ever wanted to see more of the lesser known Jedi's and their talents you will love this movie. I give it ****1/2 out of *****.

Author: saynotogop
Review_Title: Not quite up to Empire Strikes Back or Return of the Jedi, but as good as A New Hope and much better than the Phantom Menace.
Review: Very gripping film.  Blows away Episode I.  Perhaps the most dramatic of any Star Wars film, well acted by all.  Excellent use of comic relief (though C-3PO uses puns a little too much) far better than non-stop Jar-Jar in Episode I.  Overall, very, very good.

Author: tisfan
Review: Everything that was wrong with Phantom is cleared up.  The actors are better at their parts (and Anakin is much better as an adult then a kid), Jar Jar is mostly absent (and a little better spoken when he is on stage), the battles are cooler, the plot faster and less "aaaaw, isn't annie a cute kid".  The lines between Amidala and Anakin are a little stiff, but hey, I wasn't very suave when I was nineteen either... heh.  But the way they look at each other.  It is to die for.  And the music, especially the Imperial March (Vader's Theme) haunts Anakin through the film, to the best sceen, where it thunders across the theater.  Wow!  (It was much better than Cats, I'm going to see it again and again)

Author: pauljenkins
Review: Great story, great acting, great dialogue, great scenery and great effects.

Author: pittsburghdave
Review_Title: Not as good as Episode I
Review: Now before you start tuning up, let me get my story finished. I was in the clear minority thinking PM was not that bad..Dont get me wrong, AOTC is great. It just takes too long to get there.. The first half of the movie is really slow.. Finally, it gets going, and it really ends with a bang. Its nice to have just the one piece remaining(Ep III), so now we can say... "How are they going to do this". I will agree with some of the things I have seen already.. George is trying to put in too much. Some of the lines in this script are almost too hammy. There are times when he needs to heed by the idea of "less is more".What made the  first trilogy so terrific, was that you felt what you were watching was  truly about another place, another time.. Here again, just like with the pod race, there are human conventions, trying to make things seem more familiar.These aren't really needed.. John Williams score again is great. Not quite the power of EP I, but the music in the grand finale was really moving. The plusses here were the transformation of Anakin.. You could really see what will turn him in the next chapter. Also, Yoda is incredible!!! When you see him wielding a lightsaber, you'll go nuts!.. His attitude is wonderful in this chapter.. He really takes control of the Jedi council, and acts more as a leader than you have ever seen. This chapter also begins to explain a lot of lore of the first trilogy.. I dont want to give anything away, but prepare to have questions answered. The only real con I have for Episode II is that it cant seem to get out of first gear, But once it gets going... HANG ON!!! 7 out of 10

Author: freedom450
Review: This movie was 100 times better than Episode I. Anakin was typical adolescent trying to find his place in the world, so it is easy to see why he would be tempted by the Darkside. Yoda is now my idol. He just goes to show that the best things come in small packages. YODA RULES!!!!! He has one of the best fight scenes.

Author: orgar23
Review_Title: My view of Star Wars Episode 2
Review: After seeing this film i just wanted to see it again. This is more like it, unlike Episode 1 this time its Star Wars. This latest film has more depth and a much better story more like the original films. This one isnt just for the kids it a great action adventure story. The Jedi fight scenes are great bringing all the excitement of the earlier films. My favorite scene has to be Master Yodas fight near the end of the film. I seemed to drag a little in the middle with the romance scenes and most of the kids in the cinema were beginning to get a little impatient, but it is well made up for with the rest of the film. I cant wait now for Episode 3 but its not going to be out until 2005. This is a must see film for anyone, even if your not a Star Wars fan you will love it. i am going to see it again as soon as possible.

Author: sammy_porras
Review: I just saw Star Wars: Attack of the Clones.

Author: nickclabbers
Review: One word: ACTION No jar jar (oke 2 short scenes) not to much love scenes and yoda who fights against the dark side what do you want more?

Author: monkee_
Review_Title: Bring in the Clowns, Bring in the Clones...
Review: hollow dialogue, winded love scenes, but Yoda rocked?!?  Did you feel this way too?  George give up writing man!  Windu the purple light saber makes me feel as though you're working your way toward a red saber...?  A Jedi is selfless did you need to have a purple saber so badly to see yourself? Hmm, all in all we've grown far more mature than our childhood fantasys.  I loved the effects, I wanted to love the characters but couldn't alas, George, I will only see the next one because I have to.

Author: stewart-23
Review_Title: A better script and this might have been the best one yet!
Review: There are so many mixed reviews of Episode 1, but my stance is that it was pretty poor. I came out of the cinema wanting to like it and went back 2 times in an attempt to enjoy it, but at the end of the day was left cold. The dialogue was clunky and poorly delivered by pretty much everyone, Obi Wan was stiff (ooer) and uncharismatic, the Young Anikin was just young and unintresting, Ja Ja Binks was annoying, the Pod Race wasn't as exciting as it should have been and the end was absurd with Anakin saving the day by complete accident! The main saving grace was Darth Maul and the lightsabre battle, but it was not enough for me to save the film from being a major disappointment.

Author: rodviking
Review_Title: Certainly better than Episode I and a true Star Wars movie!!
Review: If you're a Star Wars fan, you won't be disappointed with this movie. It seems that George Lucas learned the lesson with Episode I and brought back the action and thrill on this one.

Author: Hatrenith
Review_Title: The original vision of Lucas is back and in full swing. (Spoiler Warning!!)
Review: In ep 4 obi wan (alec Guinness) is in the millenium Falcon with Han solo and Chewbacca, and when they drop out of hyperspace where alderan should be and its all an astroid belt, (because the death star blew it up) the tie fighter attacks the ship, and flys off...

Author: numbersix
Review: While this one was better than the first, it was still poorly acted and paced way too slowly. There were too many times you could tell that it was just a guy acting in an empty room. There were at least a couple action scenes that were either direct references to other Star Wars movies or completely gratuitous.  Heck, even the actors sounded bored.

Author: MartinRandall
Review_Title: Great visuals, lots of action but not without minor flaws..
Review: This action-packed sequel to Phantom Menace is leaps and bounds ahead of the previous film. Where to start? The most impressive thing for me was the CGI rendition of Yoda. He's noticably different from previous films - being more animated and expressive than a hand-puppet could ever be. He gets some brilliant scenes, especially towards the end of the film where he's ordering clone warriors and fighting against the estranged Jedi, Count Dooku.

Author: mailmarki
Review: Star Wars Attack of the clones seems Soulles and Fake. I am afraid george lost the spirit he had in the early 80's. The picture is so full of fake looking CG senes , instead of Lucasfilm the Silicon Graphics Logo should be displaid at the beginning

Author: achitophel7
Review_Title: The Latest Star Wars: Fun or Flop?
Review: ** Very minor spoilers, be warned **

Author: MovieInATeaCup
Review: Here's the gist of it...

Author: dfoo
Review: This movie was what the Phantom Menace was supposed to be. Minor flaws but a good movie nonetheless. A must see for everyone. Not only was it a good story, but visually it was stunning. Cant wait for the third episode in this epic saga.

Author: thewaas
Review_Title: George's got it back on track that certainly isn't a cloned film!
Review: Attack of the Clones is simply not as good as Star Wars, but then again that's our problem..... we are expecting the impact of A New Hope. But this is Star Wars in 2002. The special effects are outstanding. The crew has to win the special effects oscar or I'm going to cut my feet off!! Obi Wan flying through the air dangling off an assassin droid is simply a new achievement in special effects. Hayden Christensen shows off a fantastic talent, especially in his reunion with his mother. Superb. Portman's acting is a little wooden especially in the "by the fire" scene. But what points she loses in acting, she more than makes up for with sensual, lingering looks & fantastic costumes (well done the costume dept). It's in this film that we first get a taste of everybodies favourate Star Wars character. Although he's still only a young child, he still manages to give off a "I wouldn't mess with me if I were you" aura. Boba Fett of course is being bought up by himself (or rather he's a clone of his older, slower self), that is Jango Fett. & Yoda..... wow. Imagine a squashed, green, angry Bruce Lee & you've got everyones favourate Dagobah resident. Just cool! Well done George for jetesoning (One of his favourate words)the tight plastic atmosphere of Episode 1 & making Episode 2 one of the best films of the year! Finally, is Dooku good or bad? I'm sure there's a couple more surprises up Master Lucas' rather big Jedi cloak sleeves.

Author: Puressence
Review_Title: Someone please stop him making Episode III like this.
Review: Where do I begin.  I'm dazed, and slightly confused.  Let me, like many others, set my stall out right here.  I am a massive Star Wars fan.  The brilliance is there for all to see.  I loved mainly the human aspect of the original trilogy, the emotion, the wit and the passion for what they believed in.  When The Phantom Menace was released, I was overjoyed with spectacle of the thing.  It created the scene for what was going to happen, in a distant kind of way.  Even the universally hated Jar Jar Binks couldn't stop me from really appreciating what this film was trying to achieve.  Still, as the months passed I lost interest in that film and started to see it's bad points too.

Author: r_jarmain
Review: Some great sequences, and a more of story than Episode One.  Hayden Christensen is great as an arrogant and naive teenager with occasional glimpses into the dark side of his character;  Natalie Portman is equally rounded as the growing politician who is also discovering her own feelings and some of the complexities of people around her.

Author: DarthCaliber
Review: A++ A perfect 4 stars!

Author: moose2002
Review_Title: What the audiences wanted to see...
Review: A quick note saying that this Star Wars episode is excellent!  Granted, Star Wars is just a movie and doesn't consume my life (like it does for so many others), but Episode II compares to that of The Empire Strikes Back.  The acting is decent, the dialogue is typical "Star Wars" dialogue, but the action sequences and special effects are fantastic.  For the special effects alone, this movie is worth the $9.

Author: crouchingotter
Review: It seems that people can either come out of the cinema loving or hating "Attack of the Clones". Personally I think it all depends on the expectations a person takes into the cinema.

Author: jeffyjones
Review_Title: A visual feast, questions answered, questions created
Review: I can see why the critics wouldn't be pleased with the movie (though popularity is always a reason for them not to like something) in that it may not stand up by itself. It really needs to be considered in the context of the series.

Author: dbhauck
Review: I'm so sick and tired of people, regardless of whether or not they liked the movie, say "well, the special effects were great." Garbage! It's great for animation, but I didn't come to see Toy Story 3. Yoda is a damn puppet, and he should stay that way. Instead, he and all the other aliens look like phony CG characters that I CARE NOTHING ABOUT! And the stormtroopers? How is it that 20 years ago, Lucas was able to use REAL people for stormtroopers, and now all he uses is CG, which looks horrible! I dare someone to say that the epic battle at the end of the film looked more convincing than the battle on the ice world of Hoth.

Author: bridgestar
Review: This was a great movie, as far as the original 3 go this is close to return of the jedi in quality...

Author: wineguy2001
Review: The dialogue and acting were average, the story was better than average and showed an intelligence unseen in the Phantom Menace, and Jar Jar was barely visable (this is a good thing). One scene made me realise why the first three were better than the last two. The short order cook was the first character that seemed real, the first character we could recognize as a personality that we could relate too. Everyone else is so uptight, distanced, and shut off. There is no princess Leia or Han Solo in this. This one fact makes it hard to relate to the story, to become immersed in it. The characters fail to create the suspension of disbelief that made us all fall in love with the fairy tale that was Star Wars.

Author: gromitsprinkles
Review: What a piece of baloney! After all the hype, after the hassle of getting (expensive) tickets, I went with my girls ages 11 and 7.  Don't get me wrong - I was a HUGE fan of the first three (chaps. 4 thru 6) movies.

Author: djlando
Review: Well hi there,

Author: capttravis
Review_Title: Fast paced, slow dialogue, great connections.
Review: With the latest Star Wars film, the second trilogy is really beginning to show up.  I promise I won't give away any surprises, but there are some fantastic connections to the original trilogy.  Those out there who are true Star Wars buffs will really notice many of these.  Thanks to new computer technology, there are also some great opportunities to see some "old" characters do some new tricks.  No more hints - if you see it you'll know what I mean!  With the fantastic, epic action to parallel scenes in films like Braveheart and Gladiator, its hard to notice how sloppy the writing and dialogue are.  Amidala and Anikin's relationship is stunted and awkward, and the relationship between Skywalker and Obi-Wan is equally ill-written. But regardless, from the great music to the fantastic action to the multitude of connections this movie completes, it far surpasses it's Phantom Menace predecessor.

Author: randage
Review: This movie really impressed me. After the let down that was Episode I, I wasn't sure if this one was gonna be worth while. Then I heard my friends rave about it, and then I saw it, and loved what I saw.

Author: Ash_Housewares
Review: This film is not just a film, it is a landmark, everything about it is amazing, the fx, the acting and the plot are the best features. One thing to do when you see it is to look out for young characters who eventually would grow up to be the characters from the original trilogy. I would get anyone to see this film, it is a real pleaser to see that Lucas really does still know how to make good films. BRING ON EPISODE 3!!

Author: jamiemacman
Review: SPOILER INSIDE! I admit, the hype took me in and the first time I saw it I couldn`t help but be disappointed. The dialogue and acting was wooden, and the middle section of the film seemed to drag. But I kept faith with Mr Lucas, and returned to view it again. This time, wow! The special effects were even more impressive as different facets, especially of Coruscant caught your eye. The dialogue was pure Star Wars - much "I have a bad feeling about this" etc. And even the romance angle did not grate, appearing quite sweet. But what had not changed was the feelings the last half hour brought from me, what with Yoda proving his worth as Jedi Master (at last!), Mace Windu kicking ass, and the first appearance of the Clone (Storm)Troopers and most impressively, the Star Destroyers. The acting also seemed better this time, maybe I`d just accepted it was Star Wars not Shakespeare. Watch this film, and then watch it again to get what you missed - which will be a lot! Mr Frodo Baggins,the gauntlet is laid.

Author: duveenceli
Review_Title: The force is strong in Jedi Lucas!
Review: This movie was excellent!  Episode 1 was a great fall for Lucas, and in my opinion did not even deserve the title Star Wars near it!  However Star Wars: Episode II - ATOTC was a bounce back that only the masters of Jedi could accomplish. All around me I hear how it was to mushy, well HELLO the first three are basically the story of Anikin's transformation into the totally dark Darth Vader.  The mushy, the sentimental are what pushes him over the edge, they are what makes up Darth Vader. As for the Acting, I hear Wussy, and weak and so on.  However If you look at the original triology, look at Luke.  I can see it all come together. Luke was over emotional too, a bit of a whinner, but when pushed, WATCH OUT! So maybe with that in mind it may be a little clearer. I read a comment about Obi being weak because he hasn't caught on about Anikin.  All I have to say is quoted from Master Yoda "The darkness it all clouds." So to all you people that are Ep I lovers and degrade this movie, in the words of my beloved "Go home, put on your Jar Jar pj's and go to bed!" -ME

Author: yog_sothoth
Review: To see how far things have fallen, watch "Attack of the Clones" and then watch the real Star Wars.  I am trying to imagine Star Wars being directed in the flat, lifeless way that Lucas managed to mangle AOTC.  Play this in your head- Darth Vader saying "Tear this ship apart until you have found those plans, and get me the passengers, I want them alive!" in the monotone that everyone uses in "Attack of the Clones."  Ugh! Oh, and the real sets and locations in 1977 look much better than digital ones do in 2002.  The film quality in 1977 was also superior to the digital mess that Lucas used to shoot "Attack of the Clones" as well.

Author: mapped
Review_Title: It's missing that intangible "something" that makes a great movie
Review: The story of Star Wars (episode 4) just blew me away when I first watched the movie at age 12. The subsequent movies did not disappoint. When Episode 1 came along 3 years ago I liked it while most people seemed to dislike it. I tried not to have expectations going into this showing at 8 am this morning. But, 1/2 hour into the movie I could just feel that it was missing something.

Author: tlmelk
Review: The movie is excellent.  Action sequences very believable.  Doesn't suffer from the prolong sequences of CG that made parts of Episode I a little unbelievable.  The problem with critics is that they don't consider the movie in leu of the other 4 films.  In this light, the movie is nearly perfect.  Lucas fills in many of the plot and character gap and sets us up for the fall of Skywalker.  I'm sure after Episode III we will all be in amazement how Lucas crafted this space opera that has spanned 50 years on screen and 30 years in our lives.

Author: dvader234
Review: WOW! This movie ranks the 4th best Star Wars Series. The first is A New Hope, come on it's the original. Well anyway, Attack of the Clones Rocks! Christopher Lee plays spectacularly as the role of Count Dooku. Hayden Christiensen brings darkness and evil to the person, Anakin. Ewan McGregor plays Anakin's father-figure jedi master. But Yoda. Oh Yoda. Yoda kicks Lee's a$$, it's so funny. He's flipping and rolling and slashing at this guy. But it's so short. Another good actor is Temuera Morrison, he plays great as Jango Fett, even though he doesn't have many lines as he should, but his action parts make up for it. C-3PO is hilarious. Just keep your eye out. But, do yourself a favor and see this huge breakthrough in American Filmmaking. Take your kids, or your wife or girlfriend, or even take a bunch of your pals. It's one of those movies, you have a great time with. So see Star Wars - Episode II: Attack of the Clones in theaters now! Have fun! I know you will.

Author: marcnut
Review_Title: Movie made for Star Wars Fans
Review: While you see a lot of mixed reviews on the movie, we must not forget that this movie is made for star wars fan not the critics.  Thus if you are a fan you will enjoy it.  The effects and action are at its best and while we see very poor acting for Hayden Christianson, Natalie Portman and Ewen Mcgregor light up the screen.  What is also great about this movie is the links between this and the original trilogy. All together great film, minus Anakin Skywalker who needs up a bit more education on acting, as he lacks in his abilities to make us believe he is the next darth vader, as well he has no on screen chemistry with Natalie Portman.

Author: GrahamPatrick
Review_Title: The force is strong with this one...
Review: An amazing acheivement.

Author: Gnurkel
Review_Title: Luckily no Jar-Jar and kiddie-ani, but still 3D galore and low on characters
Review: 3D animation has taken quantum leaps the last few years and this film knows to use it. Not only background and starfighters are smooth and realistic, but fighting monsters and flabby bartenders are created with believability.

Author: deaneyre
Review: What was the true attraction of the original Star Wars?  The awesome and unstoppable power of Darth Vader.  The whole story revolves (rightly) around him.  Although fairly interesting, the `creating of Darth Vader' can logically never be as riveting as the fully mature version.  Which would you prefer to watch, Macbeth in action at the peak of his career or Macbeth as a young lad unsure of where his future lies?  That's why regardless of the depths (or lack) of creative story-telling in these three 'prequels', all will fall short of the final (original) version.  At best it can be a suspense-filled build up to the full monty.

Author: selymen
Review: Well, it feels good to finally see the plot getting thicker and better. Episode 1 had left me hungry. This one makes me want to see the next one right now!! Yes, there is lot of battles and a lot of digital effects, however they never get annoying. The critics are complaining about dialogues. When it's moving and happening on the screen, how much more do you need to understand the story? Lucas never pretended he was reinventing the wheel of story telling.

Author: ska_aholic_1999
Review: George Lucas, after a dreadful attempt with The Phantom Menace, is back in original form with Attack of the Clones.  Clones is simply the best of the Star Wars saga since The Empire Strikes Back.

Author: MrSINISTER
Review_Title: Hmmmm....how do I call this one?
Review: Ok...let me start by saying that I am total Star Wars fan. I grew up with the ANH, ESB and ROTJ and LOVED them all (even ROTJ)!!!

Author: spiritshaman
Review_Title: The best movie ever in Star Wars
Review: It is the BEST movie in Star Wars ever. I loved all of it. Great visual effects. Great story. Great characters. I loved the new planets Genosis and especially Kamino. Fantastic wild opening scenes with Obi Wan,Anakin and Zam Wessel in the air of Coruscant. Fantastic lightsaberfights with Yoda especially - impressive fighting skills he has:-)Hayden Christensen,Ewan McGregor and Christopher Lee were great.

Author: mrlee-1
Review_Title: Sadly it lacks the "feeling" of the old Star Wars trilogy.
Review: I saw "Attack of the Clones" hoping it would be a better movie than "The Phantom Menace" and I would have to say that it is, but that does not automatically make it a good Star Wars movie. "Attack of the Clones" suffers from big problems.

Author: JKat316
Review: After seeing Star Wars Episode 2, I can say that I was very pleased with the entire movie. It provides plenty of action, mystery, and a love story. This segment sets up Episode 3 very well in Anakin's character development, and while people know the result of this trilogy, the means to which that is accomplished is what really brings people to the theater. Oh yeah, and the light sabers.

Author: surfinsammy
Review_Title: I like the Phantom Menace Better
Review: I saw this film today and was disappointed. The dialog was really bad at the beginning. Natalie Portman has done better work than this (Where The Heart Is). I didn't like Hayden Christinsen either. The fight scenes were done before and it's just ho hum now. There was nothing really that got me involved in this movie. I liked the Phantom Menace because it had Liam Neeson and he is a fine actor. If Jar Jar Binks would have not been as much in the Phantom Menace it would have been better. The Yoda fight was awesome and was the highlight of the movie. George has not made any of the movies as good as The Empire Strikes Back. He did try to do this movie like the Empire, but to me he fell short.

Author: Nathan_42
Review: I was expecting it to be pretty good, but this totally surpassed my expectations.  I've never been more excited while watching a movie. People throw around the term "Jaw Dropping" a lot, but by the time I walked out of that theater, my jaw was SORE.  It was everything i could do to not make little squeals of joy during the more amazing points.

Author: Craig Kinney
Review_Title: Episode II: Accomplishment of the Clones
Review: Never has a film delivered so fully upon my expectations.  Grand, grand filmmaking, brilliantly executed, imminently watchable, full of thought, full of the spirit of the enterprise.  This coming from a person who is very anti-computer generated effects, a person who believes the magic of the first movies relied on the winning formula of fantastic ideas added to real situations, resulting in a perfect movie.  With the cg effects, I felt the film would feel too cartoonish, too distant, and harder to relate to.  I still much prefer real costumes to computer imagery, but Lucas is a visionary, and he has created a brilliant film.  What is most appealing to me is the love story, despite what is being reported it is exceptionally well-done, and the dialogue is superb as well.  Some critics do not realize that Anakin and Padme are from two stern backgrounds, and their feelings of love are forbidden, so to have that kind of connection between them they respond with their hearts and their glances.  The whole series from the beginning left the largest elements in simplicity, like the force, the light and the dark, and in simplicity it is easier to relate to.  The same with their love, it is something everyone has felt, it is both a gift and a curse for them because of their situation, and we relate by how well they portray it in their dialogue and behavior.  Hayden Christensen does an exceptional job of portraying Anakin, in fact he IS Anakin.  He portrays the arrogance that leads to the dark side, and the love and compassion that make him such a tormented being, the one who eventually let's Luke know that Luke `was right' in knowing that he still had good in him.  Natalie Portman is not only beautiful, but a marvelous character in the film, who plays the stern side of politics along with the side of love and compassion exceptionally well, fitting Hayden's emotions of love and anger perfectly.  No wonder Hayden was chosen for the part, they have real chemistry on screen.  The scene where Anakin first shows some signs of his power and anger is incredible, a scene that really puts the point across, and helps us identify with his character and the grandness of Lucas' story.    Ewan McGregor is a captivating lead, one who carries the film with considerable ease, much like his predecessor the great Alec Guinness.  He is wise and powerful, yet burdened and somewhat overshadowed by his brave young Jedi apprentice. Lucas' pacing is exceptional, the transitions, the light to dark, the dark to light, the screen fades, the handling of his material: grand enough to encompass the whole galaxy, minute enough to trace the details of love between the two leads, and the disdain of a wise leader, seeing the arrogance in his young apprentice turning to something more horrible than he can possibly imagine.

Author: jtarker
Review: As a Gen-Xer, I was one of many to grow up on the Star Wars franchise.  We had and actually used the lunchboxes.  Wiffle bats were our lightsabers. We saw a few neighborhood girls with slightly twisted parents even try that Princess Leia spiral-pigtail-in-stereo thing on their daughters, and at the time we thought it was actually cool.

Author: jason6820012001
Review: In the old Star Wars movies the characters had personality.  Princess Leah was a bitch-on-ice, and it was great watching her interact with a sarcastic Han Solo or a naïve Luke Skywalker.  Darth Vader was a nasty, evil villain and everybody wanted to be like him.  Come on, admit it, he stole the show. And for the most part, the special effects were used only to help tell a clever, witty, almost inspirational, over-the-top story.

Author: tcransone
Review: Much better than Episode I.  I enjoyed the whole movie with the exception of Hayden Christensen.  His performance seemed forced and very much over the top.  He must be an alumni of the William Shatner school of acting.  The best part of the film has to be Yoda kicking some serious butt.

Author: d_del_re
Review: All us Star wars fans were all a little disappointed with "The Phantom Menace", but George Lucas has cast off all of the bad memories of his last flick with "Attack of the Clones"

Author: geocam
Review_Title: Really develops the Star Wars Universe
Review: The story line is really grabbing, the over-the-top acting of Jar-Jar is toned down, but the 1930's Saturday Serial sense of fun is still there. Some fine tuning from Episode I and Mr. Lucas is back on track. I might add that the digital sets are fantastic in every scene, the story is propelled by fantastic action scenes and the characters are well developed. In short, I loved it!

Author: corranjedi
Review_Title: Don't believe the critics, this one was great!
Review: Besides what the critics might have said, I loved this movie down to the very last second. While still showcasing a little choppy dialogue that is somewhat characteristic of Lucas, the movie was still a thrill to watch. The fifth installment in a series of six movies, this one managed to make good on what its predecessor didn't. One noticable improvement can be seen in Anakin Skywalker.  While still not the greatest acting ever seen, Hayden Christensen does a much better job on the character than Jake Lloyd did.  While Anakin in "The Phantom Menace" came off as poorly acted kid hero, Anakin in this movie comes off how he should, a teenager who is slowly turning to the dark side. After seeing the movie twice, I can safely say that the critics were over critical of the acting. On to the movie itself.  While some accuse the first two hours being to slow and boring, I never found that to be true.  Anytime the movie would start to drag, something exciting happened, which kept you wanting to see more. Then there is the last half hour of the movie.  One of the greatest parts of any movie I have ever seen, it gives a little taste of everything, including some humor that involves R2-D2 and C-3PO.  The last half hour also showcases some of the most amazing visual effects ever shown.  The realistic looking CGI Yoda is a testament to the time spent on making the visual effects look real.  And don't get me wrong, the effects through the first two hours are amazing too.  The sound is also done quite well, and helps to immerse in the picture even more.  I would say this movie is a shoo in for Best Visual Effects and Best Sound Editing Oscars, as have many of the other Star Wars movies.  ILM and Skywalker Sound show why the are considered to be one of the best in the business. All in all, this movie is a great one, and worth seeing many times. I've already seen it twice, and I can't wait to see it more.

Author: rizzuto
Review: Great movie!! Totally Star Wars!! For me, the most exciting aspect of the film is all the linkage to the original 3 movies. You know what will happen eventually, but it is cool to see how we are going to get there.  Its fun to speculate where episode III will take us. Can't wait!!

Author: greyteeth
Review_Title: Four words: Yoda is a legend
