Review: Episode 1 one was baaad. Episode II is good. Especially Yoda. He is my hero. See this movie, despite being nowhere near as witty scriptwise as classics like ep.V, at least there is no Jar Jar! yay for Yoda!

Author: menikrudy
Review: I was very impressed with episode II: attack of the clones. I thought it was alot better than "the phantom menace" it was full of action and new and awesome scenes, that were nothing like any in the other StarWars flicks. I am looking forward to Episode III, only 4 years away.............

Author: YuryS
Review: Brilliant! Vader always was a mysterious and fascinating character for me. This film shows how and why Anakin starts on the path that brought him to the dark side. It's an excellent drama and it stands right next to Episode V, which I think is the best.

Author: bigpapathump
Review_Title: Better than Episode I, but a far cry from Han and Chewie.
Review: It was good, it wasn't great. George Lucas should strictly be an idea factory--spitting out the great, general plot lines--and leave the script writing to those who know what they're doing. There were several lines in this movie that stank of cheese--they were just plain stupid (The Christopher Lee line to Yoda at the end being the most memorable example of crap). It was George Lucas TRYING to make it cool. He can't do that. The first three movies didn't TRY, they just WERE.         GOOD NEWS: JarJar is quite scarce in this film. BAD NEWS: Believe it or not (and this may be a spoiler) but C-3PO seems to fill JarJar's void. WHAT THE...? Did anyone else notice the Sound of Music shot in the love sequence on Naboo? I think even John Williams made reference to it in the first few notes of the score. So, i give it a 7. It really was a good movie, but they just don't make 'em like they used to. And that's another thing. One of the coolest things about the first three movies was the muppets. Why use computers just because you can? The CGI Yoda doesn't even compare to the muppet. I remember when i was little, I thought Yoda was a real little creature living in the swamp on Dagobah. Now, every little kid going to see Star Wars now will spot the CGI in an instant. I personally have more respect for the skill and ingenuity of making a puppet look real than for letting a computer do all the work. Show some respect for the late Mr. Hinsen.

Author: izjulesiz
Review: George Lucas has done a great job of keeping the story intact from Episodes IV, V and VI.  I do admit I am a diehard Star Wars fan and have been for 25 years.  I was able to see one of the first viewings of Attack of the Clones and the audience was completely into the movie, cheering, clapping and almost giving Yoda a standing O.

Author: chaos3ngineer
Review: Much as I wanted them to be wrong, I couldn't help but give some credit to the reviews I'd read of this movie, which at best damned it with faint praise ('well, it's better than the last one...') and at worst dismissed it completely as an unfathomable, soulless exercise in expensive FX and bad acting.  Surely, even if they were overly critical, there must be some truth to these appraisals?  I enjoyed The Phantom Menace, but had to concede some of the points made by its detractors.  Would this be just another 'fun, but flawed' piece of sci-fi fluff?  I'd hoped for so much more, especially after Lord Of The Rings had delivered so spectacularly. Well... I'm not sure exactly how to put this... but not only was this film better than Fellowship Of The Ring, it may well be the best Star Wars film of them all.  I left the cinema dizzy with elation, hairs on end as they had been throughout the last 2½ hours.  Take your pick of superlatives - awe-inspiring, epic, captivating, enchanting, riveting, breathtaking, spectacularly beautiful... it is all of these and more.  The characters are solid and often intriguing - in Ewan McGregor's Obi Wan Kenobi we have a classic action hero who could be the prototype Jedi; Hayden Christensen as Anakin Skywalker is a complex, often brooding figure for whom we can all feel some empathy.  With his innocent beginnings, the descent into the Dark Side and eventual redemption which are to come, this phase of Anakin's life completes the cycle of classic tragic hero.  Natalie Portman makes Amidala into more than just a love interest, truly convincing as the future mother of Princess Leia.  The supporting cast is crammed with memorable performances, from the (very!) animated Yoda and the righteous Mace Windu to Jango Fett and the menacingly powerful Count Dooku.  The many worlds are bustling with all manner of alien life, charming and menacing at turns. The special effects... they need no introduction, except to say they are more convincing than computer generated images have ever been before.  Nothing breaks the spell. Were there any flaws?  I suppose there must have been.  Flaws as seen in the original trilogy, and as seen in Fellowship, and a thousand other films heaped with unconditional critical praise.  The critics must have had their own agenda in slating this film - I feel most sorry for those who claimed they couldn't follow the plot.  Perhaps they need to reconsider their choice of career, because the magic of cinema can rarely have been in such evidence as it is here - if it eludes you, it's your loss.

Author: smorgan1774
Review_Title: Not as weak as the Phantom Menace but still weak...
Review: I admit it wasn't as bad as the last movie but the movie is at best mediocre.  The charm of the first movie, a New Hope, was the one story line of the little band of heroes just escaping from one scrape to another and finally ending with the big Death Star climax.  In Empire, we got two story lines, Han, Leia and gang and Luke and Yoda.  Again, Han just escapes from one scrape to another and Luke face Vader and loses.  Great stuff.  Jedi had three story lines.  Lando and the fleet, Han & the Ewoks, Luke and Vader on the station.  It was a bit much but it worked.  Weaker than its predecessors but it was still good.

Author: bedan
Review: This movie was absolutely stunning. Amazing visuals and great feeling all through the movie. I went to this movie completely open-minded not having seen a single trailer or even read a review. I'm glad I didn't.

Author: hojaboja
Review_Title: What's missing? Jar Jar. Woo Hoo!!
Review: I saw this movie while in the States for a short stay.  Opening night in Kentucky lacked all the colorful characters of a big city openening, but none of the excitement.

Author: The Ginger Prince
Review: Standing in the queue to see this movie gave me butterflies like a 16 year old experiences before an exam. Would the old magic be back? No set piece battle to begin with followed by a segment that left one wondering more than in wonder. However momentum built up like a boulder careering down a hill, with the same explosive conclusions!

Author: crystal_lightsaber
Review_Title: Why this is such a great movie...
Review: There are many reasons why "Attack of the Clones" is a classic piece of movie making, and, while it may have some faults - which are few and far between, by the way - it manages to hold your attention throughout. *SPOILERS* OK, where should I begin. The film begins with an attempt on the life of the now Senator Amidala which spawns the beginning of the end for the Republic. Obi Wan and his apprentice Anakin are appointed to protect the Senator from further attacks. AOTC contains numerous references to the original triology which are sure to please fans. Many of the original triology's mysteries and plot holes are filled in this installment, such as how Owen and Beru Lars came to be Luke's Aunt and Uncle. The transition of Anakin to the dark side is magnificently done with appropriately dark music accompanying the scenes as Anakin's emotions tear him appart and force him to give in to his anger. While those who say that the film's romantic plotline are exteremely poor are not wrong, it is not something which takes away from the film's enjoyability. The acting of these particular scenes, while not being astounding, is exceptionally good when you actually look at the script which they had to deal with. The acting is perfect otherwise with Ewan McGregor performing excellently as Obi Wan and Christopher Lee playing the villain, Count Doocu, brilliantly. Fans of the series will not be dissappointed with AOTC as it contains some marvellous visual effects taking full advantage of the new digital technology available. The road is well paved for the original triology's events with the newly created Clone Army bearing a striking resemblance to the Stormtroopers, telling us fans how they came to be. The transport ships at the end which come to take the Clones look a lot like the infamous Star Destroyers. My favourite homage to the originals is the inclusion of "Jango Fett", the father of the chilling "Boba Fett" from TESB and ROTJ. The scene in which he and Obi Wan share a spine-chilling conversation had so much suspense in it that I was glued to my seat. It was clear that both he and Obi knew who each other were, but neither wanted to act yet. I read someone say that it was stupid as Jango would have killed Obi on the spot, but they are wrong. We see that Jango cares deeply for his son, and he obviously did not want to put him in danger. Finally, for those of us who always wanted to see the true extent of Yoda's power, we are not left in the dark, as he gets fully involved in the action, hurling streams of lightning and running rings around Doocu with his lightsabre. This was one of the best scenes combined with the duels between Anakin, Obi Wan and Doocu, and of course, the MASSIVE fight sequence between the entire Jedi order with the Clones, taking on the joined might of the Trade Federation's army and numerous other evil armies. We see Mace Windu showing us his power with the incredible beheading of Jango, which was sad because I liked him. There really is too much great things in this movie to describe in a thousand words. So, I will just say, go and see it. While this film can not please everybody - the critics will obviously say so - it should please those of us who like to see lightsabres, the force, digitally enhanced scenery, a two foot tall killing machine (Yoda) and a whole lot more.

Author: Jokersmiley
Review_Title: More fun than Phantom Menace, but fails to recapture the magic of Episodes 4-6
Review: ** MILD SPOILERS **  Attack of the Clones was a darned sight better than Episode 1, and tried to regain some of the old formula (in particular, more one liners and better pacing), however it didn't quite get there.  The script was atrocious, especially the love story between Anakin and Amidala ("soft and smooth ..." (the whole opening night audience cracked up on that one), or "I'm haunted by the memory of the kiss you shouldn't have given me", and was Anakin dreaming about his mother in that scene or was he ... I know Lucas wants us to believe he's engaging in modern myth-making, but Oedipus Rex?!?)  What the Skywalker family's blood has in midi-chloridian count, it lacks in acting talent -- first Mark Hamill, now Hayden Christensen.

Author: csdfulton
Review: I was shocked at how bad this movie is. A significant proportion of the dialog was so awful and cheesy that I literally could not listen to it and was forced to put my hands over my ears. The direction was also very poor and unimaginative. The acting was wooden and far inferior to the performances of the original trilogy. The special effects looked like a video game and did not come close to the believability of the special effects of the original trilogy (I prefer models to CGI). The fight scenes were not as good as the Phantom Menace (who's fight scenes themselves weren't nearly as good as a decent kung-fu flick). I recommend this movie only to people who liked the mummy movies or have a significant emotional commitment to the Star Wars franchise.

Author: Iribe0117
Review: I thought it was great. Star Wars fans had been waiting for a long time and it was worth the wait. It was great except for the parts where Hayden was supposed to cry over his mother and when he cuts the pear for Padme. That looked fake.

Author: philipkenobi
Review: This movie had a little of the old feeling, a little of the new feeling, and alot of an awsome feeling all of its own. The movie had alot for ever body. I think this was proble the best star wars ever.  Awsome is all i have to say about it.

Author: Gojira2015
Review_Title: Definitely Not Worth A Second Viewing In The Theater (Spoilers Inside)
Review: I was by no means a fan of The Phantom Menace, but I actually find it to be a superior film than Attack Of The Clones. As usual, the trailer made the movie look great, but the finished product pales in comparison.

Author: edebont
Review: Loved it !! Don't watch this movie as movie critic, do not compare it with the previous ones. People will always say that first trilogy is the best. Maybe true, maybe not. I've enjoyed this movie from the first minute to last. At the end I thought, damn, were's episode III !!!

Author: j_tichler
Review: A return to form and Lucas' strengths, namely the sence of epic mysticism and Jedi-centred action [al be it toned down for the kiddies]. Yoda finally shows the temper of his metal. Obi wan grows up into the mantel of Alec Guiness and some decent comic relief is provided by the stright man funny man combo of R2 and C3PO. The decried mistake of Episode one i.e. Jar-Jar is corrected and the Gungan only has three or four lines [although a pivotal part in events]and Palpatine grows steadily in power and menace. The groundwork for the third installment and the original three is firmly lain and we see Christopher Lee in the second of probably what will be the three biggest grossing films of this twelve month period [with Lord of the Rings - books one and two] as the menacing count Dooku. The usual quanta of colourfull aliens and ugly monsters [one of Episode one's good points] are also here and the film will have all Starwars fans grinning and gripping their arm-rests alternately. The climatic end is built up to beautifully and a bit of romance thrown in keeps the tone quite light, without detracting too badly from the pace. A definite improvement on The Phantom Menace and for a final word - Yoda is the man!

Author: jsambz
Review_Title: Amazing Visuals w/ A Whole Lot Of Terrible Dialog
Review: See the title?  That about sums it up.  Your jaw will hit the ground when you first see the amazing visuals that Episode II has to offer, and then about 10 minutes later your jaw will drop even further when you witness the sickeningly embarrassing dialog that ultimately keeps the movie from being the best Star Wars picture of all time.

Author: Billy bob2002
Review: I didn't read any of the critics reviews of this film but I think I will now just so that I can laugh at them for being so wrong. This movie is fantastic! In terms of star wars films it is second only to "empire strikes back."

Author: magnolia__fan
Review_Title: what is the bigger waste? my $5.50 or lucas's millions
Review: unfortunately, i came into this movie with unusually high expectations.  i will try and make this concise.  the plot was lengthy and slow.  the acting was rather poor.  anakin's lines were childish and whiny rather than tortured and misunderstood.  the love scenes were similarly weak.  anakin again came up short and appeared like a little boy with a obsessive crush rather than a young adult reuniting with his soulmate.  the movie consisted of drawn out action sequences that ended in an anticlimax.  the ten minute car chase scene and the ten minute run through the droid factory stand out in my mind as particularily large wastes of time and money.  i understand that the point of the movie was supposed to setup anakin's turn to the dark side, however, the film barely develops anakin as a character, much less a likeable character that the audience will identify with or sympathsize with. am i wrong or is anakin supposed to be a tragic hero?  i cant wait for him to fall into the molten lava pit and stop with the poorly acted and written lines.  oh yeah, the c3po "humor" was by far the worst part of the movie. i dont know why anyone over the age of 5 would see it as comic relief.  ewan mcgreggor was good and natalie portman was stunningly beautiful and decent. the rest of the cast is forgettable and detestable by turns.  i think less cgi, which the movie crammed down the viewer's throat at every turn, and more quality acting, plot development, and dialogue would have been a better use of the ungodly amounts of money lucas spent. all this movie did successfully lower the bar for episode three, further depreciate my respect for lucas a filmmaker and writer, and make me depressed about waiting another 4 years for a movie that will undoubtedly be just as poorly done. is it any wonder why my friends have lovingly dubbed this movie "episode douche?"

Author: lyrandori
Review_Title: I Can't Understand The Title Of This Wonderful Use Of The Force
Review: Now that I've seen the second Act of this great series, I can't understand its title, "Attack of the Clones".

Author: ronnyd
Review_Title: a movie that you'll be seeing not for just one time
Review: Hello reader!!

Author: geekandnerd
Review: Episode II is an impressive movie in which we can see the story of Anikin unfold.  Incredible special effects as well as spectacular fight scenes make this movie great.  The plot is the most intricate of all Star Wars movies and Lucas does an excellent job of bringing it all together for an amazing ending.  Despite a few cheezy lines, this movie packs a punch and leaves fans spellbound.

Author: LSingh4943
Review: I don't care what the critics say, I loved this movie.  Sure the love story was cornier than Pearl Harbor, the dialogue was awful, some of the acting wooden.  Everything else makes up for it though.  People may gripe about the movie today, but 20 years from now it will stand tall with all the other Star Wars films

Author: chriscullison
Review: Going from ROJ to PM it seemed that ol' George found a formula...a multi-tiered finally, a "primitive" under-dog army, and angered fans...well AOTC George found his magic again !!!  A great story, paced superb, and that gut feel that you got at the end of ESB, where you can't believe you have three years.  Hopefully the ranch remembers not to "Soprano" us, and tie up the loose ends.  BTW, beware of MACE :

Author: erjoly
Review_Title: FABULOUS ADDITION TO THE FIRST TRILOGY!!!
Review: I went into the theater hoping for the best...and what I got was the BEST!! Excellent film~if you are the most critical filmgoer who is an avid Star Wars fan~you will not be disappointed!!

Author: kfire

Review: I saw film 2 times. First time i almost fall asleep after first hour of film. Well, great than last half an hour was much freshly. Second time i especially go to film, in order that to understand why i dont like this "film" :) After second view, I no more longer Star Wars fan. This story is dead.

Author: marlowe-19
Review_Title: The years funniest movie! Well done George
Review: How contrary of Lucas to prick at all our faux Jedi posturings by making the most hilarious Sci-fi spoof since Galaxy Quest. This movie really is something to behold, you have to see it believe it. Who would have thought that a long time ago in a galaxy far far away they would have American Diners...inspired. Yoda - known for being three foot tall and walking with a cane gets up and kicks butt (this is the best moment and will have you in stitches). Queen Amidala falls fifty feet from a spaceship, lies in the desert for a good ten minutes groaning, but as soon as someone turns up to rescue her she's up and running like she'd just taken a nap.

Review_Title: The force is strong with this one.

Author: gjloehr
Review_Title: This will contain spoilers. Please don't read if you haven't seen the film!!!

Author: mendesru
Review_Title: Believe it or not, a Good Movie.
Review: Maybe some people are angry because this movie is so good and that it can attract viewers that aren't usually into sci-fi movies, but believe it or not the movie is really a good movie. The bottom line is what should someone expect from a sci-fi/action movie and in that manner I cannot talk for others but according to my own expectations (after A.I.) this movie is the best I ever saw.

Author: jedi1970
Review_Title: Solid improvement from episode I. Worth your ticket price!!
Review: George Lucas comes through on his sequel from his much loved Star Wars stories. Giving the fans many tasty treats in this latest installment.

Author: gc002b6129
Review: without doubt george lucas has exorcised the debarcle that was the phantom menace. out goes annoying, irritating young children and in comes in comes characters that are mean , moody and intense . george lucas has delivered the star wars movie that fans have been crying out for , this is the kind of movie the summer blockbuster was meant to be . the story is is a complex tapestry of political intrique and subdefuge , whilst still remaing simple enough for the younger ones to enjoy . the action set pieces are breathtaking , ilm have pushed the special effects barrier to a different level . the acting at times is a little stilted , but this is only due to george lucas's poor dialogue, he'y you cant be good at everything . all actors do the best they can with the material they have but christopher lee stands head and shoulders above the rest, an old hand showing the youngsters how its done . but the real star of this movie is yoda , without giving the plot away his final scences have to be seen to be beleived . so which movi e is the best ? clones or spiderman ? . well after seeing both it has to be star wars , but only just .

Author: deerslayer90
Review: Just a quick note: this movie had groundbreaking effects, humor, spectacular action sequences, great characters, and visual images like none i have ever seen (just like the originals). In addition, despite what many critics are saying this is the most complex and well acted movie out of the five episodes.

Author: kevind-1
Review: A long time ago in a galaxy far, far away, George Lucas made some pretty decent movies. That time has long since past. I'd love to get into how terrible this piece of CG schlock was, but I wouldn't know where to begin. Let it to suffice to say that this film lacked three fundamental that made the first three films great: 1) story, 2) a charismatic villain, 3) likeable, interesting characters. I should also add coherence to that list. And this is coming from a writing instructor and published author who often holds up Star Wars as an excellent example of the Hero's Journey in action. I feel sorry for George in a way, because it seems there's no one around him brave enough to tell him his script sucks. Shame on you George Lucas for using the Star Wars brand to once again peddle a bunch of crap on an unsuspecting public. You know you have us all over an emotional barrel. Star Wars was such a big part of so many people's childhood experience, that you know we can't resist. Here's my advice to you: Think back to your days as a frustrated auteur under the tutelage of Francis Ford Coppola. The geek may have come out of the closet and earned the money of a mogul, but you're not half the storyteller he is. Stick to what you do best: visual effects, and for the love of God, please hire a screenwriter to write the script for Episode Three (I'm available by the way). Perhaps you might even want to give Christopher Vogler a call (author of "the Writer's Journey." Just please, don't do this to us again!

Author: bkedersha
Review: The movie dragged on and on.  The story was weak, you knew immediately that is was a plot to get the Empire going.  The light saber fight with Yoda was just dumb.  George needs to hand off the project to better people, because he really screwed up this one!

Author: etcher
Review_Title: This is what I was expecting from Episode I
Review: I loved everything except some of the weak acting ability. The young lovers could have taking some acting classes and Samuel L. Jackson sounded like he was reading from the script. Other than those minor short comings I really enjoyed the film. I felt like I was only in the theatre for fifteen minutes.

Author: casper_knightshade
Review_Title: Expectations not met, but a good movie nonetheless (Spoiler Warning)
Review: (Spoiler Warning ahead)Learning from past mistakes with the euphoria of the Phantom Menace, I took a cautious approach to viewing the Attack of the Clones. In every way it is a superior film to Episode One and not because it lacked Jar-Jar Binks and more Yoda. There is the blend of a continuation of a long story that is the Star Wars Saga as we know it along with the stump splitting war sequences we all grew up with in the Original Trilogy. Visuals don't mean squat to me anymore if the story is not worth it, and this story does have merit.

Author: Rockbottom123332
Review: This movie was awsome.  Imagine the dancing baby with a lightsaber and you have Yoda fighting.  The radio djs that rated this movie a f don't know a good movie if it hit them in the back of the head.  The fighting between the clones and the bots was great.  This was just a great movie.

Author: ztigermanz
Review: Who the heck does Roger Ebert think he is or any of his other critic cronies?  Sure all movies have flaws, but to harp on them in your critique and not actually comment on the good things.  Personally, I loved this film. I was in major doubt about Hayden Christensen, but he was terrific.  The look, the personality, and his ability to foreshadow his turn to the dark side in his acting is excellent.  Go ahead critics and talk all of your crap, the fans are going to go, non-fans are going to go, and just look at the numbers, nobody gives a crap about what you think.

Author: stubrew
Review: I went to see EpII with an open mind, despite having been utterly dissapointed with Ep I. After all, Ep IV, V, and VI were all pretty good (teddybears not withstanding).

Author: XenoFlareX
Review_Title: A decent successor to Episode I... nothing more...
Review: I don't see why so many people consider this to be a work of a genius. Lucas has excellent funding with which he can hire the best special effects people in the industry. You EXPECT excellent special effects. I think that most of the scenes looked like they were video-game cutscenes (reminiscent of Final Fantasy). They looked original, colorful, but far from photo-realistic. (And sorry guys, a bunch of people in an arena with glowing rods fighting off hundreds of computer-generated creatures just doesn't do it for me.) The creatures looked like bad guys from role-playing games... I wish they would spend more time trying to come up with foes that actually LOOK fierce.

Author: SaintNomad
Review_Title: This movie did so many things right...
Review: Nuance...Subtle...many words (big and small) can be used to put this movie in a positive light.

Author: jmcgregor
Review_Title: Great CGI, but where's the script?
Review: Once again, the CGI is fantastic and the action scenes breathtaking. However, during the first hour I was amazed to find myself actually getting bored!  The acting seemed to be labouring under delusions of being grandiose, but it came across as merely wooden and unconvincing, and the romance between Amidala and Anakin Skywalker didn't have the merest hint of life or originality.  Nevertheless, Natalie Portman does the least bad job of everyone concerned and at least manages to salvage some sort of dignity. Oh, and looks quite pretty as well. :)

Author: crasely
Review: Just a few comments to add:

Author: tony-345
Review_Title: Only The Force Will Make This a Good Movie
Review: Have you ever had relatives or friends bring over slides of their vacation or their wonderful child's last ten birthdays? They walk in with eight slide carousels and regale you with still, flat, lifeless images for two hours and seven minutes? If so, you'll have a good sense of what it's like to sit through Attack of the Clones (AOTC). The film largely moves from one lifeless (and often truncated) scene to the next.

Author: porgatory6
Review: What can i say,if you read this and you havent saw the movie yet..what are you waiting for?!?! go and see it now!! the effects,the sounds,the story,the jokes...he's back! and George Lucas will give you an amazing more then 2 hours journey into the beginning of the end of the Galactic Republic. A true must for a Star Wars fan,a true must for a sci-fi fan and a true must for a movie lover!

Author: mrpac
Review: This was absolutely the worst movie I have ever seen. The acting was brutal, the story line was boring. Lucas even managed to do a poor job on the special effects. In short, if you haven't seen it, wait until it comes on network television.

Author: dankilshaw
Review: I'm so sick of people slagging off the two recent Star Wars movies, it's as if they expect a completely soul-changing experience. IT'S JUST A MOVIE!!!!!! All these people saying that TPM and ATOC 'don't have the depth and emotion of the original three', I'm sorry but the Star Wars films are (and always have been) the epitome of saturday afternoon popcorn-munching flicks. Don't get me wrong, I love the original trilogy, (any films that can contain some of the appalling lines that they had and still be enjoyable has gotta be good) but they weren't these deep, philosophical masterpieces that everyone seems to think they were. I think the obvious reason for the hatred being thrown at these recent prequels is that most people saw the original three when they were children, so they remember them as being fantastic, whereas now they're grownups and expecting these ones to be just as good, but they can't be because people are now seeing them from an adults point of view. Children at the moment love the new films, just like we loved the first trilogy. All you whining nerds out there, get over yourselves and get out more! They're George Lucas' films, he should know what's right.

Author: focusedonhim
Review_Title: A little disappointing, but would still recommend seeing it.
Review: As a huge Star Wars fan, I was happy to see the movie just to see the characters progress from the last movie and see the "history" of the previous Star Wars films finally being played out. However, as I have seen better come from George Lucas, I was disappointed in the movie as a whole.

Author: alcantad
Review_Title: Attack of the Clones is just as good as the classics!
Review: I was floored by Attack of the Clones, and can easily say that it is now in the top 2 favorite Star Wars movies for me.  I am not sure if I prefer Attack of the Clones or the Empire Strikes Back -- its that close.  I can honestly say that I have greatly enjoyed each of the Star Wars movies -- not because they gave me more of what the previous films gave, but because each one has covered new ground.  I have read a lot of the other reviews posted here by people slamming this movie (and its predecessor, The Phantom Menace, which ALSO rocked) and saying that it didn't live up to the interplay between Han, Luke & Leia from the classic trilogy.  News Flash:  This is 30 years before the original trilogy!  It is about TOTALLY DIFFERENT PEOPLE. It is asinine to expect the prequels to give us the exact same feel & chemistry as a group of characters who DO NOT EVEN APPEAR IN THIS PART OF THE STORY!!  Don't get me wrong -- Han, Luke & Leia were awesome in the classic trilogy, but Padme, Anakin and Obi-Wan are just as compelling if you give them a chance.  George Lucas has done an amazing job giving continuity with the classic trilogy.  He has also created interesting new characters, and is giving compelling reasons why Anakin is about to Darth out.  Attack of the Clones was technically superior to ALL of its predecessors, & the story completely lives up to the Star Wars name.  Perhaps the people who do nothing but lambast the film have built the original trilogy up so high in their minds that NOTHING George Lucas did would please them anyway.  The point of Star Wars is to sit back, enjoy the spectacle, & lose yourself in Lucas's Universe again, just like we did when we were children -- not to pick it apart because it wasn't custom made to YOUR perception of the classic movies.  As for the complaints over CGI, the special effects in the new trilogy are no more noticeable as artificial than the muppets & stop motion from the classics.  It is sad that so many people have COMPLETELY lost the childlike nature that Lucas's films are designed for.  I, for one, am not willing to let the modern world kill the wonderful escapism of Star Wars for me.  If you can watch this film without any preconceived notions, then you will enjoy it.  If not, then maybe you should ask yourself why you bother to go to the movies at all.  If you hate something because it doesn't give you more of the same, then perhaps you should stay home & watch re-runs.  Personally, I am glad that George Lucas has chosen to delve into new areas with the same eye for fantasy & detail that he has always had. Attack of the Clones is not only a worthy successor to the previous movies, it is an excellent film in its own right.  Give it a chance.

Author: mikeray-1
Review: So if Aniken is called Annie and if his parents are deceased what does that make him? Little Orphan... well you know. This is terrible. There's nothing cool about Star Wars anymore. No Wookies. No cool mythological imagery. No evil. No good.

Author: paulj-6
Review: Hopefully I got your attention. I'll just keep you for a second. I want to tell you just a couple things about this film that may help you or anyone else who hasn't seen it yet or are boycotting it like a few of my friends. I would first like to say that many of us were disappointed by The Phantom Menace, including myself. I'm still trying to like it. But make it a point to GO SEE THIS ONE!!! Ignore everything negative you've heard or read about this movie. You've gotta go and make up your own mind! Don't let those negative critics make up your mind for you because I almost did. I went and saw this film with very very low expectations and walked away with same feelings that I had when I saw the original Star Wars films when I was a kid. In short, I LOVED IT!!! I went and saw it twice in one weekend and I've never done that with any movie! Sure, there are a few cheesy lines and Natalie Portman (Queen Amidala) can't run, but that's pretty much it!!! The rest of the movie is spectacular! The end of the film is like watching the Grand Finale of a 4th of July fireworks display; the entire screen is completely lit up by the red, blue and green flashing of light sabers and laser-blasters for about 30 minutes. GO SEE THIS FILM!!! I promise you'll enjoy the film, or you'll just have a really expensive bucket of popcorn! 7 out of 10 at the worst.

Author: mroper-1
Review: I saw Star Wars episode II last night on digital projection and it looked unbelievable. I had a good time,but I think Lucas needs to bring in another writer for the next episode if not for the fact that the dialogue especially between anakin and padme was stiff and wooden. Christensen was terrible and not convincing as the arrogant young jedi. But I think a lot of the problem was he was miscast. Joaquin Phoenix as a young jedi would have been PERFECT. Even Portman,who is usually a great actress, looked stiff. Macgregor was good as Obi Wan and his sequences of investigating the planet Camino and finding out about the clones and Jango fett was fun. I wish Lucas had gone deeper into the Clones themselves and why Jango was the host for these clones. The fight scene between Jango and Obi Wan was awesome. Jango kicked butt and was one of the best parts of the movie. Really slick character. The flow was hurt by the budding romance scenes and not enough on the clones or Yoda. The fight between Yoda and Dooku was cool,but too short. I guess we have to just enjoy the prequels for what they are,technical marvels.

Author: robin-107
Review_Title: alas its a bit long and slow
Review: i really wanted to like this film and heard it was better than episode 1. it wasn't.

Author: opusmi
Review_Title: This is no Spiderman movie, AOTC leaves you waiting for the next prequel
Review: I watched Spiderman on its opening weekend and by half the movie I was ready to leave, it looked a copy of the Original Superman motion picture.  AOTC brings back the magic and myth of the original Trilogy, without leaving you the sense that it is a replica, and is almost as good, or tops, the Empire Strikes Back -- with two clear plots carrying over to the next prequel. The last 45 minutes looked more like only 10 minutes, time goes by that quick since it is that good! Not to mentioned that also right at the beginning you are jumped into action. Hayden Christensen carries to perfection Anakin's role --- anxious and impulsive, best reflected in his eyes. I am also glad Mindu (Samuel L Jackson) had more active screen time. George Lucas had the hard job of showing how the Republic looked before the raise of the Empire and the role of the Jedis in that "old Republic" and he clearly mastered it. After watching AOTC I came out of the movie convinced that "Return of the Jedi" is not named after Luke Skywalker come to mastering of the Force, but for Anakin (Darth Vader) conversion back to the light side of the Force. In short, I will highly recommend it.

Author: JTLem
Review_Title: "Professional" critics must have gone into wrong theater.
Review: I was thoroughly entertained for the entire movie.  The 8 1/2 hours I waited in line to see it at 12:01 were not enough!  For that movie, I think I should have waited more.

Author: andrewOne
Review_Title: Just what I had hoped for, almost
Review: I saw AOTC yesterday.  In fact, I saw it twice yesterday.  In fact Im planning on seeing it tomorrow.  To all the critics and nay sayers out there I would just like to say that I think you all might be just a little crazy.

Author: elcrazymo
Review: Star Wars 2 (Attack of the Clones) appears to be like two movies. The first part appears to move rather slowly and lethargically, while the second hour or so keeps you on the edge of the seat. The acting by Hayden Christiansen, in particular, is somewhat deplorable, and the acting by Natalie Portman is not much better, although that may be the result of a bad script. What appears to save this movie from the ranks of those like "Rollerball (2002 remake) is the fantastic action sequences that occur through the second half. I would say if you had to see one movie this summer, do not see this. See Spider-Man instead, the acting and script there are so much better.

Author: mike anderson
Review_Title: awesome. now if i could cryo sleep till 3 comes out.
Review: george lucas has outdone himself. the effects are awesome, except for a slightly shoddy section of mat work in which anakin is riding a speedbike. the story, however slightly slow and unconcluded, is light years ahead of episode 1. all i want to do is see it again and again. im scared that eventualy they will remove it from the movies, and it will be a solid year before it comes out on(hopefully a spec.ed. box set with all the others)dvd. lucas is a nice guy. maybe he will go straight from the big screen to dvd! yeah and jar jar is realy miss cleo undercover. you need a lightsaber enima if you havent already seen this movie. go! now! and remember the first step to recovery is admitting you have an addiction problem. may the force be with you, my young bladder control learners.
