I DON'T BELIEVE my eyes..this is the same person who made star wars made me fell in love with it for more than 20yrs...

Author: tonphannon
Review: OK so you have this story to tell....you know how it is suppose to go and you know what it looks like.....you can hear the sounds and voices and just thinking about it sends chills down your spine because it is so real. George took this epic story from the depths of his brain and revealed it's innermost secrets in the most stunning fashion that pushes our senses so far into it that reality is just a faint crackle of popcorn from the guy next to you. Now I could go into detail about how this story is one of the best ever told.....but that could take a while. Instead I will just say that this movie is the epitome of why we go to movies. You feel the entire spectrum of emotions while completely immersing your physical senses and bringing you away from the harsh reality of life. But this is just my opinion.....

Author: mike8403
Review: Excellent performance by Natalie and Hayden. Anyone calling the dialogue wooden, does IMO not know anything about teenage love. Yoda rocks!!!

Author: freddy22
Review: THIS is a real great movie ! nobody can deny the fact that THIS is THE MUST concerning special FX !! Each planet got its own universe (KAMINO is my special one:) , the waterfalls in naboo are just TOO beautiful ! you should go and go again and again and again... Thanx to Mr Lucas

Author: UliWaibel
Review_Title: Better than Episode I, but still disappointing
Review: At first: I'm a great fan of the old Star Wars trilogy. "Return of the Jedi" was my second movie ever seen after "Jungle Book" and it made me a real SciFi-Freak. Ok, now let's take a look at Episode II: It is really much, much more better than that Kiddie-Style Episode I !!! It has a lot more of the elemts that made the old trilogy that famous and great it is: Great Battles, extraordinary creatures, a basicly much more dark mood than Episode I.

Author: bruijter
Review: I've seen the movie already twice. The second time was even better. As everybody states: This time GL has done the right thing. The CGI are spectacular, the story is good, the acting is great(except for Hayden Christiansen he could be better, for the second time GL misses the right person for the main character) and my feeling at the end of the movie was "S**t we have to wait another two or three years for episode 3. If you didn't like Epi I you still most go and see Epi 2. If you don't like SW at all still go and see the movie. The last hour of the movie is worth every cent you have to pay.

Author: tom_stewart46
Review: The movie is worth seeing mostly for the effects and to be prepared for what I hope to be an improved Episode III. However, Lucas really stumbled here. This should have been a character movie.  This is the centerpiece of a trilogy concerning the rise the good, Anarkin Skywalker, and his fall into evil, Darth Vader, one of the movies greatest bad guys of all time.  This is the movie where we should have learned along with Amidala to love Anarkin. That would make his fall, that much more personal and involving.  He's not really very lovable here.  Hayden Christensen does the best that he can, but he's just not right.  We needed a cross between Errol Flynn and James Dean, a swashbuckling hero with a hidden inner angst.  We don't get that, and that's a shame.

Author: carruth98
Review: My favorite part was the fight scene with Yoda.  I'd see it again just for that part.  The rest of the movie was pretty good.  It's interesting to start to see how everything is going to lead to the first Star Wars.  Now you'll know where Luke Skywalker came from.

Author: brett_asay
Review: This particular rendition of Star Wars is one of the worst movies I've seen in a long time.  I put it on my list with Congo and Anaconda as movies that would have been better as an idea or a book and never made into a movie. The lack of plot and acting killed this movie.  I don't know how it has gotten such good reviews.

Author: NQA1
Review: They did it.  This is the best of the series.

Author: lukedearing
Review: I thoroughly enjoyed the new edition to the 'Star Wars' collection, and I must point out it was much more entertaining than the slightly dull 'Phantom Menace'.

Author: jlynn473
Review: This movie was much better than Ep. I.  It gave more details as to how things happen or will happen.  Gives great background on Ep IV characters. This movie has it all!!  Laughs, romance, action, great special effects. I would highly recommend this movie for all to see.

Author: kccafe1
Review: SW AOTC is great looking and story rich film. The actors, music, and special effects, automatically make this movie that will be watched for years to come. George Lucas is a true American storyteller and filmmaker. This film is everything a movie should be 4 stars**** !!!

Author: sdesh
Review: Guys, I know that we all are always very excited from the prospect of another episode of the Star Wars saga coming out, because we are so attached to the story and the characters, and we automatically recall nice childhood memories of when we, as children, saw the original episodes . However, watching Episode II has felt more like receiving an insult to the memory of the glorious original ones rather than a glorification of the series. This movie is a barren land which has very very little to offer; special effects by themselves do not impress anybody anymore, and frankly I can't find any other particular interesting feature about this movie. I have found the love story, which constitutes an important part of the plot, particularly lame and totally predictable. Guys, the sole purpose of this movie is clearly a commercial one: sell as many tickets, hats, books, videos, DVDs, posters etc etc etc as possible. It has nothing new to offer and we shouldn't donate our money to people who do not have anything valuable to offer to us.

Author: glanzer1
Review: "Did you hear the one about the Priest who spends the weekend at the Vatican summer camp?"

Author: fireprincess77
Review: If anyone takes a few moments away from complaing about Episode II and looks at the old reviews for Empire they will see that a lot of people had simlier things to say about it.  At the time when Empire was released everyone thought that it was a lame ass love story and the only thing saving it was the Fx and Master Yoda, sound familer?  And look at it how we react to it now?  It have become a institution in the world we live in.

Author: tistou77
Review: As you have noticed, i am french. So, I apologize for my poor english... I've just read some comments on IMDB and i am surprised to see that american starwars fans are much more complaining about EPII than in France. It is a great great starwars, at the same level of the original trilogy. (i hate epI so don't think i'm a hardcore starwars fan) The movie is really entertaining and give an enjoyment equal to the original episodes. I think that some old time starwars fans will NEVER like a new starwars as much as the old ones. They have turned on the dark side (ok! easy..)and are always expecting something that they'll never have. Starwars has always been mythology, pure fun, kiddy humor, strange clothes, silly action sequences, pure girly romantic love.... and all these things are linked by imagination.

Author: compaq-2
Review: ***SLIGHT SPOILERS*** Okay ... I saw this movie the night before the premier ... a friend of a friend of my brother works for the theatre and we (all 20 of us, thank you very much)saw the movie at 11:25 pm.

Author: jetfueljunkie
Review: I nearly walked out of this film. If it wasn't for the gladiatorial scene and what followed I would have. The actors did their job well considering that they were required to imagine their co-stars. Yet one wonders whether or not Natalie Portman and who-ever played Skywalker were required to do the same with each other! Honestly, the chemistry between them simply failed to materialize! I knew that the 'love' story was going to be insipid but non-existant!

Author: tappler
Review: For me, and I hope for many others, Attack of the Clones completely satisfied my every need for a film to be as fantastical and fresh as Lord of the Rings: FotR. I really believe that Lucas is growing better as a storyteller and a filmmaker and AotC proves this. It is much more confident and ambitious as The Phantom Menace and contains some of the greatest moments in the ever-evolving Star Wars universe. I cannot understand and very much dislike the current backlash towards Lucas from the media and it leaves me asking: "What in the hell are you people expecting?" Its amazing how much critics will pounce on anyone with some imagination and the drive to film something as difficult and original as Attack of the Clones. In the words of Darth Vader, AotC is "Impressive. Most impressive."

Author: dam1211
Review_Title: Potential Spoiler! Read at Your Own Risk
Review: This movie was extremely boring until its end.

Author: wd052700
Review: In my opinion the movie, Attack of the Clones, the second prequil to the Star Wars Trilogy was everything that I expected to see.  I was curious on how the story would continue and where the storyline was going to pick up in the second part.  Starting the movie off ten years later was a great idea because the story itself has alot of time to cover and jumping the timeline so much wasn't a bad effect on the movie storyline.  The movie was full of drama as well as action in the sense of how the two stories intertwine with the coming of the Galactic Empire and the destruction of the Imperial Senate.  Along with the way that Darth Vader is coming out of Anakin Skywalker.  The way that he is already starting to be very defiant with the persons in which are teaching him the trade of the Jedi Knights.  Anakin however does look upon Obewan Kenobi as his father he is also a rebelious teenager which has been shown to be a bad trait in a Jedi Knight and a additude that is not at all aloud.

Author: caivano
Review: Attack of the Clones is an impressive experience as we have all come to expect from each new film in the Star Wars saga.  Visual effects, sound, and music all combine to deliver a glorious spectacle.  Even though I knew ahead of time that all these elements would be spectacular, nothing that came before really prepared me for this when I sat down to actually see the film. As pure magic show, the Star Wars films have time and again proven their worth.  It should be noted that the film is only truly appeciated in a large theater properly equipped with digital projection and well balanced digital sound systems.

Author: mvaughn340
Review: Episode II was a major improvement over Episode I. It has the old feel of the original. Anakin and Padme are reminescent of the Luke, Leah,Han Solo love triangle, Obi wan is more like Obi wan, and the Jedi are actually a force to be reckoned with. And the edge of the seat action is back. By the end of the movie, you actually care about these characters. Maybe we should just forget Episode I and start her with the prequels.

Author: jerrodgunning
Review_Title: An Uninspired Attack on Fan Loyalty!
Review: I am a die hard fan; have been since I was eight. Speaking as such, it's my opinion that the truth about Lucas having three completed trilogies and only showing us the middle one is nothing more than a line he used in film school to pick up chics.

Author: drdionysus
Review: Well, I saw the film a few days after it came out, and, like many of my fellow fans, I was eagerly awaiting it. After Episode 1 I was hoping the this film would be heads above. Then I saw the film.

Author: Master Jedi Anakin
Review: This Star Wars has the potential to be the best ever.  It can beat all other Star Wars in movie grossing and even in popularity.  Natalie Portman is so hot, she should get her own Star Wars movie based on her.  Hayden Christensn is the best pick to play Anakin.  Ewan McGregor is the coolest Obi-Wan Kenobi.  Samuel L. Jackson as Mace Windu is the best part.

Author: spankey-1
Review: Well, saw the movie today after a couple failed attempts to get there.  I was impressed by the story-line, disappointed in the fight between Anakin and Dooku.

Author: jimbob1979
Review_Title: George Lucas had a tough job...
Review: Right...

Author: ndj1979
Review: I think that star wars ep.#2 attack of the clones was a good movie.  The special effects were cool and yoda kicked ass. The acting was good as well, I don't think that Hayden was bad, he did good with what he had. He was good but he was great in Life as a House, he totally steals the movie. Anyway over all it was good but it could have been a little shorter.

Author: Trisha39
Review: I found this particular Star Wars movie to be very disappointing, primarily due to poor casting in the two lead roles, the lack of well written story line and far too much focus on special effects.   There was a lack of passion or emotion in general.   I found myself looking at my watch wondering when it would be over.

Author: marke-1
Review: My 8 year old daughter puts it best ... "that movie had no story" Absolute unadulterated garbage - puerile, scatterbrain story-line, woeful acting (but in fairness, the actors had no chance with such an appalling script) Not in the same universe as "Empire Strikes Back". Lucas - give up now.

Author: ziogold
Review_Title: did i see the same movie???
Review: I am completely amazed at the high votes this lame film is getting. Wooden performance, lousy script, predictable action, familiar animation. Too much sappy romance for kids I would think and not enough plot for the rest of us. Since I just gave Enigma a "9" and this a "1"  and Enigma is playing at the local art house, I guess it must be true that most people are just very happy with a lot of noise and explosions. thank god for R2 and C3PO

Author: movee_geek
Review: This movie was about 10 steps up from The Phantom Menace and ranks very close to the original Star Wars, which is my favorite of all of them. George Lucas manages to successfully interweave the elements of three type of movies: action-adventure (of course), mystery and romance.

Author: vb26811
Review_Title: slow start buts gets good (little spoiler)
Review: for what seemed like an eternity to begin the movie, all there was was a love story, and i have to admit i was thinking it was worse than the horrid pod racing scene of episode 1. but then when the war began i got interested and the yoda fight scene really got me back into the movie enough to forget about the horrendous first half-for that moment. i can't really say much about acting as they seemed decent, although anakin always has the same look on his face, but i did notice that each time u see natalie portman, she seems to be wearing less, going for a fully clothed uniform at first into essentially a sports bra like shirt and tight pants (thank god it was the only thing keeping me interested for the first half!)

Author: jorgelr
Review: I am a SW fan. Big one. And I was hoping that this movie would restore my faith in Lucas to produce magic after the let-down of Episode 1. But alas..

Author: axionent
Review_Title: Grade: D, but not a typical critic's comments (vague spoilers)
Review: First of all, At 29 years of age I'm a huge fan of Star Wars, in spite of its so-called "imperfections" critics were too quick to point out in Episodes IV, V, and VI.

Author: thelaffins
Review_Title: An improvement but not up to snuff-- awkward love story
Review: Warning- this review may contain a slight spoiler to those totally unfamiliar with the premise of the Star Wars movies.

Author: BigDaddyVa
Review_Title: The first theatre movie in 25 years
Review: I haven't seen a movie in a theatre in 25 years. My kids made me go see this one. As a matter of fact, one of the last moves I saw in the theatre was Star Wars.

Author: ColoradoWolf2002
Review_Title: I liked the Second of 6 Star Wars Movies
Review: I have heard a lot of negative things about Star Wars Episode 2, and I frankly don't think that the reviews I have read have come from die hard Star Wars fans. I myself am not a die hard Star Wars fan, but I loved this movie more then anything else that has been released thus far other hen Spiderman! I will admit that it was a little slow in the begining, but giving what the meaning of what the story tried to tell people it was well done. And I don't think that it is fair to compare in great detail the stars of 4,5,6 to the stars of 1,2,3. If u like Star Wars in any way, please go and give this movie a chance, please don't go by the reviewers. Thanks :)

Author: ShroomsInSherbet
Review_Title: George Lucas is raping his own corpse
Review: I think I've only read about 100 of the reviews for AOTC, and there seems to be a mostly even division regarding the film's worth. I'd say about 40% pro, and 60% con.

Author: windermere
Review: Once again, George Lucas has taken us into new realms of awfulness.

Author: mj_milne
Review: The most despicable piece of crap I've seen in years. Utterly vacant in every department. The effects were less impressive than Episode 4 - all glossy and air brushed. This isn't just a disappointing prequel, it's a genuinely bad film.

Author: pgrogan
Review_Title: I want to love it more
Review: I enjoyed the film very much and look forward to enjoying it in the future. I would certainly say that if someone else invites me to come and watch it with them I would definitely say yes.  I would however say that in many ways I don't consider it to be a good film.  We have come to expect fairly cold heartless scripts from the Star Wars series, but as this had more than just action in it, the romantic element stood out like a sore thumb, and made those scenes insipid and boring to watch.  Its not exactly like there was any suspense involved in the romance.  We knew all along that they were going to come together. I just felt like shouting "Get on with it!" from the back of the cinema "Just shag each other and get on with the plot!".

Author: sparky13
Review: I think that the sorts of people who enjoyed this movie are somehow padding the reviews section. How on earth could this pathetic excuse for a film get 8 stars out of ten? Do you realize that "The Manchurian Candidate" rated an 8.5? How else to explain that "Clones" is considered almost on par with one of the greatest films ever made. My kids dragged me in to see "Clones," and, afterwards, even they admitted that they hated it. However, the popcorn was great and we had a discount coupon for a soft drink.

Author: Simon Mulvaney
Review_Title: Better than Episode I but still not great.
Review: After the dissapointment of my second viewing of Star Wars (it was the first time at the cinema) I and the kick-ass trailer I saw for Star Wars II I must say that I was expecting a far better and exciting movie than Star Wars I. However, I was dissapointed once again. This time wasn't as bad thought but still dissapointing. The problem as I see it is George Lucas. He simply can't seem to follow up the orignal films and is making much worse films now so he can squeeze all the money he can out of the Star Wars brand. The love story that the film is centered around is awful. I couldn't help but laugh at parts of it. It really is that bad. Also the ultra crappy Jar-Jar Binks is back but in a much smaller role than that of Star Wars I. The good points of the movie are the fight scenes which are all great particually Joda at the end of the movie. In fact the end fight seems to drag the film out of the toilet bowl at the last minute. I can only hope that Lucas gets it right for Star Wars III. So should you see this movie. I say yes. Not only for the sheer experience of seeing Star Wars on the big screen but Joda in a but of lightsabre action is worth the price of the ticket itself.

Author: lfebuary
Review: I was sooooo excited to see the new Star Wars movie, I really wanted it to be good despite all of the horrible reviews. Unfortunately I found myself laughing out loud through most of it, it was ridiculous. No pay off, no reward for the horrible acting and childish dialog. The writing must have been dumbed down significantly for kids. The acting, even by actors who are normally really good, was the worst I've ever seen. The 50's diner and characters, the Fifth Element city scenes, the advertising in city streets, the bar with sports games on monitors, the Arrival/AI/X-files aliens, etc...none of it looked or felt like the Star Wars universe developed in the previous movies. It just didn't feel like a Galaxy far, far, far away - it was like everything else we see in movies now. He just relied way too much on the 3D, which I didn't think was very good either. I still like the old models much better than 3D, you just can't get the same detail and lighting quality with 3D. The fight scene with Yoda was the only cool thing in the whole movie and it was very short. The battle sequence was one big cheesy 3D fest, and the jedi knight army wasn't much of an army. What happened to the much talked of jedi knight army in the original movies. This movie destroys all of the grandeur talked about in the original movies of the Clone Wars. The scenes with Anakin and Amadalla were just plain silly - "Hi Annie, I love you and even though you just told me you slaughtered innocent women and children and liked it, I love you and want to marry you. Now lets go frolic in a meadow together.". The acting and writing in this movie, believe it or not, was worse than the garbage we were forced to sit through in Battlefield Earth. No depth or chemistry between any of the characters. I much prefer, despite Jar Jar and the little kid, Episode I. At least with Episode I they gave us great scenes like the beginning with Liam Neison and Ewen McGregor fighting together, the fight at the end with Darth Maul, the deathstar-like space battle at the end, etc. I'm just so upset with the crap he expects all of us to accept, especially now that we have new standards with The Lord of the Rings series. It could have been so good. As far as I'm concerned, Star Wars began with A New Hope and ended with Return of the Jedi.

Author: dwcolt
Review: It is movies like this that actually make me angry when I leave the theater.

Author: afidp
Review_Title: This could be the Best Movie in the History of.......
Review: What......? Episode 2 should be have called attack of the 50' Tall Lucas Ego. Honestly, George Lucas should never be allowed to Write or Direct ever again, period (Yes,and I am one of those people who loved THX-1138)! Attack of the Clones marks the end of Cinema as we know it. This movie has done nothing to elevate the art form on any level. From it's less than uni-dimensional characters, (by the way the cast is made up of some amazing acting talent none of which is realized in this movie) to the overall story. It's even living under the guise of entertainment... Ha !

Author: hotbabyboy8701
Review_Title: Its the 3rd Best Star Wars Film!
Review: Ten years after the 'Phantom Menace' threatened the planet Naboo, Padmé Amidala is now a Senator representing her homeworld. A faction of political separatists, led by Count Dooku, attempts to assassinate her. There aren't enough Jedi to defend the Republic against the threat, so Chancellor Palpatine enlists the aid of Jango Fett, who promises that his army of clones will handle the situation. Meanwhile, Obi-Wan Kenobi continues to train the young Jedi Anakin Skywalker, who fears that the Jedi code will forbid his growing romance with Amidala... Amazing Vissual Effects an Breath-Taking Moments will leave you on the edge of your seat. I think this is one of the Best 100 Movies I've seen. Ranking at Number #17 its good enoff. Maybe Star Wars: Episode II did relate to other movies on my list like GLADIATOR the #1 Best Movie for 2 years. Episode II ends in a way like that with Ewan McGregor looking like a Gladiator with the moves. GOOD MOVIE Folks.

Author: roberta_fischer
Review_Title: Nostalgia value aside, really quite pointless
Review: Overall, I enjoyed the movie.  But then, I have a bad habit of enjoying bad movies, so perhaps I can be excused... What I did not enjoy about this film was the acting - or rather, the lack of it.  In an effort to bring depth to their roles,  the actors have valiantly over-emoted and over-acted what minimal basis there is to base a character upon.  Ani is your stereotypical teenager, chafing at his chains of underdeveloped independence.  Padmè is also stereotypical, the strong woman who is eventually overwhelmed into love.  The bad guys are all very, very bad, and the good guys are all very, very good.  Except of course, Ani, who is a bit of both.  I can see what Lucas was trying for in his script, I really can, but in his bid for technology and digital imaging he has lost the very thing that made the original Star Wars episodes so appealing, the very humanity of the characaters.  Instead of Ben Kenobi as a man who has become wiser through the years, we are given an advice-spouting mother hen of a Jedi who can barely control his apprentice.  (Don't they learn about discipline in Jedi school?)  Instead of Luke we have Ani (whine for whine, question for question, they basically balance eachother out).  Instead of Leia we have Padmè, who near the end of the film shows some of her daughter's chutzpah, but then just falls back into "I'm a female bossed around by men except when I'm really determined to do something utterly foolish" mode. Yoda has turned from old wise guru to incredibly agile spinning-top type small guy with a short future.  Where is the equivalent of Han Solo and his trusty side-kick, Chewbacca?  There is no "slightly on the wrong side of right" guy for us to cheer with, jeer with, or just plain watch as he wreaks havoc amongst all his friends.  There is no risk-taker.  The two droids are among the best acted of the characters in this film, only because through the simplicity of their roles, they can't become more wooden (metal?).

Author: cfkii
Review: I cannot believe the rating given this overblown special effect laden nonsense.  The people who voted for this surely cannot be older than 4 or 5. The original three films, though increasingly pushing forward the ILM technology, never lost that wonderful interplay between the characters, and they were generally people you cared about.  As pretty as she is, Natalie Portman's princess has none of the fiestiness of Leia. Ewan Macgregor is completely wasted as many of his one-liners just don't hit the mark probably due to acting to a blue screen continuously.  We miss the wit of Harrison Ford and to be quite honest there is no "baddie" to touch Darth Vader. Darth Maul looked the part but he was taken out at the end of Menace. Roll on the Two Towers.

Author: fjulle
Review: My heart saddens when i look at so many depressive remarks in here .. I my self am a starwars fan. Not because of the word "starwars", George Lucas, expectation or anything like it, but because i can identify with the univers: The timeless Mythological Magic and power of the living force, which are used by both the forces of good and evil, combined with the advanced technology that makes the scene very much what it is. Special. (Any of you ever heard bout the a Roleplaying game called Rifts? no, doesnt matter, forget that).

Author: ahotchin
Review: Remember when total creative control was a good thing? Expunge that memory from your mind, because George Lucas has ruined it for everybody.

Author: sumjen
Review: I have just seen the latest installment of Star Wars, and thoroughly enjoyed it.  I have also been rewatching the original series with my 7 year old. All of the complaints I have read allude to the accuracy of a fictional story.  Come on!  It's visual popcorn.  And pretty good popcorn at that. None of us will ever have the same feeling about a Star Wars movie as we did about the first one.  Wouldn't we all love to see "Raiders" for the first time again.  But we can't.  Same with this.  I loved the hokey dialogue, the simplistic moral concepts, the wooden acting.  It reminded me of the first series.  I loved the peripheral "cartoon" characters, the accents, the inventive language, the incredible detail in the construction of cities and civilizations.  I did not like Samuel L. Jackson, Yoda riding shotgun on a helicopter (will we be seeing him in the next Vietnam movie).  I thought the acting was great.  See it on a digital screen if you can, and try to see it through the eyes of a 15 year old, which is where I was when I first saw "Star Wars".  Thank you, Mr. Lucas, for continuing to see good and evil through the eyes of an innocent.

Author: stumitch
Review: OK, I'm a Star Wars fan, but who isn't? If you hated Phantom Menace, you'll love this. George has performed this time: gone is Mr Binks (well, almost.. he's got a very small role in the film); in place, a great story line, credible actors and some fantastic effects.

Author: azgardeningco
Review_Title: I think I have found a "BIG" plot flaw
Review: In short..... At just about the end of A.O.T.C we find ourselfs at the farm in the beginning of the Star Wars movies episode 5. Here we meet the the people that end up taking care of Luke (his uncle)......Q:Why then does C3PO not know any of these people nor the place, nor the planet when he is sold to them in epsode 5.Also why then do they not know him nor R2D2. If some one could inlighten me I would be greatful.... THX....Matthew

Author: ho3ho3
Review_Title: Better than the last one but still disappointed
Review: Besides the special effects, which sometimes are too much like the Jedi group fighting scene in the arena, and the potential of the story line, everything else is sub-par.  The acting is not good, and sometimes awkward, and some of the scenes drag on too long.  I guess we have one last shot with the next episode.

Author: Steve Green
Review: We all know what happens in the movie, so let's skip that part.  Great sets and effects; terrible acting (especially on the part of Hayden Christensen as Anakin); weak dialogue.  Lucas might have gotten away with the lame dialogue had he made up for it with a good lead actor, but no such luck.

Author: slipster66
Review: Well Episode II looks terrific, every CGI crammed scene is very impressive. The film is let down (supposedly by Lucas) by the script and, dare I say it, plot.  A lot of the acting (from the humans) appears truly wooden though I blame it more on the writing than the skills of those involved.  Apart from Hayden Christensen that is!  I saw Star Wars (Episode IV nowadays) when I was 11 back in 1977, and for an 11 year old it was perfect - blew away anything seen before, and full of corny dialogue to copy at school. Unfortunately the writing hasn't moved on!

Author: soledadpygmy
Review: Yeah, so. The whole point of a Star Wars movie is the special effects. That said, Hayden Christensen cried/teared up/did the angry lip quiver thing for most of the scenes he was in.  I actually liked phantom menace better.  Not even Yoda fighting could save this one.  I wonder if George Lucas encourages overacting or just doesn't know how to tone things down.

Author: nmc9298-1
Review_Title: Great Special Effects plus Stupid Story Equals Boring Film
Review: The special effects in Attack of the Clones were very detailed, however the story itself was stupid; and I couldn't care less about any of the characters. It seemed that too much was going on at the same time to really begin caring about the story and the characters. This is where the special effects failed. Much ado about nothing! The acting was pathetic. The actor playing young "Vader" was horrible. I actually laughed out loud at the embarrassing moments in the film! I went to see the film very recently, on a Saturday night, and the theater was mostly empty. I guess the word is getting out that this film has failed in many ways. Great CGI does not a movie make!

Author: cam4120
Review_Title: there may be no jar-jar binks, but this movie was still awful
Review: I can't believe all the good reviews for this movie that i've seen on this site! What I find the most sad is how movie producers can spend so much on special effects and neglect acting and plot structure. This movie was seriously lacking on the second two elements. Hayden Christian is a terrible actor (of course, they don't give him too much to work with). Trying to be John wayne just wasn't working for him. And Natalie Portman was disappointing as well. I thought she was pretty good in the first movie, but come on!! "I truly, madly, love you...?" THATS PATHETIC!! They turned her into a sappy girly girl! She played an ambitious gutsy 17 year old in episode one, and now she's almost 30 and she's falling for a teenager, one who's starting to go on a power trip at that. PLEASE. Give her a little more credit. Can we get some believable characters please, George Lucas???

Author: dteleki
Review: Attack of the Clones is a beautiful film to LOOK at, and digital projection shows it to great advantage.  But nothing can rescue it from its terrible writing.

Author: THE ORIGINAL YETI
Review_Title: poor acting, laughable dialogue and muddled storylines
Review: Cheesy, and not in a good way folks.

Author: philb-1
Review_Title: A Jedi love story that really misses the mark
Review: I realize that there are still countless fans that feel somewhat let down by George Lucas's long-awaited return to the Star Wars saga, the slightly controversial PHANTOM MENACE.  It appears that it is destined to remain as one movie that you either love or hate.  And Jar-Jar Binks....?; well, he's one alien that brought out universal negative feelings of some sort in just about everyone.  From some saying he was simply too silly to others saying he was some sort of racist statement, he stands as the symbol to many SW fans as all that was wrong with Episode One.

Author: loopholetonite
Review_Title: So monumentally stupid as to defy description
Review: This movie was so dumb, boring, and pointless that it should have not even been made!  It meanders along mindlessly for over 2 hours with scenes and dialogue that make absolutely no sense whatsoever.  The plot is confusing and muttled and seems to serve no other purpose than to set up the next movie.  Unlike 'Empire Strikes Back' which was a brilliant masterpiece, this "other" middle movie is both lame and without content.  We have convenient plot twists, horrible acting, and action sequences that were all shown in the trailers and commercials.  Anyone trying to defend this dribble is obviously only trying not to spoil their perfect little vision of Star Wars movies being able to do no wrong.  I actually liked Episode I, save for the lame ending.  Darth Vader used to give me chills.  Darth Maul reminded me of Ronald McDonald with a black suit, but at least he was a tangible bad guy. The "villains" in this pile of rubbish are not only weak, they lack any content or believability.  Yoda should have never been handed a lightsaber. That was just plain wrong and an obvious attempt to bolster an already weak film.  If for some unknown reason you *do* choose to see this, I feel sorry for you and I pity you.  No one should be subjected to this type of mind-numbing torment.  I just can't say enough about how awful this movie was.  Terrible doesn't even begin to describe it.  This was *not* a Star Wars movie, it was a 'chick-flick' filled with long, boring, undramatic dialogue and pointless  "love scenes".  See this movie only at your own risk. I give this movie -10 out of 10 stars.  It was that bad!

Author: dabuibak
Review_Title: So Many Expectations and Yet None of Them Were Met
Review: Before I start, let me say that I am a die-hard Star Wars fan.  I know endless amounts of useless trivia and have seen the original trilogy tons of times.  I grew up worshiping the original trilogy and everything else Star Wars. That said, here is why I think Episode II is quite possibly the worst movie in existence.

Author: thor_harley
Review: What gorgeously romantic cinematography; it doesn't get prettier than this. The retreat scenes on Naboo reminded me of movies like South Pacific. I was half-expecting Anakin to drift into "Younger than Springtime" or "Some Enchanted Evening".

Author: jfish938
Review: Huge dissapointment, lucas should have had someone else direct and write this movie.  Little was done well in this flick.  Displaying one of the most clumsily contrived love stories I've ever seen, coupled with absolutely terrible dialogue, attack of the clones should be titled attack of the horrible movie.  It attempts to explore vital issues like good vs. evil in such a shallow manner that I had a difficult time taking any of it seriously.  I mean, how cool could the tale of Anakin's path to the dark side be?  Lucas fails miserably, and I refuse to be pacified/distracted by some incredible CG.  I'm a huge fan of the originals.  I'd like to propose a script contest to rewrite the 3 prequels - I know that these movies have so much potential to be great!

Author: eeeopus
Review_Title: In need of a good Wookie
Review: While Anakin needs a good slap from a Wookie to stop his whiny-teen angst persona, the overall movie was incredible.  As with Jurassic Park, Terminator II,  and Blade Runner (seems to be an influence here)this movie would have been worth seeing from the special effects alone.  This is especially relevant as the dialogue does get clunky from time to time. It's a shame a small piece of the budget couldn't have gone towards getting more help on the screenplay, particularly with regard to the romance.  I mean really.  This guy is supposed to be Darth VAder and he's trying to pick up chicks with lines lamer than those I used in 8th grade.

Author: Yodamace
Review: The original trilogy was meant for an adult audience. TPM was more of a kids' movie. Attack of the Clones was a high-paced action/romance story for the whole family. The lightsaber battling surpassed every other movie with even Yoda stepping up to battle. This movie is now tied with Return of the Jedi as my favorite Star Wars movies.

Author: needcatscan
Review_Title: bad acting, no plot, slow, great special affects
Review: Well, one thing that was consistent was the acting of anakin.  Jake Lloyd can't act, and at least they continued the bad acting with Hayden. He was wooden, and most of all, WHINEY!  I haven't even heard a 5 year old whine like he did in this movie.  "Obi won is holding me back!  Obi won is jealous of me!"  I was waiting for obi won and anakin to get into a slapping fight at that scene with Padme.  Also, the plot was slow, considering the first half was almost nothing but Christensen and Portman sending back hollow emotion back and forth, (some of those lines were pathetic, "I'm intoxicated by you"?????).  And I'm sorry, but the meadow scene with the two of them, I was waiting for them to break out with the lyrics to "sound of music".  SO, finally, after about an hour and a half, when they got to the clone army and all that stuff. Finally!  The film got good, and the classic star wars shown through.  The jedi fighting scene was spectacular and Yoda's fighting scene was great.  And needless to say, Natalie portman losing clothing progressively through the whole movie was a plus too.  The only complaint I have about the the last 45 minutes, was C-3PO.  There aren't words to describe how incredibally stupid his humor was, or attempt at it. 3PO's humor was pointed towards 7 and 8 year olds.  Overall, I give the film a 5/10.  The Special effects alone are worth paying 5 bucks to see.  One suggestion for lucas though.  "Give Christensen some acting lessons!"

Author: sav_forest
Review: What can i say? Star Wars: Episode II - Attack of the Clones is not only the film of the year, but one of the best films of all time. The plot is brilliant (especially the the whole Anakin-dark side plot) Samuel L Jackson and Ewan Mcgregor play excellent parts and Hayden Christensen doesn't do too badly either. The special fx are like nothing i've seen and make films like gladiator sit and admire. Sadly the lightsabre sequences aren't as good as TPM (with the exception of Yoda-Dooku) and this must be due to the fact that Darth Maul was played by a stuntman.

Author: lilacangel1285
Review_Title: Lucas molds the perfect story for his second to last Star Wars installment
Review: Having seen this movie, I feel that Lucas created the proper elements to further unfold the tension mounting up to Episode III. Episode II consisted of all the necessary cinematic components: Action, Adventure, and Romance. It coincides with Episode V, only better. And hey, seeing Yoda in action is always good. However, the only thing I was disappointed in was not seeing some of the scenes that were cut out in the movie; many had important messages and critical dialogue. Suffice it to say, Lucas should NOT have cut out so many scenes, it might have made the movie even better. But other than that, the movie was indeed great. Star Wars forever!!!

Author: pyrrhus281
Review: Overall i think the movie is very good.  It lacks the magic that the first 3 have, but time changes things. I have not seen Hayden Christensen in anything before star wars so i dont know what to say about his talent, but i feel that he was not the right actor for the job as the after puberty daddy vader.  The special effects are awsome, I "tip my hat."  I am disappointed the most of the extras(e.g. storm troppers) were mostly COMP GEN. I would gladly sacrifice my car and body to fill a spot if modern film could have more real extras.  Ewan McGregor is the absolute perfect actor as a young Obi-Wan Kenobi. Samuel L. Jackson IS ONE OF THE BEST ACTORS IN HISTORY, but i just dont find him believable as a kick ass human jedi. I think lucas did a better job than with episode I.  I will never forgive him for killing off darth maul. I wanted to see a final bad ass battle between darth maul and darth vader (we know who would win) for the right hand seat as the sith. I thought these movies were suppose to come out earlier (86,89,92) I think I would have been more pleased with 3 movies that came after episode 6.

Author: ivan-jo
Review: I have seen comments re the acting of leads eg Hayden Christensen described as "exceptionally fine" on this page but I can't agree, I found it to be very wooden, and I think he was out of his depth.

Author: s2a7m
Review_Title: All hype, not good *slight bit of spoiler* (honestly not much to spoil though anyway)
Review: The first three star wars(episodes 4-6) were great action / fantasy / adventure movies; but no one should have taken this as a guarantee than the new episodes would also be great action / fantasy / adventure movies. They are not. They are boring, poorly acted, poorly directed, and Lucas's gold mine of easy money (no matter how bad the movie is).

Author: kris74
Review: Dear me what a dull film.  I've never been a huge fan of the Star wars films but generally quite enjoyed them as a bit of fun.  I even enjoyed the first one in a don't take it seriously bit of action bit of kid fun way but this was pure drivel from start to finish, the action scenes were ridiculous, the plot was dull in the extreme, the love interest sub plot was obviously written by Lucas's 3 yr old niece (disclaimer: I don't know if Lucas has a 3 year old niece, I was making a point) in fact I now think I was generous in giving it 2 out of 10.

Author: dknight-1
Review_Title: Interesting these Clone Wars do not seem.
Review: First and foremost - Entertaining. I wish I were a kid and hadn't gone to film school. Thank God my daughters will be able to enjoy this story from Episode 1 to Episode 6 (and in that order). I envy that fact because for them, the story only gets better. Now to my clouded thoughts.

Author: joshuwhat
Review_Title: By itself a Good Movie BUT Where has the Star Wars "feeling" Gone?
Review: I love the Star Wars films and have since I saw Star Wars IV in the theater as a kid. This is a very good movie and it is great to finally see the beginning unfold, but it seems with the special effects and abilities George Lucas has found, he has lost that true Star wars feeling. You remember in the original the spine tingling shots like when Luke and the Princess swung across the missing bridge, you felt it. Also the Original movies had a look, be it lack of modern special effects or intended look from Lucas, either way I loved it, The greys gave a "cold and dark feeling" to space. The new movies have changed and do not have the look of the with the new colors and everything stepped ahead of the older, they do not fit in with the old. The new movies make the ships and technology look more advanced than the original trilogy which comes later in time after the movies we see now.

Review: This second part of His Genius George Lucas presents us two things:

Author: byatis
Review_Title: George Lucas has stumbled yet again.
Review: I had such high hopes for this one, but alas, it seems that George Lucas has stumbled yet again.

Author: DemonWithPower
Review_Title: No, I call it agressive negotiations.
Review: I loved the movie myself, Yet I feel if you're not a huge fan of the Star Wars saga you wouldn't apreciate it that much. I own every episode, and even AOTC On DIVIX, so it's manifest I like the movies. It wasn't as good as ESB but much better than ANH. The movie needed something but I can't put my finger on it. Lucus needed to take out a little bit of the Ani+Padmé kissing scenes, they made the movie worse. We didn't really care that Anakin though Padmé's skin was as smooth, unike sand. The Geinossis battle was way to long. Yoda needed some more time.

Author: mark_kath
Review: If you are thinking of seeing the I-Max version. DO NOT GO!!!!!! You are paying 11 bucks (or however much I-Max costs in your area) to see a heavily edited Pan-And-Scan version of the Movie. Remember that I-Max screens have a 4:3 aspect ratio. not a 2.35:1 Panavision screen that the film was shot on.

Author: mega-godzilla2
Review: I was looking forward to seeing AOTC on Imax. I was extremely angry that many scenes were cut from the film. Nowhere does it mention the film is cut up or altered. So far I have counted 13 changes from the original release.

Author: boxma20
Review: After the really horrible episode 1, i expected the next movie to be a lot better. But boy o boy what a disaster episode 2 is. The acting of all characters is extremely wooden, they just stand their saying the lines from the autocue. The "love" between darth vader and padme is non existent, both cannot act well enough to convey the message. Also there is no real story to this movie at all, it seems a random sequence of CGI images, with some high school kids in it; obi-one-kenobi could be your college class-mate, he certainly does not look like a super duper jedi master thingy. I actually switched the movie off 20 minutes before the end, because i fell asleep. Please Please mr. Lucas, start gardening as a hobby and do not bore us with episode 3.

Author: m_alexander911
Review_Title: Light Sabers, Fencing, and lopping off your hand
Review: Film makers, over the last several decades have endeavored to change those desperate and necessary battles with blades to something at least approaching the viewer's expectations.

Author: Sunmaker234
Review: bad actors, bad story, stupid dialogues, (but amazing Special effects). Anyway, Mr.Lucas, a good movie does not consist only of good special-effects. I´am afraid that Episode 3 gets even worse.

Author: thomas-francois
Review_Title: It's a good commercial movie, but only commercial and for the 2000's viewers
Review: I saw this movie once again yesterday and found it really boring, without any substance in the organisation of ideas about cultures in Space, about the eternal battle between Good and Evil, between Peace and War. As for me this duality of things is very limited to anybody who has ever seen a star trek movie (which is more complex and, of course, more interesting) and where each thing is not too simple!!! But the main point of criticism is the numeric technology, Yoda is more ridiculous than everything I saw in Star Trek, the actors are almost laughing when I saw them play as if they were in a Z-series... When I did see this movie the first time, without any knowledge about Star Trek Universe I found it funny and attractive, but after the view of the seasons of the original star trek series and the first six star trek movies, I see a big difference in the tratment of two universes: in star trek things are complex, nothing is at 100 % good or bad and each people we meet needs to be well known to be wheel understood, and in star wars there will always be this eternal battle between the goods (jedi, most of the people who live in each planet) and the bads (siths and all ugly people who are after all looking bad ) ... Do you know Star Trek ?

Author: aaronius25
Review_Title: And you thought the Phantom Menace was bad...
Review: After seeing this film, I was hugely disappointed.  Not only was the acting horrible (it looked more like a 1st grade play than a large Hollywood film) but there were too many useless subplots.  For example, Anakin's and Amidala's relationship-scenes couldn't get any sappier.

Author: sikkema97
Review_Title: astonishing special effects, however film is barely rescued by Ewan McGregor.
Review: Whereas the story of how the old democratic republic slowly comes to an end could be very interesting, it is simply not told. "Ten-thousand (!) solar systems have joined a separatist movement.." Why? This is one part of the story which I would like to have been told. Of course, this is only one of the numerous plot errors in the film. Furthermore, the acting performance of Mr. Christensen is devastating for the film in its totality, only to be saved by the light-hearted hints at humour and excellent performance of Ewan McGregor.

Author: deadontime
Review_Title: Better that PM, but that's not saying much
Review: This film is a step-up from Episode I, but still suffers from many of the deficiencies present on the first film, including: pointless action scences, CGI overkill and poor character development. Character development is the basic cinematic tool that allows the audience to identify with the on-screen characters. It allows us to feel what they're feeling. Sadly, the attempt at development in this movie is a complete misfire. Thus, we bristle at the romance scenes between Portman and HC. As a guy, I had no feelings for NP, (whereas in the first Star Wars I felt myself falling for Leia). Portman, prettty as she may be, appears as a lifeless, smug, preachy character. HC is equally distasteful as a whiny, irritable teenie jedi. His horrific "crocodile tears" acting style makes the character all the more unappealing. Moreover, the romance between the two simply doesnt make sense. A grown woman is unlikely to fall in love with someone she basically reagraded as her kid brother, especially when this kid shows(albeit, very poorly) fits of demonic rage that is inconsistent with her angelic diplomatic ways. Other portions of the movie suffer from the same boring and confused plotlines  as did the first i.e the evil political machinations of the senate elite ( as well as the dull deliberations Jedi council). Sandwiched between these scenes are lifeless actions actions scenes that serve no purpose, really. A typical example of this is the final "climactic" light sabre scene. The scene is uninteresting to the viewer because the bad guy has only only been recently introduced into the movie when the scene occurs (kinda like darth maul in PM). We dont know much about and in fact, he doesnt really seem to be all that evil. The same applies to virtually all the other action scenes--and there are plenty. They simply do not engross the viewer and are neither compelling nor thrilling for that reason. Compare that to the opening scene in "minority report" where tom cruise has only several minutes to prevent a murder). The orgy of fighting between the jedi and the robots is as mechnical as the final battle scene in the first movie. Still, there are saving graces in this movie that make it a notch better than Ep.I: the fact that CGI characters do not dominate the scenes, better character development and the overall appearance that this movie is not primarily a kids movie.

Author: drugsdude
Review: Nonexistent storyline, unbelievable love story, underdeveloped characters--all these are very valid criticisms of Attack of the Clones. And I have a very valid reply: So What?

Author: Kingbart1
Review_Title: A year later, and I'm still writhing
Review: Happening upon this film, I'm nothing short of embarrassed by the fact it's been rated over a 7 (or a 4 for that matter) by IMDB readers.  I distinctly remember seeing the film in the theaters, excited about a new Star Wars movie, absolutely sure there was no way it could be worse than Episode One.

Author: cool_hand_lucas
Review_Title: A long time ago in a galaxy far short on ideas!
Review: Let me start by saying that I am a huge fan of the three original movies, yet i simply cannot grasp anyone enjoying attack of the clones. The film is simply not good. I'd elaborate but I'm not sure of where to begin. The editing is horrible as is the acting. Even an accomplished actor like Ewan Mcgregor couldn't pull it off. The creatures lack imagination, rather than originality they have just been made to look good. The sets and narrative style just don't hold that long time ago in a galaxy far, far away kind of atmosphere. In short everything is poorly done, suggesting to me that perhaps the production was quickly running close to deadline. To top it off is Yoda's lightsabre duel with Dooku. The master Jedi struggles to walk and yet manages all those unnecessary movements. In my opinion Yoda would be of the school of thought that less movement is paramount to an effective saber technique. Oh well, hopefully the third installment can capture some of the feeling of the originals and if not then episodes I through III should be stricken from the record.

Review_Title: Hayden Christensen is not the only problem....
Review: Spoilers!!!!!

Author: dino_onid
Review: CG was pathetic the acting was pathetic yoda talks more of a retard than in any other episode the directing was pathetic This Movie is Pathetic

Author: sorayia
Review: Although it's been two years,i still can't recover from the Attack of the Smurfs experience.I am not a die hard fan of the OT,but i still think they deserved sth less yawn-inducing for a prequel.Gone is the wit and chemistry of the original characters.

Author: zapoen
Review_Title: Not a bad movie, just a bad Star Wars movie...
Review: Star Wars, my favorite trilogy. The first trilogy that is (episode 4,5 and 6) cause the second (episode 1, 2 and almost 3) is just nothing compared to the first one. George Lucas never had to film these movies. These movies don't deserve the name Star Wars, cause it doesn't feel like Star Wars. I know, the movie has jedi's, the force, speeders and stuff like that, but it doesn't feel right, like if it misses a ingredient or something. That doesn't mean it's a bad movie, it's a nice science fiction movie with great special effects, but it's just a bad Star Wars movie. I never thought I would say this, but I'm disappointed in george.

Author: columbiafs
Review: I watched the original star wars movie back in 1985, when I was a teenage girl in Hong Kong. It was the first sci-fi movie I'd ever seen, and I remember myself petrified in my seat during the entire movie. From then on, I became a lover of computer effects, although I wasn't really a movie fan.

Author: lebocat
Review: This man should not be directing anything.....ever again.... He's just a money maker, who will release another 3 versions of the original trilogy, then release 3 versions of the latest trilogy, then sell all 6 in a box set, and in the end, you've bought 10 copies of 1- the same stagnant-old trilogy and 2- the sorry excuse for prequels.

Author: lewbrew16
Review_Title: Star Wars: Episode II Film Review
Review: I have just wasted 142 minuets on watching this pointless, mean-less and utter rubbish movie. I am not criticizing the actors or special effects, I will point my finger at George Lucas' bland script. The script is full of dialog that wouldn't of made a difference or affected the story line in any way at all, the actors because of the formal script and sound like robots, they are way to formal for a Star Wars movie. The relentless, pedantic dialog bores the audience not creating any tension. When i first watched this movie I actually wanted to leave the theater and was waiting for it to be over, that is not a good sign. The storyline my be solid and it often sticks to the point, but that would be the only praise I have on George Lucas' script. I honestly cannot wait to see how J.J Abrams does to rescue the Star Wars franchise. By watching the movie, I did not get a clear understanding of who the target audience is, I thought it was to complex for a 7 year old Star Wars fan to understand. Star Wars has a massive fan base, but George Lucas hasn't made anything that would impress a real Star Wars buff. The only way I can understand how the movie made so much money is because of its massive fan base, and not because of the quality of the movie. It is also to long until a good action sequence, it leaves the audience on the edge of their seats for too long and it must be obligatory for a Star Wars movie to have good action in it, or why call it a Star Wars movie at all? This movie has a few good/alright points, but in my opinion there are more bad points than good, making this a bad film.

Author: derek-letellier
Review_Title: My Least Favorite Of All The Movies
Review: While I still did enjoy this movie, it didn't really impress me like any of the other five. The overall acting, story, scenes, and music were the least thrilling of any Star Wars movie.

Author: jae-21
Review: There are reasons why someone might be inclined to give this more than a "1." Charitably, someone could regard it as marginally better than "The Phantom Menace." While debatable, short of a starring role for David Hasselhoff, SciFi just doesn't get much worse and neither film really deserve to be regarded as anything other than the worst.

Author: adanator88
Review: This movie was a huge disappointment. I really hoped for more when the first one came out, but that one was disappointing. But this one, oh my gosh it was awful. A terrible lead acting choice, so emotionless for a character supposedly in "love", he sounded like he was in pain.

Author: chasec-09363
Review_Title: Lucas Mistakes Space Opera for Soap Opera
Review: Attack of the Clones leaves a pit in your stomach when thought about. It's a horrendous mixture of green screen catastrophes, flat, boring shots, and grossly miswritten dialogue. Every time a character is on scene, it is a monstrosity to behold. Only when there is just CGI on the screen does it look good... for a Pixar movie. It is sad that this somewhat interesting story, told in all three prequels, was given such a disastrous execution. When people converse with one-another, whether it be a romantic scene or senate meeting, I feel like I could switch out the characters and CGI with daytime soap opera actors and sets and the scenes would make more sense. Mixing such a big budget with awful direction is disgusting. Every scene is so drab it hurts. Terrible.

Author: supermarioalex
Review_Title: More like Attack of the Bad Acting, Atrocious Script, and the Terrible Director.
Review: WARNING: THE FOLLOWING REVIEW CONTAINS SPOILERS. IF YOU DON'T WANT PLOT DETAILS TO BE GIVEN TO YOU, DON'T READ THIS REVIEW.

Author: mitaldo
Review: This movie is an improvement over The Phantom Menace. But still it's not a good movie. There is too much CGI. Don't get me wrong, sometimes CGI can be done great, but certainly that's not the case. Yoda and the Geonosians looked like they were ripped off straight from the Clone Wars cartoon. I think that Hayden Christensen acted really weak, even weaker than Jake Lloyd in the Phantom Menace. I would say that the light saber battles between Yoda and Count Dooku, and The Anakiin/Obi-Wan battle against the Count were decent enough. Well there were things that just annoyed me like, when nobody suspected Palpatine, even after they were told to by Dooku or when Obi-Wan didn't see Jango's suit, which was behind the bounty hunter the whole time. I like that Jar Jar doesn't have that much of a screen time. Or else this movie would have been a train wreck

Author: suphan
Review_Title: I thought there cannot be anything worse after seeing TPM. How wrong I was.
Review: Hayden Christiansen or whatever his name is - how can Anakin Skywalker like that turn into Darth Vader? Short, baby-faced, boring voice and boring personality. I've seen thousands like him in American movies. Plot. Where is a plot? That's the question. There is no plot; action and explosions instead of common sense. Obi Wan - why is he in this movie? He has nothing to do there, nobody has anything to do there. Characters are like made of paper, no flesh, no blood. This is a film without any artistic vision, how unlike Episode 4,5 and 6. Special effects are great but there are hundreds of movies every year based on computer tricks. Nothing new.

Author: sknowles-22066
Review:
I fell out of love with the prequels a long time ago in a cinema far far away but time has passed since my original viewing so I thought I would give them another go. The Phantom Menace I can forgive. It's got many many flaws and the narrative is rushed but as a stepping stone into a new trilogy it can be forgiven.
Watching Attack of The Clones, I forget how good it looks, and how impressive the battle scenes are. However what it can't be forgiven for is how much I hate Anakin Skywalker. I'm not having a go at Hayden Christensen as it has more to do with how it has been written rather than portrayed. But there's no sense of bond or, for want of a better word, bromance with Obi-Wan, which is exacerbated further in the third film. The entire time Anakin is on the screen I'm just wanting to the film to hurry up so he can become Darth Vader. Instead of showing off how talented and powerful he is, they seem to concentrate on the arrogance of the man. Therefore when he does succumb to the dark side there is no sense of loss and I think that is the biggest problem with Episodes II and III.
It's still worth a watch for the Star Wars fans but what it makes up for in style it lacks seriously in substance.

Review:

Interesting characters being pushed aside to force a romance and comments on why sand is bad.

Author: sanekgurushev
Review_Title: The worst film in saga that i've ever seen...
Review:
First, it was 90 minutes of dialogues and talking. It was so boring so i decided to chat with my friends instead of watching this piece of fruit. 
Second,
